Cash Management Springing

For so long as a Marriott Management Period or a period in which a Qualified Replacement Hotel Operator is managing the Property exists, the Borrower is required to cause all revenues from the Property to be deposited into the operating account maintained by the Hotel Operator at Wells Fargo Bank, National Association.

The Borrower has acknowledged and the Hotel Operator has agreed to cause all amounts received in such operating account in excess of the amount needed to fund operating expenses at the Property (as well as certain other Property expenses reserved by the Hotel Operator under the Hotel Operating Agreement, property management fees and incentive fees (if any)) to be deposited into a lender-controlled cash management account (the “Cash Management Account”).
The lockbox account is owned by the Borrower but controlled by, and pledged to, the lender.
On each Business Day, the financial institution maintaining such lockbox account is required to remit all funds on deposit in the account directly into the Cash Management Account.

If on any Mortgage Loan Payment Date the amount in the Cash Management Account is insufficient to make all the transfers described in clauses (i) through (viii) above, the Borrower is required to deposit into the Cash Management Account on that Mortgage Loan Payment Date the amount of the deficiency.

The Mortgage Loan Documents require that the Cash Management Account be an account or book-entry subaccount maintained with a federal or state chartered depository institution or trust company that is an eligible institution under the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

“Marriott Management Period” means any period during which The Ritz-Carlton Hotel Company, L.L.C. (or any entity that is both 51% owned by Marriott and controlled by, controlling or under common control with Marriott) is managing the Property pursuant to the Hotel Operating Agreement.
See “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserve Accounts”.

The following reserve accounts were established on or before the Origination Date and are required to be funded upon the occurrence of specified events as described below and are required to be maintained as set forth below.
The lender is required to maintain an account for the purpose of reserving amounts payable by the Borrower in respect of taxes and insurance premiums (the “Basic Carrying Costs Escrow Account”).
On the Origination Date, the Borrower remitted to the lender, for deposit into the Basic Carrying Costs Escrow Account, an amount equal to $1,083,335 in respect of taxes.

On each Mortgage Loan Payment Date, the Borrower is required to remit to the lender, for deposit into the Basic Carrying Costs Escrow Account, an amount equal to the sum of: (i) 1/12 of the taxes that the lender reasonably estimates, based on information provided by the Borrower, will be payable during the next ensuing 12 months, plus (ii) 1/12 of the insurance premiums that the lender reasonably estimates, based on information provided by the Borrower, will be payable during the next ensuing 12 months; provided, that to the extent that the insurance required to be maintained by the Borrower under the Mortgage Loan Agreement is effected under a blanket policy maintained by Marriott or its subsidiaries (which blanket policy provides insurance coverage on the Property that satisfies all of the requirements set forth in the Mortgage Loan Agreement and under “—Risk Management—Insurance” below) and a Marriott Management Period is continuing, the Borrower is not required to reserve insurance premiums in the Basic Carrying Costs Escrow Account.

If at any time the lender determines that the amount in the Basic Carrying Costs Escrow Account will not be sufficient to accumulate the full amounts necessary to pay all installments of taxes and insurance premiums by the date on which such amounts come due, the Borrower will be required increase their monthly payments by the amount reasonably estimated as sufficient to achieve such accumulation.
“Marriott” means Marriott International, Inc.

“Marriott Management Period” means any period during which Ritz-Carlton (or any entity that is both 51% owned by Marriott and controlled by, controlling or under common control with Marriott) is managing the Property pursuant to the Hotel Operating Agreement.

On each Mortgage Loan Payment Date, the Borrower is required to fund a replacement reserve account (the “FF&E Reserve Account”) for capital repairs, replacements and improvements at the Property in an amount equal to the greater of (i) the amount required to be reserved under the Hotel Operating Agreement and (ii) 5% of the monthly gross income from operations for the Property for the prior calendar month (the “FF&E Monthly Deposit”); provided that during the continuance of a Marriott Management Period or any period during which the Property is being managed by a Qualified Replacement Hotel Operator, the Borrower will be required to deposit only an amount equal to the difference, if any, between the amount reserved by the Hotel Operator for FF&E under the Hotel Operating Agreement and the FF&E Monthly Deposit.

The lender is required to, upon satisfaction of the conditions specified in the Mortgage Loan Agreement, disburse funds from the FF&E Reserve Account to the Borrower to pay the FF&E, no more frequently than once in any calendar month.
Each request for disbursement from the FF&E Reserve account is required to be made only after completion of the FF&E for which the disbursement is requested.
The Borrower is required to provide the lender with such evidence of completion of the subject FF&E as the lender may reasonably request.

The insufficiency of any balance in the FF&E Reserve Account will not relieve the Borrower from its obligation to preserve and maintain the Property in accordance with the covenants made under the Mortgage Loan Documents.

“Qualified Replacement Hotel Operator” means (i) any operator indicated on a schedule to the Mortgage Loan Agreement, provided each such hotel operator (A) has not suffered a material adverse change in its general business standing, reputation or creditworthiness from the level thereof as of the Origination Date, (B) manages at least 5, 5 star hotels (or hotels of equal quality and reputation) and at least 80% of the number of hotels and rooms such hotel operator managed as of the Origination Date, and (C) operates the Property in the same manner as Ritz-Carlton (e.g., with respect to collection of rents, reserving for and paying FF&E expenditures, control of revenues and payment of operating expenses) and (ii) any affiliate controlled by any of the foregoing persons and with respect to clause (i) or (ii), is not the subject of a bankruptcy or similar insolvency proceeding.

The lender may require the Borrower to fund a seasonality reserve account (the “Seasonality Reserve Account”) during certain months of the year, in an amount reasonably determined by the lender as sufficient to fund projected monthly cash shortfalls during slow business months; provided, however, that so long as (i) the Hotel Operating Agreement with Ritz-Carlton (or with any person that is both at least 51% owned by Marriott and controlled by, controlling or under common control with Marriott) is in effect and (ii) the Hotel Operator is reserving funds pursuant to the terms of the Hotel Operating Agreement in accordance with its customary practices, the Borrower will not be obligated to make deposits into the Seasonality Reserve Account.

In the event a Marriott Management Period is not in effect, the lender is required to, upon satisfaction of the conditions specified in the Mortgage Loan Agreement, disburse funds from the Seasonality Reserve Account to the Borrower, which funds will be applied to any deficiencies in the payment of the scheduled principal and interest payments under the Note and operating expenses and the funding of any required reserves, no more frequently than once in any calendar month.
The insufficiency of any balance in the Seasonality Reserve Account will not relieve the Borrower from its obligation to pay any such deficiencies.

In the event that a Ground Rent Reserve Period is occurring, the Borrower is required to fund a reserve for the payment of Ground Rent (the “Ground Rent Reserve Account”) in an amount equal to 1/12th of the annual Ground Rent that the lender reasonably estimates.
The lender will, or will direct the Servicer to, pay the Ground Rent to the Ground Lessor on the dates due and payable under the Ground Lease.
Any balance remaining in the Ground Rent Reserve Account after the payment of the Ground Rent will be disbursed to the Borrower.

“Ground Lease” means that certain Ground Lease, dated as of September 10, 1999 by and between the Ground Lessor and the Borrower (as successor in interest), as amended as of July 26, 2001 and as supplemented by that certain Ground Lease Estoppel, executed by the Ground Lessor and the Borrower as of the Origination Date.
“Ground Lessor” means Di Lido Beach Hotel Corporation.
“Ground Rent” means the rent or other charge payable by the tenant to the Ground Lessor under the Ground Lease.

A “Ground Rent Reserve Period” will occur in the event that (i) neither a Marriott Management Period nor a period during which a Qualified Replacement Hotel Operator is managing the Property is continuing or (ii) a Marriott Management Period or a period during which a Qualified Replacement Hotel Operator is managing the Property is continuing but the Hotel Operator is not required to pay Ground Rent directly to the Ground Lessor pursuant to the terms of the Hotel Operating Agreement.

“DSCR” means, as of any date, the ratio of (i) Net Operating Income (less any contributions to the FF&E reserve required under the Hotel Operating Agreement and the FF&E Reserve Account) for the 12 month period ending with the most recently completed calendar month to (ii) the sum of (a) the scheduled principal and interest payments due under the Note with respect to such period and (b) the aggregate of the Mezzanine Monthly Debt Service Amount with respect to such period.
“Mezzanine Monthly Debt Service Amount” means the amount of regularly scheduled interest then due and payable under the Mezzanine Loan Documents.
The lender is required to maintain an account for the purpose of reserving amounts payable by the Borrower in respect of the abated rent due under the Tatel Lease (the “Tatel Rent Reserve Account”).
On the Origination Date, the Borrower remitted to the lender, for deposit into the Tatel Rent Reserve Account, an amount equal to $479,270.

On and after such rent commencement date and once the lender has received evidence reasonably satisfactory to the lender that the tenant under the Tatel Lease has commenced paying full unabated rent, the lender will disburse any funds remaining on deposit in the Tatel Rent Reserve Account to the Borrower.

“Tatel Lease” means that certain lease, dated as of January 8, 2016, by and between the Borrower (as successor in interest to Di Lido Beach Resort, Ltd.), as landlord, and Tatel Miami LLC, as tenant, as the same may be amended.

The lender is required to maintain an account for the purpose of reserving amounts for tenant improvement allowances and/or contributions payable by the Borrower to the tenant under the Tatel Lease (the “Tatel TI Reserve Account”).
On the Origination Date, the Borrower remitted to the lender, for deposit into the Tatel TI Reserve Account, an amount equal to $450,000.

The lender is required to maintain an account for the purpose of reserving amounts for the leasing commissions payable by the Borrower to H3 Hospitality, LLC, the broker in connection with the Tatel Lease (the “Tatel LC Reserve Account”).
On the Origination Date, the Borrower remitted to the lender, for deposit into the Tatel LC Reserve Account, an amount equal to $144,881.
Each of the above described reserve accounts is required to be an eligible account under the sole dominion and control of the lender.
The Borrower has no right to make withdrawals from any of the reserve accounts.
The reserve accounts do not constitute trust funds and, except for the Cash Management Account and the lockbox account, may be commingled with other monies held by the lender.
Funds in the reserve accounts may be invested only as permitted under the Mortgage Loan Agreement.
Upon repayment of the Mortgage Loan in full, the balance of the reserve accounts will be paid to the Mezzanine Lender to the extent the Mezzanine Loan remains outstanding.

Further, for so long as a default under the Mezzanine Loan Documents is continuing, any remaining balance in any of the reserve accounts will not be returned to the Borrower after the disbursement of amounts from such reserve accounts for the payment of the relevant expenses.

Prior to the Origination Date, the Hotel Operator established an operating account maintained by the Hotel Operator (the “Hotel Operator Operating Account”) with Wells Fargo Bank, National Association.

The Hotel Operator has also established an FF&E account maintained by the Hotel Operator (the “Hotel Operator FF&E Reserve Account”) with BankUnited, N.A, which account is under the sole dominion and control of the lender.

For so long as a Marriott Management Period is continuing, the Hotel Operator has the right to withdraw funds from the Hotel Operator Operating Account and the Hotel Operator FF&E Reserve Account subject to the terms and conditions set forth in the Hotel Operating Agreement.

For so long as a Marriott Management Period or a period in which a Qualified Replacement Hotel Operator is managing the Property exists, the Hotel Operator will collect all rents from the Property and all other receipts, sums and other monies payable with respect to the Property to be deposited into the Hotel Operator Operating Account.

The Borrower will cause the Hotel Operator (and the Hotel Operator has agreed to deposit all amounts payable by the Hotel Operator to the Borrower under the Hotel Operating Agreement into the Cash Management Account.
The Cash Management Account will be held by the deposit bank, which, at origination, was established with PNC Bank, National Association.
The Cash Management Account consists of various subaccounts, which may be maintained on a ledger entry basis.
The lender and the Servicer have the sole right to make withdrawals from the Cash Management Account or such subaccounts.

“Cash Management Agreement” means that certain Deposit Account Agreement, dated as of the Origination Date, by and among the Borrower, PNC Bank, National Association (or any successor eligible institution acting as the deposit bank under the Cash Management Agreement) and the lender.

“Hotel Operator” means The Ritz-Carlton Hotel Company, L.L.C. or, if the context requires, any manager set forth in Annex H to this Offering Circular, and otherwise qualified under the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, or any successor hotel operator expressly permitted under the terms of the Hotel Operating Agreement.

“Marriott Entity” means The Ritz-Carlton Hotel Company, L.L.C. and any person that is both (i) at least 51% owned by Marriott International, Inc. and (ii) controlled by, controlling or under common control with Marriott International, Inc.
“Marriott Management Period” means any period during which a Marriott Entity or The Ritz-Carlton Hotel Company, L.L.C. is managing the Property pursuant to the Hotel Operating Agreement.

“Qualified Marriott Replacement Management Period” means any period during which (a) any manager set forth in Annex H to this Offering Circular, and otherwise qualified under the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, is managing the Property pursuant to a replacement hotel operating agreement that is qualified under the Mortgage Loan Agreement and (b) such replacement hotel operating agreement has not been terminated.
References to “reserve accounts” in the prior sentence means any amounts held in such reserve accounts that is not required to be paid to the Borrower.
The Mortgage Loan is structured with in-place cash management.

Ritz is required to deposit all gross revenues from the Property directly into an account controlled by Ritz, pay operating expenses for the Property and pay or retain other amounts permitted or required under the hotel operating agreement and the loan documents, including, without limitation, its own property management fees, incentive fees (if any) and FF&E reserves.

For so long as a Marriott Management Period or a period in which a qualified replacement Hotel Operator is managing the Property exists, the Borrower is required to cause all revenues from the Property to be paid to Ritz or to be deposited into the operating account maintained by the Hotel Operator.

The Borrower has acknowledged and Ritz has agreed to cause all amounts received in such operating account in excess of the amount needed to fund operating expenses at the Property (as well as certain other Property expenses reserved by Ritz under the hotel operating agreement, property management fees and incentive fees (if any)) to be deposited into a lender-controlled cash management account (the “Cash Management Account”).

In the event no Marriott Management Period or period in which a qualified replacement Hotel Operator is not managing the Property exists, the Borrower will establish and is required to maintain a lockbox account into which income from the Property will be deposited.
The lockbox account will be owned by the Borrower but controlled by, and pledged to, the lender.
On each Business Day, the financial institution maintaining such lockbox account is required to remit all funds on deposit in the account directly into the Cash Management Account.
See “Description of the Manager and Managing Agreement—Hotel Operating Agreement—Cash Management” in the Offering Circular for additional information.

For so long as a Marriott Management Period or a period in which a qualified replacement Hotel Operator is managing the Property exists, the Borrower is required to cause all revenues from the Property to be deposited into the operating account maintained by the Hotel Operator.

The Borrower has acknowledged and the Hotel Operator has agreed to cause all amounts received in such operating account in excess of the amount needed to fund operating expenses at the Property (as well as certain other Property expenses reserved by the Hotel Operator under the hotel operating agreement, property management fees and incentive fees (if any)) to be deposited into a lendercontrolled cash management account (the “Cash Management Account”).

In the event no Marriott Management Period or a period in which a qualified replacement Hotel Operator is managing the Property exists, the Borrower will establish and is required to maintain a lockbox account into which income from the Property will be deposited.
The lockbox account will be owned by the Borrower but controlled by, and pledged to, the lender.
On each Business Day, the financial institution maintaining such lockbox account is required to remit all funds on deposit in the account directly into the Cash Management Account.

If on any Loan Payment Date the amount in the Cash Management Account is insufficient to make all the transfers as required in the Loan Agreement, the Borrower is required to deposit into the Cash Management Account on that Loan Payment Date the amount of the deficiency.

The loan documents require that the Cash Management Account be an account or book-entry subaccount maintained with a federal or state chartered depository institution or trust company that complies with the definition of an “Eligible Institution”, as defined under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Cash Management” in the Offering Circular.

A “Marriott Management Period” means any period during which The Ritz-Carlton Hotel Company, L.L.C. (or any person that is both 51% owned by Marriott and controlled by, controlling or under common control with Marriott) is managing the Property pursuant to the hotel operating agreement.

The Mortgage Loan Agreement, together with the other Mortgage Loan Documents, creates a valid and continuing security interest (as defined in the UCC) in the Clearing Account and Cash Management Account in favor of the lender, as and when each such account may be established, which security interest is prior to all other Liens, other than Permitted Encumbrances, and is enforceable as such against creditors of and purchasers from the Borrower.

Other than in connection with the Mortgage Loan Documents and except for Permitted Encumbrances, the Borrower has not sold, pledged, transferred or otherwise conveyed its interest in the Clearing Account and Cash Management Account; (b) Each of the Clearing Account and Cash Management Account will constitute a “deposit accounts” within the meaning of the UCC; (c) Pursuant and subject to the terms hereof and of the other Mortgage Loan Documents, the Borrower agrees that the Clearing Bank will comply with all instructions originated by the lender, without further consent by the Borrower, directing disposition of the Clearing Account and all sums at any time held, deposited or invested therein, together with any interest or other earnings thereon, and all proceeds thereof (including proceeds of sales and other dispositions), whether accounts, general intangibles, chattel paper, deposit accounts, instruments, documents or securities; (d) The Clearing Account and Cash Management Account will not be held in the name of any Person other than the Borrower, as pledgor, for the benefit of the lender, as secured party; and (e) The Property is not subject to any cash management system (other than pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Documents and pursuant to a cash management system operated by Marriott or a Marriott Entity), and any and all existing tenant instruction letters issued in connection with any previous financing have been duly terminated prior to the date hereof.
The Borrower has established and is required to maintain a clearing account (the “Clearing Account”) and a cash management account (the “Cash Management Account”).

Each of the Clearing Account and the Cash Management Account is required to be an Eligible Cash Management Account (as defined under “Description of the Whole Loan—Cash Management—Clearing Account and —Cash Management Account”) held in the name of the Borrower but controlled by, and pledged to, the Lender.
The Borrower is required to cause all rents to be transmitted directly by tenants of the Property into the Clearing Account.

If the Borrower or the Manager receives any gross revenues from the Property, then the Borrower or the Manager is required to deposit such amounts in the Clearing Account within two “Business Days” (as defined in the Trust and Servicing Agreement) of receipt.
See “Description of the Whole Loan—Loan Events of Default” and “Description of the Mezzanine Loan—Mezzanine Loan Events of Default.

On each Loan Payment Date, the Borrower is required to pay (i) 1/12th of the real estate taxes that the Lender reasonably estimates will be payable during the next 12 months and (ii) 1/12th of the insurance premiums that the Lender reasonably estimates will be payable for the renewal of coverage, which amounts will be required to be transferred into an account (the “Tax and Insurance Subaccount”).
The Borrower has already paid the Lender $207,439 for insurance reserve into the Tax and Insurance Subaccount. The Borrower also made an upfront deposit of $2,364,719 for tax reserves.
The Lender may, from time to time, upon written notice to the Borrower, increase the Static Insurance Reserve Amount in accordance with the Loan Agreement.

On each Loan Payment Date, the Borrower is required to pay to the Lender an amount initially equal to $8,392 (the “Capital Reserve Monthly Deposit”) or such lesser amount as will result in the balance of the capital expense reserve equaling $200,000 (the “Capital Reserve Cap”), which amounts will be required to be transferred into an account (the “Capital Reserve Subaccount”).

The Borrower will not be required to pay the Capital Reserve Monthly Deposit in the event that the Capital Reserve Subaccount equals or exceeds the Capital Reserve Cap until such time as the balance of the Capital Reserve Subaccount equals or falls below $100,000 (at which time the Borrower is required to recommence paying the Capital Reserve Monthly Deposit, subject to the Capital Reserve Cap).

Upon the delivery of such a letter of credit, the Borrower will not be required to make the Capital Reserve Monthly Deposit for so long as such letter of credit remains undrawn and on deposit with the Lender and otherwise satisfies all of the terms and conditions set forth in the Loan Agreement.

On each Loan Payment Date, the Borrower is required to pay to the Lender an amount equal to $83,921 (the “Rollover Reserve Monthly Deposit”) or such lesser amount as will result in the balance of the rollover reserve equaling $3,021,165 (the “Rollover Reserve Cap”), which amounts will be required to be transferred into an account (the “Rollover Reserve Subaccount”).

The Borrower will not be required to pay the Rollover Reserve Monthly Deposit in the event that the Rollover Reserve Subaccount equals or exceeds the Rollover Reserve Cap until such time as the balance of the Rollover Reserve Subaccount equals or falls below $1,510,583 (at which time the Borrower is required to recommence paying the Rollover Reserve Monthly Deposit, subject to the Rollover Reserve Cap).

In addition to the deposits described above, all payments received from tenants in connection with the early termination or cancellation of any leases, including fees, penalties and commission are required to be deposited into the Rollover Reserve Subaccount.

Upon the delivery of such a letter of credit, the Borrower will not be required to make the Rollover Reserve Monthly Deposit for so long as such letter of credit remains undrawn and on deposit with the Lender and otherwise satisfies all of the terms and conditions set forth in the Loan Agreement.

The Borrower will be required to pay, or cause to be paid, to the Lender all insurance proceeds or awards due to any casualty or condemnation in accordance with the provisions of the Loan Agreement, which amounts will be required to be transferred into an account (the “Casualty and Condemnation Subaccount”).

Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Lender has the right, but not the obligation, in its sole and absolute discretion to release amounts from the Cash Collateral Reserve Subaccount for payments of approved operating expenses to the extent there are insufficient amounts in the Cash Management Account earmarked to pay for such approved operating expenses.
Each “Letter of Credit” (as defined in the Loan Documents) will be required to be held as collateral and additional security for the payment of the Whole Loan.
The Borrower has established and is required to maintain a clearing account (the “Clearing Account”) with a depository bank (the “Clearing Bank”) for the deposit of all rents from the Property.
The Borrower is required to cause all rents to be transmitted directly by tenants of the Property into the Clearing Account.

If the Borrower or the Manager receives any gross revenues from the Property, then the Borrower or the Manager is required to deposit such amounts in the Clearing Account within two Business Days of receipt.

As of the Origination Date, the Borrower also has established a cash management account (the “Cash Management Account”) pursuant to the cash management agreement, which Cash Management Account is required to be an Eligible Cash Management Account held in the name of the Borrower but controlled by, and pledged to, the Lender.
“Cash Management Bank” means PNC Bank, National Association, or such other bank or depository selected by the Lender in its discretion.

“Eligible Cash Management Account” means either (i) an account maintained with the Cash Management Bank or another depository institution or trust company; provided the short term unsecured debt obligations or commercial paper of such other depository institution or trust company are rated at least “A-1” (or equivalent) by S&P, Moody’s or Fitch in the case of accounts in which funds are held for thirty (30) days or less (or, in the case of accounts in which funds are held for more than thirty (30) days and the long term unsecured debt obligations of which are rated at least “A” (or equivalent) by S&P, Moody’s or Fitch) or (ii) a segregated trust account maintained with the trust department of a federal or state chartered depository institution or trust company acting in its fiduciary capacity which institution or trust company is subject to regulations similar to 12 C.F.R. §9.10(b), having in either case a combined capital and surplus of at least $50,000,000 and is subject to federal and state authority.
The Borrower is required to cause all rents to be transmitted directly by tenants of the Property into the Clearing Account.

If the Borrower or the Manager receives any rents from the Property, then the Borrower or the Manager is required to deposit such amounts in the Clearing Account within two (2) Business Days of receipt.

“Eligible Account” means a separate and identifiable account from all other funds held by the holding institution that is either (a) an account or accounts (or subaccounts thereof) maintained with a federal or state-chartered depository institution or trust company which complies with the definition of Eligible Institution or (b) a segregated trust account or accounts maintained with a federal or state chartered depository institution or trust company acting in its fiduciary capacity and that, in the case of a state chartered depository institution or trust company, is subject to regulations substantially similar to 12 C.F.R. §9.10(b), having in either case a combined capital and surplus of at least $50,000,000.00 and subject to supervision or examination by federal or state authority, as applicable.
An Eligible Account will not be evidenced by a certificate of deposit, passbook or other instrument.

“Eligible Institution” means (i) an institution whose commercial paper, short-term debt obligations or other shortterm deposits are rated at least “A–1” by S&P, “P–1” by Moody’s and “F–1” by Fitch, and whose long-term senior unsecured debt obligations are rated at least “A” by S&P, “A” by Fitch, and “A2” by Moody’s and whose deposits are insured by the FDIC, (ii) an institution with respect to which a Rating Agency Confirmation is obtained; provided, that, with respect to KeyBank National Association, the short term obligations, deposits, accounts or commercial paper of KeyBank National Association must be rated at least “A-2” by S&P (or, if not rated by S&P, an equivalent (or higher) rating by any two other NRSROs) and, the long term unsecured debt obligations, accounts or deposits of KeyBank National Association are rated at least “BBB” by S&P (so long as the short term unsecured debt obligations of such depository institution or trust company are rated at least “A-2” by S&P) (or, it not rated by S&P, an equivalent (or higher) rating by any two NRSROs).
The Whole Loan is structured with a hard lockbox and springing cash management.
Such lockbox account will be owned by the Borrower but is required to be pledged to and under the sole control of the lender.
The Borrower is required to cause all rents received by the Borrower to be deposited in a lockbox account or cash management account within one Business Day following receipt of such amounts.

The financial institution maintaining the lockbox account will be required to remit all amounts contained in the lockbox account on each Business Day directly into a lender-controlled cash management account (the “Cash Management Account”).

The Mortgage Loan Documents require that the Cash Management Account be an account or subaccount maintained with a depository institution or trust company that complies with the definition of an “Eligible Institution”, as defined under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserve Accounts”.
See “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserve Accounts”.

No funds were deposited into the Excess Cash Flow Reserve Account on or prior to the Origination Date.

“Debt Yield” means a ratio for the applicable period in which: (a) the numerator is the net operating income (excluding interest on credit accounts and using annualized operating expenses for any recurring expenses not paid monthly by the Borrower) for such period as set forth in the statements required under the Mortgage Loan Agreement; and (b) the denominator is the outstanding principal balance of the Mortgage Loan.

“Eligible Account” means a separate and identifiable account from all other funds held by the holding institution that is either (a) an account or accounts maintained with a federal or state-chartered depository institution or trust company which complies with the definition of Eligible Institution or (b) a segregated trust account or accounts maintained with a federal or state chartered depository institution or trust company acting in its fiduciary capacity which complies with the definition of Eligible Institution and which, in the case of a state chartered depository institution or trust company, is subject to regulations substantially similar to 12 C.F.R. § 9.10(b), having in either case a combined capital and surplus of at least $50,000,000 and subject to supervision or examination by federal and state authority, as applicable.

“Eligible Institution” means (i) a depository institution or trust company insured by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, the short-term unsecured debt obligations or commercial paper of which are rated at least “A-1+” by S&P and “P-1” by Moody’s, in the case of accounts in which funds are held for thirty (30) days or less (or, in the case of accounts in which funds are held for more than thirty (30) days, the long-term unsecured debt obligations of which are rated at least “AA” by S&P and “Aa2” by Moody’s) or (ii) KeyBank National Association in its capacity as a party to the Cash Management Agreement for so long as KeyBank National Association is not downgraded from the long-term unsecured debt obligations and short-term unsecured debt obligations ratings assigned to KeyBank National Association by the Rating Agency as of the Origination Date.

“Operating Expenses” means, for any period, the total of all expenditures, computed in accordance with GAAP, of whatever kind during such period relating to the Borrower’s operation, maintenance and management of the Property that are incurred on a regular monthly or other periodic basis, including without limitation, Ground Rent, bad debt, utilities, ordinary repairs and maintenance, insurance, license fees, property taxes and assessments, advertising expenses, management fees, payroll and related taxes, computer processing charges, tenant improvements and leasing commissions, operational equipment or other lease payments as approved by the lender, and other similar costs, but excluding depreciation, debt service under the Mortgage Loan, capital expenditures, and contributions to the reserve accounts.
Each of the above described reserve accounts is required to be an Eligible Account under the control of the lender.
The Borrower has no right to make withdrawals from any of the reserve accounts.
The reserve accounts do not constitute trust funds and may be commingled with other monies held by the lender.
Funds in the reserve accounts may be invested only as permitted under the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

All interest or other earnings on the reserve accounts (other than for the Tax and Insurance Reserve Account and the Ground Rent Reserve Account) are required to be added to and become a part of such reserve account and to be disbursed in the same manner as other monies deposited in such reserve account.
The Borrower is not permitted to have access to funds in the Lockbox Account.

The Borrower is not permitted to rescind, withdraw or change any such notice or instruction required to be sent by the Borrower without the lender’s prior written consent so long as the Mortgage Loan remains outstanding.

The Borrower is not permitted to rescind, withdraw or change any such notices or instructions required to be sent by it without the lender’s prior written consent so long as the Mortgage Loan remains outstanding.

“Cash Expenses” means, for any period, the Operating Expenses for the operation of the Property as set forth in an Approved Annual Budget to the extent that such expenses are actually incurred by the Borrower minus any payments into the Tax and Insurance Reserve Account.

“Extraordinary Expense” means an extraordinary Operating Expense or capital expenditure that must be incurred by the Borrower and not set forth in the Approved Annual Budget, which will be subject to lender’s approval.
“Lockbox Bank” means any clearing bank that establishes pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Agreement, maintains and holds a Lockbox Account, which bank is required to be an Eligible Institution.

an account (the “Excess Cash Reserve Account”) into which the Borrower is required to deposit, on each Payment Date during a Cash Sweep Period, all excess cash flow generated by the Properties;
See “DESCRIPTION OF THE MORTGAGE LOAN—Cash Management” and “—Reserve Accounts” in this Offering Circular.
All revenues derived from the Properties are required to be deposited into the Deposit Account pledged to the Mortgage Lender as security for the Mortgage Loan.
As of the Origination Date, the Deposit Account is expected to be established and maintained at Wells Fargo Bank, National Association.

Pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Documents, within five (5) Business Days following the execution of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, the Borrower will be required to send instruction letters to tenants at the Properties and each of the credit card companies or credit card clearing banks with which the Borrower or the Property Manager has entered into merchant agreements to deliver all receipts payable with respect to the Properties notifying and advising them to make all payments of rents or any other item payable under their respective leases or receipts payable with respect to the Properties, as applicable, directly to the Deposit Account or a post office address maintained by the Deposit Bank for processing deposits to the Deposit Account.

The Borrower will be required to deposit, and to cause the Property Manager to deposit, all amounts received by the Borrower or the Property Manager constituting rents and other revenues from the Properties, notwithstanding delivery of such instruction letters, into the Deposit Account within two (2) Business Days of receipt thereof.
The Deposit Account may not be commingled with other monies held by the Borrower, the Property Manager or Deposit Account Bank.
We cannot assure you that circumstances that may arise if Borrower does not observe these covenants will not adversely impact the Borrowers, the value of the Properties or the Certificates.
See “DESCRIPTION OF THE MORTGAGE LOAN—Cash Management” in this Offering Circular.

In connection with the origination of the Mortgage Loan, the Borrower will be required to establish and maintain an account (the “Deposit Account”) for the benefit of the Lender, as mortgagee, into which tenants under leases at the Properties to which the Borrower is a party and each of the credit card companies or credit card clearing banks with which the Borrower or the Property Manager has entered into merchant agreements have been irrevocably instructed to deposit all rents related to the Properties or receipts payable with respect to the Properties, as applicable.

It is expected that the Deposit Account will be established at Wells Fargo Bank, National Association (in such capacity, the “Deposit Bank”) pursuant to a Deposit Account Control Agreement by and among the Deposit Bank, the Borrower and the Lender (the “Deposit Account Agreement”).

The Borrower or the property manager, as applicable, is required to deposit into the Deposit Account all rents and other revenue generated by or derived from the operation of the Properties within two (2) Business Days of receipt.
The Deposit Account is required to be maintained with an Eligible Institution (as defined below).

The Deposit Bank will transfer on each Business Day during a Cash Management Period funds on deposit in the Deposit Account to the Cash Management Account, which funds are to be applied as set forth in “—Cash Management Account” in this Offering Circular, otherwise such funds will be remitted to the Borrower.

For purposes of this section, “Eligible Account” means a separate and identifiable account from all other funds held by the holding institution that is either (a) an account or accounts maintained with a federal or state chartered depository institution or trust company which complies with the definition of Eligible Institution or (b) a segregated trust account or accounts maintained with the corporate trust department of a federal or state chartered depository institution or trust company acting in its fiduciary capacity which, in the case of a federally chartered depository institution or trust company acting in its fiduciary capacity is subject to the regulations regarding fiduciary funds on deposit therein under 12 C.F.R. §9.10(b), and in the case of a state chartered depository institution or trust company, is subject to regulations substantially similar to 12 C.F.R. §9.10(b), having in either case a combined capital surplus of at least $50,000,000 and is subject to supervision or examination by federal and state authority.
An Eligible Account may not be evidenced by a certificate of deposit, passbook or other instrument.

For purposes of this section, “Eligible Institution” means (i) a depository institution or trust company insured by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (a) the short term unsecured debt obligations, commercial paper or other short term deposits of which are rated at least “A-1” by S&P (or “A-2” by S&P so long as the long term unsecured debt rating is at least “BBB” by S&P), or (b) the long term unsecured debt obligations of which are rated at least “BBB+” by S&P, or (ii) an institution for which a Rating Agency Confirmation has been obtained from each Rating Agency.
The Lender’s right to withdraw and apply any of the foregoing funds will be in addition to all other rights and remedies provided to the Lender under the Mortgage Loan Documents.

“Cash Sweep Avoidance Collateral” means cash or a letter of credit in an amount that, (i) if applied to reduction of the outstanding principal balance of the Mortgage Loan would result in a Debt Service Coverage Ratio of 1.40x for the most recently completed calendar quarter and/or (ii) if applied to reduction of the aggregate outstanding principal balance of the Mortgage Loan and the Mezzanine Loan (pro rata based on the respective outstanding principal balances) would result in an Aggregate Debt Service Coverage Ratio of 1.20x for the most recently completed calendar quarter, as applicable.

For purposes of this section, “Debt Service Coverage Ratio” means, as of any date of determination, for the applicable period of calculation, the ratio, as determined by the Lender (using its reasonable judgment), of (i) the Underwritten Net Cash Flow to (ii) the aggregate amount of debt service which would have been due for the preceding twelve (12) months, using a payment constant based on the Mortgage Loan Interest Rate.

For purposes of this section, “Aggregate Debt Service Coverage Ratio” means, as of any date of determination, the ratio, as determined by the Lender (using its reasonable judgment), of (i) Underwritten Net Cash Flow to (ii) the sum of (x) the aggregate amount of debt service which would have been due for the preceding twelve (12) months, using a payment constant based on the Mortgage Loan Interest Rate and (y) the aggregate amount of debt service under the Mezzanine Loan which would have been due for such period.

The following accounts have been established, each as described more particularly below: (i) a “Replacement Reserve Account”, (ii) a “PIP Reserve Account”, (iii) a “Tax and Insurance Reserve Account”, (iv) a “Ground Rent Reserve Account”, (v) an “Excess Cash Reserve Account” and (vi) a “Cash Sweep Avoidance Collateral Reserve Account” (each, a “Reserve Account” and collectively, the “Reserve Accounts”).
Funds on deposit in the Reserve Accounts may be invested in certain permitted investments specified in the Mortgage Loan Agreement as determined and directed by the Lender or the Servicer.
All income and interest earned on the investment of the Reserve Accounts will be for the account of the Borrower.
The Reserve Accounts will be subject to the exclusive dominion and control of the Servicer on behalf of the Lender.
The Borrower will have no right of withdrawal from the Reserve Accounts or any other right or power with respect to the Reserve Accounts except as expressly provided in the Mortgage Loan Agreement.
The Borrower will be liable for any deficiency in available funds in the Reserve Accounts which may be necessary to pay all amounts due from time to time under the Mortgage Loan Documents.
The Reserve Accounts are required to be Eligible Accounts and funds therein may be commingled with other monies controlled by the Lender or the Servicer or the Special Servicer, as applicable.

A Replacement Reserve Account has been established into which the Borrower will be required to deposit on each Payment Date an amount equal to the greater of (i) 4.00% of gross revenues during the calendar month immediately preceding the calendar month in which such Payment Date occurs, and (ii) the aggregate amount, if any, required to be reserved under the Franchise Agreements and the Property Management Agreements (the “Replacement Reserve Monthly Deposit”).
Amounts so deposited are referred to in this Offering Circular as “Replacement Reserve Funds”.

“Mortgage” shall mean, individually and collectively, those certain first priority fee and/or leasehold mortgages, deeds of trust or deeds to secure debt, as applicable, assignments of leases and rents, fixture filing and security agreements, executed and delivered by each Borrower as security for the Mortgage Loan and encumbering such Borrower’s Property, as the same may be amended, restated, replaced, supplemented or otherwise modified from time to time.

A PIP Reserve Account has been established to discharge the Borrower’s obligations for the payment of all costs and expenses in connection with the PIP Work (the “PIP Expenditures”) into which the Borrower will be required to deposit on the Origination Date $13,701,442. Amounts so deposited are referred to in this Offering Circular as “PIP Reserve Funds”.
“PIP Work” means any work to be performed pursuant to a Property Improvement Plan.

“Property Improvement Plan” means all property improvement plans for replacing the FF&E, remodeling, redecorating and modifying the Property required pursuant to the terms and conditions of the applicable Property Management Agreement or Franchise Agreement.

A Tax and Insurance Reserve Account has been established into which the Borrower will be required to deposit (a) on the Origination Date, an amount of approximately $1,460,413, which amount, when added to the required monthly deposits described in this paragraph are to be sufficient to make the payments of Property Taxes and insurance premiums as required in the Mortgage Loan Agreement and (b) on each Payment Date, an amount equal to, (i) one-twelfth (1/12th) of the real estate and personal property taxes, assessments, water rates or sewer rents (“Property Taxes”) that the Lender estimates will be payable during the next twelve (12) months or such higher amount necessary to accumulate with the Lender sufficient funds to pay all such Property Taxes at least 30 days prior to the earlier of (a) the date such Property Taxes will become delinquent and (b) the date that additional charges or interest will accrue due to non-payment, and (ii) except to the extent the Lender has waived in writing the insurance escrow because the insurance required under the Mortgage Loan Documents is maintained under a blanket insurance policy acceptable to the Lender, one-twelfth (1/12th) of the insurance premiums that the Lender reasonably estimates will be payable during the next 12 months for the renewal of insurance coverage afforded by the insurance policies required to be carried by the Borrower upon their expiration or such higher amount necessary to accumulate with the Lender sufficient funds to pay all insurance premiums at least thirty (30) days prior to the expiration of the related insurance policies.

A Ground Rent Reserve Account has been established into which the Borrower was required to deposit on the Origination Date $725,000 (the “Ground Rent Reserve Balance”), which represents an amount sufficient to pay all Ground Rent for a one (1) month period as reasonably determined by the Lender (based on information provided by the Borrower).
Amounts so deposited are referred to in this Offering Circular as “Ground Rent Reserve Funds”.

If at any time the Lender receives notice of any delinquency in the payment of Ground Rent, the Lender may use any amounts on deposit in the Ground Rent Reserve Account to pay to the applicable Ground Lessor any such delinquent Ground Rents.

Within ten (10) Business Days following the Lender’s request therefor, Borrower will be required to deposit with the Lender an amount sufficient to replenish the Ground Rent Reserve Funds to the Ground Rent Reserve Balance.

Any such Cash Sweep Avoidance Collateral Funds (or any letter of credit delivered as Cash Sweep Avoidance Collateral) is required to be held by the Lender as additional collateral for the Mortgage Loan.

In the event the Lender draws on any letter of credit delivered as Cash Sweep Avoidance Collateral in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, the proceeds thereof are required to be deposited into the Cash Sweep Avoidance Collateral Reserve Account.

Upon written request from the Borrower and satisfaction of the requirements set forth in the Mortgage Loan Agreement, the Lender is required to disburse to the Borrower amounts from (i) the Replacement Reserve Account to the extent necessary to pay for or reimburse the Borrower for the actual costs of any approved Replacements, or (ii) the PIP Reserve Account to the extent necessary to pay for or reimburse Borrower for PIP Expenditures.

With each request for disbursement, the Borrower is required to certify in writing to the Lender that all Required Work that is the subject of the requested disbursement has been performed in accordance with all legal requirements and that all such Required Work has been completed lien free and paid for in full or will be paid for in full upon disbursement of the requested funds.

In addition, each request for disbursement in excess of $250,000 is required to be on a form provided or reasonably approved by the Lender and is required (i) to include copies of invoices for all items or materials purchased and all labor or services provided and (ii) to specify (A) the Required Work (or portion thereof) for which the disbursement is requested, (B) the quantity and price of each item purchased, if the Required Work includes the purchase or replacement of specific items, (C) the price of all materials (grouped by type or category) used in any Required Work other than the purchase or replacement of specific items, and (D) the cost of all contracted labor or other services applicable to each Required Work for which such request for disbursement is made.

Except as described in the immediately succeeding paragraph each request for disbursement may be made only after completion of the PIP Work (or the portion thereof completed in accordance with the provisions described in the immediately succeeding paragraph), for which disbursement is requested.
The Borrower is required to provide the Lender evidence satisfactory to the Lender in its reasonable judgment of such completion or performance.

If the cost of any item of Required Work exceeds $50,000, a request for disbursement from the Reserve Accounts may be made after completion of a portion of the work under such contract, provided (A) the materials for which the request is made are on site at the Property and are properly secured or have been installed in the Property, (B) all other conditions in the Mortgage Loan Agreement for disbursement have been satisfied, and (C) in the case of a Replacement or PIP Work, funds remaining in the Replacement Reserve Account or the PIP Reserve Account, as the case may be, are, in the Lender’s reasonable judgment, sufficient to complete such Replacement and other Replacements when required or to complete the remaining PIP Work when required, as the case may be.

The Borrower is not permitted to make a request for, nor will the Lender have any obligation to make, any disbursement from any Reserve Account in respect of Required Work more frequently than once in any calendar month and (except in connection with the final disbursement) in any amount less than the lesser of (i) $10,000 or (ii) the total cost of the Required Work for which the disbursement is requested.

If the funds in any Reserve Account exceed the amount of payments actually applied by the Lender for the purposes of the account, the Lender in its sole discretion will be required to either return any excess to the Borrower or credit such excess against future payments to be made to that Reserve Account.

If at any time Lender reasonably determines that the reserve funds are not or will not be sufficient to make the required payments, the Lender will be required to notify the Borrower of such determination and the Borrower will be required to pay to the Lender any amount necessary to make up the deficiency within ten (10) days after notice from the Lender to the Borrower requesting payment thereof.

The related Loan Documents require the Borrowers to direct nonresidential tenants to pay rent directly to, and the Borrowers are required to cause all other money received by the Borrowers or the property managers with respect to the Properties (other than tenant security deposits required to be held in escrow accounts) to be deposited directly in a lockbox account established and maintained by the Borrowers for the benefit of the lender as the secured party by the end of the first Business Day following receipt of such amounts.
Amounts on deposit in the Cash Management Account are required to be applied as described under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Cash Management Account” in this Offering Circular.
See “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserve Accounts” in this Offering Circular.
The Loan Agreement requires only the non-residential tenants to deliver all rents payable thereunder directly to the Cash Management Account.
The Loan Agreement provides that the Borrowers are required to deposit all amounts received by the Borrowers constituting rent into the Cash Management Account within one Business Day after receipt.
There is a risk that the Borrowers or a property manager could divert receipts from residential tenants at the Properties rather than reserving the amounts required under the Loan Documents.
The following reserve accounts are required to be funded upon the occurrence of specified events as described below and are required to be maintained as set forth below.
The lender will cause an account (the “Loss Proceeds Account”) to be maintained for the purpose of depositing any Loss Proceeds.

“Loss Proceeds” means amounts, awards or payments payable to the Borrowers or the lender in respect of all or any portion of any Property in connection with a casualty or condemnation thereof (after the deduction therefrom and payment to the Borrowers and the lender, respectively, of any and all reasonable expenses incurred by the Borrowers and the lender in the recovery thereof, including all attorneys’ fees and disbursements, the fees of insurance experts and adjusters and the costs incurred in any litigation or arbitration with respect to such casualty or condemnation).

“Approved Management Agreement” means (i) each Initial Management Agreement, (ii) a management agreement with an Approved Property Manager substantially in the same form and substance as the corresponding Initial Management Agreement or that is on an arms-length and basis and commercially reasonable terms (provided that in no event may the base management fees be in excess of 3% of the gross revenues derived from the Property to which such management agreement relates), or (iii) any other management agreement that is reasonably approved by the lender and in the case of clause (iii) only, at the option of the lender, with respect to which a Rating Agency Confirmation is obtained, in each case (x) as the same may be amended, restated, replaced, supplemented or otherwise modified in accordance with the Loan Documents and (y) unless and until the lender requests the termination of an Approved Management Agreement pursuant to and in accordance with the Loan Agreement.

“Approved Property Manager” means, (i) Investors Management Trust Real Estate Group, Inc., and any Affiliate thereof; (ii) LivCor; (iii) Greystar; (iv) ConAm; (v) Lincoln Properties; (vi) BH Management; (vii) Westdale; (viii) Bridge; (ix) an Affiliate of BPP; (x) an affiliate of a Qualified Transferee following a permitted transfer or (xi) a reputable and experienced real estate management organization possessing experience in managing during the previous five (5) years at least 10 multifamily properties with no less than 2,500 units in the aggregate at such time, and which is not then the subject of a bankruptcy or similar insolvency proceeding against it; or an entity that is otherwise approved by lender (which approval may be conditioned on satisfaction of the rating condition), provided in each case such property manager that is not then the subject of a bankruptcy or similar insolvency proceeding against it.
“Initial Management Agreement” means those certain Management Agreements attached as a schedule to the Loan Agreement.

“Lease” means any lease, license, letting, concession, occupancy agreement, sublease to which the Borrowers are a party or has a consent right, or other agreement (whether written or oral and whether in effect as of the Origination Date or thereafter) under which the Borrowers are a lessor, sublessor, licensor or other grantor existing as of the Origination Date or thereafter entered into by the Borrowers, in each case pursuant to which any Person is granted a possessory interest in, or right to use or occupy all or any portion of any space in any of the Properties, and every modification or amendment of such leases, and every guarantee of the performance and observance of the covenants, conditions and agreements to be performed and observed by the other party to such Lease; provided that no Approved Management Agreement will constitute or be deemed to be a “Lease”.

“Leasing Commissions” means leasing commissions required to be paid by the Borrowers in connection with the leasing of space to tenants at any of the Properties pursuant to existing Leases and Leases entered into by the Borrowers in accordance with the Loan Agreement and payable in accordance with written brokerage agreements on third party/arms’ length terms, or in accordance with the Approved Management Agreement, provided that the commissions payable pursuant to an Approved Management Agreement are commercially reasonable based upon the then current brokerage market for property of a similar type and quality to such Property in the geographic market in which the Property is located.

The lender will cause an account (the “Excess Cash Flow Reserve Account”) to be maintained for deposit of excess cash flow available to be deposited in such account from the Cash Management Account as described in clause (vi) under “—Cash Management”.
No funds were deposited into the Excess Cash Flow Reserve Account on or prior to the Origination Date.

“Approved Alterations” means (i) decorative work performed in the ordinary course, (ii) alterations and repairs arising out of a casualty or condemnation in accordance with the Loan Agreement, (iii) alterations required for remediation of life safety issues or to comply with applicable law, (iv) alterations specifically described and budgeted for in an Approved Annual Budget, (v) “rent-ready” work for any vacant residential space in the ordinary course of business, (vi) Tenant Improvements and other alterations performed in accordance with any Leases existing as of the Origination Date (pursuant to the terms thereof in existence as of the Origination Date or any amendment thereto entered into in accordance with the Loan Agreement) or any Leases thereafter entered into in accordance with the Loan Agreement, and (vii) work performed in connection with the deferred maintenance conditions.

“Tenant Improvements” means, collectively, (i) tenant improvements to be undertaken for any tenant that are required to be completed by or on behalf of Borrower pursuant to the terms of such tenant’s lease, and (ii) tenant improvements paid or reimbursed through allowances to a tenant pursuant to such tenant’s lease.
Each of the above described reserve accounts is required to be an Eligible Account.
The Borrowers have no right to make withdrawals from any of the collateral accounts.
Except for the Cash Management Account and the Lockbox Account, funds in the reserve accounts may be commingled with other monies held by the lender.
Funds in the reserve accounts may be invested only as permitted under the Loan Agreement.

“Eligible Account” means an account or book-entry subaccount maintained with a federal or state-chartered depository institution or trust company that complies with the definition of Eligible Institution.

“Eligible Institution” means (i) an institution whose commercial paper, short-term debt obligations or other shortterm deposits are rated at least “A–1” by S&P, “P–1” by Moody’s and “F–1” by Fitch, and whose long-term senior unsecured debt obligations are rated at least “A” by S&P, “A” by Fitch, and “A2” by Moody’s and whose deposits are insured by the FDIC, (ii) an institution with respect to which a Rating Agency Confirmation is obtained, or (iii) Wells Fargo, for purposes of serving as Lockbox Bank, in each case so long as it is not downgraded from the long term unsecured debt obligations and short term unsecured debt obligations ratings assigned to it as of the Origination Date.

Pursuant to a lockbox agreement, the Borrowers have established and maintain one or more lockbox accounts into which income from the Properties will be deposited (the “Lockbox Account”) with the Lockbox Bank.

The Borrowers have delivered to each non-residential tenant at a Property a written notice (a “Tenant Notice”) instructing that, for so long as the mortgage encumbers such Property, (i) all payments under such Lease be remitted by them directly to, and deposited directly into, the Lockbox Account, and (ii) such instruction may not be rescinded and/or modified unless and until such tenant receives from the Borrowers or lender a copy of lender’s written consent to such rescission and/or modification.

The Borrowers are required to cause all cash revenues relating to the Properties and all other money received by the Borrowers or the Approved Property Manager with respect to the Properties (but other than tenant security deposits required to be held in escrow accounts) to be deposited in the Lockbox Account by the end of the first Business Day following the Borrowers’ or the Approved Property Manager’s receipt of the money received with respect to the Property.

The lender has the right at any time and from time to time in its sole discretion to change the Eligible Institution at which any one or more of the reserve accounts (other than the Lockbox Account) is maintained (and in the case of any such change in respect of the Cash Management Account, the lender is required to deliver not less than 5 Business Days’ prior written notice to the Borrowers and the Lockbox Bank).

Upon the resignation of the Cash Management Bank or the lender’s election to change the Eligible Institution serving as Cash Management Bank as of the Origination Date, the lender is required to designate a substitute Cash Management Bank and use commercially reasonable efforts to cause such substitute Cash Management Bank to assume the obligations (on a going forward basis) of Cash Management Bank set forth in the existing Cash Management Agreement or cause such substitute Cash Management Bank to execute and deliver a Cash Management Agreement that is in the form of the existing Cash Management Agreement or otherwise reasonably acceptable to the lender and the Borrowers, and the Borrowers are required to reasonably cooperate with the foregoing.
The Borrowers are required to maintain at all times an operating account (the “Operating Account”) into which amounts may be deposited from time to time.

The Borrowers may not permit any amounts unrelated to a Property to be commingled with amounts on deposit in the Operating Account other than income and gains from the investment of funds in the accounts held on behalf of the Borrowers.
The lender has received from the Borrowers a pledge of all of their interests in and to each of the reserve accounts.

“Budgeted Operating Expenses” means, with respect to any calendar month, an amount equal to the Operating Expenses budgeted for such calendar month as set forth in the then-applicable Approved Annual Budget.

“Cash Management Agreement” means that certain cash management agreement, dated as of the Origination Date, among the Borrowers, the lender and the Cash Management Bank that maintains the Cash Management Account as of the Origination Date, as the same may from time to time be amended, restated, replaced, supplemented or otherwise modified in accordance herewith.

“Cash Management Bank” means Wells Fargo Bank, National Association or such other bank designated from time to time by the lender (which must be an Eligible Institution) upon 5 Business Days’ prior written notice to the Borrower.

“Lockbox Bank” means Wells Fargo Bank, National Association, in each case so long as it is not downgraded from the long term unsecured debt obligations and short term unsecured debt obligations ratings assigned to it as of the Origination Date.

“Operating Expenses” means all ordinary costs and expenses with respect to the operation, management, maintenance, repair and use of the Properties, including property taxes and insurance premiums (but excluding any one time extraordinary expenses, depreciation and other non-cash items, non-recurring expenses, principal, debt service on the Mortgage Loan and other amounts due and payable on the Mortgage Loan, Leasing Commissions, capital expenditures, capital reserves, contributions to the collateral accounts and income taxes and other taxes in the nature of income taxes); provided that for purposes of calculating net operating income, Operating Expenses will be adjusted (i) to reflect any changes in both property taxes and insurance premiums that will take effect during the succeeding 12 months, to the extent known as of the date of determination and (ii) to reflect an assumed annual base property management agreement fee equal to the 3% of gross revenues.

The related loan documents require the Borrowers to direct non-residential tenants to pay rent directly to, and the Borrowers are required to cause all other money received by the Borrowers or the property managers with respect to the Properties (other than tenant security deposits required to be held in escrow accounts) to be deposited directly in a lockbox account established and maintained by the Borrowers for the benefit of the lender as the secured party by the end of the first business day following receipt of such amounts.

The related Loan Documents require the Borrowers to direct non-residential tenants to pay rent directly to, and the Borrowers are required to cause all other money received by the Borrowers or the property managers with respect to the Properties (other than tenant security deposits required to be held in escrow accounts) to be deposited directly in, a lockbox account established and maintained by the Borrowers for the benefit of the lender as the secured party by the end of the first Business Day following receipt of such amounts.
Amounts on deposit in the Cash Management Account are required to be applied as described under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Cash Management Account” in the Offering Circular.

The Pool A Borrowers are required to establish a Restricted Account and, as and when required as described below, a Cash Management Account and a Debt Service Account with respect to the Pool A Mortgage Loan and the Pool A Properties which will serve as collateral for the Pool A Mortgage Loan only.

The Pool B Borrowers are required to establish a Restricted Account and, as and when required as described below, a Cash Management Account and a Debt Service Account with respect to the Pool B Mortgage Loan and the Pool B Properties which will serve as collateral for the Pool B Mortgage Loan only.

The Pool C Borrowers are required to establish a Restricted Account and, as and when required as described below, a Cash Management Account and a Debt Service Account with respect to the Pool C Mortgage Loan and the Pool C Properties which will serve as collateral for the Pool C Mortgage Loan only.

The Pool A Mortgage Loan, the Pool B Mortgage Loan and the Pool C Mortgage Loan are not cross-collateralized and as such (a) the funds standing to the credit of any Restricted Account, Cash Management Account or Debt Service Account with respect to the Pool A Mortgage Loan and Pool A Properties will not be available to satisfy the debts and obligations of the Pool B Borrowers or the Pool C Borrowers, including, under the Pool B Mortgage Loan or the Pool C Mortgage Loan, as applicable, (b) the funds standing to the credit of any Restricted Account, Cash Management Account or Debt Service Account with respect to the Pool B Mortgage Loan and the Pool B Properties will not be available to satisfy the debts and obligations of the Pool A Borrowers or the Pool C Borrowers, including, under the Pool A Mortgage Loan or the Pool C Mortgage Loan, as applicable, and (c) the funds standing to the credit of any Restricted Account, Cash Management Account or Debt Service Account with respect to the Pool C Mortgage Loan and the Pool C Properties will not be available to satisfy the debts and obligations of the Pool A Borrowers or the Pool B Borrowers, including, under the Pool A Mortgage Loan or the Pool B Mortgage Loan, as applicable.
With respect to each Mortgage Loan, the related Borrower is required, as and when described below, to establish the following accounts:
The Borrowers are required to establish a property-level account (a “Restricted Account”).
The Restricted Account will be in the name of the applicable Borrower for the sole and exclusive benefit of the Mortgage Lender.
The Borrowers are required to deposit, or to cause to be deposited, all revenue generated by each Property into the related Restricted Account.
See “DESCRIPTION OF THE MORTGAGE LOANS—Restricted Account” in this Offering Circular.

Funds from the Pool A Properties will be deposited into Reserve Accounts (as defined below) with respect to the Pool A Mortgage Loan and the Pool A Properties, which Reserve Accounts will serve as collateral for the Pool A Mortgage Loan only.

Funds from the Pool B Properties will be deposited into Reserve Accounts (as defined below) with respect to the Pool B Mortgage Loan and the Pool B Properties, which Reserve Accounts will serve as collateral for the Pool B Mortgage Loan only.

Funds from the Pool C Properties will be deposited into Reserve Accounts (as defined below) with respect to the Pool C Mortgage Loan and the Pool C Properties, which Reserve Accounts will serve as collateral for the Pool C Mortgage Loan only.

The Pool A Mortgage Loan, the Pool B Mortgage Loan and the Pool C Mortgage Loan are not cross-collateralized and as such (a) the Reserve Accounts held with respect to the Pool A Mortgage Loan will not be available to satisfy the debts and obligations of the Pool B Borrowers or the Pool C Borrowers, including, under the Pool B Mortgage Loan or the Pool C Mortgage Loan, as applicable, (b) the Reserve Accounts held with respect to the Pool B Mortgage Loan will not be available to satisfy the debts and obligations of the Pool A Borrowers or the Pool C Borrowers, including, under the Pool A Mortgage Loan or the Pool C Mortgage Loan, as applicable, and (c) the Reserve Accounts held with respect to the Pool C Mortgage Loan will not be available to satisfy the debts and obligations of the Pool A Borrowers or the Pool B Borrowers, including, under the Pool A Mortgage Loan or the Pool B Mortgage Loan, as applicable.
See “DESCRIPTION OF THE MORTGAGE LOANS—Prepayment—Voluntary Prepayment—Pool A Mortgage Loan” and “DESCRIPTION OF THE MORTGAGE LOANS—Debt Yield Coverage Cure Funds” in this Offering Circular.

See “DESCRIPTION OF THE MORTGAGE LOANS—Tax and Insurance Funds”, “—Capital Expenditure Reserve Funds”, “—Environmental Conditions Reserve Funds”, “—Leasing Reserve Funds”, “—Excess Cash Flow Fund”, “—Operating Expense Funds”, “—Unfunded Obligations Reserve Funds” and “—Debt Yield Coverage Cure Funds” in this Offering Circular.

The Pool A Borrowers, the Pool B Borrowers and the Pool C Borrowers are required to establish and maintain a Restricted Account (as defined under “DESCRIPTION OF THE MORTGAGE LOANS—Extension Options” in this Offering Circular) pursuant to the applicable Restricted Account Agreement in the name of the applicable Borrower for the sole and exclusive benefit of the applicable Mortgage Lender into which the applicable Borrower will deposit, or cause to be deposited, all revenue generated by the applicable Properties.

On the Origination Date, Borrower represented that it sent a notice to all tenants occupying space at the applicable Property as of the Origination Date directing them to pay all rent and other sums due under the lease to which they are a party into the applicable Restricted Account.

In addition, simultaneously with the execution of any lease entered into on or after the Origination Date in accordance with the terms and conditions of the applicable Mortgage Loan Agreement, the applicable Borrower is required to furnish each tenant under each lease a direction letter to deposit all rent and other sums due under the leases to which such tenant is a party into the applicable Restricted Account.

In addition, pursuant to the applicable Mortgage Loan Documents, the Property Manager agreed that all revenues generated from the applicable Property and/or payable by the Property Manager to the applicable Borrower will be held and disbursed in accordance with the terms and conditions of the applicable Mortgage Loan Agreement.
In addition, there is no assurance that the Cash Management Account will be established as and when required under the applicable Mortgage Loan Agreement.

Because some funds may be received directly by the related Borrowers or the Property Manager, we cannot assure you that such revenues will in fact be deposited by such entities into the applicable Restricted Account.
Accordingly, in the event of the bankruptcy of a Borrower, the Mortgage Lender may only have a perfected security interest in the funds actually on deposit in the related Restricted Account.
Federal bankruptcy law also may interfere with the Mortgage Lender’s ability to enforce lockbox requirements under the related account and control agreement.
The legal proceedings necessary to resolve these issues can be time consuming and may significantly delay the receipt of revenue from the Properties.

Further, in a bankruptcy or other proceeding, certain revenue from the Properties also may escape an assignment to the extent they are used by a Borrower to maintain its Property or for other court authorized expenses.

The applicable Borrower is required to deposit, or cause the applicable Manager to deposit, all revenue generated by the applicable Property and received by the applicable Borrower or the applicable Manager, as the case may be, into the applicable Restricted Account and in which the applicable Mortgage Lender has a first-priority security interest.
