“Assignee Borrower” means another applicable Borrower under the applicable Mortgage Loan that owns one or more applicable Properties then remaining subject to the liens of the applicable Mortgage Loan Documents to which, (a) with respect to the Pool A Mortgage Loan Agreement, DDRM Countryside LLC assigns all of its right, title and interest in and to the applicable Mortgage Loan Documents, (b) with respect to the Pool B Mortgage Loan Agreement, DDRM Springfield Commons LLC assigns all of its right, title and interest in and to the applicable Interest Rate Protection Agreement and (c) with respect to the Pool C Mortgage Loan Agreement, DDRM Shoppes of Ellenwood LLC assigns all of its right, title and interest in and to the applicable Interest Rate Protection Agreement.

“Operating Expenses” means the total of all expenditures, computed in accordance with the Approved Accounting Method, of whatever kind relating to the operation, maintenance and management of the applicable Properties that are secured by the applicable Security Instruments on such date of calculation and that are incurred on a regular monthly or other periodic basis, including without limitation, (and without duplication) (a) utilities, ordinary repairs and maintenance, insurance, license fees, property taxes and assessments, advertising expenses, payroll and related taxes, computer processing charges, management fees (equal to the greater of (x) three percent (3.00%) of Gross Income from Operations for the trailing twelve (12) month period or (y) actual management fees payable under the applicable Management Agreement), operational equipment or other lease payments as set forth in the Annual Budget or Approved Annual Budget, as applicable, as reasonably approved by the applicable Mortgage Lender, (b) normalized Capital Expenditures equal to the aggregate square footage multiplied by (I) with respect to the Pool A Mortgage Loan Agreement, $0.32, (II) with respect to the Pool B Mortgage Loan Agreement, $0.35 and (III) with respect to the Pool C Mortgage Loan Agreement, $0.45, (c) normalized tenant improvement and leasing commission expenditures equal to the aggregate square footage multiplied by $1.00 and (d) the Tax and Insurance Adjustment, but specifically excluding (i) depreciation, amortization and any other non-cash items, (ii) Debt Service, (iii) non-recurring or extraordinary expenses, and (iv) deposits into the Reserve Funds.

“Reserve Funds” means the applicable Tax and Insurance Funds, the applicable Capital Expenditure Reserve Funds, the applicable Environmental Conditions Reserve Funds, the applicable Leasing Reserve Funds, the applicable Excess Cash Flow Funds, the applicable Operating Expense Funds, the applicable Unfunded Obligations Reserve Funds, solely with respect to the Pool A Mortgage Loan Agreement, the Debt Yield Coverage Cure Funds and any other escrow funds established by the applicable Mortgage Loan Agreement or the other applicable Mortgage Loan Documents.

“Security Instruments” mean, individually and/or collectively (as the context requires), each first priority Mortgage and Security Agreement, Deed of Trust and Security Agreement, and/or Deed to Secure Debt and Security Agreement dated the date hereof, executed and delivered by the applicable Borrower as security for the applicable Mortgage Loan and encumbering the applicable Property (or any portion thereof), as the same may be amended, restated, replaced, supplemented or otherwise modified from time to time.

“Cash Management Account” means an Eligible Account with the applicable Mortgage Lender or applicable servicer, as applicable, in the name of the applicable Borrower for the sole and exclusive benefit of the applicable Mortgage Lender.

The lender is required to maintain a book-entry subaccount for the purpose of reserving amounts payable by the Borrowers in respect of taxes and insurance premiums (the “Basic Carrying Costs Escrow Account”).

Additionally, if at any time the lender reasonably determines that the amount in the Basic Carrying Costs Escrow Account will not be sufficient to accumulate (upon payment of subsequent monthly amounts) the full amount of all installments of taxes and insurance premiums by the date on which such amounts come due, then the Borrowers will be required to increase their monthly payments to the Basic Carrying Costs Escrow Account by the amount that the lender reasonably estimates is sufficient to achieve such accumulation.
A blanket insurance policy was in place as of the Origination Date.
The lender will maintain a book-entry subaccount for the purpose of reserving amounts in respect of FF&E at the Properties (the “FF&E Reserve Account”).

On each Payment Date, the Borrowers will be required to remit to the lender for deposit into the FF&E Reserve Account an amount equal to the Monthly FF&E Reserve Amount (less any FF&E Reserve True-Up Amount credit).

In addition, on the Payment Date immediately following the lender’s receipt from the Borrowers of a quarterly financial statement with respect to a fiscal quarter, (1) if the FF&E Reserve True-Up Amount for such fiscal quarter is a positive number, then the Borrowers will be required to deposit such amount into the FF&E Reserve Account, and (2) if the FF&E Reserve True-Up Amount is a negative number, then such amount will be credited toward the next Monthly FF&E Reserve Amounts required to be deposited into the FF&E Reserve Account pursuant to the above.

“FF&E Reserve True-Up Amount” means, with respect to any fiscal quarter, the positive or negative difference between (i) the amount that would have been deposited into the FF&E Reserve Account during such fiscal quarter had the Monthly FF&E Reserve Amount been based on actual (rather than budgeted) operating income, minus (ii) the amount actually deposited into the FF&E Reserve Account during such fiscal quarter (excluding any FF&E Reserve True-Up Amounts deposited in respect of previous fiscal quarters).

“Monthly FF&E Reserve Amount” means, with respect to each Payment Date, the greater of (1) any amount required to be reserved for FF&E under any Approved Management Agreement or approved franchise agreement and (2) an amount equal to the product of (x) 1/12, times (y) 5%, times (z) the operating income of the Properties during the immediately preceding 12-month period.

If quarterly financial statements have not yet been delivered to the lender in respect of any portion of such 12-month period, then the determination of operating income for such portion will be based on the annual budget until such financial statements are received.

The reserve accounts will not constitute trust funds and, except for the Cash Management Account and the Lockbox Account, may be commingled with other monies held by the lender.
Funds in the reserve accounts will be invested only in certain investments meeting certain Rating Agency criteria, which investments will be credited to the related reserve account.
All income and gains from the investment of funds in the Basic Carrying Costs Escrow Account will be for the account of the Borrowers.

The Borrower is required to cause all rents to be transmitted directly by tenants of the Mortgaged Property into a clearing account (the “Clearing Account”) established and maintained by the Borrower at an eligible institution selected by the Borrower and reasonably approved by the Mortgage Lender (the “Clearing Bank”) pursuant to a deposit account control agreement.

Without in any way limiting the foregoing, if the Borrower or the property manager receives any gross revenue from the Mortgaged Property, then (i) such amounts will be deemed to be collateral for the Mortgage Loan and will be held in trust for the benefit, and as the property, of the Mortgage Lender, (ii) such amounts may not be commingled with any other funds or property of the Borrower or the property manager, and (iii) the Borrower or the property manager will be required to deposit such amounts in the Clearing Account within ten business days of receipt.

On each business day, funds in the Clearing Account will be swept by the Clearing Bank into a deposit account (the “Cash Management Account”), which is required to be an eligible account, established pursuant to a cash management agreement.

The Mortgage Lender may also establish subaccounts of the Cash Management Account, which is required to be at all times be eligible accounts (and may be ledger or book-entry accounts and not actual accounts).

“Mortgage Loan Debt Yield” means, as of any date of determination, a ratio, expressed as a percentage, in which (a) the numerator is the underwritten net cash flow as of such date, and (b) the denominator is the outstanding balance of the Mortgage Loan as of such date.

“Replacement Reserve Monthly Deposit” means, for each date of determination, one twelfth (1/12) of the amount equal to the Aggregate Square Footage multiplied by fifteen cents ($0.15). “Replacement Reserve Cap” means 24 times the Replacement Reserve Monthly Deposit.

“Aggregate Square Footage” means the aggregate rentable square footage of the Mortgaged Properties as set forth on the schedules to the Mortgage Loan Agreements (excluding the rentable square footage of each Mortgaged Property that has been released as collateral for the Mortgage Loan).

The Mortgage Lender is required to disburse funds from the Replacement Reserve Fund to the Borrower to pay for certain replacements required to be made to the Mortgaged Properties, subject to the satisfaction of certain conditions set forth in the Mortgage Loan Documents, including, but not limited to, the Borrower’s submission to the Mortgage Lender of (i) a request for payment specifying the replacements for which payment is required at least 10 days prior to the date on which the Borrower requests that such payment be made and (ii) an officer’s certificate certifying that related replacements have been completed in a good and workmanlike manner and in accordance with legal requirements, in all material respects.

The Mortgage Lender is required to disburse funds only if the request for disbursement is in an amount greater than $25,000 (or a lesser amount if the total amount in the Replacement Reserve Fund is less than $25,000, in which case only one disbursement of the amount remaining in the Replacement Reserve Fund is made).

The insufficiency of any balance in the Replacement Reserve Fund will not relieve the Borrower from its obligations to preserve and maintain the Mortgaged Properties in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Documents.
“Rollover Reserve Monthly Deposit” means, for each date of determination, one twelfth (1/12) of the amount equal to the Aggregate Square Footage multiplied by thirty cents ($0.30).
“Rollover Reserve Cap” means 24 times the Rollover Reserve Monthly Deposit.

The Mortgage Lender is required to disburse funds from the Rollover Reserve Fund to pay tenant improvement costs, tenant allowances, tenant relocation costs, tenant reimbursements, tenant related capital expenditures and leasing commission obligations or other expenditures required pursuant to a lease which are incurred or otherwise payable following the Closing Date (“Rollover Costs”) and/or vacant space preparation costs and marketing costs, subject to the satisfaction of certain conditions set forth in the Mortgage Loan Documents, including, but not limited to the Borrower’s submission to the Mortgage Lender of (i) a request for payment specifying the tenant improvements, leasing commissions and/or vacant space preparation costs and marketing costs for which payment is required at least 10 days prior to the date on which the Borrower requests that such payment be made and (ii) with respect to any request for payment relating to tenant improvement costs, an officer’s certificate certifying that the tenant improvements to be funded by the requested disbursements have been (or will be) completed in a good and workmanlike manner and in accordance with legal requirements in all material respects.

The Mortgage Lender will be required to disburse funds only if the request for disbursement is in an amount greater than $25,000 (or a lesser amount if the total amount in the Rollover Reserve Fund is less than $25,000, in which case only one disbursement of the amount remaining in the Rollover Reserve Fund will be made).

Pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Documents, the Borrower deposited into an unfunded obligations reserve account (the “Unfunded Obligations Reserve Fund”) (i) on the Origination Date, an amount equal to $1,836,559.09, which funds were for outstanding free rent and unfunded tenant improvement allowance, landlord work and leasing commissions outstanding as of the Origination Date which are to be performed or funded in the 12 months following the Origination Date pursuant to certain Leases in effect at the Mortgaged Properties.

The Mortgage Lender is required to release funds from the Unfunded Obligations Reserve Fund with respect to expired free rent credits and disburse funds from the Unfunded Obligations Reserve Fund to pay such unfunded tenant improvement allowance, landlord work and leasing commissions, subject to the satisfaction of certain conditions set forth in the Mortgage Loan Documents, including, but not limited to the Borrower’s submission to the Mortgage Lender of (i) a request for payment, which request for tenant improvement costs and/or leasing commissions are required to specify the tenant improvements and leasing commissions for which payment is required at least 10 days prior to the date on which the Borrower requests that such payment be made and (ii) with respect to any request for payment relating to tenant improvement costs, an officer’s certificate certifying that tenant improvements to be funded by the requested disbursements have been (or will be) completed in a good and workmanlike manner and in accordance with legal requirements in all material respects.

The Mortgage Lender is required to disburse funds only if the request for disbursement is in an amount greater than $25,000 (or a lesser amount if the total amount in the Unfunded Obligations Reserve Fund is less than $25,000, in which case only one disbursement of the amount remaining in the Unfunded Obligations Reserve Fund will be made).

Pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Documents, the Borrower is required to deposit into a reserve account (the “Lease Termination Reserve Fund”), in addition to and not as substitute for any required deposits for the Rollover Reserve Fund following the early termination of a lease by its tenant all lease termination payments actually received by the Borrower for the tenant under such lease.

The Mortgage Lender is required to disburse to the Borrower funds from the Lease Termination Reserve Fund to pay leasing costs and/or vacant space preparation costs and marketing costs subject to the satisfaction of certain conditions set forth in the Mortgage Loan Documents, including, but not limited to the Borrower’s submission to the Mortgage Lender of (i) a request for payment specifying the costs for which payment is required at least 10 days prior to the date on which the Borrower requests that such payment be made and (ii) with respect to any request for payment relating to tenant improvement costs, an officer’s certificate certifying that tenant improvements to be funded by the requested disbursements have been completed in a good and workmanlike manner and in accordance with legal requirements in all material respects.

The Mortgage Lender will be required to disburse funds only if the request for disbursement is in an amount greater than $25,000 (or a lesser amount if the total amount in the Lease Termination Reserve Fund is less than $25,000, in which case only one disbursement of the amount remaining in the Lease Termination Reserve Fund will be made).

Amounts deposited in the Replacement Reserve Fund, Rollover Reserve Fund and/or the Lease Termination Reserve Fund will be available with respect to any Mortgaged Property in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Mortgage Loan Documents.

The Borrower may not, without the Mortgage Lender’s prior written consent (such consent not to be unreasonably withheld): (i) surrender, terminate or cancel the Management Agreements; provided, that the Borrower may, without the Mortgage Lender’s or the Mezzanine Lender’s consent, replace any Mortgaged Property Manager so long as (A) the replacement manager is a Qualified Manager pursuant to a Replacement Management Agreement or (B) the proposed replacement manager is a party that is under common control with the related Existing Manager; (ii) reduce or consent to the reduction of the term of a Management Agreement; (iii) increase or consent to the increase of the amount of any charges or fees under the Management Agreements in a manner that would reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse Effect in respect of a Mortgaged Property; (iv) otherwise modify, change, supplement, alter or amend, or waive or release any of its rights and remedies under, the Management Agreements in a manner that would reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse Effect in respect of a Mortgaged Property; or (v) enter into an agreement or an amendment that provides that the base management fee under any Management Agreement exceeds 3.0% of gross income from operations attributable to the related Mortgaged Property.

The Loan Documents require the Borrower to fund (subject to exceptions described below) the following reserve funds (collectively, the “Reserve Funds”):

Unfunded Obligations Reserve: On the Origination Date, the Borrower deposited $5,623,512 representing, in the aggregate, any outstanding free rent, tenant improvement allowances and/or leasing commissions due in connection with any lease at each Property as of the Origination Date.

University Centre Reserve Funds: On the Origination Date, the Borrower deposited (i) $2,599,345 representing, in the aggregate, 115% of the total cost of the University Centre Restoration Budget in effect as of the Origination Date and (ii) $198,676 representing, in the aggregate, the full amount of the rent payable by affected tenants, in accordance with the terms of the Loan Documents.

Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the immediately preceding sentences with respect to the taxes payable directly by tenants identified in the Loan Documents pursuant to the related lease (such taxes, the “PBO Taxes”), the lender will pay such PBO Taxes only if the lender failed to receive certain documentation specified in the Loan Documents within 30 days after the due date for such PBO Taxes.
Excess Cash Flow reserve funds will be used to pay certain enumerated expenses as more particularly described in this Offering Circular.
The reserve deposits are subject to adjustment in connection with, and following, the release of, Collateral in accordance with the Loan Documents.
See “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserve Funds”.
“Test Date” means the last day of each fiscal quarter.

“Bankruptcy Action” means with respect to any Person (a) such Person filing a voluntary petition under the Bankruptcy Code; (b) the filing of an involuntary petition against such Person under the Bankruptcy Code, or soliciting or causing to be solicited petitioning creditors for any involuntary petition against such Person under the Bankruptcy Code; (c) such Person filing an answer consenting to or otherwise acquiescing in or joining in any involuntary petition filed against it, by any other Person under the Bankruptcy Code; (d) such Person consenting to or acquiescing in or joining in an application for the appointment of a custodian, receiver, trustee, or examiner for such Person or any portion of any individual Property or any portion of the Collateral; or (e) such Person making an assignment for the benefit of creditors.

“Person” means any individual, corporation, partnership, joint venture, limited liability company, estate, trust, unincorporated association, any federal, state, county or municipal government or any bureau, department or agency thereof and any other entity and, in each case, any fiduciary acting in such capacity on behalf of any of the foregoing.

The Borrower is required to deposit, or cause the Property Manager to deposit, all revenue derived from the Property and received by the Borrower or the Property Manager, as the case may be, into the Restricted Account and in which the lender has a first-priority security interest.

The Borrower is required within 14 days following the Origination Date to send tenant direction notices to all tenants occupying space at the Properties directing them to pay all rent and other sums due under the related leases to which they are a party into the Restricted Account.

The Borrower is required to deliver a similar notice simultaneously with the execution of any lease entered into on or after the Origination Date in accordance with the applicable terms and conditions of the Loan Agreement.

Neither the Borrower nor any other Person may maintain other accounts into which revenues from the ownership and operation of the Properties are directly deposited and neither the Borrower nor any other Person may open any other such account with respect to the direct deposit of income in connection with the Properties.

“Reserve Funds” means the Tax and Insurance Funds, the Capital Expenditure Reserve Funds, the Leasing Reserve Funds, the Excess Cash Flow Funds, the Operating Expense Funds, the Unfunded Obligations Reserve Funds and any other escrow funds established by the Loan Agreement or the other Loan Documents.

“Restricted Account” means one or more Eligible Accounts created pursuant to the Restricted Account Agreement in the name of the Borrower for the sole and exclusive benefit of the lender into which the Borrower is required to deposit, or cause to be deposited, all revenue generated by the Properties.

“Restricted Account Agreement” means that certain Blocked Account Control Agreement by and among JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A., the lender and DT Brookside LLC, dated as of the Origination Date, as the same may be amended, restated, replaced, supplemented or otherwise modified from time to time in accordance with the terms of the Loan Agreement.

“Security Instruments” or “Mortgage” means, individually and/or collectively (as the context requires), each first priority Mortgage and Security Agreement, Deed of Trust and Security Agreement, and/or Deed to Secure Debt and Security Agreement dated the date hereof, executed and delivered by the Borrower as security for the Mortgage Loan and encumbering the Properties (or any portion thereof), as the same may be amended, restated, replaced, supplemented or otherwise modified from time to time.

For so long as the Debt remains outstanding, (i) the Borrower will, or will cause the Property Manager to, immediately deposit all rent and other revenue derived from the Property and received by the Borrower or the Property Manager, as the case may be, into the Restricted Account and (ii) within 14 days following the Origination Date, the Borrower will send a notice to all tenants directing them to pay all rent and other sums due under the related lease to which they are a party into the Restricted Account.

The Borrower will maintain the Cash Management Account for so long as the Debt remains outstanding, which Cash Management Account will be under the sole dominion and control of the lender (subject to the terms of the Loan Agreement and of the Cash Management Agreement).
The Cash Management Account will have a title evidencing the foregoing in a manner reasonably acceptable to the lender.

The Borrower granted to the lender a first-priority security interest in the Cash Management Account and all deposits at any time contained therein and the proceeds thereof and will take all actions necessary to maintain in favor of the lender a perfected first priority security interest in the Cash Management Account.

The Borrower authorized the lender to file UCC Financing Statements and continuations thereof to perfect the lender’s security interest in the Cash Management Account and all deposits at any time contained therein and the proceeds thereof.
Such financing statements may describe as the collateral covered thereby “all assets of the debtor, whether now owned or hereafter acquired” or words to that effect.
All costs and expenses for establishing and maintaining the Cash Management Account (or any successor thereto) will be paid by the Borrower.
All monies now or hereafter deposited into the Cash Management Account will be deemed additional security for the Debt.
The Borrower will pay all sums due under and otherwise comply with the Cash Management Agreement.
The Borrower will not alter or modify the Cash Management Account or the Cash Management Agreement, in each case without the prior written consent of the lender.

The Cash Management Agreement will provide (and the Borrower will provide) the lender online access to bank and other financial statements relating to the Cash Management Account (including, without limitation, a listing of the receipts being collected therein).

The lender will have the right to cause the Cash Management Account to be entitled with such other designation as the lender may select to reflect an assignment or transfer of the lender’s rights and/or interests with respect to the Cash Management Account.
The lender will provide the Borrower with prompt written notice of any such renaming of the Cash Management Account.

The Borrower will not further pledge, assign or grant any security interest in the Cash Management Account or the monies deposited therein or permit any lien or encumbrance to attach thereto, or any levy to be made thereon, or any UCC Financing Statements, except those naming the lender as the secured party, to be filed with respect thereto.
The Cash Management Account (i) will be an Eligible Account and (ii) will not be commingled with other monies held by the Borrower or the applicable Bank.
Such power of attorney will be deemed to be a power coupled with an interest and cannot be revoked.

“Bank” means (individually and/or collectively, as the context requires) the bank or other institution maintaining the Cash Management Account and/or the Restricted Account, as applicable, pursuant to the Cash Management Agreement and/or the Restricted Account Agreement, as applicable.
Amounts deposited pursuant to “—Capital Expenditure Reserve Funds” are referred to in the Loan Agreement as the “Capital Expenditure Reserve Funds”.
The lender is required to disburse the Capital Expenditure Reserve Funds only for Capital Expenditures at each Property.

Within thirty (30) days after the end of each calendar month, the Borrower is required to provide to the lender (i) a list of each Person that supplied materials or labors in connection with the Capital Expenditures during the previous calendar month, (ii) lien waivers for all completed work at the Property (or to the extent the lender is prohibited from requiring waivers under applicable law with respect to work performed or materials delivered, in each case which have yet to be paid for, subordinations, conditional waivers and/or other documentation reasonably satisfactory to the lender), (iii) invoices and/or other evidence of payment of amounts owing reasonably satisfactory to the lender for payments in excess of $250,000, (iv) at the lender’s option, if the cost of any individual Capital Expenditure exceeds $250,000, a report satisfactory to the lender in its reasonable discretion form an architect or engineer approved by the lender in respect of such architect’s or engineer’s inspection of such Capital Expenditures and (v) at the lender’s option, if the cost of any individual Capital Expenditure exceeds $250,000, a title search for the Property indicating that the Property is free from all liens, claims and other encumbrances other than Permitted Encumbrances.

The lender is not required to disburse Capital Expenditures Reserves Funds more frequently than twice each calendar month nor in an amount less than the Minimum Disbursement Amount (or a lesser amount if the total amount of Capital Expenditures Reserve Funds is less than the Minimum Disbursement Amount, in which case only one disbursement of the amount \remaining in the account will be made).

Notwithstanding the foregoing, in connection with the Borrower’s sale of any Property pursuant to the terms of the Loan Agreement, the lender acknowledges that the Borrower may request and the Lender is required to disburse to the Borrower a portion of the Capital Expenditure Reserve Funds to fund any capital expense reserves required under the purchase and sale agreement for such Property for post-closing work or to fund any credit required by the purchaser for post-closing work.

Nothing in the related Loan Agreement (i) makes the lender responsible for making or completing the Capital Expenditures; (ii) requires the lender to expend funds in addition to the Capital Expenditure Reserve Funds to complete any Capital Expenditures; (iii) obligates the lender to proceed with the Capital Expenditures; or (iv) obligates the lender to demand from the Borrower additional sums to complete any Capital Expenditures.

The Borrower is required to permit the lender and the lender’s agents and representatives (including, without limitation, the lender’s engineer, architect, or inspector) or third parties to enter onto the Property upon reasonably advance notice during normal business hours (subject to the rights of tenants under their leases) to inspect the progress of any Capital Expenditures and all materials being used in connection therewith and to examine all plans and shop drawings relating to such Capital Expenditures.

The Borrower must cause all contractors and subcontractors to cooperate with the lender or the lender’s representatives or such other Persons described above in connection with inspections described in this “—Capital Expenditure Reserve Funds” section.
Any amounts remaining in the Capital Expenditure Reserve Fund after the Debt is paid in full will be returned to the Borrower.

“Capital Expenditures” for any period means replacements and/or alterations to any individual Property; provided, that, the same are (i) required to be capitalized according to the approved accounting method and (ii) included in the Annual Budget or Approved Annual Budget, as applicable.
“Minimum Disbursement Amount” means $15,000.

“Permitted Encumbrances” means, with respect to each individual Property, collectively, (a) the lien and security interests created by the Loan Agreement and the other Loan Documents, (b) all liens, encumbrances and other matters disclosed in the applicable Title Insurance Policy, (c) liens, if any, for taxes imposed by any Governmental Authority not yet delinquent or which are being contested in accordance with the terms of the Loan Agreement, (d) existing leases and new leases entered into in accordance with the Loan Agreement, (e) such other title and survey exceptions as the lender has approved or may approve in writing in the lender’s reasonable discretion, (f) any workers’, mechanics’ or similar liens on an individual Property that are bonded or discharged in accordance with the Loan Agreement within forty-five (45) days after the Borrower first received written notice of such lien, (g) any liens that are being contested in accordance with the terms of the Loan Agreement, (h) rights of tenants, as tenants only, under leases permitted hereunder, (i) all liens and security interests that are in connection with a permitted equipment lease, (j) all immaterial easements, rights-of-way, restrictions and other similar encumbrances recorded against and affecting such individual Property so long as the same are entered into in the ordinary course of the Borrower’s business (but in no event in connection with the borrowing of money or the obtaining of advances or credit) and do not (1) interfere with the ordinary conduct of the business of the Borrower or (2) have a material adverse effect, (k) any easements, restrictions, covenants, reservations and rights of way for access, water and sewer lines, telephone, cable or other fiber optic or other data transaction lines, electric lines or other utilities or for other similar purposes entered into in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Loan Agreement and (l) liens created against the Property in error or by any tenant or third party with respect to a lease so long as (1) the Borrower is diligently exercising its rights and remedies under the applicable leases, other agreement or otherwise against such tenant or third party to have such liens removed and (2) such liens do not (A) interfere with the ordinary conduct of the business of the Borrower or (B) have a material adverse effect.

Additionally, if, at any time, the lender determines that amounts on deposit in or scheduled to be deposited in (i) the Tax Account will be insufficient to pay all Taxes at each Property in full on the Tax Payment Date and/or (ii) the Insurance Account will be insufficient to pay all Insurance Premiums for Policies covering each Property in full on the Insurance Payment Date, the Borrower is required to make a True Up Payment with respect to such insufficiency into the reserve account.

The Borrower is required to notify the lender promptly of any changes to the amounts, schedules, and instructions for payment of any Taxes and Insurance Premiums at each Property of which it has or obtains knowledge and authorizes the lender or its agent to obtain the bills for Taxes at each Property directly from the appropriate taxing authority, provided, however, that the Borrower will not be required to make a True Up Payment for any Taxes paid for by an excluded tax reserve tenant so long as the excluded tax reserve tenant conditions are satisfied.

If the amount of the Tax and Insurance Funds exceeds the amount due for Taxes and Insurance Premiums, the lender will, in its discretion, return any excess to the Borrower or credit such excess against future payments to be made to the Tax and Insurance Funds.
Any amounts remaining in the Tax and Insurance Fund after the Debt has been paid in full will be returned to the Borrower.
The lender will only be obligated to collect and disburse funds for the payment of Taxes and Insurance Premiums at the Properties.
The lender will only disburse Tax and Insurance Funds to pay Tax and/or Insurance Premiums related to the Properties.
“Insurance Payment Date” means, with respect to any Policies, the date occurring 10 Business Days prior to the date the Insurance Premiums associated therewith are due and payable.
“Insurance Premiums” means premiums due under certificates of insurance.
“Policy” means a valid and enforceable insurance policy.
“Tax Payment Date” means, with respect to any Taxes, the date occurring 30 days prior to the date the same are due and payable.

“Taxes” means all present or future taxes, levies, imposts, duties, deductions, withholdings (including backup withholding), assessments, fees or other charges imposed by any Governmental Authority, including any interest, additions to tax or penalties applicable thereto.

“True Up Payment” means a payment into the applicable reserve account of a sum which, together with any amounts then on deposit in the applicable reserve account, will be sufficient to discharge the obligations and liabilities for which such applicable reserve account was established as and when such obligations and liabilities are required to be paid.
The amount of the True Up Payment will be determined by the lender in its reasonable discretion in accordance with the Loan Documents and will be final and binding absent manifest error.

On the Origination Date, the Borrower deposited into an Eligible Account held by the lender or the Servicer (the “University Centre Reserve Account”) an amount equal to (i) $2,599,345, representing, in the aggregate, 115% of the total cost of the University Centre Restoration Budget in effect as of the Origination Date (the “University Centre Restoration Funds”) and (ii) $198,676, representing, in the aggregate, the full amount of the rent payable by the University Centre Affected Tenants pursuant to the related leases assuming that such tenants were in po ssession of the premises demised under the related leases and paying full, unabated rent thereunder (the “University Centre Rent Funds”).
Amounts deposited pursuant to this “—University Centre Reserve Funds” are referred to as the “University Centre Reserve Funds”.

Within thirty (30) days after completion of the work that was the subject of a disbursement request, the Borrower will provide to the lender (i) a list of each person that supplied material or labors in connection with the work related to the University Centre Restoration Costs during the previous calendar month, (ii) lien waivers for all completed work at the University Centre Property (or to the extent Lender is prohibited from requiring waivers under applicable law with respect to work performed or materials delivered, in each case which have yet to be paid for, subordinations, conditional waivers and/or other documentation reasonably satisfactory to the lender; (iii) invoices and/or other evidence of payment of amounts owing reasonably satisfactory to the lender for payments; and (iv) at the lender’s option, a title search for the applicable Property indicating that the applicable Property is free from all liens, claims and other encumbrances other than Permitted Encumbrances.

The lender is not be required to disburse the University Centre Restoration Funds more frequently than once each calendar month nor in an amount less than the Minimum Disbursement Amount (or a lesser amount if the total amount of the University Centre Restoration Funds is less than the Minimum Disbursement Amount, in which case only one disbursement of the amount remaining in the account must be made).
The lender is only required to disburse University Centre Restoration Funds to pay for University Centre Restoration Costs.

The Borrower will have the right to settle all claims related to the Prior Hurricane Damage under the insurance policies for the University Centre Property and to retain all insurance proceeds related thereto.
“University Centre Affected Tenants” means, individually or collectively as the context requires, Staples, Petco and Americas Best Contacts.
“University Centre Property” means the Property located at 322-412 South College Road, Wilmington, North Carolina.

“University Centre Restoration” means the repair of, or alterations to, the University Centre Property (or any portion thereof) and/or the completion of the repair, alteration and/or restoration of the University Property (or any portion thereof) resulting from the Prior Hurricane Damage, with such repairs and alterations being conducted and completed in accordance with the University Centre Restoration Budget, all applicable legal requirements, all applicable leases, the Loan Agreement and the other Loan Documents.

“University Centre Restoration Costs” means those certain costs projected by the Borrower to be incurred by the Borrower in connection with the University Centre Restoration and set forth in the University Centre Restoration Budget.

“University Centre Restoration Budget” means the budget, with sufficient detail on a line item basis, which details all University Centre Restoration Costs, in the Borrower’s best estimate, to be incurred by the Borrower to complete the University Centre Restoration in accordance with all applicable leases, the Loan Agreement, the other Loan Documents and all legal requirements, together with such amendments or other modifications that may be reasonably approved by the lender following the Origination Date.

In addition, the Borrower is required to deposit into the Leasing Reserve Account any early termination fee or payment or other termination fee or payment paid by any tenant under any lease at a Property to the Borrower.
Amounts deposited pursuant to this “—Leasing Reserve Funds” are referred to as the “Leasing Reserve Funds”.

Within thirty (30) days after the end of each calendar month, the Borrower is required to provide the lender (i) with a list of each Person that supplied materials or labors in connection with the tenant improvement work during the previous calendar month, (ii) lien waivers for all completed work at the Property (or to the extent the lender is prohibited from requiring waivers under applicable law with respect to work performed or material delivered, in each case which have yet to be paid for, subordinations, conditional waivers and/or other documentation reasonably satisfactory to the lender), (iii) invoices and/or other evidence of payment of amounts owing reasonably satisfactory to the lender for payments in excess of $250,000; (iv) at lender’s option, if the cost of any individual tenant improvement exceeds $250,000, a report satisfactory to the lender in its reasonable discretion from an architect or engineer approved by the lender in respect of such architect’s or engineer’s inspection of such tenant improvement and (v) at the lender’s option, if the cost of any individual tenant improvement exceeds $250,000, a title search for the Property indicating that the Property is free from all liens, claims and other encumbrances other than Permitted Encumbrances.

The lender is not required to disburse Leasing Reserve Funds more frequently than twice each calendar month nor in an amount less than the Minimum Disbursement Amount (or a lesser amount if the total amount of Leasing Reserve Funds is less than the Minimum Disbursement Amount, in which case only one disbursement of the amount remaining in the account will be made).

Notwithstanding the foregoing, in connection with the Borrower’s sale of any Property pursuant to the terms of the Loan Agreement, the lender acknowledges that the Borrower may request and the lender will disburse a portion of the Leasing Reserve Funds to fund any tenant improvement/leasing reserves required under the applicable purchase and sale agreement for such Property for postclosing work or leasing commissions responsible to be paid by the Borrower.
Any amounts remaining in the Leasing Reserve Fund after the Debt is paid in full will be returned to the Borrower.

In no instance will the Borrower request, nor will the lender be required to disburse, funds in the Leasing Reserve Account with respect to any tenant improvement costs and/or leasing commissions to the extent that amounts therefor have been reserved for in the Unfunded Obligations Reserve Account.
Amounts deposited pursuant to this “—Operating Expense Funds” are referred to as the “Operating Expense Funds”.
Any amounts remaining in the Operating Expense Fund after the Debt has been paid in full will be returned to the Borrower.

“Aggregate Management/Services Fee Cap” means an amount equal to $4,500,000 per annum (which amount will be reduced, in accordance with the Loan Agreement, following any individual Property defeasance and/or release pursuant to, and in accordance with the Loan Agreement), which will be broken down as follows: (i) with respect to base management fees payable under the Management Agreement incurred per annum, an amount equal to the lesser of (x) actual base management fees payable under the Management Agreement and (y) the Management Fee Cap and (ii) with respect to Services Fees incurred per annum, an amount equal to $4,500,000 (which amount will be reduced in accordance with the Loan Agreement following any individual Property defeasance and/or release pursuant to, and in accordance with the Loan Agreement) minus the amounts described in clause (i) above (the “Services Fee Cap”).

For the avoidance of doubt, (i) only management fees and sub-management fees equal to or less than the Management Fee Cap will be considered an Approved Operating Expense and (ii) only Services Fees equal to or less than the Services Fee Cap (in the aggregate in any twelve month period) will be deemed Approved Operating Expenses; provided that, under no circumstances will the aggregate of the fees described in clauses (i) and (ii) above in excess of the Aggregate Management/Services Fee Cap in any twelve month period constitute Approved Operating Expenses (even if the specific cap outlined in clauses (i) and/or (ii) has not yet been reached as of the date of determination).
“Management Fee Cap” means, with respect to each Property, the aggregate of base management fees and sub-management fees equal to 3.5% of gross income from operations at such Property.
“Services Fees” means all fees and reimbursement payments payable to SITE Centers Corp. or an Affiliate by the Guarantor or the Borrower in connection with its management of the Guarantor.
The Borrower is required to perform or cause to be performed the unfunded obligations at each Property as set forth in the Loan Agreement (all such obligations, the “Unfunded Obligations”).

On the Origination Date, the Borrower was required to deposit into an Eligible Account held by the lender or Servicer (the “Unfunded Obligations Reserve Account”) an amount equal to (i) $72,398, such amount representing, in the aggregate, any outstanding free rent (the “Free Rent Funds”), and (ii) $5,551,114, such amount representing in the aggregate, any outstanding tenant improvement allowances and/or leasing commissions due in connection with any lease at each Property as of the Origination Date.
Amounts deposited pursuant to this “—Unfunded Obligations Reserve Funds” are referred to as the “Unfunded Obligations Reserve Funds”.

The lender is not be required to disburse the Unfunded Obligations Reserve Funds more frequently than once each calendar month nor in an amount less than the Minimum Disbursement Amount (or a lesser amount if the total amount of the Unfunded Obligations Reserve Funds is less than the Minimum Disbursement Amount, in which case only one disbursement of the amount remaining in the account must be made).
The lender is only required to disburse Unfunded Obligations Reserve Funds to pay for Unfunded Obligations at the Properties.
Any amounts remaining in the Unfunded Obligation Reserve Fund after the Debt has been paid in full will be returned to the Borrower.
The REIT Subsidiary will be permitted, no less frequently than quarterly, to increase or decrease, as the case may be, the Required Distribution Threshold Amount.

Within ten (10) days following written request of the Borrower (which request will be made no more frequently than quarterly and will be accompanied by an officer’s certificate (w) stating that the items to be funded from the requested disbursement are for the Required REIT Distribution, (y) identifying the amount of the Required REIT Distribution to be paid from the requested disbursement and (z) detailing the amounts used (or otherwise available) to pay such Required REIT Distribution for such taxable year), Excess Cash Flow Funds to pay the Required REIT Distributions will be released to the Borrower.

The lender will not be required to disburse Excess Cash Flow Funds more frequently than once each calendar month nor in an amount less than the Minimum Disbursement Amount (or a lesser amount if the total amount of Excess Cash Flow Funds remaining, is less than the Minimum Disbursement Amount, in which case only one disbursement of the amount remaining in the account will be made).
Each of the above described reserve accounts is required to be an Eligible Account under the control of the lender.
The reserve accounts do not constitute trust funds and may be commingled with other monies held by the lender.
Funds in the reserve accounts may be invested only as permitted under the Loan Agreement.

All interest or other earnings on the reserve accounts (other than for the Tax and Insurance Reserve Account) are required to be added to and become a part of such reserve account and to be disbursed in the same manner as other monies deposited in such reserve account.

“Eligible Account” means a separate and identifiable account from all other funds held by the holding institution that is an account or accounts maintained with a federal or state-chartered depository institution or trust company which (a) complies with the definition of Eligible Institution, (b) has a combined capital and surplus of at least $50,000,000 and (c) has corporate trust powers and is acting in its fiduciary capacity.
An Eligible Account will not be evidenced by a certificate of deposit, passbook or other instrument.

“Eligible Institution” means (i) a depository institution or trust company insured by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (a) the short term unsecured debt obligations or commercial paper of which are rated at least “A-1+” (or its equivalent) from each of the Rating Agencies (in the case of accounts in which funds are held for thirty (30) days or less) and (ii) the long term unsecured debt obligations of which are rated at least “A+” (or its equivalent) from each of the Rating Agencies (in the case of accounts in which funds are held for more than thirty (30) days), (b) such other depository institution otherwise approved by the Rating Agencies from time-to-time, or (c) in its capacity as Bank, Wells Fargo Bank, N.A, PNC Bank, N.A. or U.S. Bank, N.A., provided, that, in each case the applicable ratings of such entities are not reduced below the ratings in effect as of the Origination Date.
Hard lockbox with springing cash management.

Unfunded Obligations Reserve: $5,623,512 was deposited at origination for the completion of all tenant improvements, leasing commissions, free rent and gap rent that was outstanding as of the origination date.

University Centre Reserve: $2,599,345 was deposited at origination representing 115% of the total costs budgeted by the Borrower for restoration at University Centre due to Hurricane Florence and $198,676 was deposited for the full amount of the rent payable by affected tenants.
Hard lockboxes with springing cash management.

The Borrower is required to, and is required to cause manager to, deposit all revenue derived from the Properties and received by the Borrower and/or manager to a hard lockbox (the “Lockbox Account”) immediately following receipt.

The Borrower sent or caused to be sent notices to all tenants now occupying space at the Properties directing them to pay all rent and other sums due under the lease to which they are a party into the applicable Lockbox Account until such time as the Mortgage Loan has been repaid in full.
“Test Date” means the last day of each of the 3-month period ending on March 31, June 30, September 30 and December 31 of each year.
The following reserves are required to be funded by the Borrower:

Unfunded Obligations Reserve: On the Origination Date, the Borrower deposited (i) $5,551,114 representing, in the aggregate, any tenant improvement allowances and/or leasing commissions and (ii) $72,398 representing, in the aggregate, any outstanding free rent due in connection with any lease at each individual Property as of the Origination Date.

University Centre Reserve Funds: On the Origination Date, the Borrower deposited (i) $2,599,345, such amount representing, in the aggregate, 115.0% of the total costs budgeted by the Borrower on the Origination Date for restoration at the University Centre property and (ii) $198,676, such amount representing, in the aggregate, the full amount of the rent payable by affected tenants at University Centre pursuant to the related leases assuming that such tenants were in possession of the premises demised under their leases and paying full, unabated rent thereunder.

Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the immediately preceding sentences, (I) with respect to the taxes payable directly by tenants identified in the Mortgage Loan documents pursuant to the related lease (such taxes, the “PBO Taxes”), the Lender will pay such PBO Taxes only if the Lender failed to receive certain documentation specified in the Mortgage Loan documents within 30 days after the due date for such PBO Taxes.
The Borrower has established and is required to maintain an account in trust for the benefit of the Mortgage Lender as secured party (the “Lockbox Account”).
Borrower has granted to Mortgage Lender a first priority security interest in the Lockbox Account and all deposits at any time contained therein and the proceeds thereof.
All costs and expenses for establishing and maintaining the Lockbox Account will be paid by the Borrower.

Borrower is required to cause the Brand Manager pursuant to the Brand Management Agreement or Manager subordination agreement to, and Brand Manager is required to, deliver directly to the Lockbox Account as set forth above to be distributed as described under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Lockbox and Cash Management Accounts”.
The Brand Manager has agreed to collect all funds derived from the operation of the Mortgaged Properties managed pursuant to the Brand Management Agreement.

From such funds, Brand Manager is required to pay fees owed to Brand Manager, operating expenses, other authorized expenditures under the Brand Management Agreements (including taxes, payments of insurance maintained by Brand Manager and deposits to the FF&E reserve), and the remainder of funds will be deposited in the Lockbox Agreement.

With respect to the FF&E Reserves, the Brand Manager has established and is required to maintain two FF&E reserve accounts: one FF&E reserve account into which funds for FF&E at (i) Ritz-Carlton - Grande Lakes Property and golf course will be deposited and (ii) the JW Marriott - Grande Lakes Property will be deposited, in each case, in accordance with the applicable Brand Management Agreement and the related deposit account control agreement.
The Mortgage Lender has been granted a security interest in each FF&E reserve account.

Unless and until such time as the Brand Manager is being terminated as property manager under the Brand Management Agreements, Brand Manager is entitled to make withdrawals from each such reserve account in accordance with the related Brand Management Agreement and the related deposit account control agreement.

Under the terms of the Mortgage Loan Documents, the Borrower is required to maintain the following reserve accounts (collectively, the “Reserve Accounts”): a replacement reserve account (the “Replacement Reserve Account”) for replacement of furniture, fixtures and hotel equipment and other replacements and repairs and PIP work into which the Borrower is required to deposit on each Payment Date, an amount equal to the greater of (a) the deposit for replacements, if any, required to be deposited with the Brand Manager pursuant to the Brand Management Agreement or any Franchisor pursuant to the Franchise Agreement (without duplication) and (b) 4% of gross income from operations for the calendar month that is two calendar months prior to the calendar month in which the applicable deposit to the Replacement Reserve Fund is to be made; provided, that for so long as Borrower maintains the Mortgaged Properties in accordance with the Management Agreement, such deposits will be reduced on a dollar-for-dollar basis by an amounts deposited into an account held by Brand Manager for the same for the applicable calendar months set forth in the annual budget for the Mortgaged Properties and required pursuant to the terms of the Brand Management Agreement if Borrower delivers evidence reasonably satisfactory to Mortgage Lender that such deposit has been made; a tax and insurance reserve account (the “Tax and Insurance Reserve Account”) for real estate taxes and other amounts due to governmental authorities and insurance premiums payable with respect to the Mortgaged Properties.

On the Origination Date, Borrower deposited with Mortgage Lender $573,275 into the Environmental Work Reserve; a contested real estate tax reserve (the “Contested Real Estate Tax Reserve”), which represents the aggregate amount of the real estate taxes for the 2015, 2016 and 2017 calendar years (such taxes, the “Contested Taxes”) that were being contested by Borrower, as of the Origination Date.

Borrower, at Borrower’s own expense, will contest by appropriate legal proceeding, promptly initiated and conducted in good faith and with due diligence, the amount or validity of the Contested Taxes in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

Following the conclusion of such legal proceedings, Mortgage Lender will, within five Business Days after receipt of Borrower’s written request, disburse funds from the Contested Real Estate Tax Reserve to Borrower to timely pay all Contested Taxes payable by Borrower, or to reimburse Borrower for Contested Taxes actually paid by Borrower so long as Borrower’s written request is submitted prior to Mortgage Lender (or Servicer) having already paid such Contested Taxes to the applicable taxing authority after making a determination that, in the reasonable judgment of Mortgage Lender, the Mortgaged Properties (or any portion thereof) is in imminent danger of being sold or forfeited or the lien of the Mortgage being primed, in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement.
Any amounts remaining in the Contested Real Estate Tax Reserve after the Mortgage Loan has been paid in full are required to be promptly returned to Borrower.
See “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserve Funds”.

All funds derived from the operation of the Mortgaged Properties will be deposited by Property Manager into operating accounts established by Property Manager, subject to the Borrower’s reasonable approval.
Withdrawal from such operating accounts is to be made only by representatives of Property Manager whose signatures have been authorized.
Property Manager may also maintain reasonable petty cash funds at the Mortgaged Properties.

All the payments made by Property Manager should be made from such operating accounts, petty cash funds or the FF&E Reserve. Property Manager is not obligated to make any advance or payment with respect to the Mortgaged Properties.

If, the Borrower does not fully reimburse Property Manager for obligations or liabilities incurred by Property Manager with respect to the applicable Mortgaged Property (after receiving notice from Property Manager of such unpaid amounts), Property Manager may also deduct such amounts from the Operating Profit.
The Borrower has established and is required to maintain an account in trust for the benefit of the Mortgage Lender as secured party (the “Lockbox Account”).
Borrower has granted to Mortgage Lender a first priority security interest in the Lockbox Account and all deposits at any time contained therein and the proceeds thereof.

So long as the Mortgaged Property is subject to a Brand Management Agreement with Brand Manager, Borrower will cause the Brand Manager pursuant to the Brand Management Agreement or Property Manager subordination agreement to, and Brand Manager will, deliver directly to the Lockbox Account all income and proceeds to which Borrower is entitled pursuant to the Brand Management Agreement within one Business Day after the Borrower is entitled to distributions thereto from Brand Manager pursuant to the Brand Management Agreement.

If the Mortgaged Property is not subject to a Management Agreement with Brand Manager, Borrower will cause the Property Manager pursuant to the Management Agreement to, and Property Manager will, deliver all rent and other income and proceeds directly to the Lockbox Account within two Business Days following receipt thereof.

In the event that any such amounts or any rents in respect of the Mortgaged Property are paid directly to Borrower, Borrower will deposit such amounts or such rents into the Lockbox Account within two Business Days following Borrower’s receipt thereof, except for such other rents that are required to be deposited into a Manager Account pursuant to the Brand Management Agreement.

Borrower will promptly direct any person delivering any such amounts or such other rents directly to Borrower, to deliver such amounts or such other rents directly to the Lockbox Account or if the Mortgaged Property is being managed by a Brand Manager pursuant to a Brand Management Agreement, to the Manager Account, as applicable.
For the avoidance of doubt, capital contributions of the indirect owners of Borrower will not constitute rents.

Borrower will not, and will not permit Property Manager to, terminate, amend or modify any of the deposit account control agreements concerning the furniture, fixture and equipment reserves for the Ritz-Carlton - Grande Lakes, The Ritz-Carlton Gold Club Grande Lakes, Orlando, or the JW Marriott – Grande Lakes (collectively, the “Lockbox Agreement (FF&E Reserve)”) without the prior written consent of Mortgage Lender and Borrower will deposit funds and cause the withdrawal/disbursement of such funds in the Manager FF&E Reserve Account pursuant to the Brand Management Agreement and the related Lockbox Agreement (FF&E Reserve).

“Manager Accounts” means the “Operating Accounts” (as defined in the Management Agreement) maintained by the Property Manager in the name of the Borrower with respect to the Mortgaged Property and in accordance with the terms of the Management Agreement.
The Cash Management Account consists of various accounts, which are maintained on a ledger entry basis.

“Debt Yield (Aggregate)” will mean, for any date of determination, the percentage obtained by dividing: (a) the net operating income (excluding interest on credit accounts and using annualized operating expenses for any recurring expenses not paid monthly (e.g., Taxes and Insurance Premiums)) for the immediately preceding 12 full calendar month period as of the date of determination as set forth in the financial statements required hereunder, including, for purposes of determining gross income from operations and for purposes of determining the operating expense component of net operating income, Replacement Reserve Fund contributions equal to the greater of (A) 4% of gross income from operations and (B) the amount required under the Brand Management Agreement, and the Franchise Agreement as applicable; by (b) the sum of the outstanding principal balances of (i) the Mortgage Loan and (ii) the Mezzanine Loan on the date of determination.

“Debt Yield (Mortgage Only)” will mean, for any date of determination, the percentage obtained by dividing: (a) the net operating income (excluding interest on credit accounts and using annualized operating expenses for any recurring expenses not paid monthly (e.g., Taxes and Insurance Premiums)) for the immediately preceding 12 full calendar month period as of the date of determination as set forth in the statements required hereunder, including, for purposes of determining gross income from operations and for purposes of determining the operating expense component of net operating income, Replacement Reserve Fund contributions equal to the greater of (A) 4% of gross income from operations and (B) the amount required under the Brand Management Agreement and the Franchise Agreement, as applicable; by (b) the sum of the outstanding principal balance of the Mortgage Loan on the date of determination.

“Priority Waterfall Payments” mean the payments described in the Cash Management Agreement of Taxes, Insurance Premiums, Hotel Taxes and Custodial Funds; provided that such amounts have not previously been paid or reserved for by the Brand Manager for the Mortgaged Property in accordance with the Brand Management Agreement.

Any amounts remaining in the Cash Management Account after payment of the Priority Waterfall Payments will be deposited in the Excess Cash Flow Reserve Account and applied in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

The Cash Management Account and the Lockbox Accounts and the funds on deposit in the Cash Management Account and the Lockbox Account are pledged as additional security for the performance by the Borrower of its obligations under the Mortgage Loan Documents.

The Borrower will be required to indemnify the Cash Management Agent, its employees and officers harmless from and against any loss, cost or damage (including, without limitation, reasonable attorneys’ fees and disbursements) incurred by the Cash Management Agent in connection with the transactions contemplated by the Cash Management Agreement, except to the extent that such loss or damage results from the Cash Management Agent’s gross negligence or willful misconduct.

Under the terms of the Mortgage Loan Documents and subject to the terms below, the Borrower is required to maintain a reserve fund (the “Replacement Reserve Fund”) for the completion of Replacements at the Mortgaged Property.

On each Payment Date, the Borrower will be required to deposit with the Mortgage Lender an amount equal to the greater of the deposit for Replacements, if any, required to be deposited with the Brand Manager pursuant to the Brand Management Agreement or any Franchisor pursuant to the Franchise Agreement (without duplication) and (b) 4% of gross income from operations for the calendar month that is two calendar months prior to the calendar month in which the applicable deposit to the Replacement Reserve Fund is to be made (the “Replacement Reserve Monthly Deposit”), provided, that, for so long as Borrower maintains the Mortgaged Property in accordance with the Brand Management Agreement, the Replacement Reserve Monthly Deposit will be reduced on a dollar-for-dollar basis by any amounts deposited into an account held by Brand Manager for Replacements for the applicable calendar month set forth in the annual budget delivered pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Agreement and required pursuant to the terms of the Brand Management Agreement if Borrower delivers evidence reasonably satisfactory to Mortgage Lender that such deposit has been made.

Upon entering into a Franchise Agreement, Borrower will provide evidence reasonably satisfactory to Mortgage Lender that Borrower has sufficient funds to pay for any property improvement plans required by such Franchise Agreement; provided that if Borrower does not provide such evidence, Borrower will deposit into the replacement reserve account funds sufficient to complete any such property improvement plan work.

“Replacements” means furniture, fixtures, and equipment and other replacements and repairs required to be made to the Mortgaged Property, including performing any covenants and agreement required under any property improvement plan with which Borrower is required to comply under the Management Agreement.

Under the terms of the Mortgage Loan Documents and subject to the terms below, the Borrower is required to maintain a reserve fund (the “Tax and Insurance Escrow Fund”) for taxes and insurance premiums payable with respect to the Mortgaged Property.

Mortgage Lender will not be required to make disbursements from the Replacement Reserve Account with respect to the Mortgaged Property unless such requested disbursement is in an amount greater than $10,000 (or a lesser amount if the total amount in the Replacement Reserve Account is less than $10,000), in which case only one disbursement of the amount remaining in the account will be made and such disbursement will be made only upon satisfaction of each condition contained in this section.

If at any time the Mortgage Lender determines that the funds on deposit in the Tax and Insurance Escrow Fund will not be sufficient to pay amounts set forth in clauses (i) and (ii) above, the Borrower will be required to increase its monthly payments by the amount that the Mortgage Lender estimates will be sufficient to make up the deficiency at least 30 days prior to the due date of the tax and insurance premiums.

Under the terms of the Mortgage Loan Documents and subject to the terms below, Borrower is required to maintain a reserve fund (the “Environmental Work Reserve”) to (a) perform the Environmental Work in accordance with all applicable legal requirements, (b) use commercially reasonable and diligent efforts to complete the environmental work in a timely manner and (c) complete the environmental work within the time frames, if any, prescribed by any legal requirements.
On the Origination Date, Borrower deposited with Mortgage Lender $573,275 to perform the environmental work at the Mortgaged Property.

Mortgage Lender is not required to make disbursements from the Environmental Work Reserve unless such requested disbursement is greater than $25,000 (or a lesser amount if the total amount in the Environmental Work Account is less than $25,000), in which case only one disbursement of the amount remaining in the account is required to be made).
Any Environmental Work Reserve outstanding upon the completion of the Environmental Work will be deposited into the Lockbox Account.

“Environmental Work” means all remediation (including post-remediation monitoring) related to the recognized environmental condition associated with historical dry cleaning operations at the Mortgaged Property and as further described in that certain Phase I Environmental Site Assessment prepared by EMG, dated as of November 16, 2018, for the Mortgage Lender, delivered to the Mortgage Lender in connection with the origination of the Mortgage Loan which is legally required, necessary and appropriate to enable the Borrower to obtain from the Florida Department of Environmental Protection (“FDEP”) a letter or other written documentation in form and substance reasonably satisfactory to the Mortgage Lender that no further remediation is required to meet the Florida clean-up objectives and granting regulatory closure with respect to the presence of such recognized environmental condition.

On the Origination Date, Borrower paid to Mortgage Lender $4,526,661 (the “Contested Real Estate Tax Reserve”), which represents the aggregate amount of the real estate taxes for the 2015, 2016 and 2017 calendar years (such taxes, the “Contested Taxes”) that are being contested by Borrower, as of the Origination Date.

Borrower, at Borrower’s own expense, will contest by appropriate legal proceeding, promptly initiated and conducted in good faith and with due diligence, the amount or validity of the Contested Taxes in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

Following the conclusion of such legal proceedings, Mortgage Lender will, within five Business Days after receipt of Borrower’s written request, disburse funds from the Contested Real Estate Tax Reserve to Borrower in an amount equal to the total Contested Taxes under such proceeding, with such funds to be used to (a)(i) timely pay all Contested Taxes determined in such proceeding to be due and payable by Borrower, or (ii) to reimburse Borrower for Contested Taxes actually paid by Borrower so long as Borrower’s written request is submitted prior to Mortgage Lender (or Servicer) having already paid such Contested Taxes to the applicable taxing authority after making a determination, in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement, that in the reasonable judgment of Mortgage Lender, the Mortgaged Property (or part thereof or interest therein) is in imminent danger of being sold, forfeited, terminated, cancelled or lost or there is any danger of the lien of the Mortgage Loan being primed by any related lien resulting from the failure to pay in full such Contested Taxes, and (b) the remainder of such funds to be retained by Borrower.

Any such request for disbursement is required to include an Officer’s Certificate setting forth the amount of the Contested Taxes to be paid and the jurisdictions in which such payments will be made by such disbursement.

Upon the written request of Mortgage Lender, Borrower will deliver to Mortgage Lender receipts for payment or other evidence reasonably satisfactory to Mortgage Lender that such Contested Taxes have been paid.
Any amounts remaining in the Contested Real Estate Tax Reserve after the Mortgage Loan has been paid in full is required to be promptly returned to Borrower.

Any Excess Cash Flow Reserve Funds remaining on deposit in the Excess Cash Flow Reserve Account after the Mortgage Loan and all amounts due to Mortgage Lender have been paid in full will be paid (A) if any portion of the Mezzanine Loan Debt is then outstanding, to Mezzanine Lender to be held by Mezzanine Lender pursuant to the Mezzanine Loan Agreement for the purposes described therein and (B) if none of the Mezzanine Loan Debt is then outstanding, to Borrower.

Other than in connection with the Mortgage Loan Documents and except for Permitted Encumbrances, the Borrower has not sold, pledged, transferred or otherwise conveyed the Lockbox Account, Manager FF&E Reserve Account and Cash Management Account; (ii) Each of the Lockbox Account, Manager FF&E Reserve Account and Cash Management Account constitutes a “deposit account” and/or “securities account” within the meaning of the Uniform Commercial Code of the State of New York; (iii) Pursuant and subject to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement and the other applicable Mortgage Loan Documents and the Lockbox Agreement, Lockbox Bank and Agent have agreed to comply with all instructions originated by the Mortgage Lender, without further consent by the Borrower, directing disposition of the Lockbox Account and Cash Management Account and all sums at any time held, deposited or invested therein, together with any interest or other earnings thereon, and all proceeds thereof (including proceeds of sales and other dispositions), whether accounts, general intangibles, chattel paper, deposit accounts, instruments, documents or securities; (iv) The Lockbox Account, Manager FF&E Reserve Account and Cash Management Account are not in the name of any Person other than the Borrower, as pledgor, or the Mortgage Lender, as pledgee.

Other than as set forth in the Lockbox Agreement, the Borrower has not consented to the Lockbox Bank and Agent complying with instructions with respect to the Lockbox Account and Cash Management Account from any Person other than the Mortgage Lender.
Borrower is required to use commercially reasonable efforts to cause the Property Manager to maintain each Manager FF&E Reserve Account in an Eligible Account during the term of the Mortgage Loan.

Borrower is required to deposit, or cause to be deposited, all revenue generated by the Mortgaged Property within three business days of receipt thereof into an eligible account for the sole and exclusive benefit of the Mortgage Lender (the “Restricted Account”) and in which the Mortgage Lender has a first-priority security interest.

Borrower is also required to send direction notices to each tenant occupying space at the Mortgaged Property directing them to pay all rents and other sums due under the lease to which such tenant is party, as further described under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Restricted Account.”
See “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Cash Management”.
For a detailed description of the Reserve Accounts, see “Description of the Mortgage Loan”.

Borrower is required to deposit, or cause to be deposited, all revenue generated by the Property within three Business Days of receipt thereof into an Eligible Account for the sole and exclusive benefit of the Mortgage Lender (the “Restricted Account”) and in which the Mortgage Lender has a first-priority security interest.

Borrower is also required to: (i) within 12 Business Days following the Origination Date, send direction notices (each such notice, a “Direction Notice”) to all tenants now occupying space at the Property directing them to pay all rent and other sums due under the lease to which they are a party into the Restricted Account, (ii) simultaneously with the execution of any lease entered into on or after the Origination Date in accordance to the terms and conditions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, furnish each tenant under each lease a Direction Notice and (iii) continue to send the aforesaid Direction Notices until each addressee thereof complies with the terms of such Direction Notices.

“Priority Waterfall Payments” means the first, second, third, fourth and seventh payments above (for the Monthly Ground Rent Deposit, the Monthly Tax Deposit, the Monthly Condo Assessments Deposit, the Monthly Insurance Deposit, and the Op Ex Monthly Deposit).

“True Up Payment” means a payment into the applicable Reserve Account of a sum which, taking into account any anticipated applicable monthly deposits into the applicable Reserve Account, will be sufficient to discharge the obligations and liabilities for which such Reserve Account was established as and when required by the Mortgage Loan Agreement.
The amount of the True Up Payment will be determined by the Mortgage Lender in its reasonable discretion and will be final and binding absent manifest error.

The Borrower is required to deposit into an Eligible Account held by Mortgage Lender or Servicer (the “Leasing Reserve Account”) (i) on the Origination Date, an amount equal to $4,601,434 for Approved Leasing Costs identified in Schedule XI attached to the Mortgage Loan Agreement (the “Closing Date Approved Leasing Costs”), (ii) on each Payment Date during a Trigger Period, an amount equal to $1.25 per rentable square foot per annum at the Property (which, as of the Origination Date, is $76,915 per month) (the “Monthly Leasing Reserve Deposit”), and (iii) any amounts required to be deposited in the Leasing Reserve Account pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Agreement.
Amounts deposited pursuant to the leasing reserve account are referred to in this paragraph as the “Leasing Reserve Funds.”

Mortgage Lender will not be required to disburse Leasing Reserve Funds more frequently than once each calendar month nor in an amount less than the Minimum Disbursement Amount (or a lesser amount if the total amount of Leasing Reserve Funds is less than the Minimum Disbursement Amount, in which case only one disbursement of the amount remaining in the account will be made).

“Approved Leasing Costs” means actual out-of-pocket tenant improvement and leasing costs which are (i)(a) set forth on Schedule XI attached to the Mortgage Loan Agreement, (b) incurred by the Borrower in leasing space at the Property pursuant to Leases entered into after the Origination Date in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Documents, including brokerage commissions, tenant improvements and tenant allowances that are set forth in any such Lease, or (c) otherwise approved by Mortgage Lender, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed, and (ii) substantiated by executed Lease documents or brokerage agreements or other agreements providing for the payment of a leasing or brokerage commission.

In addition to the foregoing, actual out-of-pocket costs incurred by the Borrower for the build out of spec office space shall be deemed “Approved Leasing Costs”, provided that (x) the Borrower shall not be entitled to disbursements from the Leasing Reserve Account for such Approved Leasing Costs in any consecutive twelve (12) month period in excess of an amount equal to $0.25 per rentable square foot at the Property per annum and (y) in no event shall the Closing Date Approved Leasing Costs be disbursed to fund such Approved Leasing Costs.
“Minimum Disbursement Amount” means $15,000.
