Amounts deposited pursuant to the capital expenditure are referred to in this paragraph as the “Capital Expenditures Reserve Funds”.
Mortgage Lender will disburse Capital Expenditures Reserve Funds only for Approved Capital Expenditures.

Mortgage Lender will disburse to the Borrower the Capital Expenditures Reserve Funds upon satisfaction by the Borrower of each of the following conditions: (i) the Borrower will submit a request for payment to Mortgage Lender at least 10 Business Days prior to the date on which the Borrower requests such payment be made and specifies the Approved Capital Expenditures to be paid; (ii) on the date such request is received by Mortgage Lender and on the date such payment is to be made, no Mortgage Loan Event of Default will exist and remain uncured; (iii) Mortgage Lender will have received a certificate from the Borrower (A) stating that the items to be funded by the requested disbursement are Approved Capital Expenditures, (B) stating that all Approved Capital Expenditures at the Property to be funded by the requested disbursement have been completed (or completed to the extent of the requested disbursement) in a good and workmanlike manner and in accordance with all applicable Legal Requirements, (C) stating that each Person that supplied materials or labor in connection with the Approved Capital Expenditures to be funded by the requested disbursement has been paid in full for work completed through such date or will be paid in full upon such disbursement (or if progress payments are being made, that such Person has been or will be paid all amounts owed to them based on the work such Person has completed), and (D) stating that all previous disbursements of Capital Expenditures Reserve Funds have been used to pay for the previously identified Approved Capital Expenditures; (iv) at Mortgage Lender’s option, if the cost of any individual Approved Capital Expenditure exceeds $250,000, a title search for the Property indicating that the Property is free from all liens, claims and other encumbrances other than Permitted Encumbrances; (v) if required by Mortgage Lender if the cost of any individual Approved Capital Expenditure exceeds $250,000, Mortgage Lender will have verified (by an inspection conducted at the Borrower’s expense) performance of the work associated with such Approved Capital Expenditure; and (vi) Mortgage Lender will have received such other evidence as Mortgage Lender will reasonably request that the Approved Capital Expenditures at the Property to be funded by the requested disbursement have been completed (or completed to the extent of the requested disbursement) and are paid for or will be paid upon such disbursement to the Borrower (or if progress payments are being made, that such Person has been or will be paid all amounts owed to them based on the work such Person has completed).

Nothing with respect to Capital Expenditure Reserve Funds above will (i) make Mortgage Lender responsible for making or completing the Approved Capital Expenditures; (ii) require Mortgage Lender to expend funds in addition to the Capital Expenditures Reserve Funds to complete any Approved Capital Expenditures; (iii) obligate Mortgage Lender to proceed with any Approved Capital Expenditures; or (iv) obligate Mortgage Lender to demand from the Borrower additional sums to complete any Approved Capital Expenditures.

If requested by Mortgage Lender, the Borrower will permit Mortgage Lender and its agents and representatives to enter onto the Property upon reasonable advance notice and during normal business hours (subject to the rights of Tenants under their Leases) to inspect the progress of any Approved Capital Expenditures and all materials being used in connection therewith and to examine all plans and shop drawings relating to such Approved Capital Expenditures which are or may be kept at the Property.
The Borrower will cause all contractors and subcontractors to cooperate with Mortgage Lender and its agents and representatives in connection with inspections described in this paragraph.

The Borrower will pay all reasonable out-of-pocket costs and expenses incurred in connection with each such report and inspection (including, without limitation, the reasonable fees, costs and expenses of Mortgage Lender in connection therewith, if any).

“Approved Capital Expenditures” means Capital Expenditures incurred by the Borrower and either (i) included in the Approved Annual Budget or (ii) approved by Mortgage Lender, which approval will not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed.

Mortgage Lender will not be required to disburse Capital Expenditures Reserve Funds more frequently than once each calendar month nor in an amount less than the Minimum Disbursement Amount (or a lesser amount if the total amount of Capital Expenditures Reserve Funds is less than the Minimum Disbursement Amount, in which case only one disbursement of the amount remaining in the account will be made).
“Capital Expenditures” means amounts expended for replacements and alterations to the Property (excluding tenant improvements) and required to be capitalized according to GAAP.

“Approved Extraordinary Expense” means an operating expense of the Property not set forth on the Approved Annual Budget (and for the avoidance of doubt that is not an Approved Operating Expense) but that is approved by the Mortgage Lender in writing (which such approval may not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed) and approved by Mezzanine Lender in accordance with the Mezzanine Loan Documents (to the extent such approval is required under the Mezzanine Loan Documents).

Notwithstanding the foregoing, in no event will the Mortgage Lender’s approval be required for expenses attributable to emergencies involving an imminent threat of bodily injury or loss of life (including any structural damage to the Property that is reasonably expected to result in an imminent threat of bodily injury or loss of life).

“Approved Operating Expense” means an operating expense of the Property (i) set forth on the Approved Annual Budget, (ii) for real estate taxes, Insurance Premiums, electric, gas, oil, water, sewer or other utility service, (iii) actual property management fees due and payable to the Property Manager under the Management Agreement, such amount not to exceed one and one-half percent (1.5%) of Gross Income from Operations, or (iv) that has been approved by the Mortgage Lender, such approval not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed.

The Borrower has agreed to notify the Mortgage Lender promptly of any changes to the amounts, schedules and instructions for payment of any taxes and Insurance Premiums of which it has or obtains knowledge and has authorized the Mortgage Lender or its agent to obtain the bills for taxes directly from the appropriate taxing authority.

If the amount of the Tax and Insurance Funds exceeds the amounts due for taxes and Insurance Premiums pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Agreement, the Mortgage Lender will return any excess to the Borrower.
“Insurance Payment Date” means, with respect to any applicable Policies, the date occurring 10 days prior to the date the applicable Insurance Premiums associated therewith are due and payable.
“Tax Payment Date” means, with respect to any applicable taxes, the date occurring 10 days prior to the date the same would be delinquent if not paid.

The Borrower agrees to notify Mortgage Lender promptly of any changes to the amounts, schedules and instructions for payment of any Ground Rent of which it has or obtains knowledge and authorizes Mortgage Lender or its agent to obtain any bills, invoices or statements for Ground Rent directly from the ground lessor.

Provided there are sufficient amounts in the Ground Rent Account and no Priority Payment Cessation Period exists, Mortgage Lender will be obligated to pay the Ground Rent as it becomes due on their respective due dates on behalf of the Borrower by applying the Ground Rent Funds to the payment of such Ground Rent.
If the amount of the Ground Rent Funds will exceed the amounts due for Ground Rent pursuant to the Ground Lease, Mortgage Lender will return any excess to the Borrower.

“Ground Lease” means those certain ground leases more particularly described in the Mortgage Loan Agreement, as the same may be amended, restated, supplemented or otherwise modified from time to time after the Closing Date.
“Ground Rent” means any base rent, additional rent or other rent payable by the Borrower to the landlord under the Ground Lease, including, without limitation, any Payments in Lieu of Taxes.
“Payments in Lieu of Taxes” means any and all payments of PILOT (as defined in the Ground Lease) payable under the Ground Lease.

The Borrower agrees to notify Mortgage Lender promptly of any changes to the amounts, schedules and instructions for payment of any Assessments of which it has or obtains knowledge and authorizes Mortgage Lender or its agent to obtain any bills, invoices or statements for Assessments directly from the Condominium Board of Managers.

Provided there are sufficient amounts in the Condo Assessments Account and no Priority Payment Cessation Period exists, Mortgage Lender will be obligated to pay the Assessments as they become due on their respective due dates on behalf of Borrower by applying the Condo Assessments Funds to the payment of such Assessments.
If the amount of the Condo Assessments Funds will exceed the amounts due for Assessments pursuant to the Condominium Documents, Mortgage Lender will return any excess to Borrower.
“Condominium Board of Managers” means the Board of Managers of the Condominium.
Amounts deposited pursuant to this paragraph are referred to herein as the “Specified Tenant Space Leasing Reserve Funds.”

The Mortgage Lender will disburse to the Borrower the Specified Tenant Space Leasing Reserve Funds in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement as if such Specified Tenant Space Leasing Reserve Funds were Leasing Reserve Funds; provided that Specified Tenant Space Leasing Reserve Funds will not be disbursed to the Borrower for payment of capital expenses that are unrelated to leasing costs incurred with respect to the Specified Tenant Space.
“Specified Tenant Space” means that portion of the Property demised as of the Origination Date to the initial applicable Specified Tenant pursuant to the initial applicable Specified Tenant Lease.

“Specified Tenant Lease” means, individually and/or collectively (as the context requires), each Lease at the Property with a Specified Tenant (including, without limitation, any guaranty or similar instrument furnished thereunder), as the same may have been or may hereafter be amended, restated, extended, renewed, replaced and/or otherwise modified.
The Borrower directed all existing tenants of the Property to directly deposit all rents into a clearing account controlled by the Lender.
During a Trigger Period, funds in the deposit account will be applied and disbursed in accordance with the Whole Loan documents.
Under certain circumstances and for limited purposes described in the Whole Loan documents, the Borrower may request disbursements of such excess cash flow.
See “Loan Terms” herein for more information.

Borrower is required to deposit, or cause to be deposited, all revenue generated by the Mortgaged Property within three business days of receipt thereof into an eligible account for the sole and exclusive benefit of the Mortgage Lender (the “Restricted Account”) and in which the Mortgage Lender has a first-priority security interest.

Borrower is also required to send direction notices to each tenant occupying space at the Mortgaged Property directing them to pay all rents and other sums due under the lease to which such tenant is party, as further described under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Restricted Account.”
See “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Cash Management”.
For a detailed description of the Reserve Accounts, see “Description of the Mortgage Loan”.

Borrower is required to deposit, or cause to be deposited, all revenue generated by the Property within three Business Days of receipt thereof into an Eligible Account for the sole and exclusive benefit of the Mortgage Lender (the “Restricted Account”) and in which the Mortgage Lender has a first-priority security interest.

Borrower is also required to: (i) within 12 Business Days following the Origination Date, send direction notices (each such notice, a “Direction Notice”) to all tenants now occupying space at the Property directing them to pay all rent and other sums due under the lease to which they are a party into the Restricted Account, (ii) simultaneously with the execution of any lease entered into on or after the Origination Date in accordance to the terms and conditions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, furnish each tenant under each lease a Direction Notice and (iii) continue to send the aforesaid Direction Notices until each addressee thereof complies with the terms of such Direction Notices.

“Priority Waterfall Payments” means the first, second, third, fourth and seventh payments above (for the Monthly Ground Rent Deposit, the Monthly Tax Deposit, the Monthly Condo Assessments Deposit, the Monthly Insurance Deposit, and the Op Ex Monthly Deposit).

“True Up Payment” means a payment into the applicable Reserve Account of a sum which, taking into account any anticipated applicable monthly deposits into the applicable Reserve Account, will be sufficient to discharge the obligations and liabilities for which such Reserve Account was established as and when required by the Mortgage Loan Agreement.
The amount of the True Up Payment will be determined by the Mortgage Lender in its reasonable discretion and will be final and binding absent manifest error.
Amounts deposited pursuant to the leasing reserve account are referred to in this paragraph as the “Leasing Reserve Funds.”

Mortgage Lender will not be required to disburse Leasing Reserve Funds more frequently than once each calendar month nor in an amount less than the Minimum Disbursement Amount (or a lesser amount if the total amount of Leasing Reserve Funds is less than the Minimum Disbursement Amount, in which case only one disbursement of the amount remaining in the account will be made).

“Approved Leasing Costs” means actual out-of-pocket tenant improvement and leasing costs which are (i)(a) set forth on Schedule XI attached to the Mortgage Loan Agreement, (b) incurred by the Borrower in leasing space at the Property pursuant to Leases entered into after the Origination Date in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Documents, including brokerage commissions, tenant improvements and tenant allowances that are set forth in any such Lease, or (c) otherwise approved by Mortgage Lender, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed, and (ii) substantiated by executed Lease documents or brokerage agreements or other agreements providing for the payment of a leasing or brokerage commission.

In addition to the foregoing, actual out-of-pocket costs incurred by the Borrower for the build out of spec office space shall be deemed “Approved Leasing Costs”, provided that (x) the Borrower shall not be entitled to disbursements from the Leasing Reserve Account for such Approved Leasing Costs in any consecutive twelve (12) month period in excess of an amount equal to $0.25 per rentable square foot at the Property per annum and (y) in no event shall the Closing Date Approved Leasing Costs be disbursed to fund such Approved Leasing Costs.
“Minimum Disbursement Amount” means $15,000.
Amounts deposited pursuant to the capital expenditure are referred to in this paragraph as the “Capital Expenditures Reserve Funds”.
Mortgage Lender will disburse Capital Expenditures Reserve Funds only for Approved Capital Expenditures.

Mortgage Lender will not be required to disburse Capital Expenditures Reserve Funds more frequently than once each calendar month nor in an amount less than the Minimum Disbursement Amount (or a lesser amount if the total amount of Capital Expenditures Reserve Funds is less than the Minimum Disbursement Amount, in which case only one disbursement of the amount remaining in the account will be made).

Nothing with respect to Capital Expenditure Reserve Funds above will (i) make Mortgage Lender responsible for making or completing the Approved Capital Expenditures; (ii) require Mortgage Lender to expend funds in addition to the Capital Expenditures Reserve Funds to complete any Approved Capital Expenditures; (iii) obligate Mortgage Lender to proceed with any Approved Capital Expenditures; or (iv) obligate Mortgage Lender to demand from the Borrower additional sums to complete any Approved Capital Expenditures.

If requested by Mortgage Lender, the Borrower will permit Mortgage Lender and its agents and representatives to enter onto the Property upon reasonable advance notice and during normal business hours (subject to the rights of Tenants under their Leases) to inspect the progress of any Approved Capital Expenditures and all materials being used in connection therewith and to examine all plans and shop drawings relating to such Approved Capital Expenditures which are or may be kept at the Property.
The Borrower will cause all contractors and subcontractors to cooperate with Mortgage Lender and its agents and representatives in connection with inspections described in this paragraph.

The Borrower will pay all reasonable out-of-pocket costs and expenses incurred in connection with each such report and inspection (including, without limitation, the reasonable fees, costs and expenses of Mortgage Lender in connection therewith, if any).

“Approved Capital Expenditures” means Capital Expenditures incurred by the Borrower and either (i) included in the Approved Annual Budget or (ii) approved by Mortgage Lender, which approval will not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed.
“Capital Expenditures” means amounts expended for replacements and alterations to the Property (excluding tenant improvements) and required to be capitalized according to GAAP.

“Approved Extraordinary Expense” means an operating expense of the Property not set forth on the Approved Annual Budget (and for the avoidance of doubt that is not an Approved Operating Expense) but that is approved by the Mortgage Lender in writing (which such approval may not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed) and approved by Mezzanine Lender in accordance with the Mezzanine Loan Documents (to the extent such approval is required under the Mezzanine Loan Documents).

Notwithstanding the foregoing, in no event will the Mortgage Lender’s approval be required for expenses attributable to emergencies involving an imminent threat of bodily injury or loss of life (including any structural damage to the Property that is reasonably expected to result in an imminent threat of bodily injury or loss of life).

“Approved Operating Expense” means an operating expense of the Property (i) set forth on the Approved Annual Budget, (ii) for real estate taxes, Insurance Premiums, electric, gas, oil, water, sewer or other utility service, (iii) actual property management fees due and payable to the Property Manager under the Management Agreement, such amount not to exceed one and one-half percent (1.5%) of Gross Income from Operations, or (iv) that has been approved by the Mortgage Lender, such approval not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed.

The Borrower has agreed to notify the Mortgage Lender promptly of any changes to the amounts, schedules and instructions for payment of any taxes and Insurance Premiums of which it has or obtains knowledge and has authorized the Mortgage Lender or its agent to obtain the bills for taxes directly from the appropriate taxing authority.

If the amount of the Tax and Insurance Funds exceeds the amounts due for taxes and Insurance Premiums pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Agreement, the Mortgage Lender will return any excess to the Borrower.
“Insurance Payment Date” means, with respect to any applicable Policies, the date occurring 10 days prior to the date the applicable Insurance Premiums associated therewith are due and payable.
“Tax Payment Date” means, with respect to any applicable taxes, the date occurring 10 days prior to the date the same would be delinquent if not paid.

The Borrower agrees to notify Mortgage Lender promptly of any changes to the amounts, schedules and instructions for payment of any Ground Rent of which it has or obtains knowledge and authorizes Mortgage Lender or its agent to obtain any bills, invoices or statements for Ground Rent directly from the ground lessor.

Provided there are sufficient amounts in the Ground Rent Account and no Priority Payment Cessation Period exists, Mortgage Lender will be obligated to pay the Ground Rent as it becomes due on their respective due dates on behalf of the Borrower by applying the Ground Rent Funds to the payment of such Ground Rent. If the amount of the Ground Rent Funds will exceed the amounts due for Ground Rent pursuant to the Ground Lease, Mortgage Lender will return any excess to the Borrower.

“Ground Lease” means those certain ground leases more particularly described in the Mortgage Loan Agreement, as the same may be amended, restated, supplemented or otherwise modified from time to time after the Closing Date.
“Ground Rent” means any base rent, additional rent or other rent payable by the Borrower to the landlord under the Ground Lease, including, without limitation, any Payments in Lieu of Taxes.
“Payments in Lieu of Taxes” means any and all payments of PILOT (as defined in the Ground Lease) payable under the Ground Lease.

The Borrower agrees to notify Mortgage Lender promptly of any changes to the amounts, schedules and instructions for payment of any Assessments of which it has or obtains knowledge and authorizes Mortgage Lender or its agent to obtain any bills, invoices or statements for Assessments directly from the Condominium Board of Managers.

Provided there are sufficient amounts in the Condo Assessments Account and no Priority Payment Cessation Period exists, Mortgage Lender will be obligated to pay the Assessments as they become due on their respective due dates on behalf of Borrower by applying the Condo Assessments Funds to the payment of such Assessments.
If the amount of the Condo Assessments Funds will exceed the amount due for Assessments pursuant to the Condominium Documents, Mortgage Lender will return any excess to Borrower.
“Condominium Board of Managers” means the Board of Managers of the Condominium.
Amounts deposited pursuant to this paragraph are referred to herein as the “Specified Tenant Space Leasing Reserve Funds.”

The Mortgage Lender will disburse to the Borrower the Specified Tenant Space Leasing Reserve Funds in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement as if such Specified Tenant Space Leasing Reserve Funds were Leasing Reserve Funds; provided that Specified Tenant Space Leasing Reserve Funds will not be disbursed to the Borrower for payment of capital expenses that are unrelated to leasing costs incurred with respect to the Specified Tenant Space.
“Specified Tenant Space” means that portion of the Property demised as of the Origination Date to the initial applicable Specified Tenant pursuant to the initial applicable Specified Tenant Lease.

“Specified Tenant Lease” means, individually and/or collectively (as the context requires), each Lease at the Property with a Specified Tenant (including, without limitation, any guaranty or similar instrument furnished thereunder), as the same may have been or may hereafter be amended, restated, extended, renewed, replaced and/or otherwise modified.
The Borrower directed all existing tenants of the Property to directly deposit all rents into a clearing account controlled by the Lender.
Under certain circumstances and for limited purposes described in the Whole Loan documents, the Borrower may request disbursements of such excess cash flow.
See “Loan Terms” herein for more information.

Borrower is required to deposit, or cause to be deposited, all revenue generated by the Mortgaged Property within three business days of receipt thereof into an eligible account for the sole and exclusive benefit of the Mortgage Lender (the “Restricted Account”) and in which the Mortgage Lender has a first-priority security interest.

Borrower is also required to send direction notices to each tenant occupying space at the Mortgaged Property directing them to pay all rents and other sums due under the lease to which such tenant is party, as further described under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Restricted Account.”
See “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Cash Management”.
For a detailed description of the Reserve Accounts, see “Description of the Mortgage Loan”.

Borrower is also required to: (i) within 12 Business Days following the Origination Date, send direction notices (each such notice, a “Direction Notice”) to all tenants now occupying space at the Property directing them to pay all rent and other sums due under the lease to which they are a party into the Restricted Account, (ii) simultaneously with the execution of any lease entered into on or after the Origination Date in accordance to the terms and conditions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, furnish each tenant under each lease a Direction Notice and (iii) continue to send the aforesaid Direction Notices until each addressee thereof complies with the terms of such Direction Notices.

Mortgage Lender will disburse Capital Expenditures Reserve Funds only for Approved Capital Expenditures.

Nothing with respect to Capital Expenditure Reserve Funds above will (i) make Mortgage Lender responsible for making or completing the Approved Capital Expenditures; (ii) require Mortgage Lender to expend funds in addition to the Capital Expenditures Reserve Funds to complete any Approved Capital Expenditures; (iii) obligate Mortgage Lender to proceed with any Approved Capital Expenditures; or (iv) obligate Mortgage Lender to demand from the Borrower additional sums to complete any Approved Capital Expenditures.

The Borrower has agreed to notify the Mortgage Lender promptly of any changes to the amounts, schedules and instructions for payment of any taxes and Insurance Premiums of which it has or obtains knowledge and has authorized the Mortgage Lender or its agent to obtain the bills for taxes directly from the appropriate taxing authority.

“Ground Rent” means any base rent, additional rent or other rent payable by the Borrower to the landlord under the Ground Lease, including, without limitation, any Payments in Lieu of Taxes.
