So long as no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing or certain bankruptcy actions with respect to a Borrower have not occurred, the Borrowers will have access to the Excess Cash Flow Reserve Fund and such amounts will be required to be disbursed by the Mortgage Lender to the Borrowers within three Business Days of the Borrowers’ written request to pay for cost and expenses in connection with the ownership, management and/or operation of the Properties, including, without limitation for (i) payment of shortfalls in the payment of debt service and/or mezzanine debt service, (ii) payment of shortfalls in the required deposits into the Reserve Funds (in each case, to the extent required in the Mortgage Loan Agreement or the Cash Management Agreement), (iii) at the Borrowers’ option, principal prepayments of the Mortgage Loan and any Mezzanine Loan, (iv) at the Borrowers’ option, prepayment which is required to satisfy any Debt Yield test under the Mortgage Loan Agreement (provided such prepayment is made pro rata between the Mortgage Loan and each Mezzanine Loan), (v) payment of operating expenses (including capital expenditures), (vi) payment of management fees due and payable under the Management Agreements, (vii) payment of emergency repairs and/or life-safety items, including any such repairs or items which are capital in nature, with respect to which the Mortgage Lender is required to endeavor to fund (or cause its servicer to fund) such requests within one Business Day of request by the Borrowers, provided further that any failure to fund such request within one Business Day will in no event create any liability for the Mortgage Lender under the Mortgage Loan Agreement; (viii) payment of tenant improvement costs, tenant allowances, tenant relocation costs, tenant reimbursements, tenant inducement payments and leasing commission obligations or other expenditures required under leases (including tenant improvement costs, tenant allowances, tenant relocation costs, tenant reimbursements and leasing commission obligations or other expenditures required pursuant to a lease which are incurred or otherwise payable in connection with the entering into, renewal and/or extension of a lease) entered into in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement or existing as of the Origination Date; (ix) costs associated with the Interest Rate Cap Agreement or with respect to the Mortgage Loan or any Mezzanine Loan, including replacement Interest Rate Cap Agreements, substitute Interest Rate Cap Agreements and converted Interest Rate Cap Agreements; (x) vacant space preparation costs and marketing costs with respect to potential leasing at the Properties; (xi) payment of any shortfall of Net Proceeds with respect the costs of restoration of a Property after a casualty or condemnation incurred by, or on behalf of, the Borrowers in connection therewith; (xii) payment of any fees and costs which are due and payable to the Mortgage Lender or its servicer pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Documents or any Mezzanine Lender pursuant to the Mezzanine Loan Documents; (xiii) legal, audit and accounting (including actual costs incurred by the Guarantor or Borrower Sponsor (directly or indirectly) and its service providers for back office accounting for costs associated with the Properties or the Borrowers), provided, that such funds may not be used for the legal fees incurred in connection with the enforcement of the Borrowers’, any Mezzanine Borrower’s or any of their respective affiliates’ rights pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Documents or the Mezzanine Loan Documents, respectively; (xiv) Approved Alterations; and (xv) such other items as may be approved in writing by the Mortgage Lender, as determined in the Mortgage Lender’s reasonable discretion, provided that, for purposes of clarity, no Mezzanine Lender (or its agents or servicers) will be able to approve items for disbursement from the Excess Cash Flow Reserve Account pursuant to this clause (xv).

So long as no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing or certain bankruptcy actions with respect to a Borrower have not occurred, the Borrowers will have access to the Excess Cash Flow Reserve Fund and such amounts will be required to be disbursed by the Mortgage Lender to the Borrowers within three Business Days of the Borrowers’ written request to pay for cost and expenses in connection with the ownership, management and/or operation of the Properties, including, without limitation for (i) payment of shortfalls in the payment of debt service and/or mezzanine debt service, (ii) payment of shortfalls in the required deposits into the Reserve Funds (in each case, to the extent required in the Mortgage Loan Agreement or the Cash Management Agreement), (iii) at the Borrowers’ option, principal prepayments of the Mortgage Loan and any Mezzanine Loan, (iv) at the Borrowers’ option, prepayment which is required to satisfy any Debt Yield test under the Mortgage Loan Agreement (provided such prepayment is made pro rata between the Mortgage Loan and each Mezzanine Loan), (v) payment of operating expenses (including capital expenditures), (vi) payment of management fees due and payable under the Management Agreements, (vii) payment of emergency repairs and/or life-safety items, including any such repairs or items which are capital in nature, with respect to which the Mortgage Lender is required to endeavor to fund (or cause its servicer to fund) such requests within one Business Day of request by the Borrowers, provided further that any failure to fund such request within one Business Day will in no event create any liability for the Mortgage Lender under the Mortgage Loan Agreement; (viii) payment of tenant improvement costs, tenant allowances, tenant relocation costs, tenant reimbursements, tenant inducement payments and leasing commission obligations or other expenditures required under leases (including tenant improvement costs, tenant allowances, tenant relocation costs, tenant reimbursements and leasing commission obligations or other expenditures required pursuant to a lease which are incurred or otherwise payable in connection with the entering into, renewal and/or extension of a lease) entered into in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement or existing as of the Origination Date; (ix) costs associated with the Interest Rate Cap Agreement or with respect to the Mortgage Loan or any Mezzanine Loan, including replacement Interest Rate Cap Agreements, substitute Interest Rate Cap Agreements and converted Interest Rate Cap Agreements; (x) vacant space preparation costs and marketing costs with respect to potential leasing at the Properties; (xi) payment of any shortfall of Net Proceeds with respect the costs of restoration of a Property after a casualty or condemnation incurred by, or on behalf of, the Borrowers in connection therewith; (xii) payment of any fees and costs which are due and payable to the Mortgage Lender or its servicer pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Documents or any Mezzanine Lender pursuant to the Mezzanine Loan Documents; (xiii) legal, audit and accounting (including actual costs incurred by the Guarantor or Borrower Sponsor (directly or indirectly) and its service providers for back office accounting for costs associated with the Properties or the Borrowers), provided, that such funds may not be used for the legal fees incurred in connection with the enforcement of the Borrowers’, any Mezzanine Borrower’s or any of their respective affiliates’ rights pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Documents or the Mezzanine Loan Documents, respectively; (xiv) Approved Alterations; and (xv) such other items as may be approved in writing by the Mortgage Lender, as determined in the Mortgage Lender’s reasonable discretion, provided that, for purposes of clarity, no Mezzanine Lender (or its agents or servicers) will be able to approve items for disbursement from the Excess Cash Flow Reserve Account pursuant to this clause (xv).

In lieu of Borrower depositing all Excess Cash Flow into the Excess Cash Flow Reserve Fund in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement and the Cash Management Agreement and for so long as no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, Borrower has the right to cause Guarantor to deliver to Mortgage Lender the Excess Cash Flow Guaranty, provided, that, as a condition precedent to the delivery of such Excess Cash Flow Guaranty to Mortgage Lender, Borrower is required to deliver to Mortgage Lender, at Borrower’s sole cost and expense (i) an additional insolvency opinion in respect of such Excess Cash Flow Guaranty in form and substance reasonably satisfactory to Mortgage Lender and (ii) a legal opinion that the Excess Cash Flow Guaranty has been duly authorized, executed and delivered by Guarantor, and that the Excess Cash Flow Guaranty is valid, binding and enforceable against Guarantor in accordance with its terms, which opinions are required to be in form and substance substantially similar to the opinions delivered by Borrower’s counsel upon the closing of the Mortgage Loan with respect to validity, authority, execution and enforceability, and which may be relied upon by Mortgage Lender and the Rating Agencies.

In no instance is Borrower entitled to request, nor is Mortgage Lender obligated to disburse, Excess Cash Flow to Borrower in lieu of depositing the same into the Excess Cash Flow Reserve Fund if (I) a Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, (II) such Excess Cash Flow is not guaranteed pursuant to any Excess Cash Flow Guaranty, and/or (III) such disbursement of such amounts would cause the aggregate amount of obligations then outstanding under the Excess Cash Flow Guaranty to exceed fifteen percent (15%) of the then outstanding principal balance of the Mortgage Loan.

Pursuant to any Excess Cash Flow Guaranty, Guarantor will be required to irrevocably and unconditionally guaranty to Mortgage Lender and its successors and assigns the payment and performance of the Guaranteed Obligations upon the earlier of (i) a monetary Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (ii) a monetary Mezzanine Loan Event of Default, (iii) a Priority Payment Cessation Event, (iv) the acceleration of any Mezzanine Loan during the continuance of a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default, (v) the commencement of any action, proceeding, demand for payment, foreclosure or taking of a bill of sale or appointment of a receiver with respect to any Collateral (as defined in each Mezzanine Loan Agreement) under any Mezzanine Loan and/or the imposition of a stay, an injunction or similar judicially imposed device that has the effect of preventing a Mezzanine Lender from exercising its remedies under its respective Mezzanine Loan Documents and (vi) a deed in lieu of foreclosure or assignment in lieu of foreclosure, as applicable, with respect to the Mortgage Loan or any Mezzanine Loan.

Pursuant to any Excess Cash Flow Guaranty, Guarantor will be required to irrevocably and unconditionally guaranty to Mortgage Lender and its successors and assigns the payment and performance of the Guaranteed Obligations upon the earlier of (i) a monetary Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (ii) a monetary Mezzanine Loan Event of Default, (iii) a Priority Payment Cessation Event, (iv) the acceleration of any Mezzanine Loan during the continuance of a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default, (v) the commencement of any action, proceeding, demand for payment, foreclosure or taking of a bill of sale or appointment of a receiver with respect to any Collateral (as defined in each Mezzanine Loan Agreement) under any Mezzanine Loan and/or the imposition of a stay, an injunction or similar judicially imposed device that has the effect of preventing a Mezzanine Lender from exercising its remedies under its respective Mezzanine Loan Documents and (vi) a deed in lieu of foreclosure or assignment in lieu of foreclosure, as applicable, with respect to the Mortgage Loan or any Mezzanine Loan.

The Excess Cash Flow Guaranty, to the extent one exists, will terminate and the Guarantor will be released as Guarantor from its obligations under the Excess Cash Flow Guaranty as of (i) a Cash Sweep Cure Date, (ii) upon the deposit of the current amount of any Guaranteed Excess Cash Flow into the Excess Cash Flow Reserve Fund as required pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Agreement or (iii) at any other time that Borrower, in its sole discretion, elects to deposit the current amount of any Guaranteed Excess Cash Flow into the Excess Cash Flow Reserve Fund.

A full cash flow sweep period is triggered upon (i) the Debt Yield (calculated based on the Total Debt) falling for two consecutive quarters below 6.00%, (ii) an event of default under the Mortgage Loan or Mezzanine Loan or (iii) the occurrence of certain bankruptcy or insolvency events with respect to the Borrowers (a “Cash Sweep Period”).

A full cash flow sweep period is triggered upon (i) the Debt Yield (calculated based on the Total Debt) falling for two consecutive quarters below 6.00%, (ii) an event of default under the Mortgage Loan or Mezzanine Loan or (iii) the occurrence of certain bankruptcy or insolvency events with respect to the Borrowers (a “Cash Sweep Period”).

A full cash flow sweep period is triggered upon (i) the Debt Yield (calculated based on the Total Debt) falling for two consecutive quarters below 6.00%, (ii) an event of default under the Mortgage Loan or Mezzanine Loan or (iii) the occurrence of certain bankruptcy or insolvency events with respect to the Borrowers (a “Cash Sweep Period”).

A full cash flow sweep period is triggered upon (i) the Debt Yield (calculated based on the Total Debt) falling for two consecutive quarters below 6.00%, (ii) an event of default under the Mortgage Loan or Mezzanine Loan or (iii) the occurrence of certain bankruptcy or insolvency events with respect to the Borrowers (a “Cash Sweep Period”).

During the continuance of a Cash Sweep Period, ongoing monthly escrows include (i) 1/12th of the Lender’s reasonable estimate of the real estate taxes and insurance premiums payable over the course of the ensuing 12 months (unless insurance is maintained under an acceptable blanket policy), (ii) 1/12th of Portfolio NRA multiplied by $0.15 for capital expenditures (capped at one year of collections) and (iii) 1/12th of Portfolio NRA multiplied by $0.40 for tenant improvements and leasing commissions (capped at one year of collections).

The Mortgage Loan Documents require the Borrowers to fund (subject to exceptions described below) the following reserve funds (collectively, the “Reserve Funds”): a required repairs reserve account (the “Required Repairs Account”) for certain scheduled repairs and other work at the Properties, into which the Borrowers deposited on the Origination Date an amount equal to $320,475; an ongoing tax escrow account (the “Tax Account”) for taxes payable with respect to the Properties, into which the Borrowers deposited an amount equal to $2,732,915 and are required to deposit on a monthly basis 1/12th of the taxes that the Servicer reasonably estimates will be payable during the next 12 months; if the liability or casualty insurance policy maintained by the Borrowers covering the Properties does not constitute an approved blanket or umbrella policy, an ongoing insurance reserve account (the “Insurance Account”), into which the Borrowers would be required to deposit on a monthly basis 1/12th of the insurance premiums payable with respect to the Properties that the Servicer reasonably estimates will be payable for the renewal of coverage upon expiration thereof; an ongoing capital expenditures reserve account (the “Capital Expenditures Account”) for the payment of capital expenditures, into which the Borrowers deposited $9,333,338 and into which the Borrowers will be required to deposit on a monthly basis an amount equal to 1/12th of $750 per available bed at the Properties, subject to certain conditions set forth in “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Capital Expenditure Funds”; an account (the “SFF Cash Collateral Account”) into which the Borrowers may deposit cash collateral in order to effectuate a SFF Trigger Cure as defined in “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Deposit Account”; an insurance proceeds and condemnation awards account (the “Casualty and Condemnation Account”), into which the Borrowers will be required to pay all insurance proceeds or condemnation awards in connection with a casualty or condemnation of any Property in accordance with the provisions described in “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Casualty and Condemnation”; if a Trigger Period is continuing, a cash collateral account (the “Cash Collateral Account”), which will be held by the Servicer as additional security for the Mortgage Loan and into which the Borrowers will be required to deposit excess cash flow from remaining amounts on deposit in the Deposit Account after payment of all escrows, reserves, debt service and certain other amounts required to be made in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Documents.

So long as no Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists and no Trigger Period exists, the deposit account agreement will permit automatic transfer of deposits to the Borrowers’ operating account following payment of all monthly amounts due under the Mortgage Loan Documents.

Upon the occurrence of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default or a Trigger Period and until such time as such Mortgage Loan Event of Default or Trigger Period, as applicable, no longer exists, neither the Borrowers, nor any persons may withdraw any funds from the Deposit Account, and all funds deposited into the Deposit Account will be applied and disbursed in accordance with the provisions described in “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Deposit Account.”

Under the Mortgage Loan Documents, provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, on each Payment Date, all funds in the Deposit Account during the immediately preceding Mortgage Loan Interest Accrual Period are required to be applied on such Payment Date by the Mortgage Lender to pay the following items in the following amounts and order of priority: (i) first, to the Tax Account, to make the required deposit of Tax Funds as described in “—Tax Funds” below; (ii) second, to the Insurance Account, to make any required deposit of Insurance Funds as described in “—Insurance Funds” below; (iii) third, to the Mortgage Lender, funds sufficient to pay the Debt Service on the Mortgage Loan due on such Payment Date; (iv) fourth, to the Capital Expenditure Account, to make the required deposit of Capital Expenditure Funds as described in “—Capital Expenditure Funds” below; (v) fifth, to the Mortgage Lender, funds sufficient to pay any other amounts then due and payable under the Mortgage Loan Documents; (vi) sixth, to pay any amounts then due and payable to the cash management bank pursuant to the Cash Management Agreement; (vii) seventh, provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, if the Mezzanine A Loan (or any portion thereof) is outstanding, to the Mezzanine A Loan deposit account, funds sufficient to make payments of only the debt service under the Mezzanine A Loan due on the next Payment Date; (viii) eighth, provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing and provided no Trigger Period has occurred and is continuing, if the Mezzanine A Loan (or any portion thereof) is outstanding, to the Mezzanine A Loan deposit account, funds sufficient to make payments of any other amounts under the applicable Mezzanine Loan Documents then due and payable on the Payment Date (other than the payment of the outstanding principal balance thereof on the Maturity Date (as defined in the Mezzanine Loan Agreement for such Mezzanine Loan); (ix) ninth, provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing and no event of default with respect to the Mezzanine A Loan has occurred and is continuing, if the Mezzanine B Loan (or any portion thereof) is outstanding, to the Mezzanine B Loan deposit account, funds sufficient to make payments of only the debt service under the Mezzanine B Loan due on the next Payment Date; (x) tenth, provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default and no event of default with respect to the Mezzanine A Loan has occurred and is continuing, and provided no Trigger Period has occurred and is continuing, if the Mezzanine B Loan (or any portion thereof) is outstanding, to the Mezzanine B Loan deposit account, funds sufficient to make payments of any other amounts under the applicable Mezzanine Loan Documents then due and payable on the Payment Date (other than the payment of the outstanding principal balance thereof on the maturity date); (xi) eleventh, provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, an amount equal to all reasonable operating expenses incurred by the Borrowers during the prior Mortgage Loan Interest Accrual Period not to exceed 1% of the amount of Master Lease Base Rent paid into the Deposit Account with respect to such Payment Date for operating expenses incurred by Borrower during the prior Mortgage Loan Interest Accrual Period; (xii) twelfth, all amounts remaining after payment of the amounts set forth in clauses (i) through (xi) above (the “Available Cash”) will be applied in the following order of priority: (A) during the continuance of a Trigger Period, 100% of the Available Cash on such Payment Date will be transferred to the Cash Collateral Account to be held and disbursed in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement as described in “—Cash Collateral Funds” below; and (B) provided no Trigger Period is continuing, 100% of the Available Cash on such Payment Date will be disbursed to the Borrowers.

“Low Debt Yield Sweep Event” means the occurrence of both of the following: (a) the Mortgage Lender determines that the Debt Yield is (i) on first Calculation Date, less than 14.50%, (ii) on the second Calculation Date, less than 14.75%, (iii) on any of the third through the sixth Calculation Dates, less than 15.0%, (iv) on either the seventh or the eighth Calculation Dates, less than 15.25%, (v) on any of the ninth through the sixteenth Calculation Dates, less than 15.5%, (vi) on any Calculation Date thereafter, less than 15.75%; and (b) the Borrowers have not either: (i) prepaid the Mortgage Loan and/or the Mezzanine Loans (in accordance with the terms of “—Prepayment—Voluntary Prepayment”, including, without limitation, the payment of any applicable Spread Maintenance Premium, if any) by an amount sufficient to prevent or cure the Low Debt Yield Sweep Event, or (ii) posted a letter of credit with the Mortgage Lender in an amount equal to the amount of the prepayment that that would be sufficient to prevent or cure the Low Debt Yield Sweep Event, as described in the foregoing subclause (b)(i) (but excluding any amounts that would be attributable to the payment of any Spread Maintenance Premium), in either case within ten Business Days of the Borrowers’ receipt of written notice from the Mortgage Lender that a Low Debt Yield Sweep Event will commence.

“Low Debt Yield Sweep Event Cure” means the occurrence of either of the following: (a) the Properties achieve a Debt Yield at least equal to the applicable Debt Yield set forth in clause (a) of the definition of “Low Debt Yield Sweep Event” on a Calculation Date following the occurrence of the applicable Low Debt Yield Sweep Event; or (b) immediately upon the date that the Borrowers either (i) prepay the Mortgage Loan and/or the Mezzanine Loans in accordance with the terms of “—Prepayment—Voluntary Prepayment”, including, without limitation, the payment of any applicable Spread Maintenance Premium, if any (which prepayment may, provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing, be made using funds held by the Mortgage Lender in the Cash Collateral Account, provided, that, for the avoidance of doubt, Cash Collateral Funds will not be disbursed for the payment of any applicable Spread Maintenance Premium) by an amount sufficient to cause the Debt Yield to equal or exceed the applicable Debt Yield set forth in clause (a) of the definition of “Low Debt Yield Sweep Event”, or (ii) post a letter of credit with the Mortgage Lender in an amount equal to the amount of the prepayment that that would be sufficient to cure the Low Debt Yield Sweep Event, as described in the foregoing subclause (b)(i) (but excluding any amounts that would be attributable to the payment of any Spread Maintenance Premium).

A “Trigger Period” will commence upon the occurrence of (i) a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (ii) a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default, (iii) an uncured monetary or material non-monetary Event of Default (as defined in the Master Lease) under the Master Lease, (iv) if any Master Tenant or Operator files a voluntary petition under the Bankruptcy Code or any other federal or state bankruptcy or insolvency law, or an involuntary petition is filed against any Master Tenant or Operator under the Bankruptcy Code or any other federal or state bankruptcy or insolvency law by any other person or entity, (v) an SFF Trigger or (vi) a Low Debt Yield Sweep Event.

A “Trigger Period” will commence upon the occurrence of (i) a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (ii) a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default, (iii) an uncured monetary or material non-monetary Event of Default (as defined in the Master Lease) under the Master Lease, (iv) if any Master Tenant or Operator files a voluntary petition under the Bankruptcy Code or any other federal or state bankruptcy or insolvency law, or an involuntary petition is filed against any Master Tenant or Operator under the Bankruptcy Code or any other federal or state bankruptcy or insolvency law by any other person or entity, (v) an SFF Trigger or (vi) a Low Debt Yield Sweep Event.

A “Trigger Period” will commence upon the occurrence of (i) a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (ii) a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default, (iii) an uncured monetary or material non-monetary Event of Default (as defined in the Master Lease) under the Master Lease, (iv) if any Master Tenant or Operator files a voluntary petition under the Bankruptcy Code or any other federal or state bankruptcy or insolvency law, or an involuntary petition is filed against any Master Tenant or Operator under the Bankruptcy Code or any other federal or state bankruptcy or insolvency law by any other person or entity, (v) an SFF Trigger or (vi) a Low Debt Yield Sweep Event.

A “Trigger Period” will commence upon the occurrence of (i) a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (ii) a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default, (iii) an uncured monetary or material non-monetary Event of Default (as defined in the Master Lease) under the Master Lease, (iv) if any Master Tenant or Operator files a voluntary petition under the Bankruptcy Code or any other federal or state bankruptcy or insolvency law, or an involuntary petition is filed against any Master Tenant or Operator under the Bankruptcy Code or any other federal or state bankruptcy or insolvency law by any other person or entity, (v) an SFF Trigger or (vi) a Low Debt Yield Sweep Event.

A “Trigger Period” will commence upon the occurrence of (i) a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (ii) a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default, (iii) an uncured monetary or material non-monetary Event of Default (as defined in the Master Lease) under the Master Lease, (iv) if any Master Tenant or Operator files a voluntary petition under the Bankruptcy Code or any other federal or state bankruptcy or insolvency law, or an involuntary petition is filed against any Master Tenant or Operator under the Bankruptcy Code or any other federal or state bankruptcy or insolvency law by any other person or entity, (v) an SFF Trigger or (vi) a Low Debt Yield Sweep Event.

A “Trigger Period” will commence upon the occurrence of (i) a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (ii) a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default, (iii) an uncured monetary or material non-monetary Event of Default (as defined in the Master Lease) under the Master Lease, (iv) if any Master Tenant or Operator files a voluntary petition under the Bankruptcy Code or any other federal or state bankruptcy or insolvency law, or an involuntary petition is filed against any Master Tenant or Operator under the Bankruptcy Code or any other federal or state bankruptcy or insolvency law by any other person or entity, (v) an SFF Trigger or (vi) a Low Debt Yield Sweep Event.

Any such Trigger Period will end if: (A) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (i), the Mortgage Loan Event of Default commencing the Trigger Period has been cured and such cure has been accepted by the Mortgage Lender (and no other Mortgage Loan Event of Default is then continuing); (B) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (ii), the Mezzanine Loan Event of Default commencing the Trigger Period has been cured and such cure has been accepted by the applicable Mezzanine Lender (and no other Mezzanine Loan Event of Default is then continuing); (C) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (iii), either (1) the uncured monetary or material non-monetary Event of Default (as defined in the Master Lease) under the Master Lease commencing the Trigger Period has been cured and such cure has been accepted by the applicable Borrowers as landlord under the applicable Master Lease (and no other uncured monetary or material non-monetary Event of Default (under, and as defined in Master Lease) is then continuing), or (2) the applicable Master Tenant has been replaced with one or more replacement Master Tenants pursuant to and in compliance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, or to the extent such Event of Default (under, and as defined in Master Lease) relates only to a specific Property or Properties, such Property or Properties have been released in compliance with the terms of “—Prepayment—Release of Properties”; (D) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (iv), either (1) the applicable Master Tenant or Operator, as applicable, has reaffirmed its obligations under the Master Lease or Operating Lease, as applicable, without any modification of such Master Lease or Operating Lease, as applicable, cured all defaults capable of being cured under such Master Lease or Operating Lease, as applicable, and is and will remain in compliance with all of the provisions of such Master Lease or Operating Lease, as applicable, (2) the proceeding in connection with such action has been fully and finally concluded, dismissed or otherwise terminated, including, without limitation, in connection with an action under the Bankruptcy Code, the occurrence of the effective date of a plan of reorganization, or (3) the applicable Master Tenant or Operator, as applicable, has been replaced with one or more replacement Master Tenants or Operators, as applicable, pursuant to and in compliance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, or the Property or Properties subject to the Master Lease or Operating Lease, as applicable, with such Master Tenant or Operator, as applicable, have been released in accordance with the terms of “—Prepayment—Release of Properties”, (E) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (v), an SFF Trigger Cure occurs and (F) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (vi), a Low Debt Yield Sweep Event Cure occurs.

Any such Trigger Period will end if: (A) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (i), the Mortgage Loan Event of Default commencing the Trigger Period has been cured and such cure has been accepted by the Mortgage Lender (and no other Mortgage Loan Event of Default is then continuing); (B) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (ii), the Mezzanine Loan Event of Default commencing the Trigger Period has been cured and such cure has been accepted by the applicable Mezzanine Lender (and no other Mezzanine Loan Event of Default is then continuing); (C) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (iii), either (1) the uncured monetary or material non-monetary Event of Default (as defined in the Master Lease) under the Master Lease commencing the Trigger Period has been cured and such cure has been accepted by the applicable Borrowers as landlord under the applicable Master Lease (and no other uncured monetary or material non-monetary Event of Default (under, and as defined in Master Lease) is then continuing), or (2) the applicable Master Tenant has been replaced with one or more replacement Master Tenants pursuant to and in compliance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, or to the extent such Event of Default (under, and as defined in Master Lease) relates only to a specific Property or Properties, such Property or Properties have been released in compliance with the terms of “—Prepayment—Release of Properties”; (D) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (iv), either (1) the applicable Master Tenant or Operator, as applicable, has reaffirmed its obligations under the Master Lease or Operating Lease, as applicable, without any modification of such Master Lease or Operating Lease, as applicable, cured all defaults capable of being cured under such Master Lease or Operating Lease, as applicable, and is and will remain in compliance with all of the provisions of such Master Lease or Operating Lease, as applicable, (2) the proceeding in connection with such action has been fully and finally concluded, dismissed or otherwise terminated, including, without limitation, in connection with an action under the Bankruptcy Code, the occurrence of the effective date of a plan of reorganization, or (3) the applicable Master Tenant or Operator, as applicable, has been replaced with one or more replacement Master Tenants or Operators, as applicable, pursuant to and in compliance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, or the Property or Properties subject to the Master Lease or Operating Lease, as applicable, with such Master Tenant or Operator, as applicable, have been released in accordance with the terms of “—Prepayment—Release of Properties”, (E) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (v), an SFF Trigger Cure occurs and (F) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (vi), a Low Debt Yield Sweep Event Cure occurs.

Any such Trigger Period will end if: (A) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (i), the Mortgage Loan Event of Default commencing the Trigger Period has been cured and such cure has been accepted by the Mortgage Lender (and no other Mortgage Loan Event of Default is then continuing); (B) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (ii), the Mezzanine Loan Event of Default commencing the Trigger Period has been cured and such cure has been accepted by the applicable Mezzanine Lender (and no other Mezzanine Loan Event of Default is then continuing); (C) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (iii), either (1) the uncured monetary or material non-monetary Event of Default (as defined in the Master Lease) under the Master Lease commencing the Trigger Period has been cured and such cure has been accepted by the applicable Borrowers as landlord under the applicable Master Lease (and no other uncured monetary or material non-monetary Event of Default (under, and as defined in Master Lease) is then continuing), or (2) the applicable Master Tenant has been replaced with one or more replacement Master Tenants pursuant to and in compliance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, or to the extent such Event of Default (under, and as defined in Master Lease) relates only to a specific Property or Properties, such Property or Properties have been released in compliance with the terms of “—Prepayment—Release of Properties”; (D) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (iv), either (1) the applicable Master Tenant or Operator, as applicable, has reaffirmed its obligations under the Master Lease or Operating Lease, as applicable, without any modification of such Master Lease or Operating Lease, as applicable, cured all defaults capable of being cured under such Master Lease or Operating Lease, as applicable, and is and will remain in compliance with all of the provisions of such Master Lease or Operating Lease, as applicable, (2) the proceeding in connection with such action has been fully and finally concluded, dismissed or otherwise terminated, including, without limitation, in connection with an action under the Bankruptcy Code, the occurrence of the effective date of a plan of reorganization, or (3) the applicable Master Tenant or Operator, as applicable, has been replaced with one or more replacement Master Tenants or Operators, as applicable, pursuant to and in compliance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, or the Property or Properties subject to the Master Lease or Operating Lease, as applicable, with such Master Tenant or Operator, as applicable, have been released in accordance with the terms of “—Prepayment—Release of Properties”, (E) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (v), an SFF Trigger Cure occurs and (F) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (vi), a Low Debt Yield Sweep Event Cure occurs.

Any such Trigger Period will end if: (A) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (i), the Mortgage Loan Event of Default commencing the Trigger Period has been cured and such cure has been accepted by the Mortgage Lender (and no other Mortgage Loan Event of Default is then continuing); (B) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (ii), the Mezzanine Loan Event of Default commencing the Trigger Period has been cured and such cure has been accepted by the applicable Mezzanine Lender (and no other Mezzanine Loan Event of Default is then continuing); (C) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (iii), either (1) the uncured monetary or material non-monetary Event of Default (as defined in the Master Lease) under the Master Lease commencing the Trigger Period has been cured and such cure has been accepted by the applicable Borrowers as landlord under the applicable Master Lease (and no other uncured monetary or material non-monetary Event of Default (under, and as defined in Master Lease) is then continuing), or (2) the applicable Master Tenant has been replaced with one or more replacement Master Tenants pursuant to and in compliance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, or to the extent such Event of Default (under, and as defined in Master Lease) relates only to a specific Property or Properties, such Property or Properties have been released in compliance with the terms of “—Prepayment—Release of Properties”; (D) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (iv), either (1) the applicable Master Tenant or Operator, as applicable, has reaffirmed its obligations under the Master Lease or Operating Lease, as applicable, without any modification of such Master Lease or Operating Lease, as applicable, cured all defaults capable of being cured under such Master Lease or Operating Lease, as applicable, and is and will remain in compliance with all of the provisions of such Master Lease or Operating Lease, as applicable, (2) the proceeding in connection with such action has been fully and finally concluded, dismissed or otherwise terminated, including, without limitation, in connection with an action under the Bankruptcy Code, the occurrence of the effective date of a plan of reorganization, or (3) the applicable Master Tenant or Operator, as applicable, has been replaced with one or more replacement Master Tenants or Operators, as applicable, pursuant to and in compliance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, or the Property or Properties subject to the Master Lease or Operating Lease, as applicable, with such Master Tenant or Operator, as applicable, have been released in accordance with the terms of “—Prepayment—Release of Properties”, (E) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (v), an SFF Trigger Cure occurs and (F) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (vi), a Low Debt Yield Sweep Event Cure occurs.

“SFF Cap Number” means (a) six, at any time when there are 75 or more Properties in total; (b) five, at any time when there are 50 or more, but fewer than 75, Properties in total; and (c) three, at any time when there are less than 50 Properties in total.

“SFF Trigger” will occur (i) from, and for as long as (unless and until an SFF Trigger Cure is effectuated): (a) five or more individual Properties have each been identified as SFFs for three or more consecutive survey periods each, at any time when there are 75 or more Properties in total; (b) four or more individual Properties have each been identified as SFFs for three or more consecutive survey periods each, at any time when there are 50 or more, but fewer than 75, Properties in total; and (c) two or more individual Properties have each been identified as SFFs for three or more consecutive survey periods each, at any time when there are less than 50 Properties in total; provided, however that it will not be an SFF Trigger if the Borrowers effectuate an SFF Trigger Cure by the earlier to occur of the date that is (X) 30 days following the Borrower’s receipt of notice from Master Tenant that the applicable Property has been an SFF for three or more consecutive survey periods and (Y) 60 days following the date that the applicable Property has been an SFF for three or more consecutive survey periods; or (ii) from, and for as long as (unless and until an SFF Trigger Cure is effectuated pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement) the SFF Cap Number or more individual Properties have been identified as SFFs at any one time (including the applicable Properties that have been SFFs for three or more consecutive survey periods); provided, however that it will not be an SFF Trigger if the Borrowers effectuate an SFF Trigger Cure by the earlier to occur of the date that is (X) 30 days following the Borrowers’ receipt of notice from the Master Tenant of the applicable Property becoming an SFF and (Y) 60 days following the date that the applicable Property became as SFF.

“SFF Trigger Cure” means either (i) with respect to clause (i) of the definition of SFF Trigger, (A) the Borrower has deposited with the Mortgage Lender cash collateral in an amount equal to the Release Amount (as calculated for a Limited Cure Release) for one or more Properties that have been SFFs for three or more consecutive survey periods, (B) the Borrowers have exercised a Limited Cure Release for (or otherwise released, in accordance with the of the Mortgage Loan Agreement) one or more Properties that have been SFFs for three or more consecutive survey periods, or (C) one or more of the Properties that have been SFFs for three or more consecutive survey periods is removed from the Special Focus Facility list, such that the total number of Properties then currently identified as SFFs, which have been SFFs for three or more consecutive survey periods, but that the Borrowers have not released from the Mortgage Loan and that the Borrowers have not posted cash collateral for is equal to: (a) four or fewer, at any time when there are 75 or more Properties in total; (b) three or fewer, at any time when there are 50 or more, but fewer than 75, Properties in total; and (c) one, at any time when there are less than 50 Properties in total; or (ii) with respect to clause (ii) of the definition of SFF Trigger, (A) the Borrowers have deposited with the Mortgage Lender cash collateral in an amount equal to the Release Amount (as calculated for a Limited Cure Release) for one or more Properties that have been identified as SFFs, (B) the Borrowers have exercised a Limited Cure Release for (or otherwise released, in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement) one or more Properties that have been identified as SFFs, or (C) one or more of the Properties identified as SFFs is removed from the Special Focus Facility list, such that the total number of Properties then currently identified as SFFs, but that the Borrowers have not released from the Mortgage Loan and that the Borrowers have not posted cash collateral for is less than the SFF Cap Number; provided that no SFF Trigger Period pursuant to clause (i) of the definition of SFF Trigger is continuing.
Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in the Mortgage Loan Agreement, any release exercised to effectuate an SFF Trigger Cure will be deemed to be a Limited Cure Release.

Provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing, the Mortgage Lender will be required to direct its Mortgage Loan Servicer to disburse Required Repairs Funds to the Borrowers out of the Required Repairs Account, within 20 days after a request by the Borrowers (but not more often than once per month), in increments of at least $10,000 (or a lesser amount if the total amount in the Required Repairs Account is less than $10,000, in which case only one disbursement of the amount remaining in the account will be made), subject to the satisfaction of certain disbursement conditions set forth in the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

Notwithstanding the foregoing or anything to the contrary contained in the Mortgage Loan Agreement or in any other Mortgage Loan Document, provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing with respect to any request for a disbursement of Required Repairs Funds in an amount less than $250,000, the Mortgage Lender or Mortgage Loan Servicer (as applicable) will be required to disburse such funds upon receipt of (and subject only to the receipt of) an officer’s certificate in the form attached to the Mortgage Loan Agreement as Schedule XII certifying that the Required Repairs related to such disbursement have been completed.
Provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing, the Mortgage Lender will be required to direct the Servicer to apply Tax Funds in the Tax Account to payments of Taxes.

Provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing, the Mortgage Lender will be required to direct the Servicer to apply Insurance Funds in the Insurance Account to the timely payment of insurance premiums.

Provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing, the Mortgage Lender is required to direct the Mortgage Loan Servicer to disburse Capital Expenditure Funds to the Borrowers out of the Capital Expenditure Account for approved capital expenditures, Required Repairs and Environmental Repairs, within 10 days after the delivery by the Borrowers to the Mortgage Lender of a request therefor (but not more often than once per month), in increments of at least $10,000 (or a lesser amount if the total amount in the Capital Expenditure Account is less than $10,000, in which case only one disbursement of the amount remaining in the account will be made) subject to the satisfaction of certain disbursement conditions as set forth in the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

If the Borrowers deposit cash collateral with the Mortgage Lender in order to effectuate a SFF Trigger Cure, all such amounts will be transferred into an account (the “SFF Cash Collateral Account”) to be held by the Mortgage Lender as cash collateral for the debt, and the funds deposited therein, the “SFF Collateral Funds”.

Provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing, (a) in the event that the SFF for which such deposit was made is removed from the Special Focus Facility list, or released in compliance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, the SFF Collateral Funds attributable to such Property are required to be deposited in the Deposit Account and (b) in the event that at any time there are two or fewer SFFs, all SFF Collateral Funds are required to be deposited into the Deposit Account.

Provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default or Trigger Period is continuing, upon the Borrower’s request, the Mortgage Lender will apply SFF Collateral Funds attributable to a Property towards the Release Amount for such Property in order to effectuate a Limited Cure Release.

If a Trigger Period is continuing, all Available Cash will be paid to the Mortgage Lender, which amounts are required to be transferred by the Mortgage Lender into a sub-account of the Deposit Account (the “Cash Collateral Account” and the funds deposited therein, the “Cash Collateral Funds”) to be held by or on behalf of the Mortgage Lender in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

In addition, so long as no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, Cash Collateral Funds on deposit in the Cash Collateral Account will be available to the Borrowers, and such amounts are required to be disbursed by the Mortgage Lender to the Borrowers promptly following Borrowers’ written request, and no more frequently than bimonthly, to pay for the following cost and expenses in connection with the ownership, management and/or operation of the Properties: (i) payment of shortfalls in the required deposits into the Accounts (in each case, to the extent required in the Mortgage Loan Agreement), (ii) at the Borrower’s option, principal prepayments of the Mortgage Loan and any Mezzanine Loan (provided such prepayment is made pro rata between the Mortgage Loan and each Mezzanine Loan), (iii) at the Borrower’s option, prepayment which is required to satisfy any Debt Yield test or covenant under the Mortgage Loan Agreement (provided that such prepayment is made pro rata between the Mortgage Loan and each Mezzanine Loan), (iv) payment of operating expenses (including any capital expenditures) approved by the Mortgage Lender (such approval not to be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed), (v) payment of emergency repairs and/or life-safety items, including any such repairs or items which are capital in nature, (vi) costs associated with Interest Rate Cap Agreements with respect to the Mortgage Loan or any Mezzanine Loan, (vii) payment of any fees and costs which are due and payable to the Mortgage Lender or the Servicer pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Documents or any Mezzanine Lender pursuant to the Mezzanine Loan Documents, and (viii) such other items as may be approved in writing by the Mortgage Lender and the Mezzanine Lender, as determined in each lender’s reasonable discretion.

Any Cash Collateral Funds on deposit in the Cash Collateral Account not previously disbursed or applied will upon the termination of any Trigger Periods, provided no other Trigger Period then exists, be added to the funds disbursed on the next Payment Date.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Mortgage Lender will have the right, but not the obligation, at any time during the continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, in its sole and absolute discretion to apply any and all Cash Collateral Funds then on deposit in the Cash Collateral Account to the obligations of the Borrowers under the Mortgage Loan Documents, in such order and in such manner as the Mortgage Lender elects in its sole and absolute discretion, including to make a prepayment of principal (together with the applicable Spread Maintenance Premium, if any, applicable thereto) or any other amounts due under the Mortgage Loan Agreement.
Cash Collateral Account: During the continuance of a Trigger Period all Available Cash is required to be deposited with the Lender as additional collateral for the Mortgage Loan.

Provided no event of default has occurred and is then continuing, funds in the Cash Collateral Reserve are required to be disbursed to the Borrowers in respect of various items in accordance with the terms of the loan documents.

Provided no event of default under the Mortgage Loan has occurred and is continuing, available funds in the CMA are required to be applied in the following order: (a) deposits into the tax escrow, (b) deposits into the insurance escrow (unless a blanket insurance policy is in place), (c) payment of interest on the Mortgage Loan on the monthly payment date and the Required Amortization Payment, if applicable, (d) deposits into the capital expenditure escrow, (e) payment of any other amounts then due and payable under the loan documents, (f) payment of amounts due to cash management bank, (g) payments of any mezzanine debt service then due and payable, (h) provided no Trigger Period (as hereinafter defined) is continuing, payments of any other amounts due and payable under the  mezzanine loan documents, and (i) payment of approved operating expenses incurred during the prior month, not to exceed 1% of the amount of base rent paid into the CMA with respect to such monthly payment.

Upon the occurrence and during the continuance of an event of default, Lender must continue to make payments for taxes and insurance out of the applicable reserve accounts to the extent there are sufficient funds therein, until the Mortgage Loan is accelerated or Lender otherwise exercises any remedies (or the imposition of a judicial stay that prevents Lender from exercising remedies).

Provided no Trigger Period is continuing, all available cash after the payments described in the preceding paragraph (“Available Cash”) will be automatically transferred to Borrower's operating account on the applicable monthly payment date.

Provided that no event of default has occurred and is continuing, during the occurrence of a Trigger Period, 100.0% of the Available Cash on such monthly payment date will be transferred to an account (the “Cash Collateral Account”) owned and controlled by Lender or its servicer to be held as collateral for the Mortgage Loan, or, at Borrower’s option, to pay certain amounts and other expenses of Borrowers and Guarantor specifically permitted by the loan documents.

“Trigger Period” means the continuance of (i) an uncured event of default under the Mortgage Loan Documents or the mezzanine loan documents, (ii) an uncured monetary or material non_monetary event of default under the Master Lease, (iii) if any Master Tenant or Operator files a voluntary petition for bankruptcy or an involuntary petition for bankruptcy is filed against Master Tenant or Operator, (iv) certain triggers related to the number of special focus facilities existing in the portfolio or (v) a Low Debt Yield Sweep Period.

“Trigger Period” means the continuance of (i) an uncured event of default under the Mortgage Loan Documents or the mezzanine loan documents, (ii) an uncured monetary or material non_monetary event of default under the Master Lease, (iii) if any Master Tenant or Operator files a voluntary petition for bankruptcy or an involuntary petition for bankruptcy is filed against Master Tenant or Operator, (iv) certain triggers related to the number of special focus facilities existing in the portfolio or (v) a Low Debt Yield Sweep Period.

“Trigger Period” means the continuance of (i) an uncured event of default under the Mortgage Loan Documents or the mezzanine loan documents, (ii) an uncured monetary or material non_monetary event of default under the Master Lease, (iii) if any Master Tenant or Operator files a voluntary petition for bankruptcy or an involuntary petition for bankruptcy is filed against Master Tenant or Operator, (iv) certain triggers related to the number of special focus facilities existing in the portfolio or (v) a Low Debt Yield Sweep Period.

“Trigger Period” means the continuance of (i) an uncured event of default under the Mortgage Loan Documents or the mezzanine loan documents, (ii) an uncured monetary or material non_monetary event of default under the Master Lease, (iii) if any Master Tenant or Operator files a voluntary petition for bankruptcy or an involuntary petition for bankruptcy is filed against Master Tenant or Operator, (iv) certain triggers related to the number of special focus facilities existing in the portfolio or (v) a Low Debt Yield Sweep Period.

“Trigger Period” means the continuance of (i) an uncured event of default under the Mortgage Loan Documents or the mezzanine loan documents, (ii) an uncured monetary or material non_monetary event of default under the Master Lease, (iii) if any Master Tenant or Operator files a voluntary petition for bankruptcy or an involuntary petition for bankruptcy is filed against Master Tenant or Operator, (iv) certain triggers related to the number of special focus facilities existing in the portfolio or (v) a Low Debt Yield Sweep Period.

“Trigger Period” means the continuance of (i) an uncured event of default under the Mortgage Loan Documents or the mezzanine loan documents, (ii) an uncured monetary or material non_monetary event of default under the Master Lease, (iii) if any Master Tenant or Operator files a voluntary petition for bankruptcy or an involuntary petition for bankruptcy is filed against Master Tenant or Operator, (iv) certain triggers related to the number of special focus facilities existing in the portfolio or (v) a Low Debt Yield Sweep Period.

Any such Trigger Period shall end if (a) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (i) above, the event default has been cured and such cure has been accepted by the Lender or applicable mezzanine lender, as applicable; (b) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (ii) above, either (A) the cure of such event of default under the Master Lease or (B) the Master Tenant has been replaced with one or more replacement Master Tenants in compliance with the terms of the loan documents, or if the event of default relates only to a specific Property or Properties, (such properties have been released in accordance with the terms of the loan documents; and (c) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (iii) above, either (1) the applicable Master Tenant or Operator has reaffirmed its obligations under the Master Lease or operating lease (as applicable), without any modification of such Master Lease or operating lease (as applicable), cured all defaults capable of being cured under such and is and shall remain in compliance with all of the provisions of such Master Lease or operating lease (as applicable), (2) the proceeding in connection with such action has been fully and finally concluded, dismissed or otherwise terminated, or (3) the applicable Master Tenant or operator has been replaced with one or more replacement Master Tenants or Operators (as applicable) in compliance with the terms of the loan documents, or the Property or Properties subject to the Master Lease or operating lease (as applicable) with such Master Tenant or Operator (as applicable) have been released in accordance with the terms of the loan documents; (d) a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (iv) above, the reduction in the number of special focus facilities below the applicable trigger threshold due to the release of a sufficient number of affected properties (or the deposit of sufficient cash collateral with Lender to effectuate such releases if so applied) or due to a sufficient number of affected facilities no longer being special focus facilities or (e) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (v) above, the expiration of the Low Debt Yield Sweep Period.

Any such Trigger Period shall end if (a) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (i) above, the event default has been cured and such cure has been accepted by the Lender or applicable mezzanine lender, as applicable; (b) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (ii) above, either (A) the cure of such event of default under the Master Lease or (B) the Master Tenant has been replaced with one or more replacement Master Tenants in compliance with the terms of the loan documents, or if the event of default relates only to a specific Property or Properties, (such properties have been released in accordance with the terms of the loan documents; and (c) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (iii) above, either (1) the applicable Master Tenant or Operator has reaffirmed its obligations under the Master Lease or operating lease (as applicable), without any modification of such Master Lease or operating lease (as applicable), cured all defaults capable of being cured under such and is and shall remain in compliance with all of the provisions of such Master Lease or operating lease (as applicable), (2) the proceeding in connection with such action has been fully and finally concluded, dismissed or otherwise terminated, or (3) the applicable Master Tenant or operator has been replaced with one or more replacement Master Tenants or Operators (as applicable) in compliance with the terms of the loan documents, or the Property or Properties subject to the Master Lease or operating lease (as applicable) with such Master Tenant or Operator (as applicable) have been released in accordance with the terms of the loan documents; (d) a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (iv) above, the reduction in the number of special focus facilities below the applicable trigger threshold due to the release of a sufficient number of affected properties (or the deposit of sufficient cash collateral with Lender to effectuate such releases if so applied) or due to a sufficient number of affected facilities no longer being special focus facilities or (e) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (v) above, the expiration of the Low Debt Yield Sweep Period.

Any such Trigger Period shall end if (a) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (i) above, the event default has been cured and such cure has been accepted by the Lender or applicable mezzanine lender, as applicable; (b) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (ii) above, either (A) the cure of such event of default under the Master Lease or (B) the Master Tenant has been replaced with one or more replacement Master Tenants in compliance with the terms of the loan documents, or if the event of default relates only to a specific Property or Properties, (such properties have been released in accordance with the terms of the loan documents; and (c) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (iii) above, either (1) the applicable Master Tenant or Operator has reaffirmed its obligations under the Master Lease or operating lease (as applicable), without any modification of such Master Lease or operating lease (as applicable), cured all defaults capable of being cured under such and is and shall remain in compliance with all of the provisions of such Master Lease or operating lease (as applicable), (2) the proceeding in connection with such action has been fully and finally concluded, dismissed or otherwise terminated, or (3) the applicable Master Tenant or operator has been replaced with one or more replacement Master Tenants or Operators (as applicable) in compliance with the terms of the loan documents, or the Property or Properties subject to the Master Lease or operating lease (as applicable) with such Master Tenant or Operator (as applicable) have been released in accordance with the terms of the loan documents; (d) a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (iv) above, the reduction in the number of special focus facilities below the applicable trigger threshold due to the release of a sufficient number of affected properties (or the deposit of sufficient cash collateral with Lender to effectuate such releases if so applied) or due to a sufficient number of affected facilities no longer being special focus facilities or (e) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (v) above, the expiration of the Low Debt Yield Sweep Period.

“Low Debt Yield Sweep Period” means the period commencing on the date that Lender determines the Debt Yield is less than (i) on March 31, 2019, 14.50%, (ii) on June 30, 2019, less than 14.75%, (iii) on any of the Calculation Dates (as defined below) from (and including) September 30, 2019 through (and including) June 30, 2020, less than 15.00%, (iv) on either September 30, 2020 or December 31, 2020, less than 15.25%, (v) on any of the Calculation Dates from (and including) March 31, 2021 through (and including) the December 31, 2022, less than 15.50% and (vi) on any Calculation Date thereafter, less than 15.75%.

A Low Debt Yield Sweep Period will end upon the earliest to occur of (a) the Property achieving a Debt Yield equal to or greater than the applicable foregoing Debt Yields on any Calculation Date or (b) the date that Borrower either (x) prepays the Total Debt Loan (including any applicable spread maintenance premiums) by an amount sufficient to cause the Debt Yield to equal or exceed the applicable foregoing Debt Yields or (y) posts a letter of credit in an amount equal to the amount of prepayment required in the preceding clause (x).
Cash Collateral Account: During the continuance of a Trigger Period all Available Cash is required to be deposited with Lender as additional collateral for the Mortgage Loan.
Upon the termination of the Trigger Period, provided no other Trigger Period is continuing, all amounts in the Cash Collateral Account will be deposited back into the CMA.

Provided no event of default has occurred and is then continuing, funds in the Cash Collateral Reserve are required to be disbursed to the Borrowers in respect of various items in accordance with the terms of the loan documents.

The Borrowers have established the Lockbox Accounts, and following the occurrence of a Cash Management Period, Mortgage Lender will be required to establish a Cash Management Account with respect to the Mortgage Loan and the Properties, both of which accounts will serve as collateral for the Mortgage Loan.

During a Cash Management Period, Borrower is required to (and Mortgage Lender may) cause the Lockbox Bank to transfer to the Cash Management Account in immediately available funds by Federal wire transfer all funds on deposit in the Lockbox Accounts once every business day, and funds in the Cash Management Account will be applied as described under “DESCRIPTION OF THE MORTGAGE LOAN—Lockbox Account and Cash Management Account” in this Offering Circular.

Thus, even in the event of a Cash Management Period, the Mortgage Lender’s control over revenues from the operation of the Properties may be limited to the extent that rents and receipts are not deposited into the respective Lockbox Account, as there is a risk that such Borrower or the Property Managers could divert such funds.

So long as no Cash Management Period exists, all available amounts on deposit in the Lockbox Accounts are to be disbursed to the applicable Borrower in immediately available funds by Federal wire transfer once every business day.

Upon the occurrence and during the continuance of any Cash Management Period, Borrower is required to (and Mortgage Lender may) cause the Lockbox Bank to transfer to the Cash Management Account in immediately available funds by Federal wire transfer all amounts on deposit in the Lockbox Accounts once every business day.

Upon the occurrence and during the continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, Mortgage Lender may, in addition to any and all other rights and remedies available to the Mortgage Lender, direct the Lockbox Bank to immediately pay over all funds on deposit in the Lockbox Accounts to the Mortgage Lender and to apply any such funds to the payment of the Obligations in any order in its sole discretion.

Not later than ten (10) Business Days following delivery by Mortgage Lender of written notice to Borrower indicating that a Cash Management Period exists, Mortgage Lender will establish and maintain a segregated eligible account (the “Cash Management Accounts”) with an Eligible Bank (the “Deposit Bank”) in trust for the benefit of Mortgage Lender, which Cash Management Account will be for the sole and exclusive benefit of and under the sole dominion and control of Mortgage Lender.

Pursuant to the Cash Management Agreement (as defined below), provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, after the occurrence and during the continuance of a Cash Management Period, on each Payment Date (or, if such Payment Date is not a Business Day, on the immediately succeeding Business Day) all funds on deposit in the Cash Management Account will be applied by Mortgage Lender (or by Deposit Bank at Mortgage Lender’s direction) to the payment of the following items in the order indicated: (i) First, payment to Mortgage Lender (for deposit in the Taxes and Insurance Reserve) in respect of the applicable amount required to be deposited in the Taxes and Insurance Reserve in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement; (ii) Second, to the extent the Cash Management Account contains any Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue, payment to Borrower in an amount equal to the Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue then contained in the Cash Management Account (each such disbursement for Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue under the Mortgage Loan Agreement, an “Excluded TIR Disbursement”), subject to satisfaction of the following conditions to disbursement (the “TIR Disbursement Conditions”): Borrower certifies in writing to Mortgage Lender, not less than two (2) Business Days prior to each such Excluded TIR Disbursement, (i) the amount of the Excluded TIR Disbursement, the Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue and Tenant Protection Plan Net Revenue for the applicable Properties to which such Excluded TIR Disbursement relates, (ii) that the Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue to which the Excluded TIR Disbursement relates has been deposited into the Cash Management Account, and the Excluded TIR Disbursement does not include amounts previously paid or disbursed on account of Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue, and (iii) that the calculations of the Excluded TIR Disbursement, Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue and Tenant Protection Plan Revenue are true and correct in all material respects; (iii) Third, payment to Deposit Bank of the fees and expenses of Deposit Bank then due and payable pursuant to the Cash Management Agreement; (iv) Fourth, payment to Mortgage Lender of the Monthly Debt Service Payment Amount due on such Payment Date; (v) Fifth, payment to Mortgage Lender (for deposit in the Replacement Reserve) in respect of the applicable amount required to be deposited in the Replacement Reserve, if any, in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement; (vi) Sixth, payment to Borrower in an amount equal to the aggregate of (A) operating expenses due and payable by Borrower during the succeeding month as set forth in all material respects in the Approved Annual Budget (it being agreed that any deviation in such operating expenses from the line items in the Approved Annual Budget that are within ten (10%) of such line items and less than eight percent (8%) in the aggregate of all budgeted items will be deemed to be immaterial), and (B) Approved Extraordinary Expenses, if any (provided that monthly disbursements for Management Fees will be limited to the monthly Underwritten Management Fees based on gross income from operations for the preceding month as demonstrated to Mortgage Lender’s reasonable satisfaction); (vii) Seventh, payment to Mortgage Lender of any other amounts then due and owing under the Mortgage Loan Documents; (viii) Eighth, so long as the Mezzanine Loan remains outstanding, funds sufficient to pay the Mezzanine Monthly Debt Service Payment Amount will be deposited in the Mezzanine Account; and (ix) Ninth, payment of all amounts then remaining after payment of items (i) through (viii) (all amounts then remaining after payment of items (i) through (viii) being hereinafter referred to as “Excess Cash”) to the Excess Cash Reserve Account in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement; and (x) Lastly, if no Cash Management Period is then continuing, all Excess Cash to Borrower.

Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in the Mortgage Loan Agreement or in any other Mortgage Loan Documents, and with respect to the timing of the payment of any Excluded TIR Disbursements, during a Cash Management Period but regardless of whether an Event of Default exists, upon written request by Borrower, funds on deposit in the Cash Management Account will be disbursed by Mortgage Lender (or by Deposit Bank at Mortgage Lender’s direction) to Borrower for Excluded TIR Disbursements, subject to satisfaction of the TIR Disbursement Conditions.

Notwithstanding anything contained in the Mortgage Loan Agreement, following the occurrence of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default and during the continuance thereof, all funds on deposit in the Cash Management Account may be applied by Mortgage Lender in such order and priority as Mortgage Lender will determine in its sole discretion until the Obligations have been paid in full.

“Cash Management Period” means the period that (i) commences upon the occurrence and continuance of any Cash Trap Event, and (ii) ends upon the occurrence of a Cash Trap Event Cure. Upon Borrower’s written request, upon the occurrence of a Cash Trap Event Cure, and provided that no other Cash Trap Event exists, Mortgage Lender agrees to give notice to Clearing Bank that the Cash Management Period has ended.

“Cash Trap Event” means (a) the occurrence of any Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (b) a Debt Yield Trigger, or (c) the receipt by Mortgage Lender of written notice from Mezzanine Lender that a Mezzanine Loan Default (other than as a result of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default) has occurred.

“Cash Trap Event” means (a) the occurrence of any Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (b) a Debt Yield Trigger, or (c) the receipt by Mortgage Lender of written notice from Mezzanine Lender that a Mezzanine Loan Default (other than as a result of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default) has occurred.

“Cash Trap Event” means (a) the occurrence of any Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (b) a Debt Yield Trigger, or (c) the receipt by Mortgage Lender of written notice from Mezzanine Lender that a Mezzanine Loan Default (other than as a result of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default) has occurred.

“Cash Trap Event Cure” means, in each case provided that no other event that would cause a Cash Management Period to commence has occurred and is continuing, (i) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described in clause (a) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, Mortgage Lender accepts (in its sole discretion) a cure of the applicable Mortgage Loan Event of Default giving rise to such Cash Trap Event and no other Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists, (ii) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described clause (b) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, upon the Mortgage Lender’s reasonable determination that the Debt Yield is at least six and three-quarters percent (6.75%) for two (2) consecutive calendar quarters, as calculated by Mortgage Lender as of the end of each calendar quarter on a trailing twelve (12) month basis, and (iv) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described in clause (c) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, Mezzanine Lender has delivered to Mortgage Lender written notice that such Mezzanine Loan Default has been cured or waived (and no other Mezzanine Loan Default is then continuing).

“Cash Trap Event Cure” means, in each case provided that no other event that would cause a Cash Management Period to commence has occurred and is continuing, (i) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described in clause (a) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, Mortgage Lender accepts (in its sole discretion) a cure of the applicable Mortgage Loan Event of Default giving rise to such Cash Trap Event and no other Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists, (ii) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described clause (b) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, upon the Mortgage Lender’s reasonable determination that the Debt Yield is at least six and three-quarters percent (6.75%) for two (2) consecutive calendar quarters, as calculated by Mortgage Lender as of the end of each calendar quarter on a trailing twelve (12) month basis, and (iv) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described in clause (c) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, Mezzanine Lender has delivered to Mortgage Lender written notice that such Mezzanine Loan Default has been cured or waived (and no other Mezzanine Loan Default is then continuing).

“Cash Trap Event Cure” means, in each case provided that no other event that would cause a Cash Management Period to commence has occurred and is continuing, (i) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described in clause (a) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, Mortgage Lender accepts (in its sole discretion) a cure of the applicable Mortgage Loan Event of Default giving rise to such Cash Trap Event and no other Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists, (ii) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described clause (b) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, upon the Mortgage Lender’s reasonable determination that the Debt Yield is at least six and three-quarters percent (6.75%) for two (2) consecutive calendar quarters, as calculated by Mortgage Lender as of the end of each calendar quarter on a trailing twelve (12) month basis, and (iv) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described in clause (c) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, Mezzanine Lender has delivered to Mortgage Lender written notice that such Mezzanine Loan Default has been cured or waived (and no other Mezzanine Loan Default is then continuing).

Mortgage Lender will pay said items or disburse to Borrower from the Taxes and Insurance Reserve an amount sufficient to pay said items, provided that (i) no Default has occurred and is continuing without cure (other than a Default that will be cured by the subject payment from the Taxes and Insurance Reserve), (ii) Borrower has provided Mortgage Lender with the foregoing bills and other documents in a timely manner, (iii) sufficient funds are held by Mortgage Lender in the Taxes and Insurance Reserve for the payment of the Taxes and Insurance Premiums relating to the Property, as applicable, and (iv) the Reserve Disbursement Conditions have been satisfied.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, Borrower’s obligation to make the monthly deposits for Insurance Premiums required above will be suspended provided that the following conditions remain satisfied: (A) no Mortgage Loan Event of Default then exists; (B) Borrower or an Affiliate thereof maintains a blanket insurance policy that provides the coverages required by the Mortgage Loan Agreement with respect to the Property, that covers substantially all self-storage properties managed directly or indirectly by Sponsor and that otherwise satisfies the requirements for a blanket insurance policy set forth in the Mortgage Loan Agreement; and (C) Borrower delivers to Mortgage Lender evidence, reasonably satisfactory to Mortgage Lender, that such blanket insurance policy is in full force and effect at least thirty (30) days prior to the date on which such policy is scheduled to expire, and that the premium due for such blanket insurance policy has been paid not less than thirty (30) days thereafter.
