Funds contained in the Replacement Reserve will be utilized by Borrower solely for Capital Expenditures performed during the term of the Mortgage Loan in accordance with the capital expenditures budget prepared by Borrower, and during a Cash Management Period, the Approved Capital Expenditures Budget, and will not be used by Borrower for purposes for which any other Reserve is established.

“Reserve Disbursement Conditions” means the following conditions: (i) Mortgage Lender applies Taxes and Insurance Reserve Funds to payments of Taxes and Insurance Premiums (and Mortgage Lender may do so according to any bill, statement or estimate procured from the appropriate public office or insurer, as applicable, without inquiry into the accuracy of such bill, statement or estimate or into the validity of any tax, assessment, sale, forfeiture, tax lien or title or claim thereof); (ii) Mortgage Lender disburses Deferred Maintenance Reserve Funds for Required Repairs, Replacement Reserve Funds for Capital Expenditures performed during the term of the Mortgage Loan in accordance with the capital expenditures budget prepared by Borrower, and during a Cash Management Period, the Approved Capital Expenditures Budget, and (iii) Environmental Remediation Reserve Funds for Environmental Remediation Reserve Work, in each case, not more than once monthly with respect to each type of Reserve Fund, and in amounts not less than $25,000.00, or, if less, the remaining balance of the applicable Reserve Funds, upon satisfaction by Borrower of each of the following conditions: (a) Borrower submits a request for payment to Mortgage Lender at least five (5) Business Days prior to the date on which Borrower requests such payment be made and specify the purpose of the disbursement, (b) in the case of disbursements on account of Required Repairs, Capital Expenditures, or Environmental Remediation Reserve Work: (x) Mortgage Lender has received a certificate from Borrower (1) stating that all work to be funded by the requested disbursement has been completed in a good and workmanlike manner and in accordance with all applicable Legal Requirements, such certificate to be accompanied by a copy of any license, permit or other approval by any governmental authority required in connection therewith, (2) identifying each Person that supplied materials or labor in connection with the requested disbursement, and (3) stating that each such Person has been paid in full or will be paid in full upon such disbursement, such certificate to be accompanied by lien waivers or other evidence of payment reasonably satisfactory to Mortgage Lender, (y) at Mortgage Lender’s option for requests for disbursements for amounts greater than $250,000, Borrower obtains a title or lien search for the applicable Property indicating that such Property is free from all liens, claims and other encumbrances not previously approved by Mortgage Lender or otherwise permitted by the Mortgage Loan Documents, and (z) Mortgage Lender has received such other evidence (including, but not limited to, architectural, engineering or environmental reports) as Mortgage Lender reasonably requests that the work to be funded by the requested disbursement has been completed in accordance with all Legal Requirements and is paid for or will be paid upon such disbursement to Borrower.

Upon the occurrence and during the continuance of a Cash Management Period, all Excess Cash will be collected by Mortgage Lender and all such amounts will be held by Mortgage Lender as additional security for the Mortgage Loan (amounts so held, the “Excess Cash Reserve Funds” and the account to which such amounts are held, the “Excess Cash Reserve Account”).
At such time as any Cash Management Period ends, any funds held in the Excess Cash Reserve Account will be returned to Borrower.

During a Cash Management Period, so long as no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, upon written request of Borrower, Mortgage Lender will disburse within ten (10) Business Days of Borrower’s request but no more frequently than quarterly, Excess Cash Reserve Funds (to the extent of the balance thereof then held in the Excess Cash Reserve Account) for disbursements to Borrower to be distributed to Guarantor (such disbursement and distribution deemed to be an equity distribution by Borrower to its equity holders) in an amount that is the lesser of (i) $50,000 annually, and (ii) an amount sufficient, as reasonably determined by Borrower, to enable Guarantor to satisfy the distribution requirements applicable to REITs and otherwise avoid the imposition of U.S. federal and state income and excise taxes (including, without limitation, under Sections 857 and 4981 of the IRS Code) (measured for this purpose as if Borrower were itself a REIT, that such REIT’s assets were limited to the assets of Borrower, and that such REIT’s income was limited to Borrower’s net taxable income (or the net taxable income of Borrower’s owner for U.S. federal income tax purposes that is attributable to its interest in Borrower)).

The Mortgage Lender will be required to consult with the Mezzanine Lender with respect to any determination that a Cash Management Period is in effect, provided that such consultation will not be binding on the Mortgage Lender’s determination thereof.

The Mortgage Lender will be required to consult with the Mezzanine Lender with respect to a determination that a Cash Management Period has expired in accordance with the provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement (whether or not the related Cash Management Period was initially determined to have occurred by the Mortgage Lender or Mezzanine Lender), provided that such consultation will not be binding on Mortgage Lender’s determination thereof except that, unless a bankruptcy proceeding of a Borrower has occurred and has not been dismissed or there is a Mortgage Loan Event of Default under the Mortgage Loan Documents, and absent manifest error on the part of Mezzanine Lender, Mortgage Lender will be bound by any determination by Mezzanine Lender that a Cash Management Period is in effect (or has expired) due to the occurrence and continuance (or cure or waiver, as applicable) of a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default under the Mezzanine Loan.

The Mortgage Lender will be required to consult with the Mezzanine Lender with respect to a determination that a Cash Management Period has expired in accordance with the provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement (whether or not the related Cash Management Period was initially determined to have occurred by the Mortgage Lender or Mezzanine Lender), provided that such consultation will not be binding on Mortgage Lender’s determination thereof except that, unless a bankruptcy proceeding of a Borrower has occurred and has not been dismissed or there is a Mortgage Loan Event of Default under the Mortgage Loan Documents, and absent manifest error on the part of Mezzanine Lender, Mortgage Lender will be bound by any determination by Mezzanine Lender that a Cash Management Period is in effect (or has expired) due to the occurrence and continuance (or cure or waiver, as applicable) of a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default under the Mezzanine Loan.

In the event a Cash Management Period has occurred solely as a result of the occurrence and continuance of a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default, then upon receipt by Mortgage Lender of (i) a copy the notice of such Mezzanine Loan Event of Default delivered to the Mezzanine Borrower (which Mortgage Lender may rely on without independent investigation) and (ii) a written request by Mezzanine Lender to deliver instructions to each Clearing Bank make future deposits into the Cash Management Account, which request shall include a certification to Mortgage Lender than a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, then Mortgage Lender shall deliver such instructions to each Clearing Bank.

In the event a Cash Management Period has occurred solely as a result of the occurrence and continuance of a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default, then upon receipt by Mortgage Lender of (i) a copy the notice of such Mezzanine Loan Event of Default delivered to the Mezzanine Borrower (which Mortgage Lender may rely on without independent investigation) and (ii) a written request by Mezzanine Lender to deliver instructions to each Clearing Bank make future deposits into the Cash Management Account, which request shall include a certification to Mortgage Lender than a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, then Mortgage Lender shall deliver such instructions to each Clearing Bank.

Floating Rate Component Extensions Two, 12-month extension options, subject to (i) no ongoing Event of Default, (ii) the purchase by Borrower of an interest rate cap agreement, (iii) a 0.25% extension fee for each extension, (iv) the Debt Yield based on Lender’s underwritten net operating income is not less 7.5% for the first extension and 8.0% for the second extension, (v) if mezzanine loan is outstanding, mezzanine borrower shall have exercised applicable extension option in accordance with mezzanine loan documents, (vi) reimbursement to lender for all reasonable out-of-pocket costs incurred by the lender in connection with the requested extension and (vii) notice being delivered to lender at least 60 days prior to the applicable maturity date.

Floating Rate Component Extensions Two, 12-month extension options, subject to (i) no ongoing Event of Default, (ii) the purchase by Borrower of an interest rate cap agreement, (iii) a 0.25% extension fee for each extension, (iv) the Debt Yield based on Lender’s underwritten net operating income is not less 7.5% for the first extension and 8.0% for the second extension, (v) if mezzanine loan is outstanding, mezzanine borrower shall have exercised applicable extension option in accordance with mezzanine loan documents, (vi) reimbursement to lender for all reasonable out-of-pocket costs incurred by the lender in connection with the requested extension and (vii) notice being delivered to lender at least 60 days prior to the applicable maturity date.

So long as no Cash Management Period exists, all available amounts on deposit in the applicable Lockbox Account are to be disbursed to the applicable Borrower in immediately available funds by Federal wire transfer once every business day.

During a Cash Management Period, Borrower is required to (and Mortgage Lender may) cause the Lockbox Bank to transfer to the Cash Management Account in immediately available funds by Federal wire transfer all funds on deposit in the Lockbox Accounts once every business day, and funds in the Cash Management Account will be applied as described under “DESCRIPTION OF THE MORTGAGE LOAN—Lockbox Account and Cash Management Account” in this Offering Circular.

Thus, even in the event of a Cash Management Period, the Mortgage Lender’s control over revenues from the operation of the Properties may be limited to the extent that rents and receipts are not deposited into the respective Lockbox Account, as there is a risk that such Borrower or the Property Managers could divert such funds.

So long as no Cash Management Period exists, all available amounts on deposit in the Lockbox Accounts are to be disbursed to the applicable Borrower in immediately available funds by Federal wire transfer once every business day.

Upon the occurrence and during the continuance of any Cash Management Period, Borrower is required to (and Mortgage Lender may) cause the Lockbox Bank to transfer to the Cash Management Account in immediately available funds by Federal wire transfer all amounts on deposit in the Lockbox Accounts once every business day.

Upon the occurrence and during the continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, Mortgage Lender may, in addition to any and all other rights and remedies available to the Mortgage Lender, direct the Lockbox Bank to immediately pay over all funds on deposit in the Lockbox Accounts to the Mortgage Lender and to apply any such funds to the payment of the Obligations in any order in its sole discretion.

Not later than ten (10) Business Days following delivery by Mortgage Lender of written notice to Borrower indicating that a Cash Management Period exists, Mortgage Lender will establish and maintain a segregated eligible account (the “Cash Management Accounts”) with an Eligible Bank (the “Deposit Bank”) in trust for the benefit of Mortgage Lender, which Cash Management Account will be for the sole and exclusive benefit of and under the sole dominion and control of Mortgage Lender.

Pursuant to the Cash Management Agreement (as defined below), provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, after the occurrence and during the continuance of a Cash Management Period, on each Payment Date (or, if such Payment Date is not a Business Day, on the immediately succeeding Business Day) all funds on deposit in the Cash Management Account will be applied by Mortgage Lender (or by Deposit Bank at Mortgage Lender’s direction) to the payment of the following items in the order indicated: (i) First, payment to Mortgage Lender (for deposit in the Taxes and Insurance Reserve) in respect of the applicable amount required to be deposited in the Taxes and Insurance Reserve in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement; (ii) Second, to the extent the Cash Management Account contains any Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue, payment to Borrower in an amount equal to the Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue then contained in the Cash Management Account (each such disbursement for Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue under the Mortgage Loan Agreement, an “Excluded TIR Disbursement”), subject to satisfaction of the following conditions to disbursement (the “TIR Disbursement Conditions”): Borrower certifies in writing to Mortgage Lender, not less than two (2) Business Days prior to each such Excluded TIR Disbursement, (i) the amount of the Excluded TIR Disbursement, the Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue and Tenant Protection Plan Net Revenue for the applicable Properties to which such Excluded TIR Disbursement relates, (ii) that the Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue to which the Excluded TIR Disbursement relates has been deposited into the Cash Management Account, and the Excluded TIR Disbursement does not include amounts previously paid or disbursed on account of Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue, and (iii) that the calculations of the Excluded TIR Disbursement, Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue and Tenant Protection Plan Revenue are true and correct in all material respects; (iii) Third, payment to Deposit Bank of the fees and expenses of Deposit Bank then due and payable pursuant to the Cash Management Agreement; (iv) Fourth, payment to Mortgage Lender of the Monthly Debt Service Payment Amount due on such Payment Date; (v) Fifth, payment to Mortgage Lender (for deposit in the Replacement Reserve) in respect of the applicable amount required to be deposited in the Replacement Reserve, if any, in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement; (vi) Sixth, payment to Borrower in an amount equal to the aggregate of (A) operating expenses due and payable by Borrower during the succeeding month as set forth in all material respects in the Approved Annual Budget (it being agreed that any deviation in such operating expenses from the line items in the Approved Annual Budget that are within ten (10%) of such line items and less than eight percent (8%) in the aggregate of all budgeted items will be deemed to be immaterial), and (B) Approved Extraordinary Expenses, if any (provided that monthly disbursements for Management Fees will be limited to the monthly Underwritten Management Fees based on gross income from operations for the preceding month as demonstrated to Mortgage Lender’s reasonable satisfaction); (vii) Seventh, payment to Mortgage Lender of any other amounts then due and owing under the Mortgage Loan Documents; (viii) Eighth, so long as the Mezzanine Loan remains outstanding, funds sufficient to pay the Mezzanine Monthly Debt Service Payment Amount will be deposited in the Mezzanine Account; and (ix) Ninth, payment of all amounts then remaining after payment of items (i) through (viii) (all amounts then remaining after payment of items (i) through (viii) being hereinafter referred to as “Excess Cash”) to the Excess Cash Reserve Account in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement; and (x) Lastly, if no Cash Management Period is then continuing, all Excess Cash to Borrower.

Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in the Mortgage Loan Agreement or in any other Mortgage Loan Documents, and with respect to the timing of the payment of any Excluded TIR Disbursements, during a Cash Management Period but regardless of whether an Event of Default exists, upon written request by Borrower, funds on deposit in the Cash Management Account will be disbursed by Mortgage Lender (or by Deposit Bank at Mortgage Lender’s direction) to Borrower for Excluded TIR Disbursements, subject to satisfaction of the TIR Disbursement Conditions.

Notwithstanding anything contained in the Mortgage Loan Agreement, following the occurrence of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default and during the continuance thereof, all funds on deposit in the Cash Management Account may be applied by Mortgage Lender in such order and priority as Mortgage Lender will determine in its sole discretion until the Obligations have been paid in full.

“Cash Management Period” means the period that (i) commences upon the occurrence and continuance of any Cash Trap Event, and (ii) ends upon the occurrence of a Cash Trap Event Cure. Upon Borrower’s written request, upon the occurrence of a Cash Trap Event Cure, and provided that no other Cash Trap Event exists, Mortgage Lender agrees to give notice to Clearing Bank that the Cash Management Period has ended.

“Cash Trap Event” means (a) the occurrence of any Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (b) a Debt Yield Trigger, or (c) the receipt by Mortgage Lender of written notice from Mezzanine Lender that a Mezzanine Loan Default (other than as a result of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default) has occurred.

“Cash Trap Event” means (a) the occurrence of any Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (b) a Debt Yield Trigger, or (c) the receipt by Mortgage Lender of written notice from Mezzanine Lender that a Mezzanine Loan Default (other than as a result of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default) has occurred.

“Cash Trap Event” means (a) the occurrence of any Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (b) a Debt Yield Trigger, or (c) the receipt by Mortgage Lender of written notice from Mezzanine Lender that a Mezzanine Loan Default (other than as a result of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default) has occurred.

“Cash Trap Event Cure” means, in each case provided that no other event that would cause a Cash Management Period to commence has occurred and is continuing, (i) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described in clause (a) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, Mortgage Lender accepts (in its sole discretion) a cure of the applicable Mortgage Loan Event of Default giving rise to such Cash Trap Event and no other Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists, (ii) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described clause (b) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, upon the Mortgage Lender’s reasonable determination that the Debt Yield is at least six and three-quarters percent (6.75%) for two (2) consecutive calendar quarters, as calculated by Mortgage Lender as of the end of each calendar quarter on a trailing twelve (12) month basis, and (iv) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described in clause (c) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, Mezzanine Lender has delivered to Mortgage Lender written notice that such Mezzanine Loan Default has been cured or waived (and no other Mezzanine Loan Default is then continuing).

“Cash Trap Event Cure” means, in each case provided that no other event that would cause a Cash Management Period to commence has occurred and is continuing, (i) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described in clause (a) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, Mortgage Lender accepts (in its sole discretion) a cure of the applicable Mortgage Loan Event of Default giving rise to such Cash Trap Event and no other Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists, (ii) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described clause (b) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, upon the Mortgage Lender’s reasonable determination that the Debt Yield is at least six and three-quarters percent (6.75%) for two (2) consecutive calendar quarters, as calculated by Mortgage Lender as of the end of each calendar quarter on a trailing twelve (12) month basis, and (iv) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described in clause (c) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, Mezzanine Lender has delivered to Mortgage Lender written notice that such Mezzanine Loan Default has been cured or waived (and no other Mezzanine Loan Default is then continuing).

Mortgage Lender will pay said items or disburse to Borrower from the Taxes and Insurance Reserve an amount sufficient to pay said items, provided that (i) no Default has occurred and is continuing without cure (other than a Default that will be cured by the subject payment from the Taxes and Insurance Reserve), (ii) Borrower has provided Mortgage Lender with the foregoing bills and other documents in a timely manner, (iii) sufficient funds are held by Mortgage Lender in the Taxes and Insurance Reserve for the payment of the Taxes and Insurance Premiums relating to the Property, as applicable, and (iv) the Reserve Disbursement Conditions have been satisfied.

The Mortgage Lender will be required to consult with the Mezzanine Lender with respect to any determination that a Cash Management Period is in effect, provided that such consultation will not be binding on the Mortgage Lender’s determination thereof.

The Mortgage Lender will be required to consult with the Mezzanine Lender with respect to a determination that a Cash Management Period has expired in accordance with the provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement (whether or not the related Cash Management Period was initially determined to have occurred by the Mortgage Lender or Mezzanine Lender), provided that such consultation will not be binding on Mortgage Lender’s determination thereof except that, unless a bankruptcy proceeding of a Borrower has occurred and has not been dismissed or there is a Mortgage Loan Event of Default under the Mortgage Loan Documents, and absent manifest error on the part of Mezzanine Lender, Mortgage Lender will be bound by any determination by Mezzanine Lender that a Cash Management Period is in effect (or has expired) due to the occurrence and continuance (or cure or waiver, as applicable) of a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default under the Mezzanine Loan.

In the event a Cash Management Period has occurred solely as a result of the occurrence and continuance of a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default, then upon receipt by Mortgage Lender of (i) a copy the notice of such Mezzanine Loan Event of Default delivered to the Mezzanine Borrower (which Mortgage Lender may rely on without independent investigation) and (ii) a written request by Mezzanine Lender to deliver instructions to each Clearing Bank make future deposits into the Cash Management Account, which request shall include a certification to Mortgage Lender than a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, then Mortgage Lender shall deliver such instructions to each Clearing Bank.

In the event a Cash Management Period has occurred solely as a result of the occurrence and continuance of a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default, then upon receipt by Mortgage Lender of (i) a copy the notice of such Mezzanine Loan Event of Default delivered to the Mezzanine Borrower (which Mortgage Lender may rely on without independent investigation) and (ii) a written request by Mezzanine Lender to deliver instructions to each Clearing Bank make future deposits into the Cash Management Account, which request shall include a certification to Mortgage Lender than a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, then Mortgage Lender shall deliver such instructions to each Clearing Bank.

The Mortgage Lenders are required to pay the insurance premiums at the Plaza del Sol Property only if the Mortgage Lenders fail to receive, within 30 days after the due date for such insurance premiums, evidence reasonably acceptable to Mortgage Lenders that such insurance premiums have been paid in full and promptly following receipt of such evidence, so long as no Trigger Period is then in effect, Mortgage Lenders are required to deposit (to the extent of available funds) the amount of the paid insurance premiums at the Plaza del Sol Property for which Mortgage Lenders received evidence of payment in full in accordance with the foregoing into the Cash Management Account, which amount will be applied in accordance with Mortgage Loan Documents.

If such documentation related to the PBO Taxes is received in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Documents and no Trigger Period is then in effect, the Mortgage Lender will deposit the applicable amount of tax reserve funds into the Cash Management Account, which amount will be applied in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Documents, and the Borrower will not be required to reserve with the Mortgage Lender the taxes for the portions of the Mortgaged Properties identified in the Mortgage Loan Documents and leased to the related tenants identified thereon, so long as certain conditions set forth in the Mortgage Loan Documents are satisfied, including that there exists no Mortgage Loan Event of Default.

Operating Expense Reserve: On each Payment Date occurring on and after the occurrence and during the continuance of a Trigger Period, the Borrower is required to deposit an amount equal to the aggregate amount of Approved Operating Expenses and Approved Extraordinary Expenses incurred by the Borrower for the then current Mortgage Loan Interest Accrual Period.

Deferred Management Fee Reserve: On each Payment Date occurring on and after the occurrence and during the continuance of a Trigger Period, within five Business Days of each Payment Date during a Trigger Period, to the extent the applicable caps more fully described in this Offering Circular have not been achieved, the Borrower is required to deposit amounts for earned and unpaid deferred management fees up to the applicable cap, each as more fully described in this Offering Circular.

Excess Cash Flow Funds: On each Payment Date occurring on and after the occurrence and continuance of a Trigger Period, an amount equal to the Excess Cash Flow generated by the Property for the immediately preceding Mortgage Loan Interest Accrual Period.

Excess Cash Flow reserve funds will be used to pay Required REIT Distributions, TRS Taxes and Puerto Rico Taxes as more particularly described in this Offering Circular, with any excess being used to pay down the debt.

“Trigger Period” means a period (A) commencing upon (i) the occurrence and continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (ii) the Debt Yield falling below 10.0% (a “Debt Yield Trigger”) (for the avoidance of doubt, the parties agree that for purposes of determining whether a Debt Yield Trigger has occurred on the related Test Date, the Mortgage Lender will (x) refer to the financial statements most recently delivered for the reimbursement and expense component of Net Cash Flow and (y) refer to the most recently delivered rent roll for the income component of Net Cash Flow, and in each case, will deduct any expenses and income included in such financial statements and/or rent roll, as applicable, related to any Property that has been released in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement as of such Test Date) or (iii) the Borrower’s failure to deliver any required financial item within 10 Business Days after written notice from the Mortgage Lender; and (B) expiring upon (x) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (A)(i) above, the cure (if applicable) of such Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (y) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (A)(ii) above, (I) the date that the Debt Yield (which, for the avoidance of doubt, the first Debt Yield Trigger test will occur on March 31, 2019 and quarterly thereafter, tested on the Test Date) is equal to or greater than the Debt Yield Trigger or (II) receipt by the Mortgage Lender of a Debt Yield Trigger Cure Payment.

“Trigger Period” means a period (A) commencing upon (i) the occurrence and continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (ii) the Debt Yield falling below 10.0% (a “Debt Yield Trigger”) (for the avoidance of doubt, the parties agree that for purposes of determining whether a Debt Yield Trigger has occurred on the related Test Date, the Mortgage Lender will (x) refer to the financial statements most recently delivered for the reimbursement and expense component of Net Cash Flow and (y) refer to the most recently delivered rent roll for the income component of Net Cash Flow, and in each case, will deduct any expenses and income included in such financial statements and/or rent roll, as applicable, related to any Property that has been released in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement as of such Test Date) or (iii) the Borrower’s failure to deliver any required financial item within 10 Business Days after written notice from the Mortgage Lender; and (B) expiring upon (x) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (A)(i) above, the cure (if applicable) of such Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (y) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (A)(ii) above, (I) the date that the Debt Yield (which, for the avoidance of doubt, the first Debt Yield Trigger test will occur on March 31, 2019 and quarterly thereafter, tested on the Test Date) is equal to or greater than the Debt Yield Trigger or (II) receipt by the Mortgage Lender of a Debt Yield Trigger Cure Payment.

“Debt Yield Trigger Cure Payment” means (i) delivery to Mortgage Lender of an amount (which amounts will be held by Mortgage Lender or Servicer as additional collateral for the Mortgage Loan and may be applied to the Debt during the continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default) equal to the amount necessary to cause the Debt Yield to be at least equal to the Debt Yield Trigger calculated as if such amount had been applied pro-rata to the reduction of the principal balance of the Mortgage Loan as of the applicable Test Date.

Any amounts deposited pursuant to the foregoing will be held as additional collateral for the Mortgage Loan and will only be returned to the Borrower upon the earlier of (a) the date Mortgage Lender determines that the Debt Yield is at least equal to the Debt Yield Trigger as of any Test Date without giving effect to any amounts deposited pursuant to this provision and (b) the indefeasible payment in full of the Debt or (ii) a prepayment of the Mortgage Loan applied pro rata to the Mortgage Loan and otherwise made in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement in an amount sufficient to cause the Debt Yield to be at least equal to the Debt Yield Trigger calculated as of the applicable Test Date.

Reserves required in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement will be required to be maintained and accounted for by the Mortgage Lender with respect to each Mortgaged Property, and, provided that no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing, the Mortgage Lender will be required to release all Reserve Funds deposited for any Mortgaged Property promptly upon the Partial Release of such Mortgaged Property in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

In addition, the Casualty Proceeds Restricted Account is required to be maintained and accounted for by the Mortgage Lender with respect to each Puerto Rico Property, and that, provided that no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing, the Mortgage Lender will release all Casualty Proceeds deposited for any Puerto Rico Property promptly upon the Partial Release of such Puerto Rico Property in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

Provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, on each Payment Date, the Mortgage Lender or Servicer, as applicable, is required to allocate all funds, if any, on deposit in the Cash Management Account and disburse such funds in the following amounts and order of priority: (a) first, funds sufficient to pay the Monthly Ground Rent Deposit due for the then applicable Payment Date, if any, are required to be deposited in the Ground Lease Reserve Account;  (b) second, funds sufficient to pay the Monthly Tax Deposit due as of such Payment Date, if any, are required to be deposited in the Tax Account; (c) third, funds sufficient to pay the Monthly Insurance Deposit due as of such Payment Date, if any, are required to be deposited in the Insurance Account; (d) fourth, funds sufficient to pay any interest accruing at the Default Rate and late payment charges due and payable as of such Payment Date, if any, are required to be deposited into the Debt Service Account; (e) fifth, funds sufficient to pay the Debt Service due as of such Payment Date are required to be deposited in the Debt Service Account (without duplication of any portion thereof already deposited under paragraph (c) above); (f) sixth, during the continuance of a Trigger Period, funds sufficient to pay the Op Ex Monthly Deposit due as of such Payment Date, if any, are required to be deposited in the Operating Expense Account; (g) seventh, funds sufficient to pay the Capital Expenditures Reserve Monthly Deposit due as of such Payment Date, if any, are required to be deposited in the Capital Expenditures Reserve Account; (h) eighth, funds sufficient to pay the Leasing Reserve Monthly Deposit due as of such Payment Date, if any, are required to be deposited in the Leasing Reserve Account; (i) ninth, funds sufficient to pay any other amounts due and payable as of such Payment Date to the Mortgage Lender and/or the Servicer pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement and/or of the other Mortgage Loan Documents, if any, are required to be deposited with or as directed by the Mortgage Lender; (j) tenth, during the continuance of a Trigger Period, funds sufficient to pay the deposits (if any) required for deferred management fees pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Agreement; (k) eleventh, to the extent a Trigger Period will have occurred and be continuing, all amounts remaining in the Cash Management Account after deposits for items (a) through (j) above (“Excess Cash Flow”) are required to be deposited into the Excess Cash Flow Account; and (l) twelfth, to the extent no Trigger Period will have occurred and be continuing, all Excess Cash Flow is required to be remitted to the Borrower's operating account.

Upon (A) a bank ceasing to be an Eligible Institution, (B) the Cash Management Account ceasing to be an Eligible Account, (C) any resignation by a bank or termination of the Cash Management Agreement by the applicable bank or the Mortgage Lender and/or (D) the occurrence and continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, the Borrower will, within 15 days of the Mortgage Lender’s request, (1) terminate the existing Cash Management Agreement, (2) appoint a new Bank related to the applicable Account (which such bank will (I) be an Eligible Institution, (II) other than during the continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, be selected by the Borrower and approved by the Mortgage Lender and (III) during the continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, be selected by the Mortgage Lender), (3) cause such Bank to open a new Cash Management Account (which such account will be an Eligible Account) and enter into a new Cash Management Agreement with the Mortgage Lender on substantially the same terms and conditions as the previous Cash Management Agreement with the Mortgage Lender on substantially the same terms and conditions as the previous Cash Management Agreement with the Mortgage Lender on substantially the same terms as the previous Cash Management Agreement, and (4) send new notices required pursuant to the terms hereof relating to such Cash Management Agreement to other Persons, including under the Restricted Account Agreement and/or the Casualty Proceeds Restricted Account Agreement, as applicable.

Each of the Additional Obligor and the Borrower constitutes and appoints the Mortgage Lender its true and lawful attorney-in-fact with full power of substitution to complete or undertake any action required of the Borrower under the Mortgage Loan Agreement in the name of the Borrower and/or the Additional Obligor in the event that a Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing and the Borrower and/or the Additional Obligor fails to do the same within five (5) Business Days of written notice.

Provided that no Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists and subject to the Borrower’s compliance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement, the Borrower will have access to all Casualty Proceeds on deposit in the Casualty Proceeds Restricted Account.

Provided that no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing and/or no Trigger Period then exists, any excess funds on deposit in the Immediate Repair Account after the completion of all required Immediate Repairs will be deposited in the Cash Management Account and applied in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

The Mortgage Lender is required to disburse to the Borrower the Immediate Repair Funds upon satisfaction by the Borrower of each of the following conditions: (i) the Borrower will submit a request for payment to the Mortgage Lender at least 10 days prior to the date on which the Borrower requests such payment be made and specifies the Immediate Repairs to be paid; (ii) on the date such request is received by the Mortgage Lender and on the date such payment is to be made, no Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists and remains uncured, (iii) the Mortgage Lender will have received a certificate from the Borrower (A) stating that the items to be funded by the requested disbursement are Immediate Repairs, (B) stating that all completed Immediate Repairs at the applicable Mortgaged Property have been completed in a good and workmanlike manner and in accordance with all applicable legal requirements, and (C) identifying the scope of work and cost estimates for such Immediate Repairs.

The Mortgage Lender is required to disburse to the Borrower the Capital Expenditures Reserve Funds upon satisfaction by the Borrower of each of the following conditions: (i) the Borrower will submit a request for payment to the Mortgage Lender at least 10 days prior to the date on which the Borrower requests such payment be made and specifies the Capital Expenditures to be paid; (ii) on the date such request is received by the Mortgage Lender and on the date such payment is to be made, no Mortgage Loan Event of Default will exist and remain uncured; (iii) the Mortgage Lender will have received a certificate from the Borrower (A) stating that the items to be funded by the requested disbursement are Capital Expenditures at a Mortgaged Property, (B) stating that all Capital Expenditures at the Mortgaged Property have been completed in a good and workmanlike manner and in accordance with all applicable legal requirements, and (C) identifying the scope of work and cost estimates for such Capital Expenditures.

Notwithstanding anything contained in the Mortgage Loan Agreement to the contrary, during a Trigger Period, no Capital Expenditure Reserve Funds will be disbursed to the Property Manager for any Construction and “Tenant Coordination Fee” (as defined in the Management Agreement) or other similar fees incurred by the Property Manager (as opposed to another third party contractor or materialman) pursuant to the Management Agreement.

Provided there are sufficient amounts in the Tax Account and Insurance Account, respectively, and no Mortgage Loan Event of Default Exists, (I) the Mortgage Lender is obligated to pay the Taxes and Insurance Premiums at each individual Mortgaged Property (other than the Plaza del Sol Property )as they become due on their respective due dates (or with respect to Taxes, such earlier date as is set forth in the Mortgage Loan Agreement (as the same may be updated, amended or otherwise modified from time to time by the Borrower in the exercise of its commercially reasonable business judgment)) on behalf of the Borrower by applying the Tax and Insurance Funds to the payment of such Insurance Premiums at each individual Mortgaged Property (other than the Plaza del Sol Property), as applicable, and (II) Mortgage Lender will pay the Insurance Premiums at the Plaza del Sol Property only if Mortgage Lender failed to receive, within 30 days after the due date for such Insurance Premiums, evidence reasonably acceptable to Mortgage Lender that such Insurance Premiums have been paid in full and promptly following receipt of such evidence, so long as no Trigger Period is then in effect, Mortgage Lender is required to deposit (to the extent of available funds) that portion of the Tax and Insurance Funds equal to the amount of the paid Insurance Premiums at the Plaza del Sol Property for which Mortgage Lender received evidence of payment in full in accordance with the foregoing into the Cash Management Account, which amount will be applied in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement and the other Mortgage Loan Documents.

Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the immediately preceding sentences, (I) with respect to (a) the Taxes payable directly by Tenants identified in the Mortgage Loan Agreement (as the same may be updated, amended or otherwise modified from time to time by the Borrower in the exercise of its commercially reasonable business judgment) pursuant to the related Lease and (b) the Taxes payable with respect to the Plaza del Sol Property (collectively, such Taxes, the “PBO Taxes”), the Mortgage Lender is required to pay such PBO Taxes only if the Mortgage Lender failed to receive, within 30 days after the due date for such PBO Taxes, evidence reasonably acceptable to the Mortgage Lender that the applicable Tenant or Borrower, as applicable, paid such PBO Taxes in full and promptly following receipt of such evidence, so long as no Trigger Period is then in effect, the Mortgage Lender will deposit (to the extent of available funds) that portion of the Tax and Insurance Funds equal to the amount of the paid PBO Taxes for which Mortgage Lender received evidence of payment in full in accordance with the foregoing into the Cash Management Account, which amount will be applied in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement and the other Mortgage Loan Documents; and (II) the Borrower will not be required to reserve with the Mortgage Lender (a) the Taxes for the portions of the Properties identified in the Mortgage Loan Agreement and leased to the excluded tax reserve tenant identified thereon or (b) the Plaza del Sol Property, so long as (x) there exists no Mortgage Loan Event of Default under the Mortgage Loan Documents, (y) the Mortgage Lender has received, within 60 days after the due date for such Taxes, evidence reasonably acceptable to the Mortgage Lender that the applicable excluded tax reserve tenant or Borrower, as applicable, paid such Taxes in full and (z) to the extent applicable, such excluded tax reserve tenant has an investment grade rating (the condition set forth in clauses (x), (y) and (z) above, solely with respect to the excluded tax reserve tenants, the “excluded tax reserve tenant conditions”).

The Mortgage Lender is required to disburse to the Borrower the Leasing Reserve Funds upon satisfaction by the Borrower of each of the following conditions: (i) the Borrower submits a request for payment to the Mortgage Lender at least 10 days prior to the date on which the Borrower requests such payment be made and specifies the tenant improvement costs or leasing commissions to be paid; (ii) on the date such request is received by the Mortgage Lender and on the date such payment is to be made, no Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists and remains uncured; (iii) to the extent such Lease is subject to the Mortgage Lender’s approval pursuant to the terms and conditions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, the Mortgage Lender has reviewed and approved such Lease; (iv) the Mortgage Lender has received a certificate from the Borrower (A) stating that the items to be funded by the requested are tenant improvements or leasing commissions at a Mortgaged Property, (B) stating that all completed tenant improvements at the Mortgaged Property have been completed in good and workmanlike manner and in accordance with all applicable legal requirements, and (C) identifying the scope of work and cost estimates for such tenant improvements.

Notwithstanding anything contained in the Mortgage Loan Agreement to the contrary, during a Trigger Period, no Leasing Reserve Funds will be disbursed to the Property Manager for any “Leasing Commissions” (as defined in the Management Agreement) or other similar fees incurred by the Property Manager (as opposed to another third party broker) pursuant to the Management Agreement.

On each Payment Date occurring during a Trigger Period, the Borrower is required to deposit (or cause to be deposited) into an Eligible Account held by the Mortgage Lender or the Servicer (the “Operating Expense Account”) an amount equal to the aggregate amount of the Approved Operating Expenses and the Approved Extraordinary Expenses to be incurred by the Borrower for the then current Mortgage Loan Interest Accrual Period (such amount, the “Op Ex Monthly Deposit”).

Provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, the Mortgage Lender must disburse the Operating Expense Funds to the Borrower to pay the Approved Operating Expenses and/or the Approved Extraordinary Expenses upon the Borrower’s request (which such request must be accompanied by an officer’s certificate detailing the expenses to which the requested disbursement relates and attesting that such expense will be paid with the requested disbursement).
“Approved Operating Expenses” means an operating expense of the individual Property set forth on the Annual Budget or, if a Trigger Period is continuing, the Approved Annual Budget.

“Approved Extraordinary Expenses” means an expense of the individual Property not set forth on the annual operating budget delivered to the Mortgage Lender, or, if a Trigger Period is continuing, the Approved Annual Budget but approved by the Mortgage Lender in writing (which such approval may not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed).

The Mortgage Lender is required to disburse to the Borrower the Unfunded Obligations Reserve Funds for tenant improvement costs and/or leasing commissions upon satisfaction by the Borrower of each of the following conditions: (i) the Borrower submits a request for payment to the Mortgage Lender at least 10 days prior to the date on which the Borrower requests such payment be made and specifies the tenant improvement costs and/or leasing commissions to be paid and the Mortgaged Property to which such costs relate; (ii) on the date such request is received by the Mortgage Lender and on the date such payment is to be made, no Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists and remains uncured; (iii) to the extent that such Unfunded Obligations relate to tenant improvements at a Mortgaged Property, the Mortgage Lender has received a certificate from the Borrower (A) stating that all tenant improvements at the Mortgaged Property to be funded by the requested disbursement have been completed, to the extent of such payment, in good and workmanlike manner and in accordance with all applicable federal, state and local laws, rules and regulations, such certificate to be accompanied by a copy of any license, permit or other approval by any governmental authority required in connection with the tenant improvements (if any), (B) identifying each Person that supplied materials or labor in connection with the tenant improvements to be funded by the requested disbursement and (C) stating that each such Person has been paid in full or will be paid in full upon such disbursement, such certificate to be accompanied by lien waivers, invoices and/or other evidence of payment satisfactory to the Mortgage Lender; (iv) at the Mortgage Lender’s option, if the cost of any individual tenant improvement exceeds $250,000, the Mortgage Lender has received a title search for the Mortgaged Property indicating that the Mortgaged Property is free from all liens, claims and other encumbrances not previously approved by the Mortgage Lender (other than Permitted Encumbrances); and (v) the Mortgage Lender has received such other evidence as the Mortgage Lender reasonably requests that the tenant improvements (for any amount exceeding $5,000) at the Mortgaged Property and/or leasing commissions to be funded by the requested disbursement have been completed and/or have expired (to the extent applicable), are due and payable and are paid for or will be paid upon such disbursement to the Borrower.

On each Payment Date occurring on and after the occurrence and during the continuance of a Trigger Period, the Borrower will (A) within five (5) Business Days of each Payment Date during a Trigger Period, deliver to the Mortgage Lender an officer’s certificate (such certificate, a “Deferred Management Certificate”) detailing the applicable Deferred Management Fees earned by the Property Manager prior to the date of such officer’s certificate and not previously the subject of a Deferred Management Certificate, together with evidence (reasonably acceptable to the Mortgage Lender) that such Deferred Management Fees were actually incurred and earned by the Property Manager and (B) to the extent the applicable Deferred Management Fee Cap has not been achieved for the applicable Deferred Management Fee Calculation Period, the Borrower will deposit: (i) an amount equal to all earned and unpaid Deferred Management Leasing Fees until the aggregate amount of funds deposited in the Deferred Management Fee Reserve Account during the applicable Deferred Management Fee Calculation Period for Deferred Management Leasing Fees is equal to $1,500,000 (the “Deferred Leasing Fee Annual Cap”), (ii) an amount equal to all earned and unpaid Deferred Construction and Tenant Coordination Fees until the aggregate amount of funds deposited in the Deferred Management Fee Reserve Account during the applicable Deferred Management Fee Calculation Period for Deferred Construction and Tenant Coordination Fees is equal to $300,000 (the “Deferred Coordination Fee Annual Cap”) and (iii) earned but unpaid Deferred Disposition Fees will be deposited in the Deferred Management Fee Reserve Account (collectively, the “Deferred Management Fee Reserve Funds”).

Any Deferred Management Fee Reserve Funds remaining in the Deferred Management Fee Reserve Account will be disbursed to the Borrower for payment to the Property Manager of the Deferred Management Leasing Fees, Deferred Construction and Tenant Coordination Fees and Deferred Disposition Fees, as applicable, upon the expiration of such Trigger Period (and provided no other Trigger Period then exists) in accordance with the applicable terms and conditions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

“Deferred Management Fee Calculation Period” means with respect to each Trigger Period, (i) the period beginning on (and including) the first Payment Date of such Trigger Period and ending on (and excluding) the first anniversary thereafter and (ii) so long as such Trigger Period remains in effect, each 12 month period thereafter.

Provided no Trigger Period has occurred and is continuing, the Mortgage Lender is required to disburse the Restoration Abated Revenue Reserve Funds on deposit in the Restoration Abated Revenue Reserve Account for the payment of Restoration Abated Revenue, in each case, within 10 days following receipt of an officer’s certificate from Borrower (i) to the extent not previously provided (or if previously provided but changes have been made, an updated) a schedule detailing the full amounts (regardless of whether only a portion of such amounts is the subject of the related disbursement request), together with the time period during which such amounts are expected to be incurred, of any and all Restoration Abated Revenue required to be given to each Tenant that is the subject of the related disbursement request; (ii) specifying the Restoration Abated Revenue to which the requested disbursement relates; and (iii) certifying that the requested disbursement is for Restoration Abated Revenue, the Tenant has not paid rent during the period for which the Restoration Abated Revenue is being requested and the Restoration Abated Revenue requested to be disbursed pursuant to the most recent disbursement request have not been the subject of any prior disbursement requests.

If a Trigger Period has occurred and is continuing, any Restoration Abated Revenue Reserve Funds requested by the Borrower that would have otherwise been remitted to the Borrower pursuant to the paragraph above will instead be deposited in the Cash Management Account; provided, however, after a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, the Mortgage Lender may apply any Restoration Abated Revenue Reserve Funds due to the Borrower in such order and priority as the Mortgage Lender determines in its sole discretion.

Any amounts remaining in the Restoration Abated Revenue Reserve Fund after completion of all PR Restoration with respect to the Plaza del Sol Property in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, will (x) so long as no Mortgage Loan Event of Default and no Trigger Period has occurred and is continuing, be released to the Borrower and (y) to the extent that a Trigger Period has occurred and is continuing, but no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing, be deposited in the Cash Management Account.

From and after the first date that the funds on deposit in the Plaza del Sol Restoration Reserve Account are equal to the Plaza del Sol Restoration Reserve Cap, the Mortgage Lender will be required to disburse Plaza del Sol Restoration Reserve Funds only for Plaza del Sol Restoration Expenditures upon satisfaction by the Borrower of each of the following conditions: (i) Borrower submits a request for payment to the Mortgage Lender at least 10 days prior to the date on which the Borrower requests such payment be made and specifies the Plaza del Sol Restoration Expenditures to be paid, (ii) on the date such request is received by the Mortgage Lender and on the date such payment is to be made, no Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists and remains uncured and (iii) the Mortgage Lender has received a certificate from the Borrower (A) stating that the items to be funded by the requested disbursement are Plaza del Sol Restoration Expenditures in accordance with the approved PR Restoration Budget applicable to the Plaza del Sol Property, (B) stating that all Plaza del Sol Restoration Expenditures previously completed have been completed in a good and workmanlike manner and in accordance with all applicable legal requirements, the PR Restoration Budget applicable to the Plaza del Sol Property and the Mortgage Loan Agreement and (C) identifying the scope of work and cost estimates for such Plaza del Sol Restoration Expenditures.

Any amounts remaining in the Plaza del Sol Restoration Reserve Fund after completion of all PR Restoration with respect to the Plaza del Sol Property in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, will (x) so long as no Mortgage Loan Event of Default and no Trigger Period has occurred and is continuing, be released to Borrower and (y) to the extent that a Trigger Period has occurred and is continuing, but no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing, be deposited in the Cash Management Account.

On each Payment Date during a Trigger Period, the Borrower is required to deposit (or cause to be deposited) into an Eligible Account with the Mortgage Lender or the Servicer (the “Excess Cash Flow Account”) an amount equal to the Excess Cash Flow generated by the Properties for the immediately preceding Mortgage Loan Interest Accrual Period (each such monthly deposit being referred to as the “Monthly Excess Cash Flow Deposits” and the amounts on deposit in the Excess Cash Flow Account being referred to as the “Excess Cash Flow Funds”).

At all times, (A) within 30 days of the beginning of each Trigger Period and (B) during a Trigger Period, within 30 days of the start of the Borrower Sponsor’s taxable year, the Borrower is required to provide to the Mortgage Lender the Borrower Sponsor’s good faith estimate of the Required REIT Distribution, the TRS Taxes and/or the Puerto Rico Taxes for such taxable year (such estimated amount, the “Required Distribution/Tax Threshold Amount”), which estimate will, in each case, be verified by the Borrower Sponsor’s accountant (which will be an independent accountant reasonably acceptable to the Mortgage Lender).

Any Excess Cash Flow Funds remaining in the Excess Cash Flow Account will be disbursed to the Borrower upon the expiration of all Trigger Periods in accordance with the applicable terms and conditions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

The Borrower will have the right to withdraw and use the Casualty Proceeds on deposit in the Casualty Proceeds Restricted Account on any Business Day, provided there exists no Mortgage Loan Event of Default and the terms and provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement are satisfied, as determined by the Mortgage Lender in its reasonable discretion, and provided, further, that such Casualty Proceeds are used to pay for Restoration Costs or toward the payment of the Debt.

The Borrower will have the right to settle all claims related to the Prior Hurricane Damage and the Plaza del Sol Prior Hurricane Damage, as applicable, under the insurance policies for the Affected Individual PR Properties without the Mortgage Lender’s consent, provided that (a) no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, and (b) Borrower promptly and with commercially reasonable diligence negotiates a settlement of any such claims. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if a Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists, the Mortgage Lender will, at its election, have the exclusive right to settle or adjust any claims related to the Prior Hurricane Damage and the Plaza del Sol Prior Hurricane Damage, as applicable, under such policies.

During the continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, upon written request of the Mortgage Lender, the Borrower will cooperate with the Mortgage Lender to assign to the Mortgage Lender, as applicable, any and all plans and specifications required in connection with the PR Restoration, all contracts and subcontracts and other agreements with any materialmen, architects, engineers and other contractors performing work in connection with the PR Restoration and all permits, licenses and approvals required or obtained in connection with the PR Restoration.

At the Mortgage Lender’s option (which option will, to the extent there exists no Mortgage Loan Event of Default, be only exercisable up to two times in any 12 month period), if the cost of any individual Restoration Cost exceeds $100,000, a title search (at the Borrower’s cost and expense) for the applicable Affected Individual PR Property indicating that the applicable Affected Individual PR Property is free from all liens, claims and other encumbrances other than Permitted Encumbrances.

Provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, any Casualty Proceeds remaining in the Casualty Proceeds Restricted Account after the completion of the PR Restoration at each Puerto Rico Property affected by the Prior Hurricane Damage will be disbursed to the Borrower upon receipt by the Mortgage Lender of evidence (satisfactory to the Mortgage Lender in all respects), which evidence may include updated property condition reports, zoning reports and final unconditional lien waivers, that all Affected Individual PR Property have been fully restored in accordance with all legal requirements and the Mortgage Loan Agreement.
Loan Features/Structure: The Mortgage Loan is structured with hard lockboxes and in-place cash management as well as cash flow sweeps if the Mortgaged Portfolio NOI debt yield falls below 10.0%.

In addition, the Borrowers are required to deposit, or cause to be deposited (i) all casualty insurance proceeds (“Casualty Proceeds”) received with respect to any insurance policy related to any individual Puerto Rico Property on account of any claim made under such policies resulting from losses due to any damage caused by the previous hurricanes into a soft lockbox which Borrowers will be entitled to access so long as there exists no Mortgage Loan Event of Default, which Casualty Proceeds will be used to restore the Puerto Rico Properties or pay-down the Mortgage Loan and (ii) all business interruption insurance proceeds (“BI Proceeds”) received with respect to any insurance policy related to any individual Puerto Rico Property on account of any claim made under such policies resulting from losses due to any damage caused by such hurricanes into the BI Proceeds Reserve account.

Provided no Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, on each Monthly Payment Date, all funds on deposit in the Cash Management Account will be allocated and disbursed by the Lenders or Servicer, as applicable, in the following order of priority (and as such defined terms are used in the Offering Circular or the Mortgage Loan documents): First, funds sufficient to pay the monthly ground rent deposit due for the then Monthly Payment Date, if any, are required to be deposited in the ground lease reserve account; Second, funds sufficient to pay the monthly tax deposit due as of such Monthly Payment Date, if any, are required to be deposited in the tax reserve account; Third, funds sufficient to pay the monthly insurance deposit due as of such Monthly Payment Date, if any, are required to be deposited in the insurance reserve account; Fourth, funds sufficient to pay any interest accruing at the default rate and late payment charges due and payable as of such Monthly Payment Date, if any, are required to be deposited into the debt service account; Fifth, funds sufficient to pay the debt service due as of such Monthly Payment Date are required to be deposited in the debt service account; Sixth, during the continuance of a Trigger Period, funds sufficient to pay the operating expense monthly deposit due as of such Monthly Payment Date, if any, are required to be deposited in the operating expense reserve account; Seventh, funds sufficient to pay the capital expenditure reserve monthly deposit due as of such Monthly Payment Date, if any, are required to be deposited in the capital expenditure reserve account; Eighth, funds sufficient to pay the leasing reserve monthly deposit due as of such Monthly Payment Date, if any, are required to be deposited in the leasing reserve account; Ninth, funds sufficient to pay any other amounts due and payable as of such Monthly Payment Date to the Lenders and/or the Servicer pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement and/or of the other Mortgage Loan documents, if any, are required to be deposited with or as directed by the Lenders; Tenth, during the continuance of a Trigger Period, funds sufficient to pay the deposits (if any) required for deferred management fees pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Agreement; Eleventh, to the extent a Trigger Period has occurred and be continuing, all amounts remaining in the Cash Management Account after deposits for items one through ten above (“Excess Cash Flow”) are required to be deposited into the excess cash flow reserve account; and Lastly, to the extent no Trigger Period has occurred and be continuing, all Excess Cash Flow is required to be remitted to Borrower’s operating account.

“Trigger Period” means a period (A) commencing upon (i) the occurrence and continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (ii) the Mortgaged Portfolio NOI debt yield falling below 10.0% (a “Debt Yield Trigger”) or (iii) the Borrowers’ failure to deliver any required financial information within 10 Business Days after written notice from the Lenders; and (B) expiring upon (x) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (A)(i) above, the cure (if applicable) of such Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (y) with regard to clause (A)(ii) above, (I) the date that the Mortgaged Portfolio NOI debt yield is equal to or greater than the Debt Yield Trigger or (II) receipt by the Lenders of a Debt Yield Trigger Cure Payment pursuant to the Mortgage Loan documents and (z) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (A)(iii) above, (I) receipt by Lender of such required financial information meeting the requirements of the Mortgage Loan documents and otherwise showing that no other Trigger Period shall have occurred and be continuing and (II) payment to Lender of the applicable fee for such failure to deliver the required financial information, as required by the Mortgage Loan Documents.

“Trigger Period” means a period (A) commencing upon (i) the occurrence and continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (ii) the Mortgaged Portfolio NOI debt yield falling below 10.0% (a “Debt Yield Trigger”) or (iii) the Borrowers’ failure to deliver any required financial information within 10 Business Days after written notice from the Lenders; and (B) expiring upon (x) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (A)(i) above, the cure (if applicable) of such Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (y) with regard to clause (A)(ii) above, (I) the date that the Mortgaged Portfolio NOI debt yield is equal to or greater than the Debt Yield Trigger or (II) receipt by the Lenders of a Debt Yield Trigger Cure Payment pursuant to the Mortgage Loan documents and (z) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (A)(iii) above, (I) receipt by Lender of such required financial information meeting the requirements of the Mortgage Loan documents and otherwise showing that no other Trigger Period shall have occurred and be continuing and (II) payment to Lender of the applicable fee for such failure to deliver the required financial information, as required by the Mortgage Loan Documents.

“Debt Yield Trigger Cure Payment” means (i) delivery to the Lenders of an amount (which amounts will be held by the Lenders or Servicer as additional collateral for the Mortgage Loan and may be applied to the debt during the continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default) equal to the amount necessary to cause the Mortgaged Portfolio NOI debt yield to be at least equal to the applicable Debt Yield Trigger calculated as if such amount had been applied pro-rata to the reduction of the principal balance of the Mortgage Loan.

“Debt Yield Trigger Cure Payment” means (i) delivery to the Lenders of an amount (which amounts will be held by the Lenders or Servicer as additional collateral for the Mortgage Loan and may be applied to the debt during the continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default) equal to the amount necessary to cause the Mortgaged Portfolio NOI debt yield to be at least equal to the applicable Debt Yield Trigger calculated as if such amount had been applied pro-rata to the reduction of the principal balance of the Mortgage Loan.

The Lenders will pay the insurance premiums at the Plaza del Sol Property only if the Lenders failed to receive, within 30 days after the due date for such insurance premiums, evidence that such insurance premiums shall have been paid in full and promptly following receipt of such evidence, so long as no Trigger Period is then in effect, the Lenders will deposit (to the extent of available funds) the amount of the paid insurance premiums at the Plaza del Sol Property for which Lenders received evidence of payment in full in accordance with the foregoing into the Cash Management Account, which amount shall be applied in accordance with Mortgage Loan documents. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the immediately preceding sentences, (I) with respect to the taxes payable (a) directly by tenants identified in the Mortgage Loan documents pursuant to the related lease and (b) with respect to the Plaza del Sol Property (such taxes, the “PBO Taxes”), the Lenders will pay such PBO Taxes only if the Lenders failed to receive certain documentation specified in the Mortgage Loan documents within 30 days after the due date for such PBO Taxes.

If such documentation related to the PBO Taxes is received in accordance with the Mortgage Loan documents and no Trigger Period is then in effect, the Lenders will deposit the applicable amount of tax reserve funds into the Cash Management Account, which amount will be applied in accordance with the Mortgage Loan documents; and (II) the Borrowers will not be required to reserve with the Lenders the taxes for (a) the portions of the Mortgaged Portfolio, identified in the Mortgage Loan documents and leased to the related tenants identified thereon or (b) the Plaza del Sol Property, so long as certain conditions set forth in the Mortgage Loan documents are satisfied, including that there exists no Mortgage Loan Event of Default.

Operating Expense Reserve: On each Monthly Payment Date occurring on and after the occurrence and during the continuance of a Trigger Period, the Borrowers are required to deposit an amount equal to the aggregate amount of Approved Operating Expenses and Approved Extraordinary Expenses incurred by the Borrowers for the then current interest accrual period as more fully described in the Offering Circular.

Deferred Management Fee Reserve: On each Monthly Payment Date occurring on and after the occurrence and during the continuance of a Trigger Period, within 5 business days of each Monthly Payment Date during a Trigger Period, to the extent the applicable caps more fully described in the Offering Circular have not been achieved, amounts for earned and unpaid deferred management fees up to the applicable cap, each as more fully described in the Offering Circular.

Excess Cash Flow Funds: On each Monthly Payment Date occurring on and after the occurrence and continuance of a Trigger Period, an amount equal to the Excess Cash Flow generated by the Property for the immediately preceding Interest Accrual Period. Excess Cash Flow reserve funds will be used to pay Required REIT Distributions, TRS Taxes and Puerto Rico Taxes as more particularly described in the Offering Circular, with any excess being used to pay-down the debt.

The Borrowers have established the Lockbox Accounts, and following the occurrence of a Cash Management Period, Mortgage Lender will be required to establish a Cash Management Account with respect to the Mortgage Loan and the Properties, both of which accounts will serve as collateral for the Mortgage Loan.

So long as no Cash Management Period exists, all available amounts on deposit in the applicable Lockbox Account are to be disbursed to the applicable Borrower in immediately available funds by Federal wire transfer once every business day.

During a Cash Management Period, Borrower is required to (and Mortgage Lender may) cause the Lockbox Bank to transfer to the Cash Management Account in immediately available funds by Federal wire transfer all funds on deposit in the Lockbox Accounts once every business day, and funds in the Cash Management Account will be applied as described under “DESCRIPTION OF THE MORTGAGE LOAN—Lockbox Account and Cash Management Account” in this Offering Circular.

Thus, even in the event of a Cash Management Period, the Mortgage Lender’s control over revenues from the operation of the Properties may be limited to the extent that rents and receipts are not deposited into the respective Lockbox Account, as there is a risk that such Borrower or the Property Managers could divert such funds.

So long as no Cash Management Period exists, all available amounts on deposit in the Lockbox Accounts are to be disbursed to the applicable Borrower in immediately available funds by Federal wire transfer once every business day.

Upon the occurrence and during the continuance of any Cash Management Period, Borrower is required to (and Mortgage Lender may) cause the Lockbox Bank to transfer to the Cash Management Account in immediately available funds by Federal wire transfer all amounts on deposit in the Lockbox Accounts once every business day.

Upon the occurrence and during the continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, Mortgage Lender may, in addition to any and all other rights and remedies available to the Mortgage Lender, direct the Lockbox Bank to immediately pay over all funds on deposit in the Lockbox Accounts to the Mortgage Lender and to apply any such funds to the payment of the Obligations in any order in its sole discretion.

Not later than ten (10) Business Days following delivery by Mortgage Lender of written notice to Borrower indicating that a Cash Management Period exists, Mortgage Lender will establish and maintain a segregated eligible account (the “Cash Management Accounts”) with an Eligible Bank (the “Deposit Bank”) in trust for the benefit of Mortgage Lender, which Cash Management Account will be for the sole and exclusive benefit of and under the sole dominion and control of Mortgage Lender.

Pursuant to the Cash Management Agreement (as defined below), provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, after the occurrence and during the continuance of a Cash Management Period, on each Payment Date (or, if such Payment Date is not a Business Day, on the immediately succeeding Business Day) all funds on deposit in the Cash Management Account will be applied by Mortgage Lender (or by Deposit Bank at Mortgage Lender’s direction) to the payment of the following items in the order indicated: (i) First, payment to Mortgage Lender (for deposit in the Taxes and Insurance Reserve) in respect of the applicable amount required to be deposited in the Taxes and Insurance Reserve in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement; (ii) Second, to the extent the Cash Management Account contains any Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue, payment to Borrower in an amount equal to the Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue then contained in the Cash Management Account (each such disbursement for Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue under the Mortgage Loan Agreement, an “Excluded TIR Disbursement”), subject to satisfaction of the following conditions to disbursement (the “TIR Disbursement Conditions”): Borrower certifies in writing to Mortgage Lender, not less than two (2) Business Days prior to each such Excluded TIR Disbursement, (i) the amount of the Excluded TIR Disbursement, the Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue and Tenant Protection Plan Net Revenue for the applicable Properties to which such Excluded TIR Disbursement relates, (ii) that the Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue to which the Excluded TIR Disbursement relates has been deposited into the Cash Management Account, and the Excluded TIR Disbursement does not include amounts previously paid or disbursed on account of Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue, and (iii) that the calculations of the Excluded TIR Disbursement, Excluded Tenant Insurance Revenue and Tenant Protection Plan Revenue are true and correct in all material respects; (iii) Third, payment to Deposit Bank of the fees and expenses of Deposit Bank then due and payable pursuant to the Cash Management Agreement; (iv) Fourth, payment to Mortgage Lender of the Monthly Debt Service Payment Amount due on such Payment Date; (v) Fifth, payment to Mortgage Lender (for deposit in the Replacement Reserve) in respect of the applicable amount required to be deposited in the Replacement Reserve, if any, in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement; (vi) Sixth, payment to Borrower in an amount equal to the aggregate of (A) operating expenses due and payable by Borrower during the succeeding month as set forth in all material respects in the Approved Annual Budget (it being agreed that any deviation in such operating expenses from the line items in the Approved Annual Budget that are within ten (10%) of such line items and less than eight percent (8%) in the aggregate of all budgeted items will be deemed to be immaterial), and (B) Approved Extraordinary Expenses, if any (provided that monthly disbursements for Management Fees will be limited to the monthly Underwritten Management Fees based on gross income from operations for the preceding month as demonstrated to Mortgage Lender’s reasonable satisfaction); (vii) Seventh, payment to Mortgage Lender of any other amounts then due and owing under the Mortgage Loan Documents; (viii) Eighth, so long as the Mezzanine Loan remains outstanding, funds sufficient to pay the Mezzanine Monthly Debt Service Payment Amount will be deposited in the Mezzanine Account; and (ix) Ninth, payment of all amounts then remaining after payment of items (i) through (viii) (all amounts then remaining after payment of items (i) through (viii) being hereinafter referred to as “Excess Cash”) to the Excess Cash Reserve Account in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement; and (x) Lastly, if no Cash Management Period is then continuing, all Excess Cash to Borrower.

Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in the Mortgage Loan Agreement or in any other Mortgage Loan Documents, and with respect to the timing of the payment of any Excluded TIR Disbursements, during a Cash Management Period but regardless of whether an Event of Default exists, upon written request by Borrower, funds on deposit in the Cash Management Account will be disbursed by Mortgage Lender (or by Deposit Bank at Mortgage Lender’s direction) to Borrower for Excluded TIR Disbursements, subject to satisfaction of the TIR Disbursement Conditions.

Notwithstanding anything contained in the Mortgage Loan Agreement, following the occurrence of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default and during the continuance thereof, all funds on deposit in the Cash Management Account may be applied by Mortgage Lender in such order and priority as Mortgage Lender will determine in its sole discretion until the Obligations have been paid in full.
“Cash Management Period” means the period that (i) commences upon the occurrence and continuance of any Cash Trap Event, and (ii) ends upon the occurrence of a Cash Trap Event Cure.

Upon Borrower’s written request, upon the occurrence of a Cash Trap Event Cure, and provided that no other Cash Trap Event exists, Mortgage Lender agrees to give notice to Clearing Bank that the Cash Management Period has ended.
