“Cash Trap Event” means (a) the occurrence of any Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (b) a Debt Yield Trigger, or (c) the receipt by Mortgage Lender of written notice from Mezzanine Lender that a Mezzanine Loan Default (other than as a result of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default) has occurred.

“Cash Trap Event” means (a) the occurrence of any Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (b) a Debt Yield Trigger, or (c) the receipt by Mortgage Lender of written notice from Mezzanine Lender that a Mezzanine Loan Default (other than as a result of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default) has occurred.

“Cash Trap Event” means (a) the occurrence of any Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (b) a Debt Yield Trigger, or (c) the receipt by Mortgage Lender of written notice from Mezzanine Lender that a Mezzanine Loan Default (other than as a result of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default) has occurred.

“Cash Trap Event Cure” means, in each case provided that no other event that would cause a Cash Management Period to commence has occurred and is continuing, (i) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described in clause (a) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, Mortgage Lender accepts (in its sole discretion) a cure of the applicable Mortgage Loan Event of Default giving rise to such Cash Trap Event and no other Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists, (ii) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described clause (b) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, upon the Mortgage Lender’s reasonable determination that the Debt Yield is at least six and three-quarters percent (6.75%) for two (2) consecutive calendar quarters, as calculated by Mortgage Lender as of the end of each calendar quarter on a trailing twelve (12) month basis, and (iv) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described in clause (c) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, Mezzanine Lender has delivered to Mortgage Lender written notice that such Mezzanine Loan Default has been cured or waived (and no other Mezzanine Loan Default is then continuing).

“Cash Trap Event Cure” means, in each case provided that no other event that would cause a Cash Management Period to commence has occurred and is continuing, (i) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described in clause (a) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, Mortgage Lender accepts (in its sole discretion) a cure of the applicable Mortgage Loan Event of Default giving rise to such Cash Trap Event and no other Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists, (ii) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described clause (b) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, upon the Mortgage Lender’s reasonable determination that the Debt Yield is at least six and three-quarters percent (6.75%) for two (2) consecutive calendar quarters, as calculated by Mortgage Lender as of the end of each calendar quarter on a trailing twelve (12) month basis, and (iv) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described in clause (c) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, Mezzanine Lender has delivered to Mortgage Lender written notice that such Mezzanine Loan Default has been cured or waived (and no other Mezzanine Loan Default is then continuing).

“Cash Trap Event Cure” means, in each case provided that no other event that would cause a Cash Management Period to commence has occurred and is continuing, (i) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described in clause (a) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, Mortgage Lender accepts (in its sole discretion) a cure of the applicable Mortgage Loan Event of Default giving rise to such Cash Trap Event and no other Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists, (ii) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described clause (b) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, upon the Mortgage Lender’s reasonable determination that the Debt Yield is at least six and three-quarters percent (6.75%) for two (2) consecutive calendar quarters, as calculated by Mortgage Lender as of the end of each calendar quarter on a trailing twelve (12) month basis, and (iv) in the case of a Cash Trap Event described in clause (c) of the definition of Cash Trap Event, Mezzanine Lender has delivered to Mortgage Lender written notice that such Mezzanine Loan Default has been cured or waived (and no other Mezzanine Loan Default is then continuing).
Anything to the contrary herein or elsewhere notwithstanding, no interest or other investment earnings will be paid to Borrower on funds in the Taxes and Insurance Reserve.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, Borrower’s obligation to make the monthly deposits for Insurance Premiums required above will be suspended provided that the following conditions remain satisfied: (A) no Mortgage Loan Event of Default then exists; (B) Borrower or an Affiliate thereof maintains a blanket insurance policy that provides the coverages required by the Mortgage Loan Agreement with respect to the Property, that covers substantially all self-storage properties managed directly or indirectly by Sponsor and that otherwise satisfies the requirements for a blanket insurance policy set forth in the Mortgage Loan Agreement; and (C) Borrower delivers to Mortgage Lender evidence, reasonably satisfactory to Mortgage Lender, that such blanket insurance policy is in full force and effect at least thirty (30) days prior to the date on which such policy is scheduled to expire, and that the premium due for such blanket insurance policy has been paid not less than thirty (30) days thereafter.

Funds contained in the Replacement Reserve will be utilized by Borrower solely for Capital Expenditures performed during the term of the Mortgage Loan in accordance with the capital expenditures budget prepared by Borrower, and during a Cash Management Period, the Approved Capital Expenditures Budget, and will not be used by Borrower for purposes for which any other Reserve is established.

“Reserve Fund” mean, collectively, all funds deposited into the Reserves, including, without limitation, the Taxes and Insurance Reserve Funds, the Deferred Maintenance Reserve Funds, the Environmental Remediation Reserve Funds and the Replacement Reserve Funds.

Upon the occurrence and during the continuance of a Cash Management Period, all Excess Cash will be collected by Mortgage Lender and all such amounts will be held by Mortgage Lender as additional security for the Mortgage Loan (amounts so held, the “Excess Cash Reserve Funds” and the account to which such amounts are held, the “Excess Cash Reserve Account”).
At such time as any Cash Management Period ends, any funds held in the Excess Cash Reserve Account will be returned to Borrower.

“REIT” means a real estate investment trust within the meaning of Section 856 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, and any rule or regulation promulgated thereunder from time to time, in each case as amended from time to time (the “IRC”).
During a Cash Sweep Period, the Borrower will establish and maintain a lockbox account and direct all payment due under the Management Agreement to a lockbox account (the “Lockbox Account”).

During a Cash Sweep Period, Borrower will establish and maintain a cash management account (the “Cash Management Account” at Wells Fargo Bank, N.A. (in such capacity, the “Cash Management Bank”) into which income from the Property (other than amounts owed to the Property Manager) is required to be deposited during a Cash Sweep Period.
During a Cash Sweep Period, on each Business Day, the amounts contained in the Borrower will be transferred to the Cash Management Account.

A “Cash Sweep Period” will commence on either (i) the occurrence of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default or (ii) the first Business Day following a Debt Yield Reporting Date on which there is a Debt Yield Failure (or if the Borrower fails to deliver to the Mortgage Lender a written certification of the then-current Debt Yield prior to the applicable Debt Yield Reporting Date) and will continue until (x) with respect to a Cash Sweep Period caused by the events described in clause (i) above, no Mortgage Loan Event of Default then exists (and a Cash Sweep Period does not otherwise exist), or (y) with respect to a Cash Sweep Period caused by the events described in clause (ii) above, the Property achieves the Debt Yield Sweep Termination Hurdle as evidenced by the Borrower’s delivery of the written certification of the then-current Debt Yield (and a Mortgage Loan Event of Default does not then exist).

A “Cash Sweep Period” will commence on either (i) the occurrence of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default or (ii) the first Business Day following a Debt Yield Reporting Date on which there is a Debt Yield Failure (or if the Borrower fails to deliver to the Mortgage Lender a written certification of the then-current Debt Yield prior to the applicable Debt Yield Reporting Date) and will continue until (x) with respect to a Cash Sweep Period caused by the events described in clause (i) above, no Mortgage Loan Event of Default then exists (and a Cash Sweep Period does not otherwise exist), or (y) with respect to a Cash Sweep Period caused by the events described in clause (ii) above, the Property achieves the Debt Yield Sweep Termination Hurdle as evidenced by the Borrower’s delivery of the written certification of the then-current Debt Yield (and a Mortgage Loan Event of Default does not then exist).
“Debt Yield Failure” means the failure to satisfy the applicable Minimum Debt Yield Hurdle as of the Origination Date or, thereafter, as of two (2) consecutive Debt Yield Test Dates.
“Debt Yield Reporting Date” means the thirtieth (30th) day after each Debt Yield Test Date.

“Minimum Debt Yield Hurdle” – means the Property has achieved the following Debt Yield with respect to the corresponding Debt Yield Test Date: (i) from the Origination Date through the Initial Maturity Date, 6.75%; (ii) from the Initial Maturity Date through the end of the second Extension Term, if applicable, 7.5%; and (iii) from the end of the second Extension Term through the end of the third Extension Term, if applicable, 9.0%.

During a Cash Sweep Period, all excess cash flow will be swept and held as additional collateral for the Mortgage Loan, subject to the ability of the Borrower to obtain disbursements of such excess cash as described in “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Cash Management” in this Offering Circular.

During a Cash Sweep Period, the Operating Lessee will establish certain reserve accounts and will receive disbursements from the Mortgage Lender from the reserve accounts as described in “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserve Accounts.”

During a Cash Sweep Period, net revenue from the operations of the Property, at the time and to the extent distributed to the Operating Lessee by the Property Manager pursuant to the Management Agreement, is required to be deposited directly into a lockbox account established for the benefit of the Mortgage Lender as the secured party.
During a Cash Sweep Period, the lockbox bank is required to transfer to a cash management account all amounts on deposit in the lockbox account once every Business Day.

During a Cash Sweep Period, the Borrower will establish and maintain a lockbox account (the “Lockbox Account”) into which income from the Property (other than amounts owed to the Property Manager) is required to be deposited.

Furthermore during a Cash Sweep Period, the Borrower is required to establish and maintain a cash management account (the “Cash Management Account”) at Wells Fargo Bank, N.A. (in such capacity, the “Cash Management Bank”).
During a Cash Sweep Period, on each Business Day, the amounts contained in the Lockbox Account will be transferred to the Cash Management Account.

A “Cash Sweep Period” will commence on either (i) the occurrence of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default or (ii) the first Business Day following a Debt Yield Reporting Date on which there is a Debt Yield Failure (or if the Borrower fails to deliver to the Mortgage Lender a written certification of the then-current Debt Yield prior to the applicable Debt Yield Reporting Date) and will continue until (x) with respect to a Cash Sweep Period caused by the events described in clause (i) above, no Mortgage Loan Event of Default then exists (and a Cash Sweep Period does not otherwise exist), or (y) with respect to a Cash Sweep Period caused by the events described in clause (ii) above, the Property achieves the Debt Yield Sweep Termination Hurdle as evidenced by the Borrower’s delivery of the written certification of the then-current Debt Yield (and a Mortgage Loan Event of Default does not then exist).

A “Cash Sweep Period” will commence on either (i) the occurrence of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default or (ii) the first Business Day following a Debt Yield Reporting Date on which there is a Debt Yield Failure (or if the Borrower fails to deliver to the Mortgage Lender a written certification of the then-current Debt Yield prior to the applicable Debt Yield Reporting Date) and will continue until (x) with respect to a Cash Sweep Period caused by the events described in clause (i) above, no Mortgage Loan Event of Default then exists (and a Cash Sweep Period does not otherwise exist), or (y) with respect to a Cash Sweep Period caused by the events described in clause (ii) above, the Property achieves the Debt Yield Sweep Termination Hurdle as evidenced by the Borrower’s delivery of the written certification of the then-current Debt Yield (and a Mortgage Loan Event of Default does not then exist).
“Debt Yield Failure” means the failure to satisfy the applicable Minimum Debt Yield Hurdle as of the Origination Date or, thereafter, as of two (2) consecutive Debt Yield Test Dates.

“Debt Yield Sweep Termination Hurdle” means the earliest to occur of: (i) the date that the Property has achieved a Debt Yield that equals or exceeds the applicable Minimum Debt Yield Hurdle for two (2) consecutive Debt Yield Test Dates, in each case calculated after deducting the balances in the Excess Cash Reserve Account from the outstanding principal balance of the Mortgage Loan, or (ii) the date on which the Borrower makes a partial prepayment (including, without limitation, by use of the funds in the Excess Cash Reserve Account) of the principal balance of the Mortgage Loan in accordance with the terms and provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, such that the Minimum Debt Yield Hurdle will be satisfied.

“Minimum Debt Yield Hurdle” means the Property has achieved the following Debt Yield with respect to the corresponding Debt Yield Test Date: (i) from the Origination Date through the Initial Maturity Date, 6.75%; (ii) from the Initial Maturity Date through the end of the second Extension Term, if applicable, 7.5%; and (iii) from the end of the second Extension Term through the end of the third Extension Term, if applicable, 9.0%.

Provided that a Cash Sweep Period has not occurred and is not continuing, the Property Manager will remit to the Borrower all excess cash in the Property Manager’s control upon request, not to exceed more than once a month.

During the continuance of a Cash Sweep Period, on each Payment Date, the Mortgage Lender is required to transfer amounts from the Cash Management Account, to the extent available, to make the following payments in the following order of priority: (a) first, funds in an amount sufficient to pay the Monthly Tax Deposit shall be deposited in the Tax Reserve Account; (b) second, funds in an amount sufficient to pay the Monthly Insurance Deposit shall be deposited in the Insurance Reserve Account; (c) third, payment to Cash Management Bank or the Mortgage Lender of the monthly portion of fees charged by the Cash Management Bank or the Mortgage Lender in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement and any other fees or expenses due to the Mortgage Lender under the Mortgage Loan Documents; (d) fourth, funds in an amount sufficient to pay the next monthly debt service payment amount shall be remitted to the Mortgage Lender; (e) fifth, to the extent the Property Manager is not escrowing same, funds in an amount equal to 4% of gross revenue shall be deposited into the FF&E Reserve Account; (f) sixth, funds in an amount sufficient to pay any interest on the Mortgage Loan accruing at the Default Rate (less amounts already paid pursuant to clause (c) above), late payment charges and any other amounts due under the Mortgage Loan Documents, if any, shall be remitted to the Mortgage Lender; g) seventh, amounts required to be remitted to the Borrower or the Operating Lessee pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Agreement (to the extent not included in any of the disbursements described in clauses (a) through (f) above) for the applicable period shall be deposited into the Operating Lessee’s operating account; and (h) eighth, all amounts remaining in the Cash Management Account after the disbursements described in (a) through (g) above (“Excess Cash”) shall be deposited into the Excess Cash Reserve Account, to be held by the Mortgage Lender as additional security for the Mortgage Loan (subject to the Borrower’s and the Operating Lessee’s rights to use such funds for the purposes set forth in, and in accordance with, the Mortgage Loan Agreement).
During a Cash Sweep Period, the Operating Lessee will be required to establish, fund and maintain the following reserve accounts (the “Reserve Accounts”) as described below.

Upon the earlier to occur of (i) payment in full of the Debt or (ii) the termination of a Cash Sweep Period, as the case may be, all funds remaining in the Reserve Accounts will be returned to the Borrower or the Operating Lessee.

During the continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default and acceleration of the Mortgage Loan, the Mortgage Lender may, in its sole discretion, apply funds in the reserve accounts, and funds resulting from the liquidation of permitted investments made with funds contained in the reserve accounts, either toward payment of the Mortgage Loan and/or for the purposes for which they were held.

On each Payment Date during a Cash Sweep Period, the Operating Lessee is required to deposit, or cause the Property Manager to deposit, with the Cash Management Bank in an account controlled by the Mortgage Lender (the “Tax Reserve Account”) an amount equal to 1/12 of the taxes that the Mortgage Lender estimates will be payable during the next ensuing twelve months with respect to the Property in order to accumulate sufficient funds to pay all such taxes prior to delinquency (such amount, the “Monthly Tax Deposit”).

On each Payment Date during a Cash Sweep Period, the Operating Lessee is required to deposit, or cause the Property Manager to deposit, with the Cash Management Bank in an account controlled by the Mortgage Lender (the “Insurance Reserve Account”) an amount equal to 1/12 of the insurance premiums that the Mortgage Lender estimates will be payable during the next ensuing twelve months with respect to the Property in order to accumulate sufficient funds to pay all such taxes prior to delinquency and (ii) an amount equal to 1/12 of the insurance premiums that the Mortgage Lender estimates will be payable during the next ensuing twelve months with respect to the Property in order to accumulate sufficient funds to pay all such insurance premiums prior to delinquency (such amount, the “Monthly Insurance Deposit”).

During a Cash Sweep Period, to the extent such amounts are not being held by the Property Manager, the Operating Lessee is required to deposit, or cause the Property Manager to deposit, with the Cash Management Bank in an account controlled by the lender (the “FF&E Reserve Account”) four percent (4.0%) of gross operating revenues monthly.

During a Cash Sweep Period, all Excess Cash available pursuant to the Cash Management Agreement will be deposited in an account controlled by the lender (the “Excess Cash Reserve Account”) and held as additional collateral for the Mortgage Loan.

With respect to any such disbursements, the Mortgage Lender is required disburse funds to the Borrower from the FF&E Reserve Account upon the satisfaction of certain conditions set forth in the Mortgage Loan Agreement, including (i) no Mortgage Loan Event of Default shall then be continuing, (ii) copies of invoices or work orders corresponding to the costs to be paid or reimbursed, and (iii) proof of completion of work for which funds were disbursed from the FF&E Reserve Account; provided, however, that if the disbursement of funds from the FF&E Reserve Account is required under the Management Agreement, then certain documentation requirements will not apply, but the Operating Lessee will be required to use commercially reasonable efforts to obtain and provide to the Mortgage Lender the documentation within a reasonable period of time after such disbursement.

During a Cash Sweep Period, and provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, within seven (7) business days of the Borrower’s request, Mortgage Lender is required to remit to the Borrower amounts necessary to (a)(1) make prepayments of the Mortgage Loan in accordance with the terms and provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement to achieve a Debt Yield Sweep Termination Hurdle and a Debt Yield Sweep Disbursement Hurdle or (2) make prepayments of the Mortgage Loan in accordance with the terms and provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement only if Borrower is unable to make a prepayment to fully achieve a Debt Yield Sweep Termination Hurdle and a Debt Yield Sweep Disbursement Hurdle under the Mortgage Loan Agreement and (b) pay the following expenses relating to the Property: (1) expenses in accordance with the approved Annual Budget, (2) expenses or shortfalls relating to a Restoration of the Property after a casualty or condemnation performed in accordance with the terms and provisions described below under “—Casualty, Condemnation and Restoration”, (3) fees or reimbursements payable to the Property Manager under the Management Agreement, (4) emergency repairs and/or life safety items (including any capital expenditures) at the Property, subject to Mortgage Lender’s reasonable approval (which Mortgage Lender shall endeavor to provide within three (3) Business Days), (5) any payments made by the Borrower as landlord under any lease of the real property existing as of the Origination Date or entered into in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement, (6) any costs in connection with the purchase or extension of any interest rate cap agreement required under the Mortgage Loan Agreement, (7) fees and costs imposed on the Borrower under the Mortgage Loan Documents, (8) sales, use, occupancy and similar taxes on receipts relating to the Property, (9) distributions required for tax purposes in order to maintain the status as a “real estate investment trust” of any direct or indirect majority owner of the Borrower (in no event to exceed $300,000.00 per calendar year), (10) out-of-pocket legal, audit and accounting costs actually incurred relating to the Property (including actual costs incurred by the Guarantor and its service providers for back-office accounting and for costs associated with the Property or the Borrower) not to exceed $200,000.00 per annum, (11) out-of-pocket legal costs and expenses, arising in connection with the Property or the Borrower’s partnership and operation of the Property; provided that amounts in the Excess Cash Reserve Account will not be used for legal fees in connection with (y) the enforcement of the Borrower’s rights made under the Mortgage Loan Documents or (z) any defense of an enforcement by the Mortgage Lender under the Mortgage Loan Documents and (12) any other expenses relating to the Property approved by the Mortgage Lender, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld so long as the Borrower promptly delivers to the Mortgage Lender a reasonably detailed explanation of such other expenses.
