Prior to a Cash Sweep Period (as defined below), available cash flow will be deposited by the manager, Hilton Management LLC (“Manager”), into a Borrower-owned and controlled account.
During a Cash Sweep Period, available cash flow will be deposited by Manager into the deposit account, which will be swept into the cash management account on a daily basis.

Furthermore, during a Cash Sweep Period, all excess cash flow after reserves for real estate taxes, insurance premiums, the next monthly debt service payment, and FF&E will be swept and held as additional collateral for the Mortgage Loan and disbursed subject to and in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan documents.

Cash Sweep Period: A “Cash Sweep Period” will commence upon the occurrence of (i) an event of default under the Mortgage Loan documents or (ii) a Debt Yield Failure (as defined below), and will terminate upon (a) the cure of such event of default, in the case of clause (i) or (b) the date that a Debt Yield Sweep Disbursement Hurdle (as defined below) has occurred, in the case of clause (ii).

Cash Sweep Period: A “Cash Sweep Period” will commence upon the occurrence of (i) an event of default under the Mortgage Loan documents or (ii) a Debt Yield Failure (as defined below), and will terminate upon (a) the cure of such event of default, in the case of clause (i) or (b) the date that a Debt Yield Sweep Disbursement Hurdle (as defined below) has occurred, in the case of clause (ii).

Debt Yield Failure: A “Debt Yield Failure” will occur if the Mortgage Loan debt yield for two consecutive calendar quarters immediately preceding the date of determination, based on the trailing twelve month period, is less than (i) 6.75% prior to the first day of the first extension term, (ii) 7.5% at any time during the first or second extension terms, or (iii) 9.0% during the third extension term (each of (i) through (iii), a “Debt Yield Sweep Disbursement Hurdle”) and will end (a) if the Mortgage Loan debt yield for two consecutive calendar quarters immediately preceding the date of determination, based on the trailing twelve month period, equals or exceeds (x) 6.75% prior to the first day of the first extension term, (y) 7.5% at any time during the first or second extension terms, or (z) 9.0% during the third extension term or (b) the Borrower makes a partial prepayment of the principal balance of the loan such that the respective Debt Yield Sweep Disbursement Hurdle is met.

Ongoing Reserves: None. During a Cash Sweep Period (as defined herein), the Borrower will be required to fund reserves for real estate taxes, insurance premiums, the next monthly debt service payment, and FF&E, to the extent such reserves are not held by the Manager.
Prior to a Cash Sweep Period (as defined below), available cash flow will be deposited by the manager, Hilton Management LLC, into a Borrower-owned and controlled account.

During a Cash Sweep Period, available cash flow will be deposited by Manager into the deposit account, which will be swept into the cash management account on a daily basis. Furthermore, during a Cash Sweep Period, all excess cash flow after reserves for real estate taxes, insurance premiums, the next monthly debt service payment, and FF&E will be swept and held as additional collateral for the Mortgage Loan and disbursed subject to and in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan documents.

A “Cash Sweep Period” will commence upon the occurrence of (i) an event of default under the Mortgage Loan documents or (ii) a Debt Yield Failure (as defined below), and will terminate upon (a) the cure of such event of default, in the case of clause (i) or (b) the date that a Debt Yield Sweep Disbursement Hurdle (as defined below) has occurred, in the case of clause (ii).

A “Cash Sweep Period” will commence upon the occurrence of (i) an event of default under the Mortgage Loan documents or (ii) a Debt Yield Failure (as defined below), and will terminate upon (a) the cure of such event of default, in the case of clause (i) or (b) the date that a Debt Yield Sweep Disbursement Hurdle (as defined below) has occurred, in the case of clause (ii).

A “Debt Yield Failure” will occur if the Mortgage Loan debt yield for two consecutive calendar quarters immediately preceding the date of determination, based on the trailing twelve month period, is less than (i) 6.75% prior to the first day of the first extension term, (ii) 7.5% at any time during the first or second extension terms, or (iii) 9.0% during the third extension term (each of (i) through (iii), a “Debt Yield Sweep Disbursement Hurdle”) and will end (a) if the Mortgage Loan debt yield for two consecutive calendar quarters immediately preceding the date of determination, based on the trailing twelve month period, equals or exceeds (x) 6.75% prior to the first day of the first extension term, (y) 7.5% at any time during the first or second extension terms, or (z) 9.0% during the third extension term or (b) the Borrower makes a partial prepayment of the principal balance of the Mortgage Loan such that the respective Debt Yield Sweep Disbursement Hurdle is met.

On each Monthly Payment Date, prior to the Anticipated Repayment Date, except during the continuance of an event of default, the Lender or the Servicer, as applicable, will allocate all funds on deposit in the cash management account and disburse such funds in the following amounts and order of priority: (i) First, to the tax account, an amount equal to 1/12th of projected annual real estate and personal property taxes for the purpose of reserving amounts in respect of taxes; (ii) Second, to the insurance account, an amount equal to 1/12th of projected annual insurance premiums (unless insurance is maintained under a blanket insurance policy) for the purpose of reserving amounts in respect of insurance premiums; (iii) Third, to the Lender, funds sufficient to pay (a) the Note A monthly interest payment amount and (b) the Note B monthly interest payment amount, all in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement; (iv) Fourth, to the capital expenditure account, funds in an amount equal to the monthly capital expenditures for the purpose of reserving amounts in respect of payments of capital expenditure funds in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement; (v) Fifth, to the Lender, any other amounts then due and payable under the Mortgage Loan Documents; (vi) Sixth, during a Trigger Period or if a Mezzanine Loan is outstanding, subject to the terms of the cash management agreement, to the Borrower, funds in an amount equal to the monthly amount set forth in the approved annual budget for operating expenses (the “Monthly Operating Expense Budgeted Amount”) (provided, however, that (y) management fees included in the Monthly Operating Expense Budgeted Amount, to be paid therefrom to the Property Manager and, if applicable, management fees to be paid to the Property Manager under clause (vii) below may not exceed, in any calendar year, 3% of rents collected from the Property per calendar year, in the aggregate (the “Annual Management Fee Cap” ) and (z) any management fees that are due to the Property Manager (whether from the Monthly Operating Expense Budgeted Amount and/or the Approved Extraordinary Operating Expenses) (in any calendar year for work done during such year) that exceed the Annual Management Fee Cap will be disbursed to the Property Manager pursuant to clause (x)(C) below); (vii) Seventh, solely to the extent the Note A outstanding principal balance has been reduced to zero, to Lender during a Trigger Period or if a Mezzanine Loan is outstanding, to the Borrower, payments for any extraordinary operating expense not set forth in the approved annual budget that is approved by the Lender (“Approved Extraordinary Operating Expenses”), if any (provided, however, that (y) management fees included in the Approved Extraordinary Operating Expenses, to be paid therefrom to the Property Manager and management fees to be paid to the Property Manager under the preceding clause (vi) may not exceed, in any calendar year, the Annual Management Fee Cap and (z) any management fees that are due to the Property Manager (whether from the Approved Extraordinary Operating Expenses and/or the Monthly Operating Expense Budgeted Amount) (in any calendar year, for work done during such year) that exceed the Annual Management Fee Cap will be disbursed to the Property Manager pursuant to clause (x)(C) below); (viii) Eighth, (A) during a Lease Sweep Period (as defined in “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserves and Guaranties—Lease Sweep Letter of Credit”), an amount equal to $1,031,600 (the “Required Minimum Monthly Lease Sweep Deposit Amount”) to be applied and disbursed as follows: (1) First, to the lease sweep account (but only until the aggregate Lease Sweep Funds transferred in the lease sweep account during the Lease Sweep in question (inclusive of any lease termination payments made into the lease sweep account with respect to such Lease Sweep Period) equals the Lease Sweep Reserve Threshold); (2) Second, once such Lease Sweep Reserve Threshold has been met, to an account (the “Debt Service Reserve Account”) until the aggregate amount of funds transferred during the Lease Sweep Period in question into (x) the lease sweep account (inclusive of any lease termination payments made into the lease sweep account with respect to such Lease Sweep Period) and (y) the Debt Service Reserve Account equals the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap (as defined in “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserves and Guaranties—Lease Sweep Letter of Credit”); provided that (A) if a Lease Sweep Period is continuing due to an insolvency of the related tenant, then the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap will not apply and all Required Minimum Monthly Lease Sweep Deposit Amounts will continue to be deposited into the Debt Service Reserve Account; and (B) if the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap has been met (and no Lease Sweep Period is continuing due to an insolvency of the related tenant), then any Required Minimum Monthly Lease Sweep Deposit Amounts in excess of the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap will be applied as set forth below; (ix) Ninth, to the Mezzanine Debt Service Account funds in an amount equal to the mezzanine debt service payment due and owing on the next Monthly Payment Date (provided, however, that amounts allocated to the Mezzanine Debt Service Account pursuant to this subparagraph (ix) will be held in the Mezzanine Debt Service Account until such next Monthly Payment Date, at which time, such amounts will be transferred to the Mezzanine Loan Account); and (x) Lastly, (A) during a Lease Sweep Period, an amount equal to all then available cash will be applied and disbursed as follows: (1) First, to the lease sweep account (but only until the aggregate Lease Sweep Funds transferred in the lease sweep account during the Lease Sweep in question equals the Lease Sweep Reserve Threshold); (2) Second, once such Lease Sweep Reserve Threshold has been met, to the Debt Service Reserve Account until the aggregate amount of funds transferred during the Lease Sweep Period in question into (x) the lease sweep account (inclusive of the deposits made into the lease sweep account pursuant to the clauses above and any lease termination payments received by Lender and deposited into the lease sweep account) and (y) the Debt Service Reserve Account (inclusive of the deposits made in the Debt Service Reserve Account pursuant to the clauses above and any lease termination payments received by Lender and deposited into the Debt Service Reserve Account with respect to the Lease Sweep Period in question), in the aggregate, equals the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap; provided that if a Lease Sweep Period is continuing due to an Insolvency Trigger, then the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap will not apply and all remaining available cash will continue to be deposited into the Debt Service Reserve Account; lastly, any remaining available cash will be deposited or disbursed (x) if a Trigger Period other than a Lease Sweep Period is continuing concurrently with a Lease Sweep Period, into the Cash Collateral Account (to be held or disbursed in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Documents) or (y) if no Trigger Period is continuing, pursuant to clause (C) below; or (3) Lastly, any remaining available cash will be deposited or disbursed (x) if a Trigger Period other than a Lease Sweep Period is continuing concurrently with a Lease Sweep Period, into the Cash Collateral Account or (y) if no Trigger Period is continuing, pursuant to clause (C) below, or (B) during a Trigger Period (other than due to the continuance of Lease Sweep Period), all available cash will be deposited into to the Cash Collateral Account (provided, that, if such Trigger Period is caused solely by a DSCR below the required threshold, but only until funds deposited into the Cash Collateral Account during such low DSCR period equal $35,063,300); or (C) provided no Trigger Period is continuing all available cash will be disbursed (x) first to the Property Manager, until any amounts owed to the Property Manager (in excess of the Annual Management Fee Cap paid to such Property Manager during any calendar year) are paid in full, and (y) then to the Borrower.

On each Monthly Payment Date, prior to the Anticipated Repayment Date, except during the continuance of an event of default, the Lender or the Servicer, as applicable, will allocate all funds on deposit in the cash management account and disburse such funds in the following amounts and order of priority: (i) First, to the tax account, an amount equal to 1/12th of projected annual real estate and personal property taxes for the purpose of reserving amounts in respect of taxes; (ii) Second, to the insurance account, an amount equal to 1/12th of projected annual insurance premiums (unless insurance is maintained under a blanket insurance policy) for the purpose of reserving amounts in respect of insurance premiums; (iii) Third, to the Lender, funds sufficient to pay (a) the Note A monthly interest payment amount and (b) the Note B monthly interest payment amount, all in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement; (iv) Fourth, to the capital expenditure account, funds in an amount equal to the monthly capital expenditures for the purpose of reserving amounts in respect of payments of capital expenditure funds in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement; (v) Fifth, to the Lender, any other amounts then due and payable under the Mortgage Loan Documents; (vi) Sixth, during a Trigger Period or if a Mezzanine Loan is outstanding, subject to the terms of the cash management agreement, to the Borrower, funds in an amount equal to the monthly amount set forth in the approved annual budget for operating expenses (the “Monthly Operating Expense Budgeted Amount”) (provided, however, that (y) management fees included in the Monthly Operating Expense Budgeted Amount, to be paid therefrom to the Property Manager and, if applicable, management fees to be paid to the Property Manager under clause (vii) below may not exceed, in any calendar year, 3% of rents collected from the Property per calendar year, in the aggregate (the “Annual Management Fee Cap” ) and (z) any management fees that are due to the Property Manager (whether from the Monthly Operating Expense Budgeted Amount and/or the Approved Extraordinary Operating Expenses) (in any calendar year for work done during such year) that exceed the Annual Management Fee Cap will be disbursed to the Property Manager pursuant to clause (x)(C) below); (vii) Seventh, solely to the extent the Note A outstanding principal balance has been reduced to zero, to Lender during a Trigger Period or if a Mezzanine Loan is outstanding, to the Borrower, payments for any extraordinary operating expense not set forth in the approved annual budget that is approved by the Lender (“Approved Extraordinary Operating Expenses”), if any (provided, however, that (y) management fees included in the Approved Extraordinary Operating Expenses, to be paid therefrom to the Property Manager and management fees to be paid to the Property Manager under the preceding clause (vi) may not exceed, in any calendar year, the Annual Management Fee Cap and (z) any management fees that are due to the Property Manager (whether from the Approved Extraordinary Operating Expenses and/or the Monthly Operating Expense Budgeted Amount) (in any calendar year, for work done during such year) that exceed the Annual Management Fee Cap will be disbursed to the Property Manager pursuant to clause (x)(C) below); (viii) Eighth, (A) during a Lease Sweep Period (as defined in “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserves and Guaranties—Lease Sweep Letter of Credit”), an amount equal to $1,031,600 (the “Required Minimum Monthly Lease Sweep Deposit Amount”) to be applied and disbursed as follows: (1) First, to the lease sweep account (but only until the aggregate Lease Sweep Funds transferred in the lease sweep account during the Lease Sweep in question (inclusive of any lease termination payments made into the lease sweep account with respect to such Lease Sweep Period) equals the Lease Sweep Reserve Threshold); (2) Second, once such Lease Sweep Reserve Threshold has been met, to an account (the “Debt Service Reserve Account”) until the aggregate amount of funds transferred during the Lease Sweep Period in question into (x) the lease sweep account (inclusive of any lease termination payments made into the lease sweep account with respect to such Lease Sweep Period) and (y) the Debt Service Reserve Account equals the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap (as defined in “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserves and Guaranties—Lease Sweep Letter of Credit”); provided that (A) if a Lease Sweep Period is continuing due to an insolvency of the related tenant, then the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap will not apply and all Required Minimum Monthly Lease Sweep Deposit Amounts will continue to be deposited into the Debt Service Reserve Account; and (B) if the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap has been met (and no Lease Sweep Period is continuing due to an insolvency of the related tenant), then any Required Minimum Monthly Lease Sweep Deposit Amounts in excess of the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap will be applied as set forth below; (ix) Ninth, to the Mezzanine Debt Service Account funds in an amount equal to the mezzanine debt service payment due and owing on the next Monthly Payment Date (provided, however, that amounts allocated to the Mezzanine Debt Service Account pursuant to this subparagraph (ix) will be held in the Mezzanine Debt Service Account until such next Monthly Payment Date, at which time, such amounts will be transferred to the Mezzanine Loan Account); and (x) Lastly, (A) during a Lease Sweep Period, an amount equal to all then available cash will be applied and disbursed as follows: (1) First, to the lease sweep account (but only until the aggregate Lease Sweep Funds transferred in the lease sweep account during the Lease Sweep in question equals the Lease Sweep Reserve Threshold); (2) Second, once such Lease Sweep Reserve Threshold has been met, to the Debt Service Reserve Account until the aggregate amount of funds transferred during the Lease Sweep Period in question into (x) the lease sweep account (inclusive of the deposits made into the lease sweep account pursuant to the clauses above and any lease termination payments received by Lender and deposited into the lease sweep account) and (y) the Debt Service Reserve Account (inclusive of the deposits made in the Debt Service Reserve Account pursuant to the clauses above and any lease termination payments received by Lender and deposited into the Debt Service Reserve Account with respect to the Lease Sweep Period in question), in the aggregate, equals the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap; provided that if a Lease Sweep Period is continuing due to an Insolvency Trigger, then the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap will not apply and all remaining available cash will continue to be deposited into the Debt Service Reserve Account; lastly, any remaining available cash will be deposited or disbursed (x) if a Trigger Period other than a Lease Sweep Period is continuing concurrently with a Lease Sweep Period, into the Cash Collateral Account (to be held or disbursed in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Documents) or (y) if no Trigger Period is continuing, pursuant to clause (C) below; or (3) Lastly, any remaining available cash will be deposited or disbursed (x) if a Trigger Period other than a Lease Sweep Period is continuing concurrently with a Lease Sweep Period, into the Cash Collateral Account or (y) if no Trigger Period is continuing, pursuant to clause (C) below, or (B) during a Trigger Period (other than due to the continuance of Lease Sweep Period), all available cash will be deposited into to the Cash Collateral Account (provided, that, if such Trigger Period is caused solely by a DSCR below the required threshold, but only until funds deposited into the Cash Collateral Account during such low DSCR period equal $35,063,300); or (C) provided no Trigger Period is continuing all available cash will be disbursed (x) first to the Property Manager, until any amounts owed to the Property Manager (in excess of the Annual Management Fee Cap paid to such Property Manager during any calendar year) are paid in full, and (y) then to the Borrower.

On each Mortgage Monthly Payment Date after the Anticipated Repayment Date, except during the continuance of an event of default, the Lender or the servicer, as applicable, will allocate all funds on deposit in the cash management account and disburse such funds in the following amounts and order of priority: (i) First, to the tax account, to make the required payments of tax funds; (ii) Second, to the insurance account, to make the required payments of insurance funds; (iii) Third, to Lender, funds sufficient to pay the Note A monthly interest payment amount; (iv) Fourth, to Lender, funds sufficient to pay the Note B monthly interest payment amount; (v) Fifth, to the Mezzanine Debt Service Account, funds in an amount equal to the mezzanine debt service payment (computing all interest payments thereunder at the Initial Mezzanine Interest Rate, and excluding, for the avoidance of ambiguity, the payment of any Mezzanine Accrued Interest) due and owing on the next Monthly Payment Date (provided, however, that amounts allocated to the Mezzanine Debt Service Account pursuant to this subparagraph (v) will be held in the Mezzanine Debt Service Account until such next Monthly Payment Date, at which time, such amounts will be transferred to the Mezzanine Loan Account); (vi) Sixth, to Lender, to be applied to reduce the Note A outstanding principal balance, funds sufficient to pay the monthly amount determined by Lender to be required to fully amortize the Note A outstanding principal balance and Note B outstanding principal balance over an amortization schedule of 30 years using an assumed interest rate of the Initial Blended Interest Rate; (vii) Seventh, solely to the extent the Note A outstanding principal balance has been reduced to zero, to Lender, to be applied to reduce the Note B outstanding principal balance, funds sufficient to pay the monthly amount determined by Lender to be required to fully amortize the outstanding principal balance of Note A and Note B over an amortization schedule of 30 years using an assumed interest rate of the Initial Blended Interest Rate; (viii) Eighth, at Lender’s option, to make payments in an amount determined by Lender into the capital expenditure account in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement; (ix) Ninth, to Borrower, funds in an amount equal to the Monthly Operating Expense Budgeted Amount (provided, however, that management fees paid to Property Manager under this clause (ix) do not exceed, in any calendar year, the Annual Management Fee Cap); (x) Tenth, to repay the Note A outstanding principal balance; (xi) Eleventh, to repay the Note B outstanding principal balance; (xii) Twelfth, to pay Note A Accrued Interests; and (xiii) Lastly, to pay Note B Accrued Interest.

The Borrower is required under the Mortgage Loan Documents to maintain and fund the following reserve accounts: an account with the Cash Management Bank controlled by the lender for the purpose of depositing on each Monthly Payment Date an amount equal to 1/12th of the taxes that the lender estimates will be payable during the next ensuing 12 months (initially, $87,587, adjusted to reflect a credit for any prepaid real estate taxes) with respect to the Property in order to accumulate sufficient funds to pay all such taxes prior to delinquency as described under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserves and Guaranties”; an account with the Cash Management Bank controlled by the lender for the purpose of depositing on each Monthly Payment Date during which the Property is not insured pursuant to a blanket insurance policy which satisfies the requirements of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, an amount equal to 1/12th of projected annual insurance premiums as described under “Description of the Mortgage Loan— Reserves and Guaranties”; an account with the Cash Management Bank controlled by the lender for the purpose of reserving on each Monthly Payment Date during the continuance of a Trigger Period amounts in respect of capital expenditures in an amount equal to $12,085 as described under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserves and Guaranties”; an account with the Cash Management Bank controlled by the lender for the purpose of depositing on each Monthly Payment Date during the continuance of a Lease Sweep Period, but only until the aggregate funds in such account equal the Lease Sweep Reserve Threshold, an amount equal to $1,031,600 as described in “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserves and Guaranties; on the Origination Date the Borrower deposited with the Cash Management Bank, on behalf of the lender, the amount of $16,127,329 (the “Rent Concession Funds”), to create a reserve to simulate payments of rent prior to the date that rent will be payable under the Facebook Leases; on the Origination Date the Borrower deposited with the Cash Management Bank, on behalf of the lender, the amount of $23,165,933 which represents the total amount Borrower is obligated to pay to Facebook pursuant to the tenant improvement allowance; on the Origination Date, the Borrower deposited with the Cash Management Bank, on behalf of the lender, the amount of $525,523 for the purpose of reserving for upfront taxes; each reserve account must be held in an eligible account and may be invested in permitted investments as directed by the lender.

On certain Monthly Payment Dates identified in the Mortgage Loan Agreement, provided that no Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, a portion of the Rent Concession Funds in an amount equal to the correspondingly identified “Rent Concession Amount” set forth with respect to such Monthly Payment Date will be added to the rents disbursed on such Monthly Payment Date.

Provided no Loan Event of Default is continuing, the Lender will be required to direct the Servicer to disburse funds on deposit in the Lease Sweep Account to the Borrower for payment of certain approved leasing expenses payable under leases at the Property, within ten days after the delivery by the Borrower to the Lender of a request therefor (but not more often than once per month), in increments of at least $10,000 upon the satisfaction of certain conditions.

On each Monthly Payment Date during the continuance of a Lease Sweep Period, but only until the aggregate Lease Sweep Funds transferred in the Lease Sweep Account (inclusive of the Initial Lease Termination Payment Application made into the Lease Sweep Account with respect to such Lease Sweep Period) equals the Lease Sweep Reserve Threshold, Borrower is required to pay to Lender (i) the Required Minimum Monthly Lease Sweep Deposit Amount and (ii) an amount equal to the available cash, and all such amounts will be transferred by Lender into an account (the “Lease Sweep Account”).

In addition, all Lease Sweep Lease Termination Payments will be transferred to Lender and applied as follows: (i) first, into the Lease Sweep Account and applied towards the Lease Sweep Reserve Threshold until, after taking into account cash from the Property that is otherwise transferred into the Lease Sweep Account from the Cash Management Account pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement during the Lease Sweep Period in question, the Lease Sweep Reserve Threshold has been met (the “Initial Lease Termination Payment Application”), (ii) next, into the Debt Service Reserve Account (described below) until, after taking into account all other funds transferred during the Lease Sweep Period in question into the Lease Sweep Account and Debt Service Reserve Account, the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap is met (the “Lease Termination Payment Debt Service Amount”) (provided that no such cap exists with respect to a Lease Sweep Period continuing during a Lease Sweep Tenant Party Insolvency Proceeding, in which case the Lease Termination Payment Debt Service Amount will mean the remainder of the Lease Sweep Lease Termination Payment) and (iii) lastly, any remaining amount will be deposited into the Lease Sweep Account.
“Required Minimum Monthly Lease Sweep Deposit Amount” means on each Monthly Payment Date during the continuance of a Lease Sweep Period, an amount equal to $1,031,600.

Provided no Loan Event of Default is continuing, the Lender will be required to direct the Servicer to disburse funds on deposit in the Lease Sweep Account to the Borrower for payment of certain approved leasing expenses related to Lease Sweep Leases, within ten days after the delivery by the Borrower to the Lender of a request therefor (but not more often than once per month), in increments of at least $10,000 upon the satisfaction of certain conditions.

Provided no Loan Event of Default is continuing, if (w) a Lease Sweep Period commenced with respect to a Lease Sweep Lease upon the occurrence of a default under a Lease Sweep Lease and has subsequently ceased, and (x) the Occupancy Conditions are satisfied and no other Lease Sweep Period is continuing, then the aggregate funds on deposit in the Lease Sweep Account and the Debt Service Reserve Account and not previously disbursed or applied (less (A) any Unpaid TILC Obligation Amount, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed for approved lease sweep space leasing expenses, (B) any Remaining Rent Abatement Amount, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be disbursed on each Monthly Payment Date in amounts sufficient to replicate full contractual rents under each lease and (C) any Remaining Space Amount, as determined by Lender, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed for Approved Lease Sweep Lease Leasing Expenses in connection with the Remaining Lease Sweep) will be required to be disbursed on the next occurring Monthly Payment Date in accordance with the cash management provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

Provided no Loan Event of Default is continuing, if (w) a Lease Sweep Period commenced with respect to a Lease Sweep Lease upon the occurrence of a default under a Lease Sweep Lease and has subsequently ceased, and (x) the Occupancy Conditions are satisfied and no other Lease Sweep Period is continuing, then the aggregate funds on deposit in the Lease Sweep Account and the Debt Service Reserve Account and not previously disbursed or applied (less (A) any Unpaid TILC Obligation Amount, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed for approved lease sweep space leasing expenses, (B) any Remaining Rent Abatement Amount, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be disbursed on each Monthly Payment Date in amounts sufficient to replicate full contractual rents under each lease and (C) any Remaining Space Amount, as determined by Lender, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed for Approved Lease Sweep Lease Leasing Expenses in connection with the Remaining Lease Sweep) will be required to be disbursed on the next occurring Monthly Payment Date in accordance with the cash management provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

Provided no Loan Event of Default is continuing, if (w) a Lease Sweep Period commenced with respect to a Lease Sweep Lease caused by the occurrence of a Lease Sweep Tenant Party Insolvency Proceeding, has subsequently ceased, and (x) the Occupancy Conditions with respect to such Lease Sweep Space are satisfied, then funds in the Lease Sweep Account applicable to the Lease Sweep Space in question and not previously disbursed or applied (less (A) any Unpaid TILC Obligation Amount, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed for approved lease sweep space leasing expenses, (B) any Remaining Rent Abatement Amount, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be disbursed on each Monthly Payment Date in amounts sufficient to replicate full contractual rents under each applicable lease and (C) any Remaining Space Amount, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed for approved lease sweep space leasing expenses in connection with the Remaining Lease Sweep Space),will be required to be disbursed on the next occurring Monthly Payment Date in accordance with the cash management provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

Provided no Loan Event of Default is continuing, if (w) a Lease Sweep Period commenced with respect to a Lease Sweep Lease caused by the occurrence of a Lease Sweep Tenant Party Insolvency Proceeding, has subsequently ceased, and (x) the Occupancy Conditions with respect to such Lease Sweep Space are satisfied, then funds in the Lease Sweep Account applicable to the Lease Sweep Space in question and not previously disbursed or applied (less (A) any Unpaid TILC Obligation Amount, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed for approved lease sweep space leasing expenses, (B) any Remaining Rent Abatement Amount, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be disbursed on each Monthly Payment Date in amounts sufficient to replicate full contractual rents under each applicable lease and (C) any Remaining Space Amount, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed for approved lease sweep space leasing expenses in connection with the Remaining Lease Sweep Space),will be required to be disbursed on the next occurring Monthly Payment Date in accordance with the cash management provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

Provided no Loan Event of Default is continuing, if (x) a Lease Sweep Period commenced in accordance with clause (i)(b) of the defined term “Lease Sweep Period”, (y) such Lease Sweep Period ceased because the applicable conditions described in the Mortgage Loan Agreement have been met with respect to the Lease Sweep Spaces, and (z) notwithstanding the foregoing, the Occupancy Conditions are satisfied and no other Lease Sweep Period is continuing, then funds in the Lease Sweep Account not previously disbursed or applied (less (A) any Unpaid TILC Obligation Amount, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed for approved lease sweep space leasing expenses, (B) any Remaining Rent Abatement Amount, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be disbursed on each Monthly Payment Date in amounts sufficient to replicate full contractual rents under each applicable lease and (C) any Remaining Space Amount, as determined by Lender, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed for approved lease sweep space leasing expenses in connection with the Remaining Lease Sweep Space, will be disbursed on the next occurring Monthly Payment Date in accordance with the cash management provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

Provided no Loan Event of Default is continuing, if (x) a Lease Sweep Period commenced in accordance with clause (i)(b) of the defined term “Lease Sweep Period”, (y) such Lease Sweep Period ceased because the applicable conditions described in the Mortgage Loan Agreement have been met with respect to the Lease Sweep Spaces, and (z) notwithstanding the foregoing, the Occupancy Conditions are satisfied and no other Lease Sweep Period is continuing, then funds in the Lease Sweep Account not previously disbursed or applied (less (A) any Unpaid TILC Obligation Amount, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed for approved lease sweep space leasing expenses, (B) any Remaining Rent Abatement Amount, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be disbursed on each Monthly Payment Date in amounts sufficient to replicate full contractual rents under each applicable lease and (C) any Remaining Space Amount, as determined by Lender, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed for approved lease sweep space leasing expenses in connection with the Remaining Lease Sweep Space, will be disbursed on the next occurring Monthly Payment Date in accordance with the cash management provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

Provided no Loan Event of Default is continuing, if (x) a Lease Sweep Period commenced in accordance with clauses (i)(c) or (i)(f) of the defined term “Lease Sweep Period”, (y) such Lease Sweep Period ceased because the applicable conditions described in clause (ii)(2)(A) or (B) of the defined term “Lease Sweep Period” have been met with respect to the Lease Sweep Spaces, and (z) notwithstanding the foregoing (or any provision in clause (ii)(2)(A) or (B) of the defined term “Lease Sweep Period”), the Occupancy Conditions are satisfied and no other Lease Sweep Period is continuing, then funds in the Lease Sweep Account not previously disbursed or applied (less (A) any Unpaid TILC Obligation Amount, as determined by Lender, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed for approved lease sweep space leasing expenses, (B) any Remaining Rent Abatement Amount, as determined by Lender, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be disbursed on each Monthly Payment Date in amounts sufficient to replicate full contractual rents under each applicable lease in accordance with a schedule to be delivered to, and reasonably approved by, Lender and (C) any Remaining Space Amount, as determined by Lender, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed for approved lease sweep space leasing expenses in connection with the Remaining Lease Sweep Space), will be disbursed on the next occurring Monthly Payment Date in accordance with the cash management provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

Provided no Loan Event of Default is continuing, if (x) a Lease Sweep Period commenced in accordance with clauses (i)(c) or (i)(f) of the defined term “Lease Sweep Period”, (y) such Lease Sweep Period ceased because the applicable conditions described in clause (ii)(2)(A) or (B) of the defined term “Lease Sweep Period” have been met with respect to the Lease Sweep Spaces, and (z) notwithstanding the foregoing (or any provision in clause (ii)(2)(A) or (B) of the defined term “Lease Sweep Period”), the Occupancy Conditions are satisfied and no other Lease Sweep Period is continuing, then funds in the Lease Sweep Account not previously disbursed or applied (less (A) any Unpaid TILC Obligation Amount, as determined by Lender, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed for approved lease sweep space leasing expenses, (B) any Remaining Rent Abatement Amount, as determined by Lender, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be disbursed on each Monthly Payment Date in amounts sufficient to replicate full contractual rents under each applicable lease in accordance with a schedule to be delivered to, and reasonably approved by, Lender and (C) any Remaining Space Amount, as determined by Lender, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed for approved lease sweep space leasing expenses in connection with the Remaining Lease Sweep Space), will be disbursed on the next occurring Monthly Payment Date in accordance with the cash management provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

Provided no Loan Event of Default is continuing, if a Lease Sweep Period terminated pursuant to clause (ii)(5) of the defined term "Lease Sweep Period", any Lease Sweep Funds remaining once the Occupancy Conditions are satisfied with respect to the Lease Sweep Space and provided that no other Lease Sweep Period is continuing (less (A) any Unpaid TILC Obligation Amount, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed for approved lease sweep space leasing expenses, (B) any Remaining Rent Abatement Amount, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be disbursed on each Monthly Payment Date in amounts sufficient to replicate full contractual rents under each applicable lease and (C) any Remaining Space Amount, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed for approved lease sweep space leasing expenses in connection with the Remaining Lease Sweep Space) will be required to be disbursed on the next occurring Monthly Payment Date in accordance with the cash management provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

Provided no Loan Event of Default is continuing, if a Lease Sweep Period terminated pursuant to clause (ii)(5) of the defined term "Lease Sweep Period", any Lease Sweep Funds remaining once the Occupancy Conditions are satisfied with respect to the Lease Sweep Space and provided that no other Lease Sweep Period is continuing (less (A) any Unpaid TILC Obligation Amount, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed for approved lease sweep space leasing expenses, (B) any Remaining Rent Abatement Amount, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be disbursed on each Monthly Payment Date in amounts sufficient to replicate full contractual rents under each applicable lease and (C) any Remaining Space Amount, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed for approved lease sweep space leasing expenses in connection with the Remaining Lease Sweep Space) will be required to be disbursed on the next occurring Monthly Payment Date in accordance with the cash management provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

Other than with respect to a Lease Sweep Period triggered or continuing due to a Lease Sweep Tenant Party Insolvency Proceeding, the Borrower has the option of preventing the commencement of a Lease Sweep Period (or, if already triggered, terminating such Lease Sweep Period) by delivering to the Lender a Lease Sweep Letter of Credit in a face amount equal to the applicable Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap (it being understood that if more than one Lease Sweep Trigger would be in effect, the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap applicable will be the highest cap applicable to the triggers being prevented or terminated).

During the continuance of a Loan Event of Default, the Lender will have the right, at its option, to draw on all or any portion of any Letter of Credit and to apply such amount(s) drawn to payment of the Mortgage Loan in such order, proportion or priority as the Lender may determine.

Prior to the Open Prepayment Date, any such application to the debt during the continuance of a Loan Event of Default will be subject to the Prepayment Fee and, if applicable, the Liquidated Damages Amount.

“Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap” means (i) with respect to a Lease Sweep Trigger continuing solely pursuant to clause (i)(d) of the defined term “Lease Sweep Period”, $24,544,310; or (ii) with respect to a Lease Sweep Trigger continuing solely pursuant to clause (i)(b) of the defined term “Lease Sweep Period”, $35.00 per rentable square foot of Terminated Space; or (iii) with respect to a Lease Sweep Trigger continuing pursuant to a Dark Period Event, whether or not a Lease Sweep Trigger pursuant to clauses (i)(b) and/or (i)(d) of the defined term “Lease Sweep Period” is concurrently continuing, $50.00 per rentable square foot of Dark Space; or (iv) with respect to a Lease Sweep Trigger continuing pursuant to a Facebook Downgrade Event, whether or not a Lease Sweep Trigger pursuant to clauses (i)(b), (i)(c) and/or (i)(d) of the defined term “Lease Sweep Period” is concurrently continuing, $35,063,300.

A “Lease Sweep Period” will: (i) commence on the first Monthly Payment Date following the occurrence of any of the following (each, a “Lease Sweep Trigger”): (a) the date on which, with respect to any Lease Sweep Lease, (i) a Lease Sweep Lease Tenant Party cancels or terminates its Lease Sweep Lease with respect to all or a Material Termination Portion of the Lease Sweep Space subject to such Lease Sweep Lease prior to the then current expiration date under such Lease Sweep Lease, or (ii) a Lease Sweep Lease Tenant Party delivers to the Borrower or Property Manager a notice to the effect that it is surrendering, canceling or terminating its Lease Sweep Lease with respect to all or a Material Termination Portion of the Lease Sweep Space subject to such Lease Sweep Lease (such affected space being the “Terminated Space”); provided, however, no Lease Sweep Period will commence pursuant to this clause (i)(b) if, in connection with such termination or cancellation (or delivery of notice of termination or cancellation), Borrower simultaneously enters into a replacement lease(s) with one or more Investment Grade Entities covering the Terminated Space, provided that such replacement lease is a Qualified Lease and provided that the Occupancy Conditions are satisfied with respect to such replacement Lease on or prior to the date of such termination or cancellation (or delivery of notice of termination or cancellation); (b) the date on which, with respect to any Lease Sweep Lease, a Lease Sweep Tenant Party ceases operating its business at 20% or more of its Lease Sweep Space on a rentable square foot basis (a “Dark Period Event” and the affected space being the “Dark Space”); provided, however, that if the Lease Sweep Tenant Party (x) is Facebook, (y) one or more Investment Grade Entities or (z) has subleased the Dark Space portion of its premises to one or more Investment Grade Entities who has accepted delivery thereof (i.e., the lease has commenced) and is paying unabated rent at a contract rate no less than the contract rate required under the Lease Sweep Lease, in any such case, such Lease Sweep Tenant Party will not be deemed to have ‘gone dark’ for purposes of this clause (c) and no Lease Sweep Period will commence pursuant to this clause (c); (c) upon a default under a Lease Sweep Lease by the tenant thereunder that continues beyond any applicable notice and cure period; or (d) upon the occurrence of a Lease Sweep Tenant Party Insolvency Proceeding (an “Insolvency Trigger”); (e) the date on which, with respect to any Facebook Lease, Facebook (x) becomes rated by at least two of Fitch, Moody’s and S&P and (y) is thereafter not rated as an Investment Grade Entity (a “Facebook Downgrade Event”); notwithstanding the foregoing, Borrower and Lender expressly acknowledge that Facebook has not been rated as of the date hereof; and (ii) will end on the earliest of the applicable of the following to occur: (a) in the case of clause (i)(b), the date on which, with respect to each Lease Sweep Space, one or more replacement tenants acceptable to Lender (in its sole but good faith discretion) execute and deliver replacement lease(s) covering the Requisite Lease Sweep Space, provided that such replacement lease(s) are Qualified Leases and provided that the Occupancy Conditions are satisfied; (b) in the case of clauses (i)(c) or (i)(f), the date on which either (A) one or more replacement tenants acceptable to Lender (in its sole but good faith discretion) execute and deliver replacement lease(s) covering the Requisite Lease Sweep Space, provided that such replacement tenant(s) and lease(s) are Qualified Leases and provided that the Occupancy Conditions are satisfied or (B) for a Dark Period Event or a Facebook Downgrade Event, Facebook (or its parent) is restored as an Investment Grade Entity or the entirety of the Lease Sweep Space has been sublet to an Investment Grade Entity who has accepted delivery thereof (i.e., the lease has commenced) and is paying unabated rent at a contract rate no less than the contract rate required under the lease Sweep Lease; (c) in the case of clause (i)(d) above, the applicable Lease Sweep Tenant Party Insolvency Proceeding has terminated and the applicable Lease Sweep Lease has been affirmed, assumed or assigned in a manner satisfactory to the Lender; (d) in the case of clause (i)(e) above, the applicable Lease Sweep Tenant Party Insolvency Proceeding has terminated and the applicable Lease Sweep Lease has been affirmed, assumed or assigned in a manner satisfactory to Lender; and (e) in the case of clauses (i)(b) through (i)(d) and (i)(f), the date on which the aggregate amount of funds transferred into the Lease Sweep Account and the Debt Service Reserve Account (including any Lease Sweep Lease Termination Payments with respect to the Lease Sweep Lease(s) in question deposited into the Lease Sweep Account) equals the applicable Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap (for the avoidance of doubt: (x) a Lease Sweep Period terminating pursuant to this clause (ii)(5) will terminate once funds in an amount equal to the applicable Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap have been transferred into the Lease Sweep Account and the Debt Service Reserve Account over the course of the Lease Sweep Period; but all of such funds will not have to be, at any one time, on deposit all at once in such Lease Sweep Account and the Debt Service Reserve Account and (y) if a Lease Sweep Trigger is continuing due to the occurrence of more than one Lease Sweep Trigger, the aggregate amount of funds required to be transferred over the course of the Lease Sweep Period will be equal to the amount of the largest Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap applicable to all then-continuing Lease Sweep Triggers, such that each Lease Sweep Trigger will be treated as concurrent and not duplicative or independent of another (by way of example: if the Lease Sweep Triggers due to a default (under clause (i)(d)) and due to a notice of termination (under clause (i)(b)), the total amount swept for such triggers will be capped at $35.00 per rentable square foot, whereas if triggers are continuing due to a default (under clause (i)(d)) and due to a Facebook Downgrade Event (under clause (i)(f)), the total amount swept for such triggers will be capped at $50.00 per rentable square foot since the Facebook Downgrade Event requires the larger capped amount)).

“Lease Sweep Reserve Threshold” means (i) with respect to a Lease Sweep Trigger continuing pursuant to clauses (i)(d) and/or (i)(f) of the defined term “Lease Sweep Period”, $21,037,980, or (ii) with respect to a Lease Sweep Trigger continuing solely pursuant to clauses (i)(b) and/or (i)(c) of the defined term “Lease Sweep Period”, $30.00 per rentable square foot of Dark Space and/or Terminated Space, as applicable.

“Occupancy Conditions” means, with respect to the Lease Sweep Space in question, (I) with respect to Lease Sweep Space at least equal to the Requisite Lease Sweep Space, the delivery by the Borrower to the Lender of evidence reasonably satisfactory to the Lender (including an estoppel certificate executed by the relevant Lease Sweep Lease Tenant Party(ies)) that (A) the entirety of such Requisite Lease Sweep Space is tenanted (or, in the case of a lease renewal or extension, continues to be tenanted) under one or more Qualified Leases, (B) all contingencies under the lease or leases of the Lease Sweep Space in question (or the lease renewal or extension) to the effectiveness of such lease(s) have been satisfied and the rent commencement date under all such lease(s) has been set, (C) all leasing commissions payable in connection with the Lease or Leases of the Lease Sweep Space in question (or the lease renewal or extension) have been paid and all tenant improvement obligations or other landlord obligations of an inducement nature have either been completed or paid in full or, alternatively, sufficient funds have be retained in the Lease Sweep Account for such purposes (the “Unpaid TILC Obligation Amount”), (D) the Lease Sweep Tenant(s) under the Lease or Leases of the Lease Sweep Space in question (or the lease renewal or extension) has actually commenced paying full contractual rent and any initial free rent period or period of partial rent abatements has expired or, alternatively, sufficient funds will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account to account for all remaining scheduled free rent periods or rent abatements (the “Remaining Rent Abatement Amount” and, collectively with the Unpaid TILC Obligation Amount, the “Unpaid Landlord Obligations Amount”), and (E) the Lease Sweep Tenant(s) under the Lease or Leases of the Lease Sweep Space in question (or the lease renewal or extension) have accepted delivery of the demised premises, (II) in the event that the conditions under the foregoing clause (I) are satisfied by Qualified Leases that demise Requisite Lease Sweep Space that is less than 100% of the rentable square feet demised under the Facebook Lease as of the date hereof (the difference between such space leased under the Facebook Lease and the space leased under such Qualified Lease demised to satisfy the foregoing clause (I) being the “Remaining Lease Sweep Space”), the then aggregate amount of funds on deposit in the Lease Sweep Account and the Debt Service Reserve Account on account of the Remaining Lease Sweep Space and not previously disbursed or applied (and not allocable to the Unpaid Landlord Obligation Amount), will be equal to or greater than the product of (x) the applicable per rentable square foot Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap and (y) the rentable square feet of the Remaining Lease Sweep Space (such required amount, the “Remaining Space Amount”) and (III) the Debt Service Coverage Ratio and the Combined DSCR after giving effect to the Lease or Leases of the Lease Sweep Space in question (or the lease renewal or extension) (taking into account the Remaining Rent Abatement Amount as rents) will be equal to or greater than the Debt Service Coverage Ratio and the Combined DSCR in effect immediately prior to the occurrence of the subject Lease Sweep Period.

If, during a Lease Sweep Period, the aggregate funds transferred into Lease Sweep Account during the Lease Sweep Period in question (inclusive of any Lease Termination Payments made into the Lease Sweep Account with respect to such Lease Sweep Period pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, but excluding any Lease Termination Payment Debt Service Amount equals the Lease Sweep Reserve Threshold, then on each Monthly Payment Date during such Lease Sweep Period, all Required Minimum Monthly Lease Sweep Deposit Amounts and Available Cash (or such Required Minimum Monthly Lease Sweep Deposit Amounts or other amounts required to be deposited into an account, will be transferred by Lender into the Debt Service Reserve Account.

Unless a Lease Sweep Period is continuing due to a Lease Sweep Tenant Party Insolvency Proceeding, in no event will the aggregate amount of funds transferred into (x) the Lease Sweep Account during the Lease Sweep in question (inclusive of any Lease Termination Payments made into the Lease Sweep Account with respect to such Lease Sweep Period other than any portion transferred pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement) and (y) the Debt Service Reserve Account during the Lease Sweep Period in question exceed the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap.
However, if a Lease Sweep Period is continuing due to a Lease Sweep Tenant Party Insolvency Proceeding, the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap will not be in effect.

Provided no Loan Event of Default is continuing, if rents are insufficient to pay Debt Service on the Mortgage Loan in accordance with the cash management provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, funds not previously disbursed or applied will be disbursed from the Debt Service Reserve Account to pay Debt Service on the Mortgage Loan in accordance with the cash management provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

In addition, provided no Loan Event of Default is continuing, at Borrower’s request, funds not previously disbursed or applied may be disbursed from the Debt Service Reserve Account to pay for approved leasing expenses and approved lease sweep space leasing expenses if and only if insufficient funds for such purposes are available in the TILC Account and/or the Lease Sweep Account for such purposes (in which event such amounts will be disbursed subject to and in accordance with the provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement).

If a Trigger Period is continuing (other than a Trigger Period continuing due to a Lease Sweep Period), all Available Cash will be required to be paid to the Lender, which amounts will be required to be transferred by the Lender into an account (the “Cash Collateral Account”) to be held by Lender as cash collateral for the Mortgage Loan.

Any Cash Collateral Funds on deposit in the Cash Collateral Account not previously disbursed or applied will be disbursed to Borrower, upon the termination of such Trigger Period (provided no other Trigger Period then exists); provided that if such Trigger Period is terminated because funds accumulated in the Cash Collateral Account equal $35,063,300, such Cash Collateral Funds will not be disbursed to Borrower until clause the Debt Service Coverage Ratio is at least 1.90x or the Combined DSCR is 1.50x for at least two consecutive Calculation Dates.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, Lender will have the right, but not the obligation, at any time during the continuance of a Loan Event of Default or from and after the Anticipated Repayment Date, in its sole and absolute discretion to apply any and all Cash Collateral Funds then on deposit in the Cash Collateral Account to the Mortgage Loan or obligations, in such order and in such manner as Lender elects in its sole and absolute discretion, including to make a prepayment of principal (together with the applicable Prepayment Fee and/or Liquidated Damages Amount, if any, applicable thereto) or any other amounts due under the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

“Low DSCR Period” will commence if, as of any date of calculation, (A) the Property is not fully leased to either (a) Facebook or (b) one or more Investment Grade Entities, pursuant to a Lease(s) that is substantially on the same or better terms as the Facebook Lease, and (B) the Debt Service Coverage Ratio is less than 1.90x or the DSCR based on the combined Mortgage Loan and Mezzanine Loan (the “Combined DSCR”) is less than 1.50x and (ii) will end on the earlier to occur of the date (x) a Debt Service Coverage Ratio of at least 1.90x and a Combined DSCR of at least 1.50x is achieved for at least two consecutive Calculation Dates, as determined by Lender and (y) funds on deposit in the Cash Collateral Account equal $35,063,300.

“Mezzanine Loan Default” means a Loan Event of Default under the Mezzanine Loan and as defined in the Mezzanine Loan Documents and Lender may conclusively rely on any notice from Mezzanine Loan Lender of such Mezzanine Loan Default without any inquiry into the validity thereof.

A “Trigger Period” will commence upon (i) the Anticipated Repayment Date, (ii) the occurrence of a Loan Event of Default, (iii) the commencement of a Low DSCR Period, (iv) the commencement of a Lease Sweep Period, or (v) the occurrence of a Mezzanine Loan Default; and will end if (A) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (i), the Mortgage Loan and all obligations have been repaid in full, (B) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (ii), the Loan Event of Default commencing the Trigger Period has been cured and such cure has been accepted by Lender (and no other Loan Event of Default is then continuing), (C) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (iii), the Low DSCR Period has ended pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement (and no other Trigger Period is continuing), (D) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (iv), the Lease Sweep Period has ended pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement (and no other Trigger Period is continuing), or (E) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (v), until receipt of a Mezzanine Loan Default Revocation Notice (and no other Trigger Period is continuing).

A “Trigger Period” will commence upon (i) the Anticipated Repayment Date, (ii) the occurrence of a Loan Event of Default, (iii) the commencement of a Low DSCR Period, (iv) the commencement of a Lease Sweep Period, or (v) the occurrence of a Mezzanine Loan Default; and will end if (A) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (i), the Mortgage Loan and all obligations have been repaid in full, (B) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (ii), the Loan Event of Default commencing the Trigger Period has been cured and such cure has been accepted by Lender (and no other Loan Event of Default is then continuing), (C) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (iii), the Low DSCR Period has ended pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement (and no other Trigger Period is continuing), (D) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (iv), the Lease Sweep Period has ended pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement (and no other Trigger Period is continuing), or (E) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (v), until receipt of a Mezzanine Loan Default Revocation Notice (and no other Trigger Period is continuing).

A “Trigger Period” will commence upon (i) the Anticipated Repayment Date, (ii) the occurrence of a Loan Event of Default, (iii) the commencement of a Low DSCR Period, (iv) the commencement of a Lease Sweep Period, or (v) the occurrence of a Mezzanine Loan Default; and will end if (A) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (i), the Mortgage Loan and all obligations have been repaid in full, (B) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (ii), the Loan Event of Default commencing the Trigger Period has been cured and such cure has been accepted by Lender (and no other Loan Event of Default is then continuing), (C) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (iii), the Low DSCR Period has ended pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement (and no other Trigger Period is continuing), (D) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (iv), the Lease Sweep Period has ended pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement (and no other Trigger Period is continuing), or (E) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (v), until receipt of a Mezzanine Loan Default Revocation Notice (and no other Trigger Period is continuing).

On each Monthly Payment Date, prior to the Anticipated Repayment Date, except during the continuance of an event of default, the Lender or the servicer, as applicable, will allocate all funds on deposit in the cash management account and disburse such funds in the following amounts and order of priority: (i) First, to the tax account, an amount equal to 1/12th of projected annual real estate and personal property taxes for the purpose of reserving amounts in respect of taxes; (ii) Second, to the insurance account, an amount equal to 1/12th of projected annual insurance premiums (unless insurance is maintained under an Acceptable Blanket Policy) for the purpose of reserving amounts in respect of insurance premiums; (iii) Third, to the Lender, funds sufficient to pay (a) the Note A monthly interest payment amount and (b) the Note B monthly interest payment amount, all in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement; (iv) Fourth, to the capital expenditure account, funds in an amount equal to the monthly capital expenditures for the purpose of reserving amounts in respect of payments of capital expenditure funds in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement; (v) Fifth, to the Lender, any other amounts then due and payable under the Mortgage Loan Documents; (vi) Sixth, during a Trigger Period or if a Mezzanine Loan is outstanding, subject to the terms of the cash management agreement, to the Borrower, funds in an amount equal to the monthly amount set forth in the Approved Annual Budget for operating expenses (the “Monthly Operating Expense Budgeted Amount”) (provided, however, that (y) management fees included in the Monthly Operating Expense Budgeted Amount, to be paid therefrom to the Property Manager and, if applicable, management fees to be paid to the Property Manager under clause (vii) below may not exceed, in any calendar year, 3% of rents collected from the Property per calendar year, in the aggregate (the “Annual Management Fee Cap”) and (z) any management fees that are due to the Property Manager (whether from the Monthly Operating Expense Budgeted Amount and/or the Approved Extraordinary Operating Expenses) (in any calendar year for work done during such year) that exceed the Annual Management Fee Cap will be disbursed to the Property Manager pursuant to clause (x)(C) below); (vii) Seventh, during a Trigger Period or if a Mezzanine Loan is outstanding, to the Borrower, payments for any extraordinary operating expense not set forth in the approved annual budget that is approved by the Lender (“Approved Extraordinary Operating Expenses”), if any (provided, however, that (y) management fees included in the Approved Extraordinary Operating Expenses, to be paid therefrom to the Property Manager and management fees to be paid to the Property Manager under the preceding clause (vi) may not exceed, in any calendar year, the Annual Management Fee Cap and (z) any management fees that are due to the Property Manager (whether from the Approved Extraordinary Operating Expenses and/or the Monthly Operating Expense Budgeted Amount) (in any calendar year, for work done during such year) that exceed the Annual Management Fee Cap will be disbursed to the Property Manager pursuant to clause (x)(C) below); viii) Eighth, during a Lease Sweep Period, an amount equal to the Required Minimum Monthly Lease Sweep Deposit Amount to be applied and disbursed as follows: (A) during a Lease Sweep Period, an amount equal to the Required Minimum Monthly Lease Sweep Deposit Amount to be applied and disbursed as follows: (1) First, to the Lease Sweep Account (but only until the aggregate Lease Sweep Funds transferred in the Lease Sweep Account during the Lease Sweep in question (inclusive of any Lease Termination Payments made into the Lease Sweep Account with respect to such Lease Sweep Period) equals the Lease Sweep Reserve Threshold); (2) Second, once such Lease Sweep Reserve Threshold has been met, to an account (the “Debt Service Reserve Account”)) until the aggregate amount of funds transferred during the Lease Sweep Period in question into (x) the Lease Sweep Account (inclusive of any Lease Termination Payments made into the Lease Sweep Account with respect to such Lease Sweep Period) and (y) the Debt Service Reserve Account equals the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap; provided that (1) if a Lease Sweep Period is continuing due to an Insolvency Trigger, then the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap will not apply and all Required Minimum Monthly Lease Sweep Deposit Amounts will continue to be deposited into the Debt Service Reserve Account; and (2) if the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap has been met (and no Lease Sweep Period is continuing due to an Insolvency Trigger), then any Required Minimum Monthly Lease Sweep Deposit Amounts in excess of the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap will be applied as set forth below (ix) Ninth, to the Mezzanine Debt Service Account funds in an amount equal to the mezzanine debt service payment due and owing on the next Monthly Payment Date (provided, however, that amounts allocated to the Mezzanine Debt Service Account pursuant to this subparagraph (ix) will be held in the Mezzanine Debt Service Account until such next Monthly Payment Date, at which time, such amounts will be transferred to the Mezzanine Loan Account); and (x) Lastly, (A) during a Lease Sweep Period, an amount equal to all then available cash will be applied and disbursed as follows: (1) First, to the Lease Sweep Account (but only until the aggregate Lease Sweep Funds transferred in the Lease Sweep Account during the Lease Sweep in question equals the Lease Sweep Reserve Threshold); (2) Second, once such Lease Sweep Reserve Threshold has been met, to the Debt Service Reserve Account until the aggregate amount of funds transferred during the Lease Sweep Period in question into (x) the Lease Sweep Account (inclusive of the deposits made into the Lease Sweep Account pursuant to the clauses above and any lease termination payments received by Lender and deposited into the Lease Sweep Account) and (y) the Debt Service Reserve Account (inclusive of the deposits made in the Debt Service Reserve Account pursuant to the clauses above and any lease termination payments received by Lender and deposited into the Debt Service Reserve Account with respect to the Lease Sweep Period in question), in the aggregate, equals the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap; provided that if a Lease Sweep Period is continuing due to an Insolvency Trigger, then the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap will not apply and all remaining available cash will continue to be deposited into the Debt Service Reserve Account; lastly, any remaining available cash will be deposited or disbursed (x) if a Trigger Period other than a Lease Sweep Period is continuing concurrently with a Lease Sweep Period, into the Cash Collateral Account (to be held or disbursed in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Documents) or (y) if no Trigger Period is continuing, pursuant to clause (C) below; or (3) Lastly, any remaining Available Cash will be deposited or disbursed (x) if a Trigger Period other than a Lease Sweep Period is continuing concurrently with a Lease Sweep Period, into the Cash Collateral Account or (y) if no Trigger Period is continuing, pursuant to clause (C) below, or (B) during a Trigger Period (other than due to the continuance of a Lease Sweep Period), all available cash will be deposited into to the Cash Collateral Account (provided, that, if such Trigger Period is caused solely by a Low DSCR Period, but only until funds deposited into the Cash Collateral Account during such Low DSCR Period equal $35,063,300); or (C) provided no Trigger Period is continuing all Available Cash will be disbursed (x) first to the Property Manager, until any amounts owed to the Property Manager (in excess of the Annual Management Fee Cap paid to such Property Manager during any calendar year) are paid in full, and (y) then to the Borrower
