and (x) Lastly, (A) during a Lease Sweep Period, an amount equal to all then available cash will be applied and disbursed as follows: (1) First, to the Lease Sweep Account (but only until the aggregate Lease Sweep Funds transferred in the Lease Sweep Account during the Lease Sweep in question equals the Lease Sweep Reserve Threshold); (2) Second, once such Lease Sweep Reserve Threshold has been met, to the Debt Service Reserve Account until the aggregate amount of funds transferred during the Lease Sweep Period in question into (x) the Lease Sweep Account (inclusive of the deposits made into the Lease Sweep Account pursuant to the clauses above and any lease termination payments received by Lender and deposited into the Lease Sweep Account) and (y) the Debt Service Reserve Account (inclusive of the deposits made in the Debt Service Reserve Account pursuant to the clauses above and any lease termination payments received by Lender and deposited into the Debt Service Reserve Account with respect to the Lease Sweep Period in question), in the aggregate, equals the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap; provided that if a Lease Sweep Period is continuing due to an Insolvency Trigger, then the Lease Sweep And Debt Service Reserve Cap will not apply and all remaining available cash will continue to be deposited into the Debt Service Reserve Account; lastly, any remaining available cash will be deposited or disbursed (x) if a Trigger Period other than a Lease Sweep Period is continuing concurrently with a Lease Sweep Period, into the Cash Collateral Account (to be held or disbursed in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Documents) or (y) if no Trigger Period is continuing, pursuant to clause (C) below; or (3) Lastly, any remaining Available Cash will be deposited or disbursed (x) if a Trigger Period other than a Lease Sweep Period is continuing concurrently with a Lease Sweep Period, into the Cash Collateral Account or (y) if no Trigger Period is continuing, pursuant to clause (C) below, or (B) during a Trigger Period (other than due to the continuance of a Lease Sweep Period), all available cash will be deposited into to the Cash Collateral Account (provided, that, if such Trigger Period is caused solely by a Low DSCR Period, but only until funds deposited into the Cash Collateral Account during such Low DSCR Period equal $35,063,300); or (C) provided no Trigger Period is continuing all Available Cash will be disbursed (x) first to the Property Manager, until any amounts owed to the Property Manager (in excess of the Annual Management Fee Cap paid to such Property Manager during any calendar year) are paid in full, and (y) then to the Borrower

On each Mortgage Monthly Payment Date after the Anticipated Repayment Date, except during the continuance of an event of default, the Lender or the servicer, as applicable, will allocate all funds on deposit in the cash management account and disburse such funds in the following amounts and order of priority: (i) First, to the tax account, to make the required payments of tax funds; (ii) Second, to the insurance account, to make the required payments of insurance funds; (iii) Third, to Lender, funds sufficient to pay the Note A monthly interest payment amount; (iv) Fourth, to Lender, funds sufficient to pay the Note B monthly interest payment amount; (v) Fifth, to the Mezzanine Debt Service Account funds in an amount equal to the mezzanine debt service payment (computing all interest payments thereunder at the Initial Mezzanine Interest Rate, and excluding, for the avoidance of ambiguity, the payment of any Mezzanine Accrued Interest) due and owing on the next Monthly Payment Date (provided, however, that amounts allocated to the Mezzanine Debt Service Account pursuant to this subparagraph (v) will be held in the Mezzanine Debt Service Account until such next Monthly Payment Date, at which time, such amounts will be transferred to the Mezzanine Loan Account); (vi) Sixth, to Lender, to be applied to reduce the outstanding principal balance of the A Notes, funds sufficient to pay the monthly amount determined by Lender to be required to fully amortize the outstanding principal balance of the A Notes and outstanding principal balance of the B Notes over an amortization schedule of 30 years using an assumed interest rate of the Initial Blended Interest Rate; (vii) Seventh, solely to the extent the outstanding principal balance of the A Notes has been reduced to zero, to Lender, to be applied to reduce the outstanding principal balance of the B Notes, funds sufficient to pay the monthly amount determined by Lender to be required to fully amortize the outstanding principal balance of Note A and Note B over an amortization schedule of 30 years using an assumed interest rate of the Initial Blended Interest Rate; (viii) Eighth, at Lender’s option, to make payments in an amount determined by Lender into the Capital Expenditure Account in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement; (ix) Ninth, to Borrower, funds in an amount equal to the Monthly Operating Expense Budgeted Amount (provided, however, that (y) management fees paid to Property Manager under this clause (v) may not exceed, in any calendar year, the Annual Management Fee Cap); (x) Tenth, to repay the outstanding principal balance of the A Notes; (xi) Eleventh, to repay the outstanding principal balance of the B Notes; (xi) Twelfth, to pay Note A Accrued Interests; and (xii) Lastly, to pay Note B Accrued Interest.

On each Mortgage Monthly Payment Date after the Anticipated Repayment Date, except during the continuance of an event of default, the Lender or the servicer, as applicable, will allocate all funds on deposit in the cash management account and disburse such funds in the following amounts and order of priority: (i) First, to the tax account, to make the required payments of tax funds; (ii) Second, to the insurance account, to make the required payments of insurance funds; (iii) Third, to Lender, funds sufficient to pay the Note A monthly interest payment amount; (iv) Fourth, to Lender, funds sufficient to pay the Note B monthly interest payment amount; (v) Fifth, to the Mezzanine Debt Service Account funds in an amount equal to the mezzanine debt service payment (computing all interest payments thereunder at the Initial Mezzanine Interest Rate, and excluding, for the avoidance of ambiguity, the payment of any Mezzanine Accrued Interest) due and owing on the next Monthly Payment Date (provided, however, that amounts allocated to the Mezzanine Debt Service Account pursuant to this subparagraph (v) will be held in the Mezzanine Debt Service Account until such next Monthly Payment Date, at which time, such amounts will be transferred to the Mezzanine Loan Account); (vi) Sixth, to Lender, to be applied to reduce the outstanding principal balance of the A Notes, funds sufficient to pay the monthly amount determined by Lender to be required to fully amortize the outstanding principal balance of the A Notes and outstanding principal balance of the B Notes over an amortization schedule of 30 years using an assumed interest rate of the Initial Blended Interest Rate; (vii) Seventh, solely to the extent the outstanding principal balance of the A Notes has been reduced to zero, to Lender, to be applied to reduce the outstanding principal balance of the B Notes, funds sufficient to pay the monthly amount determined by Lender to be required to fully amortize the outstanding principal balance of Note A and Note B over an amortization schedule of 30 years using an assumed interest rate of the Initial Blended Interest Rate; (viii) Eighth, at Lender’s option, to make payments in an amount determined by Lender into the Capital Expenditure Account in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement; (ix) Ninth, to Borrower, funds in an amount equal to the Monthly Operating Expense Budgeted Amount (provided, however, that (y) management fees paid to Property Manager under this clause (v) may not exceed, in any calendar year, the Annual Management Fee Cap); (x) Tenth, to repay the outstanding principal balance of the A Notes; (xi) Eleventh, to repay the outstanding principal balance of the B Notes; (xi) Twelfth, to pay Note A Accrued Interests; and (xii) Lastly, to pay Note B Accrued Interest.

A cash flow sweep is triggered upon (i) the Anticipated Repayment Date, (ii) an event of default under the Whole Loan or Mezzanine Loan, (iii) the DSCR, from and after the date that the Property is not fully leased to either (a) Facebook or (b) one or more Investment Grade Entities, as calculated in the Whole Loan documents and inclusive of the Mezzanine Loan, is less than 1.50x or, excluding the Mezzanine Loan, is less than 1.90x or (iv) the earlier to occur of (a) Facebook surrenders, cancels or terminates or gives notice of its intent to surrender, cancel or terminate any of its leases at the Property, (b) Facebook ceases operating its business in 20.0% or more of the space in a building subject to its leases (the “Dark Space”), unless the Lease Sweep Tenant Party (x) is Facebook Tenant, (y) is one or more Investment Grade Entities or (z) has subleased the Dark Space portion of its premises to one or more Investment Grade Entities who has accepted delivery thereof, (c) upon the occurrence of a Lease Sweep Tenant Party Insolvency Proceeding, (d) during the continuance of a default of the lease of Facebook (or any replacement tenant) beyond any applicable notice and cure period, (e) the date on which Facebook (x) becomes rated by at least two of Fitch, Moody’s and S&P and (y) is thereafter not rated as an Investment Grade Entity.

Funds deposited into the Clearing Account will be swept by the clearing bank on a daily basis into the Borrower’s operating account at the bank maintaining the clearing account, unless a Trigger Period is continuing, in which event such funds are required to be swept on a daily basis into the deposit account maintained by the Mortgage Lender and applied and disbursed in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement and the cash management agreement.

During the continuance of a Trigger Period, funds in the clearing account will no longer be swept to the Borrower’s operating account, and such funds will be swept into the deposit account and be disbursed in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement and the cash management agreement, as described in “Description of the Whole Loan—Deposit Account”.

During the continuance of any Trigger Period, on each Payment Date, except during the continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, all funds on deposit in the deposit account will be applied in the order as described in “Description of the Whole Loan—Deposit Account”.
Any funds remaining in the reserve accounts established for taxes, insurance and condominium common charges are required to be returned to the Borrower when any Trigger Period Ends.
Any funds remaining in the cash collateral reserve account are required to be returned to the Borrower when any Trigger Period ends.

Upon the occurrence and during the continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default under the Whole Loan, the Mortgage Lender may apply any amounts then on deposit in the deposit account to the payment of the indebtedness in any order and in such manner as the Mortgage Lender determines in its sole and absolute discretion.
Each reserve account must be an eligible account and may be invested in permitted investments as directed by the Borrower, or during a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, the Mortgage Lender.

The Borrower is required under the Mortgage Loan Documents to maintain and fund the following reserve accounts: an account for the purpose of reserving, during the continuance of a Trigger Period, tax funds; an account for the purpose of reserving, during the continuance of a Trigger Period, insurance funds; an account for the purpose of reserving capital expenditure funds during the continuance of a Trigger Period and commencing from and after the monthly payment date in July 2024; an account into which certain funds received in connection with the Borrower taking certain actions under a lease will be held (if not required to be deposited into another reserve), including payments in connection with a lease modification or termination; an account into which all insurance proceeds or awards due to any casualty or condemnation will be deposited and held; an account for the purpose of reserving, during the continuance of a Trigger Period, certain excess cash flow relating to the Whole Loan to be held as additional security for the Whole Loan; an account for the purpose of depositing, during the continuance of a Trigger Period, condominium common charges; an account for the purpose of depositing certain excess cash flow relating to the Whole Loan for use to pay certain costs and expenses involved with re-tenanting lease sweep space; and an account for the purpose of reserving certain funds in connection with Warner Media Tenant’s contraction option.

A “Trigger Period” (as more fully defined under “Description of the Whole Loan—Clearing Account”) will commence upon (i) the occurrence of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (ii) the commencement of a Low Debt Yield Period or (iii) the commencement of a Lease Sweep Period; and will end if, (A) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (i), the Mortgage Loan Event of Default commencing the Trigger Period has been cured and such cure has been accepted by the Mortgage Lender (and no other Mortgage Loan Event of Default is then continuing), or (B) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (ii), the Low Debt Yield Period has ended pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, or (C) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (iii), the Lease Sweep Period has ended pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement (and no other Lease Sweep Period is then continuing).

A “Trigger Period” (as more fully defined under “Description of the Whole Loan—Clearing Account”) will commence upon (i) the occurrence of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (ii) the commencement of a Low Debt Yield Period or (iii) the commencement of a Lease Sweep Period; and will end if, (A) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (i), the Mortgage Loan Event of Default commencing the Trigger Period has been cured and such cure has been accepted by the Mortgage Lender (and no other Mortgage Loan Event of Default is then continuing), or (B) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (ii), the Low Debt Yield Period has ended pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, or (C) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (iii), the Lease Sweep Period has ended pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement (and no other Lease Sweep Period is then continuing).

A “Trigger Period” (as more fully defined under “Description of the Whole Loan—Clearing Account”) will commence upon (i) the occurrence of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (ii) the commencement of a Low Debt Yield Period or (iii) the commencement of a Lease Sweep Period; and will end if, (A) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (i), the Mortgage Loan Event of Default commencing the Trigger Period has been cured and such cure has been accepted by the Mortgage Lender (and no other Mortgage Loan Event of Default is then continuing), or (B) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (ii), the Low Debt Yield Period has ended pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, or (C) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (iii), the Lease Sweep Period has ended pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement (and no other Lease Sweep Period is then continuing).

Funds deposited into the Clearing Account will be swept by the Clearing Account bank on a daily basis into the Borrower’s operating account at the bank maintaining the Clearing Account, unless a Trigger Period is continuing, in which event such funds are required to be swept on a daily basis into the Deposit Account and applied and disbursed in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement and the Cash Management Agreement.

A “Trigger Period” will commence upon (i) the occurrence of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (ii) the commencement of a Low Debt Yield Period or (iii) the commencement of a Lease Sweep Period; and will end if, (A) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (i), the Mortgage Loan Event of Default commencing the Trigger Period has been cured and such cure has been accepted by the Mortgage Lender (and no other Mortgage Loan Event of Default is then continuing), or (B) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (ii), the Low Debt Yield Period has ended pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, or (C) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (iii), the Lease Sweep Period has ended pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement (and no other Lease Sweep Period is then continuing).

A “Trigger Period” will commence upon (i) the occurrence of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (ii) the commencement of a Low Debt Yield Period or (iii) the commencement of a Lease Sweep Period; and will end if, (A) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing pursuant to clause (i), the Mortgage Loan Event of Default commencing the Trigger Period has been cured and such cure has been accepted by the Mortgage Lender (and no other Mortgage Loan Event of Default is then continuing), or (B) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (ii), the Low Debt Yield Period has ended pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, or (C) with respect to a Trigger Period continuing due to clause (iii), the Lease Sweep Period has ended pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement (and no other Lease Sweep Period is then continuing).

A “Low Debt Yield Period” will commence if, as of any Calculation Date, the Debt Yield is less than 6.5% (the “Low Debt Yield Threshold” ”); and will end if the Mortgaged Property has achieved both a Debt Yield of at least 6.5% for two consecutive calculation dates.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists, (i) a Low Debt Yield Period will end upon the Borrower delivering to the Mortgaged Lender, as additional collateral and security for the payment of the Debt, immediately available funds or one or more letters of credit having an aggregate notional amount, that, if applied as a prepayment of the Outstanding Principal Balance, would cause the Debt Yield of the Mortgaged Property to equal or exceed the Low Debt Yield Threshold (however, the Borrower’s delivery to the Mortgage Lender of any such letter of credit will not result in the aggregate notional amount of all letters of credit held by the Mortgage Lender pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Documents to exceed ten percent (10%) of the Outstanding Principal Balance and any such letter of credit will be subject to the terms and conditions set forth in the Mortgage Loan Agreement and (ii) so long as the Warner Media Lease is in full force and effect and no monetary default or material non-monetary default beyond all applicable notice and cure periods exists thereunder, then in the event that the Debt Yield is less than the Low Debt Yield Threshold as a result of the Warner Media Tenant’s exercise of the Contraction Option (as defined in the Warner Media Lease) (the “Contraction Option”), no Low Debt Yield Period will apply until such time as the Debt Yield first increases to or above the Low Debt Yield Threshold and then decreases below the Low Debt Yield Threshold as of any calculation date (in which event, from such time and thereafter, this clause (ii) will no longer apply); provided, however, that if the Debt Yield is less than the Low Debt Yield Threshold as a result of the Warner Media Tenant’s exercise of the Contraction Option and the foregoing clause (ii) were to apply, but the same does not apply as a result of the existence of a monetary default or material non-monetary default under the Warner Media Lease, then upon the cure thereof, the Low Debt Yield Period caused by the exercise of the Contraction Option will end and no Low Debt Yield Period will apply until such time as the Debt Yield first increases to or above the Low Debt Yield Threshold and then decreases below the Low Debt Yield Threshold as of any calculation date (in which event, from such time and thereafter, the foregoing clause (ii) will no longer apply).

Notwithstanding the foregoing, provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists, (i) a Low Debt Yield Period will end upon the Borrower delivering to the Mortgaged Lender, as additional collateral and security for the payment of the Debt, immediately available funds or one or more letters of credit having an aggregate notional amount, that, if applied as a prepayment of the Outstanding Principal Balance, would cause the Debt Yield of the Mortgaged Property to equal or exceed the Low Debt Yield Threshold (however, the Borrower’s delivery to the Mortgage Lender of any such letter of credit will not result in the aggregate notional amount of all letters of credit held by the Mortgage Lender pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Documents to exceed ten percent (10%) of the Outstanding Principal Balance and any such letter of credit will be subject to the terms and conditions set forth in the Mortgage Loan Agreement and (ii) so long as the Warner Media Lease is in full force and effect and no monetary default or material non-monetary default beyond all applicable notice and cure periods exists thereunder, then in the event that the Debt Yield is less than the Low Debt Yield Threshold as a result of the Warner Media Tenant’s exercise of the Contraction Option (as defined in the Warner Media Lease) (the “Contraction Option”), no Low Debt Yield Period will apply until such time as the Debt Yield first increases to or above the Low Debt Yield Threshold and then decreases below the Low Debt Yield Threshold as of any calculation date (in which event, from such time and thereafter, this clause (ii) will no longer apply); provided, however, that if the Debt Yield is less than the Low Debt Yield Threshold as a result of the Warner Media Tenant’s exercise of the Contraction Option and the foregoing clause (ii) were to apply, but the same does not apply as a result of the existence of a monetary default or material non-monetary default under the Warner Media Lease, then upon the cure thereof, the Low Debt Yield Period caused by the exercise of the Contraction Option will end and no Low Debt Yield Period will apply until such time as the Debt Yield first increases to or above the Low Debt Yield Threshold and then decreases below the Low Debt Yield Threshold as of any calculation date (in which event, from such time and thereafter, the foregoing clause (ii) will no longer apply).

A “Lease Sweep Period” (i) will commence on the first Payment Date following the occurrence of any of the following: (a) a Lease Sweep Tenant Party Insolvency Proceeding; (b) a failure by Lease Sweep Tenant to pay base rent under the Lease Sweep Lease or other material monetary or material non- monetary default by a Lease Sweep Tenant under its Lease Sweep Lease, in each case, beyond any applicable notice and cure period under such Lease Sweep Lease; (c) the date that any Lease Sweep Tenant “goes dark” (i.e. ceases operations at its Lease Sweep Space at the Property or any portion thereof) such that operations are no longer conducted in a portion of the Lease Sweep Space at least equal to the Lease Sweep Threshold SF (and for purposes of this clause (c), a sublease by Warner Media Tenant to a subtenant of a portion of the Lease Sweep Space will not constitute “dark” space except during the last two (2) years of the term of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, i.e., from and after the Payment Date occurring in July, 2027); (d) the date that Borrower or Property Manager receives written notice from a Lease Sweep Tenant under a Lease Sweep Lease (or any portion of the premises under a Lease Sweep Lease) that it is electing to contract (other than pursuant to the Contraction Option), surrender, cancel or terminate such Lease Sweep Lease (or portion thereof), or electing to not renew its Lease Sweep Lease, or the date that a Lease Sweep Tenant under a Lease Sweep Lease (or any portion of the premises under a Lease Sweep Lease) actually contracts (other than pursuant to the Contraction Option), surrenders, cancels or terminates such Lease Sweep Lease (or portion thereof), in each case, prior to the then current expiration date of such Lease Sweep Lease (or portion thereof), and in each case, such that the applicable Lease Sweep Tenant will no longer occupy at the Mortgaged Property at least the Lease Sweep Threshold SF; or (e) upon a decline in the long-term issuer credit rating of any tenant under a Lease Sweep Lease (or, if such Lease Sweep Lease is guaranteed, a decline in the long- term issuer credit rating of the Lease Sweep Guarantor under such Lease Sweep Lease) below “BB-” by S&P (or the equivalent long-term issuer credit rating by any other Rating Agency); provided, however, that this clause (e) will not apply to any Lease Sweep Lease that replaces the Warner Media Lease unless the tenant under such replacement Lease Sweep Lease (or, if such replacement Lease Sweep Lease is guaranteed, the Lease Sweep Guarantor under such replacement Lease Sweep Lease) has a long-term issuer credit rating of at least “BB-“ by S&P (or the equivalent long-term issuer credit rating by any other Rating Agency) as of the date that such replacement Lease Sweep Lease commences; and (ii) will end upon the first to occur of the following: (A) in the case of clause (i)(a) above, (x) with respect to any Lease Sweep Tenant Party Insolvency Proceeding with respect to Lease Sweep Tenant, (1) the applicable Lease Sweep Lease has been assumed (but not assigned) by the Lease Sweep Tenant without any negative material change in the economics, scope or duration of such Lease Sweep Lease, and a plan of reorganization has been confirmed as to the Lease Sweep Tenant and the effective date of such plan of reorganization has occurred, or (2) the applicable Lease Sweep Lease has been assigned to and assumed by an unaffiliated third party assignee pursuant to an assignment approved in the Lease Sweep Tenant Party Insolvency Proceeding by a non-appealable court order and a replacement guaranty of the Lease Sweep Lease has been executed by a replacement Lease Sweep Guarantor, and (y) with respect to any Lease Sweep Tenant Party Insolvency Proceeding with respect to Lease Sweep Guarantor, (1) the applicable Lease Sweep Lease remains and has remained in full force and effect, and Lease Sweep Tenant has not failed to pay base rent under such Lease Sweep Lease and no other material monetary or material non-monetary defaults have occurred and are continuing under such Lease Sweep Lease, in each case, beyond any applicable notice and cure period (other than a Lease Sweep Tenant Party Insolvency Proceeding with respect to such Lease Sweep Tenant, provided, in such case, the foregoing clause (x) must also be required to be satisfied), and a plan of reorganization has been confirmed as to the Lease Sweep Guarantor and the effective date of such plan of reorganization has occurred (provided, if applicable, the foregoing clause (x) must also be satisfied) or (2) the applicable Lease Sweep Lease has been assigned to and assumed by an unaffiliated third party assignee pursuant to an assignment approved in the Lease Sweep Tenant Party Insolvency Proceeding by a non appealable court order and a replacement guaranty of the Lease Sweep Lease has been executed by a replacement Lease Sweep Guarantor; (B) in the case of clause (i)(b) above, the date on which the subject default has been cured by the Lease Sweep Tenant (and no other failure by Lease Sweep Tenant to pay base rent under the Lease Sweep Lease or other material monetary or material non-monetary default by the Lease Sweep Tenant under its Lease Sweep Lease then exists); (C) in the case of clause (i)(c) or (d) above, the reletting percentage of the rentable square feet of the affected Lease Sweep Space (i.e. the portion of the Lease Sweep Space in which Lease Sweep Tenant has “gone dark” or the portion that has been contracted, surrendered, canceled, terminated or not renewed, as applicable) is leased pursuant to one or more Qualified Leases in full force and effect and entered into in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement and, in the Mortgage Lender’s reasonable judgment, either (x) all Approved Lease Sweep Space Leasing Expenses, free rent periods and/or rent abatement periods set forth in all such Qualified Leases and all other landlord obligations of an inducement nature required to be performed by the Borrower with respect to such Qualified Leases have been completed or paid in full, or (y) sufficient funds have been accumulated in the Lease Sweep Account to cover all anticipated Approved Lease Sweep Space Leasing Expenses, free rent periods, and/or rent abatement periods set forth in all such Qualified Leases and all other landlord obligations of an inducement nature with respect to such Qualified Leases; provided, that with respect to the foregoing clause (y), (1) the Borrower has the right (in lieu of and/or in addition to accumulating sufficient funds in the Lease Sweep Account) to deliver to the Mortgage Lender in immediately available funds for deposit into the Lease Sweep Account, an amount sufficient to satisfy the amounts required under the foregoing clause (y) and/or to deliver to the Mortgage Lender one or more letters of credit having an aggregate notional amount equal to the amount required to satisfy the foregoing clause (y), in each case, taking into account any funds that have been accumulated in the Lease Sweep Account.

“Lease Sweep Deposit Amount” means (i) if a Lease Sweep Period has commenced and is continuing solely pursuant to clause (i)(c) of the definition of Lease Sweep Period, an amount equal to the total rentable square feet of the Lease Sweep Lease (exclusive of (a) any rentable square footage covered by unexercised expansion options and (b) if the Contraction Option has been exercised, from and after the fifth anniversary of the Origination Date, the Contraction Space Square Footage, provided that the Borrower has deposited with the Mortgage Lender the required amounts pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Agreement multiplied by $87.00, (ii) if a Lease Sweep Period has commenced and continuing solely pursuant to clause (i)(e) of the definition of Lease Sweep Period, an amount equal to the total rentable square feet of the Lease Sweep Lease (exclusive of (a) any rentable square footage covered by unexercised expansion options and (b) if the Contraction Option has been exercised, from and after the fifth anniversary of the Origination Date, the Contraction Space Square Footage, provided that the Borrower has deposited with the Mortgage Lender the required amounts pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Agreement multiplied by $50.00, and (iii) in all other circumstances, an amount equal to the total rentable square feet of the Lease Sweep Lease (exclusive of (a) any rentable square footage covered by unexercised expansion options and (b) if the Contraction Option has been exercised, from and after the fifth anniversary of the Origination Date, the Contraction Space Square Footage, provided that the Borrower has deposited with the Mortgage Lender the required amounts pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Agreement) multiplied by $125.00.

“Lease Sweep Threshold SF” means (a) 800,000 rentable square feet, minus (b) if Warner Media Tenant exercises its Contraction Option, the portion of the Contraction Space Square Footage leased pursuant to Qualified Leases then in full force and effect.

Under the Mortgage Loan Documents, provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, on each Payment Date during the continuance of a Trigger Period, all funds in the Deposit Account are required to be applied by the Mortgage Lender to pay the following items in the following amounts and order of priority: (i) first, to the Tax Account, funds sufficient to make the required payments of Tax Funds as described in “—Tax Funds” below; (ii) second, to the Insurance Account, funds sufficient to make the required payments of Insurance Funds as described in “—Insurance Funds” below; (iii) third, to the Condominium Reserve Account, funds sufficient to make the required payments of Condominium Reserve Funds as described in “—Condominium Reserve Funds” below; (iv) fourth, to the Mortgage Lender, funds sufficient to pay the Monthly Debt Service Payment due on such Payment Date, applied to the payment of interest computed at the Interest Rate (plus, if applicable, interest at the Default Rate); (v) fifth, to the Capital Expenditure Account, funds sufficient to make the required payments of Capital Expenditure Funds as described in “—Capital Expenditure Funds” below; (vi) sixth, to the Rollover Account, funds sufficient to make the required payments of Rollover Funds as described in “—Rollover Funds” below; (vii) seventh, to the Mortgage Lender, funds sufficient to pay any other amounts then due and payable under the Mortgage Loan Documents; (viii) eighth, to the Borrower, funds in an amount equal to the monthly budgeted operating expenses; (ix) ninth, to the Borrower, funds sufficient to pay any approved extraordinary operating expenses approved by the Mortgage Lender; (x) tenth, to distributions to any REIT owning a direct or indirect interest in Borrower to enable such REIT to make distributions with respect to any preferred interest issued by it, in an aggregate annual amount not to exceed $100,000; and (xi) eleventh, all amounts remaining after payment of the amounts set forth in clauses (i) through (x) above (the “Available Cash”) will be applied as follows: (A) during the continuance of a Lease Sweep Period, (x) if the Lease Sweep Period is continuing solely based on clause (e) of the definition of Lease Sweep Period, fifty percent (50%) of the Available Cash to the Lease Sweep Account to be held and disbursed in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement, and (y) in all other cases, one hundred percent (100%) of the Available Cash to the Lease Sweep Account to be held and disbursed as described in “—Lease Sweep Funds” below; (B) during the continuance of a Trigger Period that is not caused solely by the continuance of a Lease Sweep Period, all Available Cash that is not deposited into the Lease Sweep Account pursuant to clause (i) above (if any) will be deposited into the Cash Collateral Account to be held and disbursed in accordance with Mortgage Loan Agreement; and/or (C) during the continuance of a Trigger Period that is caused solely by the continuance of a Lease Sweep Period, all Available Cash that is not deposited into the Lease Sweep Account pursuant to clause (i) above (if any) will be disbursed to the Borrower.

Under the Mortgage Loan Documents, provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, on each Payment Date during the continuance of a Trigger Period, all funds in the Deposit Account are required to be applied by the Mortgage Lender to pay the following items in the following amounts and order of priority: (i) first, to the Tax Account, funds sufficient to make the required payments of Tax Funds as described in “—Tax Funds” below; (ii) second, to the Insurance Account, funds sufficient to make the required payments of Insurance Funds as described in “—Insurance Funds” below; (iii) third, to the Condominium Reserve Account, funds sufficient to make the required payments of Condominium Reserve Funds as described in “—Condominium Reserve Funds” below; (iv) fourth, to the Mortgage Lender, funds sufficient to pay the Monthly Debt Service Payment due on such Payment Date, applied to the payment of interest computed at the Interest Rate (plus, if applicable, interest at the Default Rate); (v) fifth, to the Capital Expenditure Account, funds sufficient to make the required payments of Capital Expenditure Funds as described in “—Capital Expenditure Funds” below; (vi) sixth, to the Rollover Account, funds sufficient to make the required payments of Rollover Funds as described in “—Rollover Funds” below; (vii) seventh, to the Mortgage Lender, funds sufficient to pay any other amounts then due and payable under the Mortgage Loan Documents; (viii) eighth, to the Borrower, funds in an amount equal to the monthly budgeted operating expenses; (ix) ninth, to the Borrower, funds sufficient to pay any approved extraordinary operating expenses approved by the Mortgage Lender; (x) tenth, to distributions to any REIT owning a direct or indirect interest in Borrower to enable such REIT to make distributions with respect to any preferred interest issued by it, in an aggregate annual amount not to exceed $100,000; and (xi) eleventh, all amounts remaining after payment of the amounts set forth in clauses (i) through (x) above (the “Available Cash”) will be applied as follows: (A) during the continuance of a Lease Sweep Period, (x) if the Lease Sweep Period is continuing solely based on clause (e) of the definition of Lease Sweep Period, fifty percent (50%) of the Available Cash to the Lease Sweep Account to be held and disbursed in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement, and (y) in all other cases, one hundred percent (100%) of the Available Cash to the Lease Sweep Account to be held and disbursed as described in “—Lease Sweep Funds” below; (B) during the continuance of a Trigger Period that is not caused solely by the continuance of a Lease Sweep Period, all Available Cash that is not deposited into the Lease Sweep Account pursuant to clause (i) above (if any) will be deposited into the Cash Collateral Account to be held and disbursed in accordance with Mortgage Loan Agreement; and/or (C) during the continuance of a Trigger Period that is caused solely by the continuance of a Lease Sweep Period, all Available Cash that is not deposited into the Lease Sweep Account pursuant to clause (i) above (if any) will be disbursed to the Borrower.

Upon the occurrence of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, the Mortgage Lender, at its option, may apply any gross revenue then in the possession of the Mortgage Lender, Whole Loan Servicer or the bank or banks selected by the Mortgage Lender to maintain the Deposit Account (including any reserve funds on deposit in any cash management account) to the payment of the obligations under the Mortgage Loan Documents in such order, proportion and priority as the Mortgage Lender may determine in its sole and absolute discretion.
Notwithstanding the paragraph above, the Borrower’s obligation to make monthly deposits into the Tax Account will be suspended so long as no Trigger Period has occurred and is continuing.

Upon the commencement of a Trigger Period, (i) Borrower’s obligation to make monthly deposits will be reinstated on the immediately succeeding Payment Date, and will continue until such time as such Trigger Period has ceased and (ii) on the first Payment Date following the commencement of such Trigger Period, in addition to the monthly deposit due on such date, Borrower is also required to deliver to Mortgage Lender for deposit into the Tax Account such additional Tax Funds as determined by Mortgage Lender in order to accumulate sufficient funds to pay all Property Taxes for the Mortgaged Property at least thirty (30) days prior to their respective due dates.
Upon the cessation of a Trigger Period, all Tax Funds will be disbursed to the Borrower.
Provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists and remains uncured, the Mortgage Lender will apply Tax Funds in the Tax Account to payments of Property Taxes.

If the amount of the Tax Funds exceeds the amounts due for Property Taxes (including if as a result of Warner Media Tenant making a payment of Property Taxes which relates to Tax Funds then being held in the Tax Account for such payment and the Borrower is not required to reimburse Warner Media Tenant for such payments pursuant to the Warner Media Lease) and provided that no Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists, the Mortgage Lender will, in its sole discretion, either deposit such excess into the Deposit Account as rents or credit such excess against the next payments to be made to the Tax Funds.
Notwithstanding the paragraph above, the Borrower’s obligation to make monthly deposits into the Insurance Account will be suspended so long as no Trigger Period has occurred and is continuing.

Upon the commencement of a Trigger Period subject to the last paragraph under this heading “—Insurance Funds”, (i) Borrower’s obligation to make monthly deposits will be reinstated on the immediately succeeding Payment Date, and will continue until such time as such Trigger Period has ceased and (ii) on the first Payment Date following the commencement of such Trigger Period, in addition to the monthly deposit due on such date, Borrower is also required to deliver to Mortgage Lender for deposit into the Insurance Account such additional Insurance Funds as determined by Mortgage Lender in order to accumulate sufficient funds to pay all insurance premiums for the Mortgaged Property at least thirty (30) days prior to their respective due dates.
Upon the cessation of a Trigger Period, all Insurance Funds will be disbursed to Borrower.

Provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists and remains uncured, the Mortgage Lender will apply Insurance Funds in the Insurance Account to the timely payment of insurance premiums, provided the Borrower will be required to furnish the Mortgage Lender with all bills, invoices and statements for the insurance premiums for which such funds are required at least 30 days prior to the date on which such charges first become payable.

If the amount of the Insurance Funds exceeds the amounts due for insurance premiums (including if as a result of Warner Media Tenant paying the Insurance Premiums which relate to the Insurance Funds then being held in the Insurance Account and the Borrower is not required to reimburse Warner Media Tenant for such payment pursuant to the Warner Media Lease) and provided that no Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists, the Mortgage Lender will, in its sole discretion, either deposit such excess into the Deposit Account as rents or credit such excess against the next payments to be made to the Insurance Funds.

Notwithstanding the paragraph above (but subject to the last sentence in this paragraph), the Borrower’s obligation to make monthly deposits into the Capital Expenditure Account will be suspended so long as no Trigger Period has occurred and is continuing.

Upon the commencement of a Trigger Period, Borrower’s obligation to make monthly deposits will be reinstated on the immediately succeeding Payment Date, and will continue until such time as such Trigger Period has ceased.
Upon the cessation of a Trigger Period, all Capital Expenditure Funds will be disbursed to Borrower.

Provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists and remains uncured, the Mortgage Lender will disburse Capital Expenditure Funds to the Borrower out of the Capital Expenditure Account, within ten (10) days after the delivery by the Borrower to Mortgage Lender of a request therefor (but not more often than once per month), in increments of at least $5,000 (or a lesser amount if the total amount in the Capital Expenditure Account is less than $5,000, in which case only one disbursement of the amount remaining in the account may be made) provided that: (i) such disbursement is for an Approved Capital Expenditure; (ii) the request for disbursement is accompanied by (A) an officer’s certificate from the Borrower (1) stating that the items to be funded by the requested disbursement are Approved Capital Expenditures, and a description thereof, including a budget for any Approved Capital Expenditures, (2) to the Borrower’s knowledge, stating that all Approved Capital Expenditures to be funded by the requested disbursement have been completed (or completed to the extent of the requested disbursement) in a good and workmanlike manner and in compliance, in all material respects, with all applicable legal requirements, (3) identifying each person that supplied materials or labor in connection with the Approved Capital Expenditures to be funded by the requested disbursement, (4) stating that each such person has been paid in full or will be paid in full upon such disbursement, or if such payment is a progress payment, that such payment represents full payment to such person, less any applicable retention amount, for work completed through the date of the relevant invoice from such person, (5) stating that the Approved Capital Expenditures (or the relevant portions thereof) to be funded from the disbursement in question have not been the subject of a previous disbursement, (6) stating that all previous disbursements of Capital Expenditure Funds have been used to pay the previously identifieApproved Capital Expenditures, and (7) stating that all outstanding Approved Capital Expenditures (other than those to be paid from the requested disbursement) have been paid in full other than any applicable retention amount, (B) a copy of any license, permit or other approval required at the current stage of work by any governmental authority in connection with the Approved Capital Expenditures and not previously delivered to Mortgage Lender, (C) with respect to the prior disbursement of Approved Capital Expenditures, copies of appropriate lien waivers or other evidence of payment reasonably satisfactory to Mortgage Lender, and (D) at Mortgage Lender’s option for any disbursement(s) that when aggregated together with other disbursements from the Capital Expenditures Funds, the Rollover Funds, the Leasing Sweep Funds and the Contraction Space Funds, equal $5,000,000 or more since the last title search, a title search for the Mortgaged Property indicating that the Mortgaged Property is free from all liens, claims and other encumbrances that do not constitute Permitted Encumbrances, and (F) such other evidence as Mortgage Lender may reasonably request to demonstrate that the Approved Capital Expenditures to be funded by the requested disbursement have been completed and are paid for or will be paid upon such disbursement to the Borrower (or the portion thereof as to which such request for disbursement has been submitted has been completed and is paid for (other than any retention amount which is not a part of such disbursement request) or will be paid upon such disbursement to the Borrower) and (iii) if such disbursement request is for $100,000 or more, Mortgage Lender, may if it desires verify (by an inspection conducted at the Borrower’s expense) performance of the work associated with such Approved Capital Expenditure.

The following items are also required to be deposited into a sub-account of the Deposit Account (the “Rollover Account”) and held as the “Rollover Funds”: (i) other than any Lease Sweep Lease Termination Payments and any Contraction Payment (which will be deposited into the Contraction Space Account), all sums paid with respect to lease modifications of any lease (or otherwise paid in connection with the Borrower taking any action under any lease (e.g., granting a consent) or waiving any provision thereof), settlement of claims of the Borrower against third parties in connection with any lease, any termination payments, and any sum received from a tenant to obtain a consent to assignment, sublease or holdover, or any security deposit held by the Borrower following a default under a lease, and (ii) any other extraordinary event pursuant to which the Borrower receives payments derived from the use, ownership or operation of the Mortgaged Property.

Provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing, the Mortgage Lender will disburse Rollover Funds to Borrower out of the Rollover Account to pay or reimburse Borrower for Approved Leasing Expenses, within ten (10) days after the delivery by Borrower to Mortgage Lender of a request therefor (but not more often than once per month), in increments of at least $5,000 provided that: (i) such disbursement is for an Approved Leasing Expense and (ii) the request for disbursement is accompanied by (A) an officer’s certificate from Borrower (1) stating that the items to be funded by the requested disbursement are Approved Leasing Expenses, and a description thereof, including a budget for any Approved Leasing Expenses, (2) to Borrower’s knowledge, stating that any tenant improvements at the Mortgaged Property to be funded by the requested disbursement (or the relevant portion thereof as to which such request for funds relates) have been completed in a good and workmanlike manner, and in compliance, in all material respects, with all applicable legal requirements, (3) identifying each person that supplied materials or labor in connection with the Approved Leasing Expenses to be funded by the requested disbursement, (4) stating that each such person has been paid in full or will be paid in full upon such disbursement, or if such payment is a progress payment, that such payment represents full payment to such person, less any applicable retention amount, for work completed through the date of the relevant invoice from such person, (5) stating that the Approved Leasing Expenses (or the relevant portions thereof) to be funded from the disbursement in question have not been the subject of a previous disbursement, (6) stating that all previous disbursements of Rollover Funds have been used to pay the previously identified Approved Leasing Expenses, (7) stating that all outstanding Approved Leasing Expenses (other than those to be paid from the requested disbursement) have been paid in full and (8) stating that any tenant improvements at the Mortgaged Property to be funded by the requested disbursement (or the relevant portion thereof as to which such request for funds relates) have been completed in accordance with the applicable leases, (B) a copy of any license, permit or other approval by any governmental authority required at the current stage of work in connection with the tenant improvements and not previously delivered to Mortgage Lender, (C) with respect to the prior disbursement of Approved Leasing Expenses, copies of appropriate lien waivers or other evidence of payment reasonably satisfactory to Mortgage Lender, and (D) at Mortgage Lender’s option for any disbursement(s) that when aggregated together with other disbursements from the Capital Expenditures Funds, the Rollover Funds, the Leasing Sweep Funds and the Contraction Space Funds, equal $5,000,000 or more since the last title search, a title search for the Mortgaged Property indicating that the Mortgaged Property is free from all liens, claims and other encumbrances that do not constitute Permitted Encumbrances.

On each Payment Date during a Lease Sweep Period, all Available Cash (other than Available Cash being deposited into the Cash Collateral Account or being disbursed to the Borrower) is required to be paid to the Mortgage Lender, which amounts will be transferred by the Mortgage Lender into an account (the “Lease Sweep Account”).

Provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing, the Mortgage Lender will disburse Lease Sweep Funds to Borrower out of the Lease Sweep Account, within ten (10) days after the delivery by Borrower to Mortgage Lender of a request therefor (but not more often than once per month), in increments of at least $5,000 provided that: (i) such disbursement is for an Approved Lease Sweep Space Leasing Expense and (ii) the request for disbursement is accompanied by (A) an officer’s certificate from Borrower (1) stating that the items to be funded by the requested disbursement are Approved Lease Sweep Space Leasing Expenses, and a description thereof, including a budget for any Approved Lease Sweep Space Leasing Expenses, (2) to Borrower’s knowledge, stating that any tenant improvements at the Mortgaged Property to be funded by the requested disbursement (or the relevant portion thereof as to which such request for funds relates) have been completed in a good and workmanlike manner and in compliance, in all material respects, with all applicable legal requirements, (3) stating that the Approved Lease Sweep Space Leasing Expenses (or the relevant portions thereof) to be funded from the disbursement in question have not been the subject of a previous disbursement, (4) stating that all previous disbursements of Lease Sweep Funds have been used to pay the previously identified Approved Lease Sweep Space Leasing Expenses, and (5) stating that all outstanding Approved Lease Sweep Space Leasing Expenses (other than those to be paid from the requested disbursement) have been paid in full, (B) a copy of any license, permit or other approval by any governmental authority required at the current stage of work in connection with the tenant improvements and not previously delivered to Mortgage Lender, (C) with respect to the prior disbursement of Approved Lease Sweep Space Leasing Expenses, copies of appropriate lien waivers or other evidence of payment reasonably satisfactory to Mortgage Lender, and (D) at Mortgage Lender’s option for any disbursement(s) that when aggregated together with other disbursements from the at Mortgage Lender’s option for any disbursement(s) that when aggregated together with other disbursements from the Capital Expenditures Funds, the Rollover Funds, the Leasing Sweep Funds and the Contraction Space Funds, equal $5,000,000 or more since the last title search, a title search for the Mortgaged Property indicating that the Mortgaged Property is free from all liens, claims and other encumbrances that do not constitute Permitted Encumbrances.

Provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing, funds deposited in the Lease Sweep Account with respect to the Lease Sweep Space not previously disbursed or applied will be disbursed (x) provided no Trigger Period is continuing, to Borrower or (y) if a Trigger Period is continuing, on the next occurring Payment Date, as follows: (i) if the Lease Sweep Period for such Lease Sweep Space ceased as described by clause (ii)(C) or clause (ii)(E) of the definition of “Lease Sweep Period”, any such remaining Lease Sweep Funds applicable to the Lease Sweep Space in question will be disbursed once all Occupancy Conditions are satisfied with respect to the Lease Sweep Space, less (x) sufficient funds (which are not allocated to the obligations under any other Lease) to pay any remaining leasing commissions, tenant improvement obligations or other landlord obligations of an inducement nature under such Lease Sweep Lease, as reasonably determined by the Mortgage Lender, will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed to the Borrower for Approved Lease Sweep Space Leasing Expenses in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement and (y) sufficient funds (which are not allocated to the obligations under any other Lease) to account for all remaining scheduled free rent periods, rent abatements and other offsets to rent until the applicable tenant actually commences paying full contractual rent (without abatement or offset), as reasonably determined by Lender, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be disbursed to the Borrower (if no Trigger Period is then continuing) or into the Deposit Account (if a Trigger Period is then continuing) on each Payment Date in amounts sufficient to replicate full contractual rents under each applicable Lease in accordance with a schedule to be delivered to, and reasonably approved by, the Mortgage Lender; or (ii) if the Lease Sweep Period for such Lease Sweep Space ceased as described by clause (ii)(A), clause (ii)(B) or clause (ii)(D) of the definition of “Lease Sweep Period”, all remaining Lease Sweep Funds applicable to the Lease Sweep Space in question will be disbursed once the applicable conditions described in clause (ii)(A) or clause (ii)(C), as applicable, of the definition of “Lease Sweep Period” have been met.

Provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing, funds deposited in the Lease Sweep Account with respect to the Lease Sweep Space not previously disbursed or applied will be disbursed (x) provided no Trigger Period is continuing, to Borrower or (y) if a Trigger Period is continuing, on the next occurring Payment Date, as follows: (i) if the Lease Sweep Period for such Lease Sweep Space ceased as described by clause (ii)(C) or clause (ii)(E) of the definition of “Lease Sweep Period”, any such remaining Lease Sweep Funds applicable to the Lease Sweep Space in question will be disbursed once all Occupancy Conditions are satisfied with respect to the Lease Sweep Space, less (x) sufficient funds (which are not allocated to the obligations under any other Lease) to pay any remaining leasing commissions, tenant improvement obligations or other landlord obligations of an inducement nature under such Lease Sweep Lease, as reasonably determined by the Mortgage Lender, will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be periodically disbursed to the Borrower for Approved Lease Sweep Space Leasing Expenses in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement and (y) sufficient funds (which are not allocated to the obligations under any other Lease) to account for all remaining scheduled free rent periods, rent abatements and other offsets to rent until the applicable tenant actually commences paying full contractual rent (without abatement or offset), as reasonably determined by Lender, which amount will be retained in the Lease Sweep Account and will be disbursed to the Borrower (if no Trigger Period is then continuing) or into the Deposit Account (if a Trigger Period is then continuing) on each Payment Date in amounts sufficient to replicate full contractual rents under each applicable Lease in accordance with a schedule to be delivered to, and reasonably approved by, the Mortgage Lender; or (ii) if the Lease Sweep Period for such Lease Sweep Space ceased as described by clause (ii)(A), clause (ii)(B) or clause (ii)(D) of the definition of “Lease Sweep Period”, all remaining Lease Sweep Funds applicable to the Lease Sweep Space in question will be disbursed once the applicable conditions described in clause (ii)(A) or clause (ii)(C), as applicable, of the definition of “Lease Sweep Period” have been met.

Provided that no Mortgage Loan Event of Default then exists, insurance proceeds treated as business or rental interruption insurance (to the extent of available funds) will be applied by Mortgage Lender, on each Payment Date, (A) in accordance with priorities described under “—Deposit Account” above (other than the last clause (xii) with respect to Available Cash) (the “Approved Monthly BI Expenses”) for such month, regardless of whether a Trigger Period is continuing, and (B) second, to the extent that Mortgage Lender determines that the amount of business or rental interruption insurance proceeds then remaining in the Casualty and Condemnation Account is sufficient to pay for all future Approved Monthly BI Expenses through the completion of the subject Restoration and stabilization of the Mortgaged Property, disbursed by Mortgage Lender to Borrower in an aggregate amount under this clause (B) not to exceed the Approved Monthly BI Expenses actually incurred and paid for by Borrower from the date of the applicable Casualty to the date of the first installment of business or rental interruption insurance proceeds advanced by the applicable insurance company (as evidenced by supporting documentation by Borrower that is reasonably acceptable to Mortgage Lender).

Provided no Trigger Period then exists, all remaining business or rental interruption insurance proceeds will be disbursed to Borrower upon the final completion of the subject Restoration and the recommencement of full unabated rent being paid by the tenants under the leases required to remain in place under clause (iii) of the fourth paragraph under “—Casualty and Condemnation” below.

If a Trigger Period has occurred and is continuing, any and all Available Cash (other than Available Cash being deposited into the Lease Sweep Account) will be required to be paid to the Mortgage Lender, which amounts are required to be transferred by the Mortgage Lender into a subaccount of the Deposit Account (the “Cash Collateral Account”)

Provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, if amounts on deposit in the Rollover Account and the Contraction Space Amount are not sufficient to pay any Approved Leasing Expenses, Mortgage Lender is required to, upon request of Borrower, disburse Cash Collateral Funds to pay or reimburse Borrower for such Approved Leasing Expenses (subject to the satisfaction of the conditions precedent for disbursement of Rollover Funds described under “—Rollover Funds” above or (with respect to the Contraction Space) Contraction Space Funds described under “—Contraction Space Funds” above).
Any Cash Collateral Funds then on deposit in the Cash Collateral Account not previously disbursed or applied will, upon the termination of such Trigger Period, be disbursed to Borrower

During the continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, the Mortgage Lender has the right, but not the obligation, at any time during the continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, in its sole and absolute discretion, to apply any and all Cash Collateral Funds then on deposit in the Cash Collateral Account to the Whole Loan or obligations under the Mortgage Loan Documents, in its sole and absolute discretion, including to make a prepayment of principal (together with the applicable Prepayment Fee and/or Liquidated Damages, if any, applicable thereto).

Notwithstanding the paragraph above, the Borrower’s obligation to make monthly deposits into the Condominium Reserve Account will be suspended so long as no Trigger Period has occurred and is continuing.

Upon the commencement of a Trigger Period, (i) Borrower’s obligation to make monthly deposits will be reinstated on the immediately succeeding Payment Date, and will continue until such time as such Trigger Period has ceased and (ii) on the first Payment Date following the commencement of such Trigger Period, in addition to the monthly deposit due on such date, Borrower is also required to deliver to Mortgage Lender for deposit into the Condominium Reserve Account such additional Condominium Reserve Funds as determined by Mortgage Lender in order to accumulate sufficient funds to pay all Common Charges for the Mortgaged Property at least thirty (30) days prior to their respective due dates.
Upon the cessation of a Trigger Period, all Condominium Reserve Funds will be disbursed to Borrower.

If the amount of the Condominium Reserve Funds exceeds the amounts due for Common Charges and provided that no Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists, the Mortgage Lender will, in its sole discretion, either deposit such excess into the Deposit Account as rents or credit such excess against the next payments to be made to the Condominium Reserve Funds.

After payment of (i) all costs and expenses of the Borrower incurred in connection with Warner Media Tenant’s exercise of the Contraction Option (including, without limitation, any costs of subdividing and demising the Borrower Condominium Unit, the modifications described on Exhibit I to the Warner Media Lease and all reasonable out-of-pocket costs and expenses of the Mortgage Lender incurred in connection with the Contraction Option), (ii) all amounts due to Warner Media Tenant in connection with such Contraction Option (including, without limitation, prorations of prior expenditures of Warner Media Tenant relating to the Contraction Space), and (iii) the deposit of the Contraction Space Escrow Amount in the Contraction Space Account, all remaining amounts of the Contraction Payment (the “Remaining Contraction Payment”) must be (x) if a Trigger Period is then continuing, deposited by the Borrower into the Cash Collateral Account and (y) if no Trigger Period is then continuing, retained by the Borrower.

Provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing, the Mortgage Lender will be required to disburse Contraction Space Funds to the Borrower out of the Contraction Space Account, within ten (10) days after the delivery by the Borrower to the Mortgage Lender of a request therefor (but not more often than once per month), in increments of at least $5,000 provided that: (i) such disbursement is for an Approved Leasing Expenses pursuant to Qualified Leases for the Contraction Space (provided, no amounts for free rent may be disbursed until either (A) all leasing commissions, tenant improvement obligations or other landlord obligations of an inducement nature under such Qualified Lease, as reasonably determined by the Mortgage Lender, have been completed, or (B) in the Mortgage Lender’s reasonable determination, funds are available in the Contraction Space Account in excess of the unpaid leasing commissions, tenant improvement obligations and other landlord inducements, in which case, such excess funds will be available to be disbursed to fund such free rent), (ii) the Qualified Lease is in full force and effect, (iii) the aggregate Approved Leasing Expenses pursuant to Qualified Leases will not exceed an amount equal to the portion of the Contraction Space Square Footage then leased pursuant to Qualified Leases, multiplied by $125.00 (unless such excess is escrowed with the Mortgage Lender), and (iv) the request for disbursement is accompanied by (A) an officer’s certificate from the Borrower (1) stating that the items to be funded by the requested disbursement are Approved Leasing Expenses, and a description thereof, including a budget for any Approved Leasing Expenses, (2) to the Borrower’s knowledge, stating that any tenant improvements at the Mortgaged Property to be funded by the requested disbursement (or the relevant portion thereof as to which such request for funds relates) have been completed in a good and workmanlike manner and in compliance, in all material respects, with all applicable legal requirements, (3) stating that the Approved Leasing Expenses (or the relevant portions thereof) to be funded from the disbursement in question have not been the subject of a previous disbursement, (4) stating that all previous disbursements of Contraction Space Funds have been used to pay the previously identified Approved Leasing Expenses, and (5) stating that all outstanding Approved Leasing Expenses (other than those to be paid from the requested disbursement) have been paid in full, (B) a copy of any license, permit or other approval by any governmental authority required at the current stage of work in connection with the tenant improvements and not previously delivered to the Mortgage Lender, (C) with respect to the prior disbursement of Approved Leasing Expenses, copies of appropriate lien waivers or other evidence of payment reasonably satisfactory to the Mortgage Lender, and (D) at the Mortgage Lender’s option for any disbursement(s) that when aggregated together with other disbursements from the Capital Expenditures Funds, the Rollover Funds, the Leasing Sweep Funds and the Contraction Space Funds, equal $5,000,000 or more since the last title search, a title search for the Mortgaged Property indicating that the Mortgaged Property is free from all liens, claims and other encumbrances that do not constitute Permitted Encumbrances.

Provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing, all funds on deposit in the Contraction Space Account with respect to the Contraction Space not previously disbursed or applied must be disbursed (x) provided no Trigger Period is continuing, to the Borrower or (y) if a Trigger Period is continuing, on the next occurring Payment Date, into the Deposit Account to be applied as described in “—Deposit Account” above, in each case, as follows: any such remaining Contraction Space Funds will be disbursed once all Occupancy Conditions (Contraction Space) are satisfied with respect to the Contraction Space, less (x) sufficient funds (which are not allocated to the obligations under any other lease) to pay any remaining leasing commissions, tenant improvement obligations or other landlord obligations of an inducement nature under such Qualified Leases, as reasonably determined by the Mortgage Lender, will be retained in the Contraction Space Account and will be periodically disbursed to the Borrower for Approved Leasing Expenses for such Contraction Space Lease in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement as described in the previous paragraph and (y) sufficient funds to account for all remaining scheduled free rent periods, rent abatements and other offsets to rent until the tenants under all Qualified Leases actually commence paying full contractual rent (without abatement or offset), as reasonably determined by the Mortgage Lender, which amount will be retained in the Contraction Space Account and will be disbursed to the Borrower (if no Trigger Period is then continuing) or into the Deposit Account (if a Trigger Period is then continuing) on each Payment Date in amounts sufficient to replicate full contractual rents under each applicable Qualified Lease in accordance with a schedule to be delivered to, and reasonably approved by, the Mortgage Lender.

If no Trigger Period exists, the funds in the clearing account will be swept on each business day into Borrower’s operating account and, if a Trigger Period exists, such funds will be swept on each business day into a deposit account controlled by the Lender (the “CMA”).
During a Trigger Period, funds in the CMA will be applied and disbursed in accordance with the Whole Loan documents.

During a Trigger Period, all excess cash (or 50% of all excess cash with respect to certain lease sweep triggers) after payment of the monthly debt service on the Whole Loan, all required reserves and budgeted operating expenses, and certain other items in the waterfall described in the Whole Loan documents will be reserved into a lease sweep reserve or cash collateral account as additional collateral for the Whole Loan.

So long as no event of default is continuing under certain circumstances and for limited purposes described in the Whole Loan documents, the Borrower may request disbursements of such excess cash flow.

A “Trigger Period” will be continuing (i) during an uncured event of default under the Whole Loan documents, (ii) during a Lease Sweep Period (defined below) or (iii) upon the occurrence of a Low Debt Yield Trigger (defined below).

A “Trigger Period” will be continuing (i) during an uncured event of default under the Whole Loan documents, (ii) during a Lease Sweep Period (defined below) or (iii) upon the occurrence of a Low Debt Yield Trigger (defined below).

A “Trigger Period” will be continuing (i) during an uncured event of default under the Whole Loan documents, (ii) during a Lease Sweep Period (defined below) or (iii) upon the occurrence of a Low Debt Yield Trigger (defined below).

On each business day, the financial institution maintaining the restricted account is required to remit all funds on deposit in the deposit account to (i) for so long as no Trigger Period is continuing, an operating account of the Borrowers and (ii) during the continuance of a Trigger Period, a cash management account (the “Cash Management Account”) which is required to be established upon the first occurrence of a Trigger Period.

During the continuance of a Trigger Period, all excess cash flow (after payment of debt service on the Mortgage Loan, required reserves and operating expenses) will be deposited to an excess cash flow reserve account.

A “Trigger Period” means a period commencing upon the earliest of (1) the occurrence and continuance of a Loan Event of Default, (2) the Debt Yield falling below 6.25% and (3) the commencement of a Specified Tenant Trigger Period (as defined under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Restricted Account”) and will end if the most recent Trigger Period commenced in connection with: (A) clause (1) above, upon the cure of such Loan Event of Default, (B) clause (2) above, the date upon which the Debt Yield, determined as of the last day of a calendar quarter, exceeds 6.50% and (C) clause (3) above, when the Specified Tenant Trigger Period no longer exists.

A “Trigger Period” means a period commencing upon the earliest of (1) the occurrence and continuance of a Loan Event of Default, (2) the Debt Yield falling below 6.25% and (3) the commencement of a Specified Tenant Trigger Period (as defined under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Restricted Account”) and will end if the most recent Trigger Period commenced in connection with: (A) clause (1) above, upon the cure of such Loan Event of Default, (B) clause (2) above, the date upon which the Debt Yield, determined as of the last day of a calendar quarter, exceeds 6.50% and (C) clause (3) above, when the Specified Tenant Trigger Period no longer exists.

A “Trigger Period” means a period commencing upon the earliest of (1) the occurrence and continuance of a Loan Event of Default, (2) the Debt Yield falling below 6.25% and (3) the commencement of a Specified Tenant Trigger Period (as defined under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Restricted Account”) and will end if the most recent Trigger Period commenced in connection with: (A) clause (1) above, upon the cure of such Loan Event of Default, (B) clause (2) above, the date upon which the Debt Yield, determined as of the last day of a calendar quarter, exceeds 6.50% and (C) clause (3) above, when the Specified Tenant Trigger Period no longer exists.

The Mortgage Loan Documents require the Borrowers to maintain and fund the following reserve accounts, each of which are subaccounts of the Cash Management Account: an account funded by the Borrowers on the Origination Date in an amount equal to approximately $10,676,679 for the purpose of reserving for the estimated costs of the capital improvements designated as of the Origination Date (the “Origination Date Capital Improvements Account”) as described under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserve Accounts—Origination Date Capital Improvements Account”; an account funded by the Borrowers on the Origination Date in an amount equal to approximately $16,677,149 for the purpose of reserving for unfunded obligations required to be funded by the Borrowers and other amounts in respect of free or prepaid rent, tenant improvements, gap rent, leasing commissions and common area maintenance reconciliation amounts (the “Unfunded Obligations Account”) as described under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserve Accounts— Unfunded Obligations Account”; an account funded by the Borrowers on the Origination Date in an amount equal to $894,490 for the purpose of reserving for the estimated costs of the immediate repairs designated as of the Origination Date (the “Immediate Repair Account”) as described under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserve Accounts—Immediate Repair Account”; an account funded monthly by the Borrowers for the purpose of reserving amounts payable with respect to replacements and capital repairs (the “Capital Expenditures Reserve Account”) in a monthly amount equal to approximately $18,556 as described under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserve Accounts—Capital Expenditures Reserve Account”; an account funded monthly by the Borrowers for the purpose of reserving amounts payable with respect to tenant improvements and leasing commissions (the “Leasing Reserve Account”) in a monthly amount equal to approximately $29,930 (subject to an aggregate cap of $500,000) as described under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserve Accounts— Leasing Reserve Account”; an account funded monthly by the Borrowers for the purpose of reserving amounts payable with respect of taxes and insurance premiums payable with respect to the Property (the “Tax and Insurance Account”) in a monthly amount equal to 1/12th of the projected annual taxes and insurance premiums as described under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserve Accounts—Tax and Insurance Account”; on each Payment Date during the continuance of a Trigger Period, an account for the purpose of reserving amounts payable with respect to approved operating expenses and approved extraordinary expenses (the “Operating Expense Account”) in a monthly amount equal the operating expenses included in the annual budget for the Property and/or approved by the lenders as described under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserve Accounts—Operating Expense Account”; on each Payment Date during the continuance of a Trigger Period, an account with respect to excess cash flow (after payment of all required debt service, reserves and operating expenses) as described under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Cash Management” (the “Excess Cash Flow Account”) (and if no Loan Event of Default is continuing, amounts in the Excess Cash Flow Account will be released to the Cash Management Account) as described under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Reserve Accounts—Excess Cash Flow Account”.

So long as no Trigger Period is in effect and no Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, funds on deposit in the Restricted Account will be released to the Borrowers’ operating account on each Business Day.
No funds are required to be deposited into the Operating Expense Account or Excess Cash Flow Account so long as no Trigger Period is in effect.

Pursuant to the Restricted Account Agreement, funds on deposit in the Restricted Account are required to be transferred on each Business Day or at the direction of the Borrowers unless a Trigger Period exists, in which case such funds are required to be transferred on each Business Day to the Cash Management Account.

Upon the first occurrence of a Trigger Period, the lenders, on the Borrowers’ behalf, are required to establish, pursuant to the Cash Management Agreement, an Eligible Account (the “Cash Management Account”) with the Cash Management Bank, in the name of the Borrowers for the sole and exclusive benefit of the lenders.

Upon the first occurrence of a Trigger Period, the lenders, on the Borrowers’ behalf, will also establish with the lenders or the Servicer, pursuant to the Cash Management Agreement, an Eligible Account into which the Borrowers are required to deposit, or cause to be deposited the amounts required for the payment of debt service under the Mortgage Loan (the “Debt Service Account”).

Upon the expiration of a Trigger Period, so long as no other Trigger Period is then continuing, the lenders are required to send a direction letter to Cash Management Bank within ten Business Days following such expiration, directing the Cash Management Bank to transfer all funds on deposit in the Cash Management Account to the account specified by the Borrowers; provided that upon the occurrence and during the continuance of a subsequent Trigger Period, the lenders may send a notice rescinding such direction letter.
