The Borrowers will not be required to make deposits into the applicable Reserve Accounts during the continuance of a Trigger Period if sufficient funds to make such deposits (taking into account the priority of payment in “—Cash Management Account below) are deposited in the Cash Management Account.

“Specified Tenant Cure Conditions” means any of the following, as applicable, (i) in the event the Specified Tenant Trigger Period is due to the events described in clause (a)(i) of the definition of “Specified Tenant Trigger Period,” the applicable Specified Tenant is no longer insolvent or subject to any bankruptcy or insolvency proceedings and has, if applicable, affirmed the applicable Specified Tenant Lease pursuant to final, non-appealable order of a court of competent jurisdiction or one or more replacement tenants reasonably acceptable to the lenders (if the lenders’ acceptance is otherwise required under the Mortgage Loan Agreement) is occupying (or is obligated under its lease to occupy) such Specified Tenant’s space pursuant to a lease entered into by the Borrowers in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement, which is in full force and effect and is paying full unabated rent (or any abated rent has been deposited into the Unfunded Obligations Account or otherwise reserved by the lenders), (ii) in the event the Specified Tenant Trigger Period is due to the events described in clause (a)(ii) of the definition of “Specified Tenant Trigger Period,” the lenders’ receipt of evidence reasonably satisfactory to it that one or more replacement tenants reasonably acceptable to the lenders (if the lenders’ acceptance is otherwise required under the Mortgage Loan Agreement) is occupying (or is obligated under its lease to occupy) such Specified Tenant’s space pursuant to a lease entered into by the Borrowers in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement, which is in full force and effect and is paying full unabated rent (or any abated rent has been deposited into the Unfunded Obligations Account or otherwise reserved by the lenders), (iii) in the event the Specified Tenant Trigger Period is due to the events described in clause (a)(iii) of the definition of “Specified Tenant Trigger Period,” the lenders’ receipt of evidence reasonably satisfactory to it that the applicable Specified Tenant has cured all Specified Tenant Defaults under the applicable Specified Tenant Lease or one or more replacement tenants reasonably acceptable to the lenders (if the lenders’ acceptance is otherwise required under the Mortgage Loan Agreement) is occupying (or is obligated under its lease to occupy) such Specified Tenant’s space pursuant to a lease entered into by the Borrowers in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement, which is in full force and effect and is paying full unabated rent (or any abated rent has been deposited into the Unfunded Obligations Account or otherwise reserved by the lenders), (iv) in the event the Specified Tenant Trigger Period is due to the events described in clause (a)(iv) of the definition of “Specified Tenant Trigger Period,” the lenders’ receipt of evidence reasonably satisfactory to them that the failure by the WeWork Tenant described in such definition has been remedied and (v) in the event the Specified Tenant Trigger Period is due to the events described in clause (a)(v) of the definition of “Specified Tenant Trigger Period,” the applicable Specified Tenant has revoked or rescinded all termination or cancellation notices with respect to the applicable Specified Tenant Lease and has re-affirmed the applicable Specified Tenant Lease as being in full force and effect or one or more replacement tenants reasonably acceptable to the lenders (if the lenders’ acceptance is otherwise required under the Mortgage Loan Agreement) is occupying (or is obligated under its lease to occupy) such Specified Tenant’s space pursuant to a lease entered into by the Borrowers in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement, which is in full force and effect and is paying full unabated rent (or any abated rent has been deposited into the Unfunded Obligations Account or otherwise reserved by the lenders).
“Specified Tenant Default” means an “Event of Default” as such term is defined in any Specified Tenant Lease, beyond any applicable notice and cure periods set forth in such lease.

“Specified Tenant Trigger Period” means a period (a) commencing upon any of (i) any bankruptcy proceeding or similar insolvency proceeding of any Specified Tenant, (ii) any termination or cancellation of any Specified Tenant Lease (including, without limitation, rejection in any bankruptcy or similar insolvency proceeding) and/or any Specified Tenant Lease failing to otherwise be in full force and effect, (iii) any Specified Tenant Default, (iv) so long as the WeWork Tenant is a Specified Tenant, the Borrowers’ receipt of knowledge that such WeWork Tenant, or any Affiliate of WeWork Tenant occupying space in the improvements at the Property, has failed, for a continuous period of at least 90 days, to have at least 50% of its available leased space in the improvements at the Property (i.e., excluding the Second Expansion Premises prior to the Second Expansion Rent Commencement Date and any space that is unavailable due to casualty, permitted tenant work or reorganization/moving of members, licensees, sublessees and/or employees in the ordinary course of WeWork Tenant’s business operations) open for business to (i.e., made available for use by) its members, licensees, sublessees and/or employees in each case during customary hours in such Specified Tenant Space, (v) any Specified Tenant giving written notice to the Borrowers that it is terminating its lease for all or any portion of its Specified Tenant Space that is 20% or more of the rentable square footage of the improvements; and (b) expiring upon the lenders’ receipt of evidence reasonably acceptable to the lenders of the satisfaction of the Specified Tenant Cure Conditions.

“Trigger Period” means a period: (A) commencing upon the earliest of: (i) the occurrence and continuance of a Loan Event of Default; (ii) the Debt Yield falling below 6.25%; and (iii) the commencement of a Specified Tenant Trigger Period; and (B) expiring upon: (x) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (A)(i) above, the curing of such Loan Event of Default; (y) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (A)(ii) above, the date that the Debt Yield is equal to or greater than 6.50% for one calendar quarter; and (z) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (A)(iii) above, a Specified Tenant Trigger Period ceasing to exist in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

“Trigger Period” means a period: (A) commencing upon the earliest of: (i) the occurrence and continuance of a Loan Event of Default; (ii) the Debt Yield falling below 6.25%; and (iii) the commencement of a Specified Tenant Trigger Period; and (B) expiring upon: (x) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (A)(i) above, the curing of such Loan Event of Default; (y) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (A)(ii) above, the date that the Debt Yield is equal to or greater than 6.50% for one calendar quarter; and (z) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (A)(iii) above, a Specified Tenant Trigger Period ceasing to exist in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

“Trigger Period” means a period: (A) commencing upon the earliest of: (i) the occurrence and continuance of a Loan Event of Default; (ii) the Debt Yield falling below 6.25%; and (iii) the commencement of a Specified Tenant Trigger Period; and (B) expiring upon: (x) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (A)(i) above, the curing of such Loan Event of Default; (y) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (A)(ii) above, the date that the Debt Yield is equal to or greater than 6.50% for one calendar quarter; and (z) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (A)(iii) above, a Specified Tenant Trigger Period ceasing to exist in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, a Trigger Period will not be deemed to expire in the event that a Trigger Period then exists for any other reason.

On each Payment Date, the lenders or the Servicer, as applicable, is required to allocate all funds, if any, on deposit in the Cash Management Account and disburse such funds in the following amounts and order of priority: (a) first, funds sufficient to pay the Monthly Tax Deposit due for the then applicable Payment Date, if any, are required to be deposited in the Tax Account; (b) second, funds sufficient to pay the Monthly Insurance Deposit due for the then applicable Payment Date, if any, are required to be deposited in the Insurance Account; (c) third, funds sufficient to pay any interest accruing at the Default Rate and late payment charges, if any, are required to be deposited into the Debt Service Account; (d) fourth, funds sufficient to pay the debt service due on the then applicable Payment Date (without duplication of any portion of such debt service already deposited in the Cash Management Account under clause (c) above) are required to be deposited in the Debt Service Account;(e) fifth, funds sufficient to pay the Op Ex Monthly Deposit for the then applicable Payment Date, if any, are required to be deposited in the Operating Expense Account; (f) sixth, funds sufficient to pay the Leasing Reserve Monthly Deposit for the then applicable Payment Date, if any, are required to be deposited in the Leasing Reserve Account; (g) seventh, funds sufficient to pay the Capital Expenditures Reserve Monthly Deposit for the then applicable Payment Date, if any, are required to be deposited in the Capital Expenditures Reserve Account; (h) eighth, without duplication of funds set forth in clauses (c) and (d), funds sufficient to pay any other amounts due and owing to the lenders and/or the Servicer pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement and/or of the other Mortgage Loan Documents, if any, are required to be deposited with or as directed by the lenders; and (i) ninth, all amounts remaining in the Cash Management Account after deposits for items (a) through (h) above (“Excess Cash Flow”) are required to be (i) to the extent a Trigger Period has occurred and is continuing, deposited into the Excess Cash Flow Account and (ii) to the extent that no Trigger Period occurs, be promptly disbursed to the Borrowers.

Unless a Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, any Origination Date Capital Improvements Reserve Funds remaining on deposit in the Origination Date Capital Improvements Reserve Account after, in the lenders’ reasonable judgment, completion and/or payment, as applicable, of all Origination Date Capital Improvements will be released to the Borrowers or, if a Trigger Period is then continuing, deposited by the lenders in the Restricted Account.

The lenders are required to disburse to the Borrowers (or, during a Trigger Period, deposit into the Restricted Account) any Unfunded Obligation Funds constituting Replacement Rent on a monthly basis in an amount equal to the amount that would otherwise have been payable under the applicable lease.

Unless a Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, any Unfunded Obligations Funds (other than amounts deposited in connection with the Second Expansion Premises) remaining on deposit in the Unfunded Obligations Account after completion and/or payment, as applicable (in the lenders’ reasonable judgment) of all Unfunded Obligations (including the expiration of any related free rent periods) are required to be released to the Borrowers or, if a Trigger Period is then continuing, deposited by the lenders in the Restricted Account.

Unless a Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, any Unfunded Obligations Funds deposited in connection with the Second Expansion Premises remaining on deposit in the Unfunded Obligations Account following the expiration of the free rent period following the occurrence of the Second Expansion Rent Commencement Date are required to be released to the Borrowers or, if a Trigger Period is then continuing, deposited by the lenders in the Restricted Account.

Unless a Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, any Immediate Repair Funds remaining on deposit in the Immediate Repair Account after completion and/or payment, as applicable (in the lenders’ reasonable judgment) of all Immediate Repairs will be released to the Borrowers or, if a Trigger Period is then continuing, deposited by the lenders in the Restricted Account.

The lenders are required to disburse to the Borrowers the Capital Expenditures Reserve Funds upon satisfaction by the Borrowers of each of the following conditions: (i) the Borrowers submit a request for payment to the lenders at least 10 days prior to the date on which the Borrowers request such payment be made and specify the Capital Expenditures to be paid or for which the Borrowers will be reimbursed); (ii) on the date such request is received by the lenders and on the date such payment is to be made, no Loan Event of Default exists and remains uncured, (iii) the lenders have received a certificate from the Borrowers (A) stating that the items to be funded (or reimbursed) by the requested disbursement are Capital Expenditures, (B) stating that all Capital Expenditures at the Property to be funded (or reimbursed) by the requested disbursement have been completed, to the extent of such payment, in a good and workmanlike manner and, to the Borrowers’ knowledge, in accordance with all applicable legal requirements, such certificate to be accompanied by a copy of any license, permit or other approval required by any governmental authority in connection with the Capital Expenditures (if any), (C) identifying each Person that supplied materials or labor in connection with the Capital Expenditures to be funded (or reimbursed) by the requested disbursement and (D) stating that each such Person has performed in full the work that is the subject of such disbursement, such certificate to be accompanied by lien waivers, invoices and/or other evidence of payment reasonably satisfactory to the lenders; (iv) at the lenders’ option, if the cost of any individual disbursement request for Capital Expenditure Reserve Funds exceeds $250,000, a title search for the Property indicating that the Property is free from all liens, claims and other encumbrances other than Permitted Encumbrances; and (v) at the lenders’ option, if the cost of any individual disbursement request for Capital Expenditures Reserve Funds exceeds $250,000, the lenders have verified (by an inspection conducted at the Borrowers’ expense) performance of the work associated with such Capital Expenditure.

The lenders are required to disburse to the Borrowers the Leasing Reserve Funds (other than any termination fees) upon satisfaction by the Borrowers of each of the following conditions: (i) the Borrowers submit a request for payment to the lenders at least ten days prior to the date on which the Borrowers request such payment be made and specify the tenant improvement costs and leasing commissions to be paid (or for which the Borrowers will be reimbursed); (ii) on the date such request is received by the lenders and on the date such payment is to be made, no Loan Event of Default exists and remains uncured; (iii) the lenders have reviewed and, if required under the Mortgage Loan Agreement, approved the lease and related leasing commissions in respect of which the Borrowers are obligated to pay or reimburse certain tenant improvement costs and leasing commissions; (iv) the lenders have received and, if required under the Mortgage Loan Agreement, approved a budget for tenant improvement costs and a schedule of leasing commissions payments and the requested disbursement will be used to pay all or a portion of such costs and payments; (v) the lenders have received evidence from the Borrowers, reasonably acceptable to the lenders, that (A) all tenant improvements at the Property to be funded (or reimbursed) by the requested disbursement have been completed in good and workmanlike manner and in accordance with all applicable federal, state and local laws, rules and regulations, including a copy of any license, permit or other approval by any governmental authority required in connection with the tenant improvements (to the extent the applicable tenant is required to deliver the same to the Borrowers) and (B) each Person that supplied materials or labor in connection with the tenant improvements has been paid in full or will be paid in full upon such disbursement, including lien waivers, invoices and/or other evidence of payment reasonably satisfactory to the lenders; and (vi) at the lenders’ option, if the cost of any individual disbursement request for Leasing Reserve Funds exceeds $250,000, a title search for the Property indicating that the Property is free from all liens, claims and other encumbrances not previously approved by the lenders.

On each Payment Date, any termination fee held in the Leasing Reserve Account (other than any termination fee with respect to the WeWork Lease) is required to be released to the Borrowers (or, during a Trigger Period, deposited into the Restricted Account) in an amount equal to the amount of rent that would otherwise have been payable under the applicable lease; provided, however, that the lenders will retain an amount equal to $100 per square foot of the termination fee in the Leasing Reserve Account until the applicable premises subject to the terminated lease is relet to a new tenant who is occupying (or is obligated under its lease to occupy) such premises pursuant to a lease entered into in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement, which is in full force and effect and paying full unabated rent (or any abated rent is being reserved under the Mortgage Loan Agreement).
Upon any such reletting, if no Trigger Period then exists, any balance remaining of such termination fee will be released to the Borrowers.

Provided there are sufficient amounts in the Tax Account and Insurance Account, respectively, and no Loan Event of Default is continuing, the lenders are obligated to pay the Taxes and insurance premiums as they become due on their respective due dates on behalf of the Borrowers by applying the Tax and Insurance Funds to the payment of such Taxes and insurance premiums.

Provided no Loan Event of Default is continuing, the lenders are required to disburse the Operating Expense Funds to the Borrowers to pay Approved Operating Expenses and/or Approved Extraordinary Expenses upon the Borrowers’ request (which such request is required to be accompanied by an officer’s certificate detailing the applicable expenses to which the requested disbursement relates and attesting that such expense will be paid with the requested disbursement).

On each Payment Date occurring on and after the occurrence and continuance of a Trigger Period, the Borrowers are required to deposit (or to cause there to be deposited in accordance with “—Cash Management Account”) into an Eligible Account held by the lenders or Servicer (the “Operating Expense Account”) an amount equal to the aggregate amount of Approved Operating Expenses and Approved Extraordinary Expenses to be incurred by the Borrowers for the then current Loan Interest Accrual Period (such amount, the “Op Ex Monthly Deposit”).

Provided no Loan Event of Default is continuing, the lenders are required to disburse the Operating Expense Funds to the Borrowers to pay Approved Operating Expenses and/or Approved Extraordinary Expenses upon the Borrowers’ request (which such request is required to be accompanied by an officer’s certificate detailing the applicable expenses to which the requested disbursement relates and attesting that such expense will be paid with the requested disbursement).
After a Trigger Period has ended, any funds available in the Operating Expense Account will be released to the Borrowers.

On each Payment Date occurring on and after the occurrence and continuance of a Trigger Period, the Borrowers are required to deposit (or cause to be deposited pursuant to “—Cash Management Account” above) into an Eligible Account with the lenders or the Servicer (the “Excess Cash Flow Account”) an amount equal to the Excess Cash Flow generated by the Property for the immediately preceding Loan Interest Accrual Period (the amounts on deposit in the Excess Cash Flow Account, the “Excess Cash Flow Funds”).

Provided no Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, any Excess Cash Flow Funds remaining in the Excess Cash Flow Account are required to be disbursed to the Borrowers upon the expiration of any Trigger Period in accordance with the applicable terms and conditions under the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

The Borrowers are required to fund the following reserves monthly: (i) a tax and insurance reserve in amounts sufficient to accumulate payments for property taxes and, unless a blanket policy is in place or an event of default is continuing, insurance premiums; (ii) a capital expenditures reserve in the amount of approximately $18,556; (iii) a tenant improvements and leasing commissions reserve in the amount of approximately $29,930, capped at $500,000; (iv) during a Trigger Period (as defined below), an operating expense reserve in an amount equal to the operating expenses included in the annual budget for the Property and/or approved by the Lenders for the then current interest accrual period; and (v) during a Trigger Period, an excess cash flow reserve for all remaining excess cash flow amounts after payment of debt service, required reserves and operating expenses to be held as additional collateral.

“Specified Tenant Trigger Period” means (A) the bankruptcy of a Specified Tenant; (B) the termination of a Specified Tenant’s lease; (C) a default under a Specified Tenant’s lease; (D) the WeWork Tenant or an affiliate failing to have at least 50% of leased space open for business for a period of at least 90 days; or (E) if a Specified Tenant gives notice that it is terminating its lease for all or any portion of its space that is 20% or more of the rentable square footage at the Property.

“Trigger Period” means a period (A) commencing upon the earliest of (i) the occurrence and continuance of an event of default, (ii) the Debt Yield falling below 6.25%, and (iii) the commencement of a Specified Tenant Trigger Period; and (B) expiring upon (x) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (i) above, the cure (if applicable) of such event of default, (y) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (ii) above, the date that the Debt Yield is equal to or greater than 6.50% for one calendar quarter, and (z) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (iii) above, the Specified Tenant Trigger Period ceasing to exist.

“Trigger Period” means a period (A) commencing upon the earliest of (i) the occurrence and continuance of an event of default, (ii) the Debt Yield falling below 6.25%, and (iii) the commencement of a Specified Tenant Trigger Period; and (B) expiring upon (x) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (i) above, the cure (if applicable) of such event of default, (y) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (ii) above, the date that the Debt Yield is equal to or greater than 6.50% for one calendar quarter, and (z) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (iii) above, the Specified Tenant Trigger Period ceasing to exist.

“Trigger Period” means a period (A) commencing upon the earliest of (i) the occurrence and continuance of an event of default, (ii) the Debt Yield falling below 6.25%, and (iii) the commencement of a Specified Tenant Trigger Period; and (B) expiring upon (x) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (i) above, the cure (if applicable) of such event of default, (y) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (ii) above, the date that the Debt Yield is equal to or greater than 6.50% for one calendar quarter, and (z) with regard to any Trigger Period commenced in connection with clause (iii) above, the Specified Tenant Trigger Period ceasing to exist.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, a Trigger Period will not expire in the event that a Trigger Period then exists for any other reason.

The Borrowers established a clearing account or concentration account for each Property that is not a Property managed by the Marriot Manager (each, a “Marriott Managed Property”) and entered into a cash management agreement for the establishment of a cash management account upon the occurrence of a Cash Trap Period under the Mortgage Loan.

All amounts (other than a reasonable minimum balance and certain reasonable fees) in the clearing accounts will be transferred to the applicable concentration account (which may be transferred absent a Cash Trap Period to a separate account of the Operating Lessee).

Upon the occurrence and continuance of a Cash Trap Period under the Mortgage Loan, all amounts (other than a reasonable minimum balance and certain reasonable fees) on deposit in the sweep accounts will be swept into the cash management account and will be applied as described under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Clearing Account, Concentration Account and Cash Management Account” in this Offering Circular.

A “Cash Trap Period” is deemed to occur when either (i) the debt yield falls below 9.0% (the “Debt Yield Threshold”) for two consecutive calendar quarters, based on the trailing 12 month period (a “Debt Yield Trigger Event”) or (ii) an event of default under the Mortgage Loan has occurred and is continuing (an “EOD Trigger”).

A “Cash Trap Period” is deemed to occur when either (i) the debt yield falls below 9.0% (the “Debt Yield Threshold”) for two consecutive calendar quarters, based on the trailing 12 month period (a “Debt Yield Trigger Event”) or (ii) an event of default under the Mortgage Loan has occurred and is continuing (an “EOD Trigger”).

A Cash Trap Period ceases if (I) in the event of a Debt Yield Trigger Event, the debt yield equals or exceeds the Debt Yield Threshold for two consecutive calendar quarters, which may be achieved by making voluntary prepayments of amounts sufficient to satisfy the Debt Yield Threshold, or (II) in the event of an EOD Trigger, no events of default under the Mortgage Loan have occurred and are continuing.

A Cash Trap Period ceases if (I) in the event of a Debt Yield Trigger Event, the debt yield equals or exceeds the Debt Yield Threshold for two consecutive calendar quarters, which may be achieved by making voluntary prepayments of amounts sufficient to satisfy the Debt Yield Threshold, or (II) in the event of an EOD Trigger, no events of default under the Mortgage Loan have occurred and are continuing.

The Mortgage Loan Documents require the Borrowers and/or the Operating Lessees to fund (subject to exceptions described below) the following ongoing reserve funds (together with the Origination Date Replacement Reserve Funds and the PIP Letter of Credit, collectively, the “Reserve Funds”): during a Cash Trap Period, an ongoing tax and insurance escrow account (the “Tax and Insurance Escrow Fund”) for taxes and insurance premiums payable with respect to the Properties.

The Borrowers are required to deposit into the Tax and Insurance Escrow Fund on each Payment Date during a Cash Trap Period under the Mortgage Loan an amount equal to (i) 1/12th of the annual taxes reasonably estimated by the lender to be payable with respect to the Properties during the next ensuing 12 months in order to accumulate sufficient funds to pay all such taxes at least 30 days prior to their respective due dates and (ii) 1/12th of the annual insurance premiums reasonably estimated by the lender to be payable during the next ensuing 12 months for the renewal of the insurance policies required to be maintained under the Mortgage Loan Documents in order to accumulate sufficient funds to pay all such insurance premiums at least 30 days prior to the expiration of the insurance policies; provided, that with respect to taxes and/or insurance premiums for any Brand Managed Property that are reserved for in an account maintained by the applicable Property Manager pursuant to the applicable management agreement or are previously paid for by the applicable Property Manager, so long as the Borrower delivers to the lender the invoices or other evidence of payment that the applicable Property Managers are holding such required funds, the required deposits for such Properties will be reduced on a dollar-for-dollar basis by such amount; provided, further that for so long as no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing, the Borrowers will not be required to make deposits for insurance premiums if insurance coverage is provided under a blanket policy reasonably acceptable to the lender; during a Cash Trap Period, an ongoing replacement reserve account (the “Replacement Reserve Fund”) for payment of certain fixtures, furnishings and equipment expenditures (and certain PIP work as further described under “Description of the Mortgage Loan—Replacement Reserve Fund”).

The Borrowers are required to deposit into the Replacement Reserve Account on each Payment Date during a Cash Trap Period, an amount equal to the greater for (A) the deposit for FF&E, replacements and repairs if any, required to be deposited with any related franchisor or related Property Manager pursuant to the applicable franchise agreement or management agreement (without duplication) to which a Borrower is a party, and (B) 4.0% of gross income from operations for the Properties, in each case for the calendar month two calendar months prior to the calendar month of the Payment Date on which such deposit is required; provided, that replacements will not include expense items that would otherwise be expensed in the operating statements of the Properties pursuant to the Uniform System of Accounts (unless such expense items are unanticipated repair and maintenance expenses in connection with replacements not contemplated by the annual budget); provided further, that for so long as the Borrowers maintain the related Brand Managed Properties in accordance with the applicable management agreement, the required deposit will be reduced on a dollar-for-dollar basis by any budgeted amounts deposited into the applicable manager account for replacements for the applicable month if the Borrowers deliver evidence reasonably satisfactory to the lender that such deposit has been made; during a Cash Trap Period, an ongoing ground lease reserve account (the “Ground Lease Reserve Fund”) for ground rent with respect to the related Property.

The Borrowers are required to deposit into the Ground Lease Reserve Fund on each Payment Date during a Cash Trap Period an amount equal to 1/12th of the ground rent due under the ground leases for any related Property, which the lender reasonably estimates will be payable by the related Borrower during the next ensuing 12 months to pay all such ground rent at least 30 days prior to the date due under the related ground lease; and during a Cash Trap Period, unless the Guarantor has delivered an excess cash flow guaranty in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, the Borrowers are required to deposit into a reserve account (the “Excess Cash Flow Reserve Fund”) all remaining amounts on deposit in the Cash Management Account after payment of all escrows, reserves, approved operating expenses, debt service, management fees and other amounts required to be made in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Documents (the “Excess Cash Flow”).

With respect to each of the Properties other than the Marriott Managed Properties, the Properties are subject to springing cash management, and the related Property Manager is required to cause all revenues from such Property to be deposited into a clearing account, which funds, in the absence of a Cash Trap Event, will be transferred to the related Operating Lessee.

Therefore, in the absence of a Cash Trap Event, reserves will not be funded automatically and the lender has less assurance that the Borrowers and Operating Lessees will comply with all the reserve requirements using cash flow from those Properties.

As a result, the lender’s control over these reserve funds will be limited even after the occurrence of an event of default under the Mortgage Loan Agreement so long as the related Management Agreement has not been terminated.

The Operating Lessees have established Clearing Accounts and Concentration Accounts and will, upon the occurrence of a Cash Trap Period, establish a Cash Management Account with respect to the Mortgage Loan and the Properties which will serve as collateral for the Mortgage Loan.

All amounts (other than a reasonable minimum balance and certain reasonable fees) in the Clearing Accounts will be transferred to the applicable concentration account (each, a “Concentration Account” and collectively, the “Concentration Accounts”) which will then be transferred absent a Cash Trap Period to the Operating Lessees as directed by the Operating Lessees in accordance with the account control agreements for the applicable Concentration Account.

During a Cash Trap Period, all amounts (other than a reasonable minimum balance and certain reasonable fees) on deposit in the Concentration Accounts (other than a reasonable minimum balance and certain reasonable fees) will be transferred, not less than two times per week, to the cash management account established for the Mortgage Loan (the “Cash Management Account”) maintained by an eligible cash management agent in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement (the “Agent”).

Pursuant to the Cash Management Agreement on each business day during a Cash Trap Period, all funds on deposit (other than a reasonable minimum balance and certain reasonable fees) in the Cash Management Account are to be applied in the following order of priority: (i) to any amounts required under the Mortgage Loan Agreement to be deposited into the Ground Lease Reserve Fund; (ii) to pay any amounts required by the Mortgage Loan Agreement to be deposited into the Tax and Insurance Escrow Fund; (iii) to pay any sales, use and occupancy taxes and custodial funds due into the hotel taxes and custodial funds subaccount; (iv) to pay the due and payable fees and expenses of the Agent, to the related Agent subaccount; (v) to pay the monthly debt service payment due on the next occurring Payment Date, to the mortgage debt service subaccount; (vi) to pay any interest due and payable at the Default Rate (less amounts already paid pursuant to clause (v) above), late payment charges and other amounts then due under the Mortgage Loan Documents with respect to the Mortgage Loan debt (other than the payment of any outstanding principal balance on the Maturity Date, whether such Maturity Date is the scheduled maturity date or an earlier date due to an acceleration of the Mortgage Loan), to the debt service subaccount; (vii) payments for operating expenses (including without limitation, management fees) for the applicable period in accordance with the annual budget or Approved Annual Budget, to the operating expense subaccount; (viii) to pay any amounts required by the Mortgage Loan Agreement to be deposited into the related Replacement Reserve Fund; (ix) during a Cash Trap Period, all amounts remaining in the Cash Management Account after deposits for items described in clauses (i) through (viii) above to the related excess cash flow reserve subaccount to be used as described in “—Excess Cash Flow Reserve Fund” under this Offering Circular unless an excess cash flow guaranty has been executed and delivered to the lender, in which case such remaining amounts permitted to be disbursed to the Operating Lessees in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement will be disbursed to the Operating Lessees and (x) if a Cash Trap Period is no longer continuing, all amounts remaining in the Cash Management Account after deposits for items described in clauses (i) through (ix) above to the Operating Lessees’ remainder account.

Notwithstanding anything contained in the Mortgage Loan Agreement or Mortgage Loan Documents to the contrary, if a Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing under the Mortgage Loan, and a Priority Payment Cessation Event under the Mortgage Loan has not occurred, (i) the lender will apply amounts on deposit in the Cash Management Account (in excess of the minimum balance) to payment of (a) the items described in clauses (i) through (iii) above, provided that such amounts have not previously been paid or reserved for by the applicable Marriott Managers with respect to the related Marriott Managed Properties in accordance with the related Brand Management Agreements (the “Priority Waterfall Payments”), and (b) provided that all Priority Waterfall Payments have been made, Protective Advances related to the Mortgage Loan and (ii) any amounts remaining in the Cash the lender in such order and priority as the lender will determine.
“Cash Trap Event” means the occurrence of (i) a Mortgage Loan Event of Default or (ii) a Debt Yield Trigger Event.
“Cash Trap Event” means the occurrence of (i) a Mortgage Loan Event of Default or (ii) a Debt Yield Trigger Event.

“Cash Trap Event Cure” means (a) no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing, and in the event that the related Cash Trap Event occurred solely as a result of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, the lender (in its sole and absolute discretion) has accepted a cure by the Borrowers of the Mortgage Loan Event of Default and (b) in the event that a Cash Trap Event occurred as a result of a Debt Yield Trigger Event, the achievement of a Debt Yield Cure with respect to the Mortgage Loan.

“Cash Trap Event Cure” means (a) no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing, and in the event that the related Cash Trap Event occurred solely as a result of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, the lender (in its sole and absolute discretion) has accepted a cure by the Borrowers of the Mortgage Loan Event of Default and (b) in the event that a Cash Trap Event occurred as a result of a Debt Yield Trigger Event, the achievement of a Debt Yield Cure with respect to the Mortgage Loan.

“Debt Yield Cure” means (a) no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing and (b) the achievement of a Debt Yield equal to or exceeding the Required Debt Yield for the two consecutive calendar quarters immediately preceding the date of determination based upon the trailing 12-month period immediately preceding such date of determination (which Required Debt Yield may be achieved at the Borrowers’ sole discretion, by making voluntary prepayments in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement in amounts necessary to achieve such Required Debt Yield); provided that in the event the Required Debt Yield is achieved by such a prepayment, the Debt Yield Trigger Period will terminate upon such prepayment.

“Debt Yield Cure” means (a) no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing and (b) the achievement of a Debt Yield equal to or exceeding the Required Debt Yield for the two consecutive calendar quarters immediately preceding the date of determination based upon the trailing 12-month period immediately preceding such date of determination (which Required Debt Yield may be achieved at the Borrowers’ sole discretion, by making voluntary prepayments in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement in amounts necessary to achieve such Required Debt Yield); provided that in the event the Required Debt Yield is achieved by such a prepayment, the Debt Yield Trigger Period will terminate upon such prepayment.

“Debt Yield Trigger Event” means the occurrence of a Debt Yield of less than the Required Debt Yield on any date of determination for the two consecutive calendar quarters immediately preceding the date of such determination, based upon the trailing 12-month period immediately preceding such date of determination, as determined by the lender.
“Debt Yield Trigger Period” means the period commencing on the occurrence of a Debt Yield Trigger Event and continuing until the occurrence of a Debt Yield Cure.
“Required Debt Yield” means 9.00%.

Under the terms of the Mortgage Loan Documents, during a Cash Trap Period the Borrowers are required to maintain a reserve fund (the “Tax and Insurance Escrow Fund”) for Taxes and insurance premiums payable with respect to the Properties.

The Borrowers are required to deposit into the Tax and Insurance Escrow Fund on each Payment Date during a Cash Trap Period under the Mortgage Loan an amount equal to (i) 1/12th of the annual Taxes reasonably estimated by the lender to be payable with respect to the Properties during the next ensuing 12 months in order to accumulate sufficient funds to pay all such Taxes at least 30 days prior to their respective due dates and (ii) 1/12th of the annual insurance premiums reasonably estimated by the lender to be payable during the next ensuing 12 months for the renewal of the insurance policies required to be maintained under the Mortgage Loan Documents in order to accumulate sufficient funds to pay all such insurance premiums at least 30 days prior to the expiration of the insurance policies; provided, that with respect to Taxes and/or insurance premiums for any Brand Managed Property that are reserved for in a bank account maintained by a Brand Manager in the name of the applicable individual Borrower or Operating Lessee, as applicable, in accordance with the terms of the applicable Brand Management Agreement (each such account, a “Manager Account”) or are previously paid for by the applicable Brand Managers, so long as the Borrowers deliver to the lender, the invoices or other evidence of payment that the applicable Brand Managers are holding such required funds, the required deposits for such Properties will be reduced on a dollar-to-dollar basis by such amount; provided, further, that for so long as no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is continuing under the Mortgage Loan, the Borrowers will not be required to make deposits for insurance premiums if insurance coverage is provided under a blanket policy reasonably acceptable to the lender.

In addition, with respect to any individual Property located in Florida, if a Cash Trap Period has occurred and is continuing, the lender will use commercially reasonable efforts to provide the applicable Borrowers with any notice required by Section 501.137, Florida Statutes.

Pursuant to the Mortgage Loan Documents, on each Payment Date during a Cash Trap Period, the Borrowers are required to pay to the lender an amount equal to the greater of (i) the deposit for Replacements, if any, required to be deposited with Franchisor or Manager pursuant to the applicable Franchise Agreement or Management Agreement (without duplication) and (ii) 4% of gross income from operations for the calendar month that is two calendar months prior to the calendar month in which the applicable deposit to the Replacement Reserve Fund is to be made (the “Replacement Reserve Monthly Deposit”) to fund Replacements, PIP work and Brand Mandated Work; provided, that for so long as the Borrowers maintain the related Brand Managed Properties in accordance with the applicable Brand Management Agreement, the Replacement Reserve Monthly Deposit will be reduced on a dollar for- dollar basis by any budgeted amounts deposited into the applicable Manager Account for replacements and Brand Mandated Work for the applicable calendar month as set forth in the annual budget and required pursuant to the terms of the applicable Brand Management Agreement if the Borrowers deliver evidence reasonably satisfactory to the lender that such deposit has been made.
In no event will the lender be obligated to disburse Replacement Reserve Funds to the Borrowers if a Mortgage Loan Event of Default exists under the Mortgage Loan.

During a Cash Trap Period under the Mortgage Loan, the lender will have the right to approve all contracts or work orders in connection with related replacements and PIP work for amounts greater than $500,000 (such approval is not to be unreasonably withheld, delayed or conditioned, and with respect to the Brand Managed Properties, will be limited to the extent that the Borrowers and/or the Operating Lessees have the right to approve such contracts under the applicable Brand Management Agreement).

The lender will also have the right to require an inspection of a related Property during a Cash Trap Period under the Mortgage Loan, in connection with any single related Replacement (other than a single replacement that is an approved alteration or PIP work or Brand Mandated Work) in excess of $1,000,000, prior to making a monthly disbursement from the Replacement Reserve Fund.

Under the terms of the Mortgage Loan Documents, during a Cash Trap Period the Borrowers are required to maintain a reserve fund (the “Ground Lease Reserve Fund”) for the payment of ground rent with respect to the related Property.

The Borrowers are required to deposit on each Payment Date during a Cash Trap Period under the Mortgage Loan an amount equal to 1/12th of the ground rent due under the related Ground Lease, which the lender reasonably estimates will be payable by the Borrowers during the next ensuing 12 months to pay all such ground rent at least 30 days prior to the date due under each related Ground Lease.

During a Cash Trap Period under the Mortgage Loan, unless an excess cash flow guaranty is delivered in accordance with the terms of the Mortgage Loan Agreement, the Borrowers are required to deposit into a reserve fund (the “Excess Cash Flow Reserve Fund”) all remaining amounts on deposit in the Cash Management Account after payment of all escrows, reserves, approved operating expenses, debt service, management fees and other amounts required to be made in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Documents (the “Excess Cash Flow”).

During a Debt Yield Trigger Period under the Mortgage Loan, so long as no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing under the Mortgage Loan and no bankruptcy action of any Borrower has occurred, upon written request of the Borrowers, the lender will be required to disburse within three Business Days of the Borrowers’ request and no more frequently than bimonthly, funds from the related Excess Cash Flow Reserve Fund for: (i) payment of any operating expenses (including management fees, franchise fees and other fees, charges or costs, payable to any related Property Manager under the related Management Agreement or Franchisor under the related Franchise Agreement), (ii) emergency repairs and/or life safety issues (including any capital expenditures) at any related Property which the lender will endeavor to fund within one Business Day of the Borrowers’ request for such funds, (iii) capital expenditures and replacements, PIP work and Brand Mandated Work (after application of amounts then on deposit in the Replacement Reserve Fund), (iv) sales, use and occupancy taxes and custodial funds, (v) costs incurred in connection with the purchase of any FF&E or renewal, extension or purchase of an Alterations Letter of Credit, Restoration Letter of Credit or a PIP Letter of Credit, (vi) costs incurred in connection with the purchase, extension or amendment of any interest rate cap agreement or replacement interest rate cap agreement required under the Mortgage Loan Documents, (vii) voluntary prepayment of the Mortgage Loan in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Documents or, (viii) legal, audit, tax and accounting (including actual costs incurred by BREIT OP (directly or indirectly) and its service providers for back-office accounting and for costs associated with the Property or the Borrowers); provided that excess cash flow will not be used for expenses in connection with (A) the enforcement of the Borrowers’ or the Operating Lessees’ rights under the Mortgage Loan Documents or (B) any defense of any enforcement by the lender of its rights under the Mortgage Loan Documents, (ix) payment of condominium common charges, association fees or other expenses and charges of condominiums and ground rent or other costs or expenses payable pursuant to any Ground Lease, (x) costs of restoration in excess of available Net Proceeds, (xi) debt service, (xii) any fees and costs payable by the Borrowers, with respect to the Mortgage Loan, including to the lender, subject to and in compliance with the Mortgage Loan Documents, including, without limitation costs to extend any PLL Policy, (xiii) costs associated with existing leases or any new leases entered into pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Documents, including costs related to tenant improvement allowances, leasing commissions, tenant related capital expenditures, tenant inducement payments and relocation costs, vacant space preparation costs and marketing costs with respect to potential leasing at the Property (after application of amounts then on deposit in the Replacement Reserve Fund), (xiv) principal prepayments of the Mortgage Loan in the amount necessary to satisfy a Debt Yield Cure, (xv) approved alterations, (xvi) payment of shortfalls in the required deposits into the related reserve accounts (in each case, to the extent required in the Mortgage Loan Agreement and the cash management agreement); (xvii) Permitted REIT Distributions; and (xviii) such other items as reasonably approved by the lender.

During a Debt Yield Trigger Period under the Mortgage Loan, so long as no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing under the Mortgage Loan and no bankruptcy action of any Borrower has occurred, upon written request of the Borrowers, the lender will be required to disburse within three Business Days of the Borrowers’ request and no more frequently than bimonthly, funds from the related Excess Cash Flow Reserve Fund for: (i) payment of any operating expenses (including management fees, franchise fees and other fees, charges or costs, payable to any related Property Manager under the related Management Agreement or Franchisor under the related Franchise Agreement), (ii) emergency repairs and/or life safety issues (including any capital expenditures) at any related Property which the lender will endeavor to fund within one Business Day of the Borrowers’ request for such funds, (iii) capital expenditures and replacements, PIP work and Brand Mandated Work (after application of amounts then on deposit in the Replacement Reserve Fund), (iv) sales, use and occupancy taxes and custodial funds, (v) costs incurred in connection with the purchase of any FF&E or renewal, extension or purchase of an Alterations Letter of Credit, Restoration Letter of Credit or a PIP Letter of Credit, (vi) costs incurred in connection with the purchase, extension or amendment of any interest rate cap agreement or replacement interest rate cap agreement required under the Mortgage Loan Documents, (vii) voluntary prepayment of the Mortgage Loan in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Documents or, (viii) legal, audit, tax and accounting (including actual costs incurred by BREIT OP (directly or indirectly) and its service providers for back-office accounting and for costs associated with the Property or the Borrowers); provided that excess cash flow will not be used for expenses in connection with (A) the enforcement of the Borrowers’ or the Operating Lessees’ rights under the Mortgage Loan Documents or (B) any defense of any enforcement by the lender of its rights under the Mortgage Loan Documents, (ix) payment of condominium common charges, association fees or other expenses and charges of condominiums and ground rent or other costs or expenses payable pursuant to any Ground Lease, (x) costs of restoration in excess of available Net Proceeds, (xi) debt service, (xii) any fees and costs payable by the Borrowers, with respect to the Mortgage Loan, including to the lender, subject to and in compliance with the Mortgage Loan Documents, including, without limitation costs to extend any PLL Policy, (xiii) costs associated with existing leases or any new leases entered into pursuant to the terms of the Mortgage Loan Documents, including costs related to tenant improvement allowances, leasing commissions, tenant related capital expenditures, tenant inducement payments and relocation costs, vacant space preparation costs and marketing costs with respect to potential leasing at the Property (after application of amounts then on deposit in the Replacement Reserve Fund), (xiv) principal prepayments of the Mortgage Loan in the amount necessary to satisfy a Debt Yield Cure, (xv) approved alterations, (xvi) payment of shortfalls in the required deposits into the related reserve accounts (in each case, to the extent required in the Mortgage Loan Agreement and the cash management agreement); (xvii) Permitted REIT Distributions; and (xviii) such other items as reasonably approved by the lender.

Upon the occurrence of a Cash Trap Event Cure under the Mortgage Loan, all excess cash flow reserve funds will be deposited into the Cash Management Account to be disbursed in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

In lieu of the Borrowers depositing all Excess Cash Flow into the Excess Cash Flow Reserve Fund and for so long as no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, the Borrowers will have the right to cause the Guarantor to deliver to the lender the excess cash flow guaranty, provided, that, as a condition precedent to the delivery of such excess cash flow guaranty to the lender, the Borrowers will deliver to the lender, at the Borrowers’ sole cost and expense (i) an additional insolvency opinion in respect of such excess cash flow guaranty in form and substance reasonably satisfactory to the lender and (ii) a legal opinion that the excess cash flow guaranty has been duly authorized, executed and delivered by the Guarantor, and that the excess cash flow guaranty is valid, binding and enforceable against the Guarantor in accordance with its terms, in form and substance substantially similar to the opinions delivered by the Borrowers’ counsel upon the closing of the Mortgage Loan with respect to validity, authority, execution and enforceability, and which may be relied upon by the lender and the Rating Agency.

In no instance will the Borrowers be entitled to request, nor will the lender be obligated to disburse, Excess Cash Flow to the Borrowers in lieu of depositing the same into the Excess Cash Flow Reserve Fund if (I) a Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, (II) such Excess Cash Flow is not guaranteed pursuant to the excess cash flow guaranty, and/or (III) such disbursement of such amounts would cause the aggregate amount of obligations then outstanding under the excess cash flow guaranty (plus the outstanding amount of the PIP Letter of Credit, the outstanding amount under any Alterations Letter of Credit and the outstanding amount of any Restoration Letter of Credit if the applicant is the Guarantor or a subsidiary of the Guarantor that directly or indirectly owns 49% or more of the equity interests in the Borrowers) to exceed 15% of the then outstanding principal balance of the Mortgage Loan.

Upon the earliest to occur of (i) a monetary Mortgage Loan Event of Default, (ii) a Priority Payment Cessation Event, and (iii) the delivery of a deed in lieu of foreclosure, the Borrowers (or the Guarantor, pursuant to the excess cash flow guaranty) are required to remit to the lender an amount equal to the guaranteed Excess Cash Flow as of such date, which amount will at the lender’s option either be deposited by the lender into the Excess Cash Flow Reserve Fund or applied in accordance with the applicable terms and provisions of the Mortgage Loan Agreement as if such amounts had been contained in the Excess Cash Flow Reserve Fund.

During the continuance of a Cash Trap Period (as defined below) there will be ongoing reserves for: Ground lease rent and charges, to the extent applicable; Monthly escrow payments for taxes and insurance (except in the case of any Property for which insurance is provided under a blanket policy that includes such Property); FF&E in an amount equal to the greater of (x) 4.0% of total gross revenues or (y) the amounts required under any franchise agreements or management agreements.
At all times during the term of the Mortgage Loan, other than during a Cash Trap Period, all funds deposited in the Accounts are available to Borrower.

During the existence of a Cash Trap Period, all funds deposited in the Accounts will be transferred not less than twice per week to a cash management account controlled by the lenders to be applied to pay debt service on the Mortgage Loan and fund the monthly reserves.

A “Cash Trap Period” is deemed to occur when either (i) the debt yield falls below 9.0% (the “Debt Yield Threshold”) for two (2) consecutive calendar quarters, based on the trailing 12 month period (a “Debt Yield Trigger”) or (ii) an event of default under the Mortgage Loan has occurred and is continuing (an “EOD Trigger”).

A “Cash Trap Period” is deemed to occur when either (i) the debt yield falls below 9.0% (the “Debt Yield Threshold”) for two (2) consecutive calendar quarters, based on the trailing 12 month period (a “Debt Yield Trigger”) or (ii) an event of default under the Mortgage Loan has occurred and is continuing (an “EOD Trigger”).

During a Cash Trap Period, all excess funds will be held in a collateral account (the “Cash Collateral Account”) as additional collateral for the Mortgage Loan unless the Borrower Sponsor or certain of its affiliates provides the lenders with a guaranty in the amount that would otherwise have been reserved.

So long as no EOD Trigger exists, amounts on deposit in the Cash Collateral Account (if any) will be available and disbursed to the Borrower to pay costs and expenses in connection with the ownership, management and/or operation of the Properties to the extent that such amounts are not otherwise paid through the cash management system, to satisfy the Borrower’s obligations under the Mortgage Loan documents, or to make prepayments of the Mortgage Loan.

Upon receipt of notice from the lender, during a Cash Management Period, all amounts in the Clearing Account are required to be swept on each Business Day to a lender controlled cash management account (the “Cash Management Account”).
If a Cash Management Period has not occurred or ceases to exist all amounts in the Clearing Account are required to be transferred into the Borrower’s accounts once every Business Day.

Upon the occurrence of an event of default under the Whole Loan, the lender may direct all funds on deposit in the Clearing Account to the lender and to apply any such funds to the payment of the Whole Loan in any order in its sole discretion.

“Cash Management Period” is deemed to (a) commence upon the commencement of any Cash Trap Period; and (b) ends upon the lender giving notice to the Borrowers and the Clearing Bank that the Cash Management Period has ended, which notice the lender is only required to give if: (1) the Whole Loan and all other obligations under the mortgage loan documents have been repaid in full; or (2) there has been a release of all the Properties; or (3) the applicable Cash Trap Period has terminated (and no other Cash Trap Period is then continuing).

“Cash Trap Period” is deemed to be continuing (i) upon the occurrence of any event of default under the Mortgage Loan until cured; (ii) upon any bankruptcy action of a Borrower, a Principal, the Guarantor or the Property Manager has occurred until in the case of a bankruptcy action of Property Manager only, if a Borrower replaces the Property Manager with a qualified manager under a replacement management agreement; (iii) upon the failure by the Borrowers to maintain the debt service coverage ratio based on the aggregate Whole Loan and Mezzanine Loans of at least 1.05x for two consecutive calendar quarters until the debt service coverage ratio based on the aggregate Whole Loan and Mezzanine Loans has been equal to at least 1.10x for two consecutive calendar quarters; or (iv) the occurrence of an event of default under a Mezzanine Loan until cured.

“Cash Trap Period” is deemed to be continuing (i) upon the occurrence of any event of default under the Mortgage Loan until cured; (ii) upon any bankruptcy action of a Borrower, a Principal, the Guarantor or the Property Manager has occurred until in the case of a bankruptcy action of Property Manager only, if a Borrower replaces the Property Manager with a qualified manager under a replacement management agreement; (iii) upon the failure by the Borrowers to maintain the debt service coverage ratio based on the aggregate Whole Loan and Mezzanine Loans of at least 1.05x for two consecutive calendar quarters until the debt service coverage ratio based on the aggregate Whole Loan and Mezzanine Loans has been equal to at least 1.10x for two consecutive calendar quarters; or (iv) the occurrence of an event of default under a Mezzanine Loan until cured.

“Cash Trap Period” is deemed to be continuing (i) upon the occurrence of any event of default under the Mortgage Loan until cured; (ii) upon any bankruptcy action of a Borrower, a Principal, the Guarantor or the Property Manager has occurred until in the case of a bankruptcy action of Property Manager only, if a Borrower replaces the Property Manager with a qualified manager under a replacement management agreement; (iii) upon the failure by the Borrowers to maintain the debt service coverage ratio based on the aggregate Whole Loan and Mezzanine Loans of at least 1.05x for two consecutive calendar quarters until the debt service coverage ratio based on the aggregate Whole Loan and Mezzanine Loans has been equal to at least 1.10x for two consecutive calendar quarters; or (iv) the occurrence of an event of default under a Mezzanine Loan until cured.
It will be a Mortgage Loan Event of Default if the Borrowers do not complete the Required Repairs by the required deadline for each repair as set forth in the Mortgage Loan Agreement.

However, the inability of the Borrowers to complete any one or more of the Required Repairs within the applicable time periods will not, in and of itself, constitute a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, provided that the Borrowers are and have diligently and continuously taken all commercially reasonable steps necessary to complete the Required Repair(s) in question.

Upon the occurrence of such a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, the lender, at its option, may withdraw all Required Repairs Funds from the Required Repairs Account and the lender may apply such funds either to completion of the Required Repairs or toward reduction of the outstanding principal balance of the Whole Loan in such order, proportion and priority as the lender may determine in its sole discretion.

Upon the occurrence and during the continuance of a Cash Trap Period, the lender will be required to collect all Excess Cash and such amounts will be held by the lender in an account (the “Excess Cash Flow Reserve Account”) as additional security for the Whole Loan.
Upon the conclusion of any Cash Trap Period, the lender will be required to promptly return any funds held in the Excess Cash Flow Reserve Account.

A “Cash Trap Period” will be deemed to (a) commence upon: (i) the occurrence of any Mortgage Loan Event of Default; (ii) if any bankruptcy action of the Borrowers, the Principal, the Guarantor or the Property Manager has occurred; (iii) the failure by the Borrowers to maintain the debt service coverage ratio of at least 1.05x for two consecutive calendar quarters; or (iv) the occurrence of a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default; and (b) have terminated, if ever: (i) in the case of clause (a)(i), the lender accepts a cure of the Mortgage Loan Event of Default giving rise to such Cash Trap Period and no other Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred which is continuing; or (ii) in the case of a bankruptcy action of the Property Manager only, if the Borrowers replace the Property Manager with a Qualified Property Manager under a replacement management agreement; or (iii) in the case of clause (a)(iii), for two consecutive calendar quarters since the commencement of the existing Cash Trap Period, the debt service coverage ratio has been at least equal to 1.10x (provided that no other Cash Trap Period is then continuing); or (iv) in the case of clause (a)(iv), upon receipt of a notice that a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default has been cured or waived.

A “Cash Trap Period” will be deemed to (a) commence upon: (i) the occurrence of any Mortgage Loan Event of Default; (ii) if any bankruptcy action of the Borrowers, the Principal, the Guarantor or the Property Manager has occurred; (iii) the failure by the Borrowers to maintain the debt service coverage ratio of at least 1.05x for two consecutive calendar quarters; or (iv) the occurrence of a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default; and (b) have terminated, if ever: (i) in the case of clause (a)(i), the lender accepts a cure of the Mortgage Loan Event of Default giving rise to such Cash Trap Period and no other Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred which is continuing; or (ii) in the case of a bankruptcy action of the Property Manager only, if the Borrowers replace the Property Manager with a Qualified Property Manager under a replacement management agreement; or (iii) in the case of clause (a)(iii), for two consecutive calendar quarters since the commencement of the existing Cash Trap Period, the debt service coverage ratio has been at least equal to 1.10x (provided that no other Cash Trap Period is then continuing); or (iv) in the case of clause (a)(iv), upon receipt of a notice that a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default has been cured or waived.

A “Cash Trap Period” will be deemed to (a) commence upon: (i) the occurrence of any Mortgage Loan Event of Default; (ii) if any bankruptcy action of the Borrowers, the Principal, the Guarantor or the Property Manager has occurred; (iii) the failure by the Borrowers to maintain the debt service coverage ratio of at least 1.05x for two consecutive calendar quarters; or (iv) the occurrence of a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default; and (b) have terminated, if ever: (i) in the case of clause (a)(i), the lender accepts a cure of the Mortgage Loan Event of Default giving rise to such Cash Trap Period and no other Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred which is continuing; or (ii) in the case of a bankruptcy action of the Property Manager only, if the Borrowers replace the Property Manager with a Qualified Property Manager under a replacement management agreement; or (iii) in the case of clause (a)(iii), for two consecutive calendar quarters since the commencement of the existing Cash Trap Period, the debt service coverage ratio has been at least equal to 1.10x (provided that no other Cash Trap Period is then continuing); or (iv) in the case of clause (a)(iv), upon receipt of a notice that a Mezzanine Loan Event of Default has been cured or waived.

Upon the occurrence and during the continuance of a Mortgage Loan Event of Default, the lender may, in addition to any and all other rights and remedies available to the lender, apply any sums then present in any or all of the reserve funds to the reduction of the outstanding principal balance of the Whole Loan in any order in its sole discretion.

During any Cash Management Period, the Borrowers will cause the Clearing Bank to transfer to the Cash Management Account in immediately available funds by federal wire transfer all amounts on deposit in the Clearing Account once every Business Day.

If a Cash Management Period has not occurred or ceases to exist, the Clearing Bank will transfer to the Borrowers’ account in immediately available funds by federal wire transfer all amounts in the Clearing Account once every Business Day.

Upon the occurrence of a Cash Management Period, the lender will be required to establish and maintain a segregated Eligible Account (the “Cash Management Account”) to be held by the Deposit Bank in trust for the benefit of the lender, and which will be under the sole dominion and control of the lender.

During the continuance of a Cash Management Period, provided no Mortgage Loan Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, on each Mortgage Loan Payment Date (or, if suchMortgage Loan Payment Date is not a Business Day, on the immediately preceding Business Day) all funds on deposit in the Cash Management Account are required to be applied by the lender (or by the Deposit Bank at the lender’s direction) to the payment of the following items in the order indicated: (i) First, payment to the lender (for deposit in the Tax and Insurance Escrow Account) in respect of the Tax and Insurance Escrow Funds in accordance with “—Reserve Accounts—Tax and Insurance Escrow Account” above; (ii) Second, payment to the Deposit Bank of the fees and expenses of the Deposit Bank then due and payable pursuant to the Cash Management Agreement; (iii) Third, payment to the lender of the monthly debt service payment amount; (iv) Fourth, payment to the Borrowers in an amount equal to the aggregate of (A) operating expenses due and payable by the Borrowers during the succeeding month as set forth in the Approved Annual Budget, and (B) Extraordinary Expenses, if any, approved by the lender; (v) Fifth, payment to the lender (for deposit in the Capital Expenditure Reserve Account) in respect of the Capital Expenditures Monthly Deposit in accordance with “—Reserve Accounts—Capital Expenditure Reserve Account” above; (vi) Sixth, payment to the lender of any other amounts then due and payable under the Mortgage Loan Documents (other than the outstanding principal balance of the Whole Loan); (vii) Seventh, provided that (A) no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is then continuing and (B) the lender has received the monthly notice setting forth the debt service amount payable by the Senior Mezzanine Borrower from the Senior Mezzanine Lender with respect to such Mortgage Loan Payment Date, to the Senior Mezzanine Lender (at an account designated in writing by the Senior Mezzanine Lender to the lender), funds in an amount equal to the debt service payment amount for the Senior Mezzanine Loan payable on such Mortgage Loan Payment Date; (viii) Eighth, provided that (A) no Mortgage Loan Event of Default is then continuing and (B) the lender has received the monthly notice setting forth the debt service amount payable by the Junior Mezzanine Borrower from Junior Mezzanine Lender with respect to such Mortgage Loan Payment Date, to the Junior Mezzanine Lender (at an account designated in writing by the Junior Mezzanine Lender to the lender), funds in an amount equal to the debt service payment amount for the Junior Mezzanine Loan payable on such Mortgage Loan Payment Date; and (ix) Lastly, if a Cash Trap Period is then continuing, payment of all amounts then remaining after payment of items (i) through (viii) above to the Excess Cash Flow Reserve Account in accordance with “—Reserve Accounts—Excess Cash Flow Reserve Account” above.
“Extraordinary Expense” means, during the continuance of a Cash Management Period, an extraordinary operating expense or capital expenditure not set forth in the Approved Annual Budget.

The Borrowers are also required to fund an excess cash flow reserve during a Cash Management Period in an amount equal to all cash in excess of debt service on the Whole Loan and the Mezzanine Loans, required reserves and certain other operating expenses (and in certain cases, required distributions for tax payments and similar matters).

A “Cash Management Period” will be continuing upon (i) an event of default under the Whole Loan until cured, (ii) upon any bankruptcy action of a Borrower, the Guarantor or the Property Manager until the Property Manager is replaced in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement, (iii) the aggregate debt service coverage ratio on the Whole Loan and the Mezzanine Loans falls below 1.05x as of the end of any two consecutive calendar quarters until the aggregate debt service coverage ratio on the Whole Loan and the Mezzanine Loans is at least 1.10x for two consecutive calendar quarters or (iv) the occurrence of an event of default under a Mezzanine Loan until cured.

A “Cash Management Period” will be continuing upon (i) an event of default under the Whole Loan until cured, (ii) upon any bankruptcy action of a Borrower, the Guarantor or the Property Manager until the Property Manager is replaced in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement, (iii) the aggregate debt service coverage ratio on the Whole Loan and the Mezzanine Loans falls below 1.05x as of the end of any two consecutive calendar quarters until the aggregate debt service coverage ratio on the Whole Loan and the Mezzanine Loans is at least 1.10x for two consecutive calendar quarters or (iv) the occurrence of an event of default under a Mezzanine Loan until cured.

A “Cash Management Period” will be continuing upon (i) an event of default under the Whole Loan until cured, (ii) upon any bankruptcy action of a Borrower, the Guarantor or the Property Manager until the Property Manager is replaced in accordance with the Mortgage Loan Agreement, (iii) the aggregate debt service coverage ratio on the Whole Loan and the Mezzanine Loans falls below 1.05x as of the end of any two consecutive calendar quarters until the aggregate debt service coverage ratio on the Whole Loan and the Mezzanine Loans is at least 1.10x for two consecutive calendar quarters or (iv) the occurrence of an event of default under a Mezzanine Loan until cured.
During a Cash Management Period, all amounts in the Clearing Account are required to be swept once every Business Day to a lender-controlled cash management account (the “Cash Management Account”).
If a Cash Management Period has not occurred or ceases to exist, all amounts in the Clearing Account may be transferred into the Borrowers’ accounts once every Business Day.

Upon the occurrence of an event of default under the Whole Loan, the lender may direct all funds on deposit in the Clearing Account to the lender and apply any such funds to the payment of the Whole Loan in any order in its sole discretion.

“Cash Management Period” is deemed to (a) commence upon the commencement of any Cash Trap Period; and (b) ends upon the lender giving notice to the Borrowers and the Clearing Bank that the Cash Management Period has ended, which notice the lender is only required to give if: (1) the Whole Loan and all other obligations under the mortgage loan documents have been repaid in full; or (2) there has been a release of all the Properties; or (3) the applicable Cash Trap Period has terminated (and no other Cash Trap Period is then continuing).

The mortgage loan documents require the Borrowers to fund the following reserve accounts: at origination, the Borrowers funded a required repairs account (the “Required Repairs Account”), in an amount equal to $216,938, for work specified in the Mortgage Loan Agreement reasonably required to be performed within six months of the Origination Date; an ongoing account for all amounts payable in respect of property taxes and insurance premiums (the “Tax and Insurance Escrow Account”), into which the Borrowers deposited $732,500 on the Origination Date, to be funded monthly in an amount equal to the sum of (a) 1/12 of projected annual property taxes, and (b) 1/12 of projected annual insurance premiums; an ongoing account for all amounts payable in respect of capital improvements, replacements and repairs (the “Capital Expenditure Reserve Account”), into which the Borrowers deposited $11,136,554 on the Origination Date, to be funded monthly, commencing on the Mortgage Loan Payment Date in an amount equal to $18,125 capped at $500,000; during the continuance of a Cash Management Period, an account for excess cash flow (after payment of all required debt service on the Whole Loan and the Mezzanine Loans, reserves and operating expenses) as described under “Description of the Whole Loan—Cash Management” (the “Excess Cash Flow Reserve Account” in the Offering Circular”).

“Cash Trap Period” is deemed to be continuing (i) upon the occurrence of any event of default under the Mortgage Loan until cured; (ii) if any bankruptcy action of a Borrower, the Guarantor or the Property Manager has occurred until in the case of a bankruptcy action of Property Manager only, if a Borrower replaces the Property Manager with a qualified manager under a replacement management agreement; (iii) upon the failure by the Borrowers to maintain the debt service coverage ratio based on the Total Debt of at least 1.05x for two consecutive calendar quarters until the debt service coverage ratio based on the Total Debt has been at least equal to 1.10x for two consecutive calendar quarters; or (iv) upon the occurrence of an event of default under either of the Mezzanine Loans until cured.
